original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: agniṃ naro dīdhitibhir araṇyor hastacyutī janayanta praśastam /
analyzed: agnim naraḥ dīdhitibhiḥ araṇyoḥ hasta cyutī janayanta praśastam
translated: Men generate Agni with thoughts in the kindling wood, tossed by the hands, to be praised,

original: dūredṛśaṃ gṛhapatim atharyum //
analyzed: dūredṛśam gṛhapatim atharyum
translated: The far-seeing, the householder, the ancient one.

original: tam agnim aste vasavo ny ṛṇvan supraticakṣam avase kutaś cit /
analyzed: tam agnim aste vasavaḥ ni ṛṇvan supraticakṣam avase kutas cit
translated: That Agni, the Vasus have set up as a priest, well-seen, for help from somewhere,

original: dakṣāyyo yo dama āsa nityaḥ //
analyzed: dakṣāyyaḥ yaḥ dame āsa nityaḥ
translated: Who is worthy of choice, who is ever present in the house.

original: preddho agne dīdihi puro no 'jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha /
analyzed: preddhaḥ agne dīdihi puras naḥ jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha
translated: Be kindled, O Agni, shine in front of us, O youngest, with your unceasing light.

original: tvāṃ śaśvanta upa yanti vājāḥ //
analyzed: tvām śaśvantaḥ upa yanti vājāḥ
translated: To you come all the powers.

original: pra te agnayo 'gnibhyo varaṃ niḥ suvīrāsaḥ śośucanta dyumantaḥ /
analyzed: pra te agnayaḥ gnibhyaḥ varam niḥ su vīrāsaḥ śośucanta dyumantaḥ
translated: Your fires, O Agni, more excellent than the fires, shine forth, with good heroes, splendid,

original: yatrā naraḥ samāsate sujātāḥ //
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ samāsate sujātāḥ
translated: Where well-born men sit together.

original: dā no agne dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ svapatyaṃ sahasya praśastam /
analyzed: dāḥ naḥ agne dhiyā rayim su vīram su apatyam sahasya praśastam
translated: Give us, O Agni, wealth with your mind, with good heroes, self-dependent, to be praised by the mighty,

original: na yaṃ yāvā tarati yātumāvān //
analyzed: na yam yāvā tarati yātumāvān
translated: Which the ever-wandering one does not overcome.

original: upa yam eti yuvatiḥ sudakṣaṃ doṣā vastor haviṣmatī ghṛtācī /
analyzed: upa yam eti yuvatiḥ su dakṣam doṣā vastoḥ haviṣmatī ghṛtācī
translated: To whom the young woman comes, the skillful one, the oblation-bearing one, the ghee-offering, in the evening and in the morning,

original: upa svainam aramatir vasūyuḥ //
analyzed: upa svā enam aramatiḥ vasūyuḥ
translated: To him comes Armatī, rich in goods.

original: viśvā agne 'pa dahārātīr yebhis tapobhir adaho jarūtham /
analyzed: viśvāḥ agne pa daha arātīḥ yebhiḥ tapobhiḥ adahaḥ jarūtham
translated: Burn up all the evil spirits, O Agni, with those flames with which you burn up wickedness,

original: pra nisvaraṃ cātayasvāmīvām //
analyzed: pra nisvaram cātayasva amīvām
translated: Drive away the cry of the wolf, as of an enemy.

original: ā yas te agna idhate anīkaṃ vasiṣṭha śukra dīdivaḥ pāvaka /
analyzed: ā yaḥ te agne idhate anīkam vasiṣṭha śukra dīdivas pāvaka
translated: O Agni, O Vasishtha, when they enkindle thy face, O bright, shining, purifying one,

original: uto na ebhi stavathair iha syāḥ //
analyzed: uta u naḥ ebhiḥ stavathaiḥ iha syāḥ
translated: And also with these praises of ours, be thou here.

original: vi ye te agne bhejire anīkam martā naraḥ pitryāsaḥ purutrā /
analyzed: vi ye te agne bhejire anīkam martāḥ naraḥ pitryāsaḥ purutrā
translated: Those mortal men, O Agni, who have spread out thy face in many places, the descendants of fathers,

original: uto na ebhiḥ sumanā iha syāḥ //
analyzed: uta u naḥ ebhiḥ sumanāḥ iha syāḥ
translated: And also with these (praises), be thou well-disposed here.

original: ime naro vṛtrahatyeṣu śūrā viśvā adevīr abhi santu māyāḥ /
analyzed: ime naraḥ vṛtra hatyeṣu śūrāḥ viśvāḥ adevīḥ abhi santu māyāḥ
translated: May these heroes, slayers of Vrtra, in the battles, overcome all the godless illusions,

original: ye me dhiyam panayanta praśastām //
analyzed: ye me dhiyam panayanta praśastām
translated: Those who promote my praiseworthy thought.

original: mā śūne agne ni ṣadāma nṛṇām māśeṣaso 'vīratā pari tvā /
analyzed: mā śūne agne ni sadāma nṛṇām mā a śeṣasaḥ vīra tā pari tvā
translated: O Agni, let us not sit here in vain among men, let us not be without offspring or without heroes around thee,

original: prajāvatīṣu duryāsu durya //
analyzed: prajāvatīṣu duryāsu durya
translated: In the houses with offspring, in the houses.

original: yam aśvī nityam upayāti yajñam prajāvantaṃ svapatyaṃ kṣayaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: yam aśvī nityam upayāti yajñam prajāvantam su apatyam kṣayam naḥ
translated: The sacrifice which the horse-rider always approaches, which is full of offspring, which is our own prosperity,

original: svajanmanā śeṣasā vāvṛdhānam //
analyzed: sva janmanā śeṣasā vāvṛdhānam
translated: Which has grown by its own birth and by the remainder.

original: pāhi no agne rakṣaso ajuṣṭāt pāhi dhūrter araruṣo aghāyoḥ /
analyzed: pāhi naḥ agne rakṣasaḥ ajuṣṭāt pāhi dhūrteḥ a raruṣaḥ aghāyoḥ
translated: Protect us, O Agni, from the Raksases' displeasure, protect us from the deceitful, the red, the evil-doing one,

original: tvā yujā pṛtanāyūṃr abhi ṣyām //
analyzed: tvā yujā pṛtanāyūn abhi syām
translated: With thee as ally I will conquer the armies in battle.

original: sed agnir agnīṃr aty astv anyān yatra vājī tanayo vīḷupāṇiḥ /
analyzed: sa id agniḥ agnīn ati astu anyān yatra vājī tanayaḥ vīḍu pāṇiḥ
translated: Let that Agni, O Agni, be surpassed by other fires, where the strong son, with his hands smeared with fat,

original: sahasrapāthā akṣarā sameti //
analyzed: sahasra pāthāḥ akṣarā sameti
translated: Comes together with the one of a thousand powers, the imperishable one.

original: sed agnir yo vanuṣyato nipāti sameddhāram aṃhasa uruṣyāt /
analyzed: sa id agniḥ yaḥ vanuṣyataḥ nipāti sameddhāram aṃhasaḥ uruṣyāt
translated: Let that Agni be surpassed, who strikes down the one who is to be overcome, who should be protected from misfortune by the one who kindles (the fire),

original: sujātāsaḥ pari caranti vīrāḥ //
analyzed: sujātāsaḥ pari caranti vīrāḥ
translated: The well-born heroes go around him.

original: ayaṃ so agnir āhutaḥ purutrā yam īśānaḥ sam id indhe haviṣmān /
analyzed: ayam saḥ agniḥ āhutaḥ purutrā yam īśānaḥ sam id indhe haviṣmān
translated: This is that Agni who is worshipped in many places, whom the powerful one kindles with oblations.

original: pari yam ety adhvareṣu hotā //
analyzed: pari yam eti adhvareṣu hotā
translated: To whom the priest comes in sacrifices.

original: tve agna āhavanāni bhūrīśānāsa ā juhuyāma nityā /
analyzed: tve agne āhavanāni bhūrī īśānāsaḥ ā juhuyāma nityā
translated: In you, O Agni, we would offer the many oblations, O lord, always.

original: ubhā kṛṇvanto vahatū miyedhe //
analyzed: ubhā kṛṇvantaḥ vahatū miyedhe
translated: Making both, may they carry to the dear sacrifice.

original: imo agne vītatamāni havyājasro vakṣi devatātim accha /
analyzed: imaḥ u agne vītatamāni havyā ajasraḥ vakṣi devatātim accha
translated: These, O Agni, most delightful oblations, carry the bearer of oblations to the company of the gods.

original: prati na īṃ surabhīṇi vyantu //
analyzed: prati naḥ īm surabhīṇi vyantu
translated: May they enjoy the fragrant offerings to you.

original: mā no agne 'vīrate parā dā durvāsase 'mataye mā no asyai /
analyzed: mā naḥ agne vīra te parā dāḥ durvāsase mataye mā naḥ asyai
translated: Do not give us to the childlessness of hero-less women, O Agni, to misfortune, to want of offspring.

original: mā naḥ kṣudhe mā rakṣasa ṛtāvo mā no dame mā vana ā juhūrthāḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ kṣudhe mā rakṣase ṛtāvaḥ mā naḥ dame mā vane ā juhūrthāḥ
translated: Do not deceive us in hunger, in the Rta of the Rakshas, do not deceive us in the house, in the forest.

original: nū me brahmāṇy agna uc chaśādhi tvaṃ deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ /
analyzed: nu me brahmāṇi agne ud śaśādhi tvam deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ
translated: Now, O Agni, make my prayers successful. You, O god, are the purifier for the wealthy.

original: rātau syāmobhayāsa ā te yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: rātau syāma ubhayāsaḥ ā te yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May we be in your favor, O you of both kinds. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: tvam agne suhavo raṇvasaṃdṛk sudītī sūno sahaso didīhi /
analyzed: tvam agne su havaḥ raṇva saṃdṛś su dītī sūno sahasaḥ didīhi
translated: You, O Agni, are easy to invoke, pleasant to look at, O son of strength, shine with good thoughts.

original: mā tve sacā tanaye nitya ā dhaṅ mā vīro asman naryo vi dāsīt //
analyzed: mā tve sacā tanaye nitye ā dhak mā vīraḥ asmat naryaḥ vi dāsīt
translated: Do not abandon us, as a father his son, in the struggle. Let not our hero, our man, be enslaved.

original: mā no agne durbhṛtaye sacaiṣu deveddheṣv agniṣu pra vocaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ agne durbhṛtaye sacā eṣu deva iddheṣu agniṣu pra vocaḥ
translated: Do not, O Agni, speak of us to these, kindled by the gods, to the fires, for our ill-keeping.

original: mā te asmān durmatayo bhṛmāc cid devasya sūno sahaso naśanta //
analyzed: mā te asmān durmatayaḥ bhṛmāt cit devasya sūno sahasaḥ naśanta
translated: Let not our evil thoughts, O god, O son of strength, overtake us even from afar.

original: sa marto agne svanīka revān amartye ya ājuhoti havyam /
analyzed: sa martaḥ agne su anīka revān amartye yaḥ ājuhoti havyam
translated: That mortal, O Agni, O beautiful one, the rich one who offers oblation to the immortal one,

original: sa devatā vasuvaniṃ dadhāti yaṃ sūrir arthī pṛcchamāna eti //
analyzed: sa devatā vasu vanim dadhāti yam sūriḥ arthī pṛcchamānaḥ eti
translated: He bestows the god who wins goods, whom the lord, the seeker, comes to ask.

original: maho no agne suvitasya vidvān rayiṃ sūribhya ā vahā bṛhantam /
analyzed: mahaḥ naḥ agne suvitasya vidvān rayim sūribhyaḥ ā vaha bṛhantam
translated: O Agni, knowing great bliss, bring to the lords great wealth,

original: yena vayaṃ sahasāvan mademāvikṣitāsa āyuṣā suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: yena vayam sahasāvat madema a vikṣitāsaḥ āyuṣā su vīrāḥ
translated: By which, O conqueror, we may rejoice, unwounded, with long life, with brave sons.

original: nū me brahmāṇy agna uc chaśādhi tvaṃ deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ /
analyzed: nu me brahmāṇi agne ud śaśādhi tvam deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ
translated: Now, O Agni, promote my prayers, thou, O god, art a good provider for the wealthy ones.

original: rātau syāmobhayāsa ā te yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: rātau syāma ubhayāsaḥ ā te yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May we be in the favour of both of thee. Do ye preserve us ever with your blessings.

original: juṣasva naḥ samidham agne adya śocā bṛhad yajataṃ dhūmam ṛṇvan /
analyzed: juṣasva naḥ samidham agne adya śoca bṛhat yajatam dhūmam ṛṇvan
translated: Accept our kindling-stick, O Agni, this day, shine forth, O worshipper, and stir the lofty smoke.

original: upa spṛśa divyaṃ sānu stūpaiḥ saṃ raśmibhis tatanaḥ sūryasya //
analyzed: upa spṛśa divyam sānu stūpaiḥ sam raśmibhiḥ tatanaḥ sūryasya
translated: Touch the heavenly ridge with thy flames, and extend with thy rays the light of the sun.

original: narāśaṃsasya mahimānam eṣām upa stoṣāma yajatasya yajñaiḥ /
analyzed: narāśaṃsasya mahimānam eṣām upa stoṣāma yajatasya yajñaiḥ
translated: The greatness of these, of Narāśaṁsa, we will praise with our hymns, of the worshipped one with sacrifices.

original: ye sukratavaḥ śucayo dhiyandhāḥ svadanti devā ubhayāni havyā //
analyzed: ye su kratavaḥ śucayaḥ dhiyandhāḥ svadanti devāḥ ubhayāni havyā
translated: Those who are well-ordered, pure, and wise, the gods who enjoy both kinds of offerings.

original: īḷenyaṃ vo asuraṃ sudakṣam antar dūtaṃ rodasī satyavācam /
analyzed: īḍenyam vaḥ asuram su dakṣam antar dūtam rodasī satya vācam
translated: The adorable Asura, well-skilled, the inner messenger of the two worlds, of true speech,

original: manuṣvad agnim manunā samiddhaṃ sam adhvarāya sadam in mahema //🔽saparyavo bharamāṇā abhijñu pra vṛñjate namasā barhir agnau /
analyzed: manuṣvat agnim manunā samiddham sam adhvarāya sadam id mahema  saparyavaḥ bharamāṇāḥ abhijñu pra vṛñjate namasā barhiḥ agnau
translated: We will serve Agni according to Manu, well-kindled by Manu, for the performance of sacrifice.🔽The attendants, bearing the oblations, spread out the sacrificial grass in the fire with reverence.

original: ājuhvānā ghṛtapṛṣṭham pṛṣadvad adhvaryavo haviṣā marjayadhvam //
analyzed: ājuhvānāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭham pṛṣadvat adhvaryavaḥ haviṣā marjayadhvam
translated: O Adhvaryus, anoint with oblation the swift one with ghee on his back.

original: svādhyo vi duro devayanto 'śiśrayū rathayur devatātā /🔽pūrvī śiśuṃ na mātarā rihāṇe sam agruvo na samaneṣv añjan //
analyzed: su ādhyaḥ vi duraḥ devayantaḥ śiśrayuḥ rathayuḥ devatātā  pūrvī śiśum na mātarā rihāṇe sam agruvaḥ na samaneṣu añjan
translated: The divine maidens, seeking the house, have sat down, the charioteer, devoted to the gods,🔽The two great mothers, as it were, embrace the child. They anoint him in the assemblies, the two with wide hips.

original: uta yoṣaṇe divye mahī na uṣāsānaktā sudugheva dhenuḥ /🔽barhiṣadā puruhūte maghonī ā yajñiye suvitāya śrayetām //
analyzed: uta yoṣaṇe divye mahī naḥ uṣāsānaktā sudughā iva dhenuḥ  barhiṣadā puruhūte maghonī ā yajñiye suvitāya śrayetām
translated: And the two divine maidens, Dawn and Night, like a well-milking cow,🔽Bestow upon us the two bountiful ones, rich in oblations, who sit on the sacrificial grass, for prosperity.

original: viprā yajñeṣu mānuṣeṣu kārū manye vāṃ jātavedasā yajadhyai /
analyzed: viprā yajñeṣu mānuṣeṣu kārū manye vām jātavedasā yajadhyai
translated: I think of you two, O sages, at human sacrifices, to worship with Jātavedas.

original: ūrdhvaṃ no adhvaraṃ kṛtaṃ haveṣu tā deveṣu vanatho vāryāṇi //
analyzed: ūrdhvam naḥ adhvaram kṛtam haveṣu tā deveṣu vanathaḥ vāryāṇi
translated: Make our sacrifice lofty in your offerings. Grant us those boons among the gods.

original: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣā iḷā devair manuṣyebhir agniḥ /🔽sarasvatī sārasvatebhir arvāk tisro devīr barhir edaṃ sadantu //
analyzed: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣāḥ iḷā devaiḥ manuṣyebhiḥ agniḥ  sarasvatī sārasvatebhiḥ arvāk tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam sadantu
translated: May Bharani with the Bharanis in unison, Ila with the gods, Agni with men,🔽Sarasvati with the Sarasvatas, come hitherward. May the three goddesses sit on this sacred grass.

original: tan nas turīpam adha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭar vi rarāṇaḥ syasva /
analyzed: tat naḥ turīpam adha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭar vi rarāṇaḥ syasva
translated: O Tvastr, God, grant us that which is most nourishing, that which is most productive, being well-disposed.

original: yato vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ sudakṣo yuktagrāvā jāyate devakāmaḥ //
analyzed: yatas vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ su dakṣaḥ yukta grāvā jāyate deva kāmaḥ
translated: From which a hero, skilled in work, well-formed, with yoked press-stone, is born, longing for the gods.

original: vanaspate 'va sṛjopa devān agnir haviḥ śamitā sūdayāti /
analyzed: vanaspate vaḥ sṛja upa devān agniḥ haviḥ śamitā sūdayāti
translated: O lord of the forest, let loose the gods. Agni, the purifier, prepares the oblation.

original: sed u hotā satyataro yajāti yathā devānāṃ janimāni veda //
analyzed: sa id u hotā satyataraḥ yajāti yathā devānām janimāni veda
translated: He, the priest, more truthful, offers sacrifice, as he knows the generations of the gods.

original: ā yāhy agne samidhāno arvāṅ indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ turebhiḥ /
analyzed: ā yāhi agne samidhānaḥ arvāṅ indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham turebhiḥ
translated: Come hither, O Agni, kindled, with the gods, with Indra, with the swift, on your chariot.

original: barhir na āstām aditiḥ suputrā svāhā devā amṛtā mādayantām //
analyzed: barhiḥ naḥ āstām aditiḥ su putrā svāhā devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām
translated: Sit on the sacred grass, O Aditi, with good sons. Hail! Let the immortal gods rejoice.

original: agniṃ vo devam agnibhiḥ sajoṣā yajiṣṭhaṃ dūtam adhvare kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: agnim vaḥ devam agnibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ yajiṣṭham dūtam adhvare kṛṇudhvam
translated: Make ye ready Agni, the God, with the Agnis, in unison, the best priest at the sacrifice.

original: yo martyeṣu nidhruvir ṛtāvā tapurmūrdhā ghṛtānnaḥ pāvakaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ martyeṣu nidhruviḥ ṛtāvā tapuḥ mūrdhā ghṛta annaḥ pāvakaḥ
translated: Who among mortals is firmly established, truthful, with a head of flame, eater of ghee, the pure one.

original: prothad aśvo na yavase 'viṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇād vy asthāt /
analyzed: prothat aśvaḥ na yavase viṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇāt vi asthāt
translated: The horse neighs as he longs for the barley when he has come forth from the great enclosure.

original: ād asya vāto anu vāti śocir adha sma te vrajanaṃ kṛṣṇam asti //
analyzed: āt asya vātaḥ anu vāti śociḥ adha sma te vrajanam kṛṣṇam asti
translated: Of thee, O Agni, when thou art born anew, the young bull,

original: ud yasya te navajātasya vṛṣṇo 'gne caranty ajarā idhānāḥ /
analyzed: ud yasya te nava jātasya vṛṣṇaḥ gne caranti ajarāḥ idhānāḥ
translated: the kindling-sticks move without decay.🔽The ruddy smoke goeth up to the sky,

original: acchā dyām aruṣo dhūma eti saṃ dūto agna īyase hi devān //
analyzed: acchā dyām aruṣaḥ dhūmaḥ eti sam dūtaḥ agne īyase hi devān
translated: and thou, O Agni, goest as a messenger to the gods.

original: vi yasya te pṛthivyām pājo aśret tṛṣu yad annā samavṛkta jambhaiḥ /🔽seneva sṛṣṭā prasitiṣ ṭa eti yavaṃ na dasma juhvā vivekṣi //🔽tam id doṣā tam uṣasi yaviṣṭham agnim atyaṃ na marjayanta naraḥ /
analyzed: vi yasya te pṛthivyām pājaḥ aśret tṛṣu yat annā samavṛkta jambhaiḥ  senā iva sṛṣṭā prasitiḥ te eti yavam na dasma juhvā vivekṣi  tam id doṣā tam uṣasi yaviṣṭham agnim atyam na marjayanta naraḥ
translated: Thy flame hath shone on the earth, when with thy jaws thou hast crushed the food in three places.🔽It goeth forth like an army with its weapons, like a horse to be fed with the tongue.🔽In the evening and in the morning, O most youthful Agni, men adorn thee like a horse.

original: niśiśānā atithim asya yonau dīdāya śocir āhutasya vṛṣṇaḥ //🔽susaṃdṛk te svanīka pratīkaṃ vi yad rukmo na rocasa upāke /
analyzed: niśiśānāḥ atithim asya yonau dīdāya śociḥ āhutasya vṛṣṇaḥ  su saṃdṛś te su anīka pratīkam vi yat rukmaḥ na rocase upāke
translated: They place thee in thy birthplace as a guest: the flame of the offered strong one shineth.🔽Thy face, O fair-faced one, is well-seen, when thou shinest like a disk in thy vicinity.

original: divo na te tanyatur eti śuṣmaś citro na sūraḥ prati cakṣi bhānum //🔽yathā vaḥ svāhāgnaye dāśema parīḷābhir ghṛtavadbhiś ca havyaiḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ na te tanyatuḥ eti śuṣmaḥ citraḥ na sūraḥ prati cakṣi bhānum  yathā vaḥ svāhā agnaye dāśema parīḍābhiḥ ghṛtavadbhiḥ ca havyaiḥ
translated: Thy strength goeth forth like the thunder of the sky: like a wonderful sun thou lookest at the light.🔽As we should offer to Agni with Svāhā-calls, with oblations accompanied by ghee,

original: tebhir no agne amitair mahobhiḥ śatam pūrbhir āyasībhir ni pāhi //
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ agne amitaiḥ mahobhiḥ śatam pūrbhiḥ āyasībhiḥ ni pāhi
translated: with those inexhaustible great things of thine, O Agni, protect us with a hundred iron forts!

original: yā vā te santi dāśuṣe adhṛṣṭā giro vā yābhir nṛvatīr uruṣyāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ vā te santi dāśuṣe adhṛṣṭāḥ giraḥ vā yābhiḥ nṛvatīḥ uruṣyāḥ
translated: Or those irresistible songs which thou hast for the worshipper, or those which protect him with manly power,

original: tābhir naḥ sūno sahaso ni pāhi smat sūrīñ jaritṝñ jātavedaḥ //
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ sūno sahasaḥ ni pāhi smat sūrīm jaritṝm jātavedaḥ
translated: With those, O Son of Strength, do thou guard us, guard our princes and our praisers, O all-knower.

original: nir yat pūteva svadhitiḥ śucir gāt svayā kṛpā tanvā rocamānaḥ /
analyzed: niḥ yat pūtā iva svadhitiḥ śuciḥ gāt svayā kṛpā tanvā rocamānaḥ
translated: When he hath gone forth, pure as a sharp axe, shining with his own light,

original: ā yo mātror uśenyo janiṣṭa devayajyāya sukratuḥ pāvakaḥ //
analyzed: ā yaḥ mātroḥ uśenyaḥ janiṣṭa deva yajyāya su kratuḥ pāvakaḥ
translated: The active one, who was born between the two mothers, the wise, the pure one, for the worship of the gods.

original: etā no agne saubhagā didīhy api kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatema /
analyzed: etā naḥ agne saubhagā didīhi api kratum su cetasam vatema
translated: These blessings, O Agni, do thou grant to us; may we attain to the well-ordered thought.

original: viśvā stotṛbhyo gṛṇate ca santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: viśvā stotṛbhyaḥ gṛṇate ca santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May they be for all the praisers and singers. Do ye, O ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: pra vaḥ śukrāya bhānave bharadhvaṃ havyam matiṃ cāgnaye supūtam /
analyzed: pra vaḥ śukrāya bhānave bharadhvam havyam matim ca agnaye su pūtam
translated: Bear to your bright light, to Agni, your pure oblation and your thought,

original: yo daivyāni mānuṣā janūṃṣy antar viśvāni vidmanā jigāti //🔽sa gṛtso agnis taruṇaś cid astu yato yaviṣṭho ajaniṣṭa mātuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ daivyāni mānuṣā janūṃṣi antar viśvāni vidmanā jigāti  sa gṛtsaḥ agniḥ taruṇaḥ cit astu yatas yaviṣṭhaḥ ajaniṣṭa mātuḥ
translated: Who with his knowledge penetrates all the generations of gods and men.🔽Let that Agni be strong, though but a tender child, from whom the youngest is born of his mother.

original: saṃ yo vanā yuvate śucidan bhūri cid annā sam id atti sadyaḥ //
analyzed: sam yaḥ vanā yuvate śucidan bhūri cit annā sam id atti sadyas
translated: Who, with his pure teeth, chews the wood and eats even much food in a moment.

original: asya devasya saṃsady anīke yam martāsaḥ śyetaṃ jagṛbhre /
analyzed: asya devasya saṃsadi anīke yam martāsaḥ śyetam jagṛbhre
translated: Of this God, in the presence of the assembly, whom mortal men have seized as a white (victim),

original: ni yo gṛbham pauruṣeyīm uvoca durokam agnir āyave śuśoca //
analyzed: ni yaḥ gṛbham pauruṣeyīm uvoca durokam agniḥ āyave śuśoca
translated: He who hath spoken the word of manly strength, hard to be borne, Agni hath shone for Âyu.

original: ayaṃ kavir akaviṣu pracetā marteṣv agnir amṛto ni dhāyi /
analyzed: ayam kaviḥ akaviṣu pracetāḥ marteṣu agniḥ amṛtaḥ ni dhāyi
translated: This Agni, the immortal, the wise, the sage, hath been placed among men, in the midst of the unwise.

original: sa mā no atra juhuraḥ sahasvaḥ sadā tve sumanasaḥ syāma //
analyzed: sa mā naḥ atra juhuraḥ sahasvas sadā tve sumanasaḥ syāma
translated: Do thou, O mighty one, offer us here (a share in) that (prosperity); may we ever be dear to thee.

original: ā yo yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ sasāda kratvā hy agnir amṛtāṃ atārīt /
analyzed: ā yaḥ yonim deva kṛtam sasāda kratvā hi agniḥ amṛtām atārīt
translated: He who hath sat down in the place made by the gods, by his wisdom Agni hath passed over the immortals.

original: tam oṣadhīś ca vaninaś ca garbham bhūmiś ca viśvadhāyasam bibharti //
analyzed: tam oṣadhīḥ ca vaninaḥ ca garbham bhūmiḥ ca viśva dhāyasam bibharti
translated: The plants and the trees bear him as their germ, and the earth bears him who supports all.

original: īśe hy agnir amṛtasya bhūrer īśe rāyaḥ suvīryasya dātoḥ /
analyzed: īśe hi agniḥ amṛtasya bhūreḥ īśe rāyaḥ su vīryasya dātoḥ
translated: For Agni is lord of the ample immortality, he is lord of the bestowal of wealth and good heroism.

original: mā tvā vayaṃ sahasāvann avīrā māpsavaḥ pari ṣadāma māduvaḥ //
analyzed: mā tvā vayam sahasāvan avīrāḥ mā apsavaḥ pari sadāma mā a duvaḥ
translated: O thou of mighty power, let us not, without heroes, without strength, come to thee for help.

original: pariṣadyaṃ hy araṇasya rekṇo nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma /
analyzed: pariṣadyam hi araṇasya rekṇaḥ nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
translated: For we would be lords of the wealth of the ever-present (Agni), of the wealth of the one who sits in the assembly.

original: na śeṣo agne anyajātam asty acetānasya mā patho vi dukṣaḥ //
analyzed: na śeṣaḥ agne anya jātam asti acetānasya mā pathaḥ vi dukṣaḥ
translated: There is no other birth, O Agni, for the thoughtless one; do not thou pour him into the path of destruction.

original: nahi grabhāyāraṇaḥ suśevo 'nyodaryo manasā mantavā u /
analyzed: nahi grabhāya araṇaḥ su śevaḥ nyodaryaḥ manasā mantavai u
translated: For the well-disposed (Agni) is not to be seized by the one who is not of the same body, who is not wise in his mind.

original: adhā cid okaḥ punar it sa ety ā no vājy abhīṣāḷ etu navyaḥ //
analyzed: adhā cit okaḥ punar id saḥ eti ā naḥ vājī abhīṣāh etu navyaḥ
translated: Even then he comes again to his own place; may the strong one come to us with help, the new (Agni).

original: tvam agne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvam u naḥ sahasāvann avadyāt /
analyzed: tvam agne vanuṣyataḥ ni pāhi tvam u naḥ sahasāvan avadyāt
translated: Do thou, O Agni, protect us from the reviler; do thou, O victor, from blame.

original: saṃ tvā dhvasmanvad abhy etu pāthaḥ saṃ rayi spṛhayāyyaḥ sahasrī //
analyzed: sam tvā dhvasmanvat abhī etu pāthaḥ sam rayi spṛhayāyyaḥ sahasrī
translated: Let the path come to thee, full of prosperity; let wealth, to be desired, come to us, a thousandfold.

original: etā no agne saubhagā didīhy api kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatema /
analyzed: etā naḥ agne saubhagā didīhi api kratum su cetasam vatema
translated: Grant us these blessings, O Agni; may we attain to good understanding and thought.

original: viśvā stotṛbhyo gṛṇate ca santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: viśvā stotṛbhyaḥ gṛṇate ca santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May all be for the praisers and the singer. Do ye all preserve us ever with your blessings.

original: prāgnaye tavase bharadhvaṃ giraṃ divo arataye pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: pra agnaye tavase bharadhvam giram divaḥ arataye pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Bring to the mighty Agni the song, to him who delights in the sky and the earth,

original: yo viśveṣām amṛtānām upasthe vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhe jāgṛvadbhiḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ viśveṣām amṛtānām upasthe vaiśvānaraḥ vāvṛdhe jāgṛvadbhiḥ
translated: Who in the lap of all the Immortals, Vaiṣvânara, hath grown great with the watchful ones.

original: pṛṣṭo divi dhāyy agniḥ pṛthivyāṃ netā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabha stiyānām /
analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ divi dhāyi agniḥ pṛthivyām netā sindhūnām vṛṣabhaḥ stiyānām
translated: Agni is to be worshipped in the sky, on earth; the leader of the streams, the strong one of the moving ones.

original: sa mānuṣīr abhi viśo vi bhāti vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhāno vareṇa //
analyzed: sa mānuṣīḥ abhi viśaḥ vi bhāti vaiśvānaraḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ vareṇa
translated: He shines over the human tribes, Vaiṣvânara, grown great with a boon.

original: tvad bhiyā viśa āyann asiknīr asamanā jahatīr bhojanāni /🔽vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puro yad agne darayann adīdeḥ //
analyzed: tvat bhiyā viśaḥ āyan asiknīḥ asamanāḥ jahatīḥ bhojanāni  vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puraḥ yat agne darayan adīdeḥ
translated: Through thy fear the tribes of men have come, the helpless, the helpless, leaving their food.🔽Shining to Pûru, O Vaiṣvânara Agni, when thou didst shine, O Agni, rending the forts.

original: tava tridhātu pṛthivī uta dyaur vaiśvānara vratam agne sacanta /
analyzed: tava tri dhātu pṛthivī uta dyauḥ vaiśvānara vratam agne sacanta
translated: Thy three-fold realm, O Vaiṣvânara Agni, the earth and the sky, obey thy law.

original: tvam bhāsā rodasī ā tatanthājasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ //
analyzed: tvam bhāsā rodasī ā tatantha ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ
translated: Thou hast spread out the two world-halves with thy light, shining with thy undecaying radiance.

original: tvām agne harito vāvaśānā giraḥ sacante dhunayo ghṛtācīḥ /
analyzed: tvām agne haritaḥ vāvaśānāḥ giraḥ sacante dhunayaḥ ghṛtācīḥ
translated: Thy bays, O Agni, thy songs that utter praise, thy drops anointed, follow thee,

original: patiṃ kṛṣṭīnāṃ rathyaṃ rayīṇāṃ vaiśvānaram uṣasāṃ ketum ahnām //
analyzed: patim kṛṣṭīnām rathyam rayīṇām vaiśvānaram uṣasām ketum ahnām
translated: The lord of men, the charioteer of wealth, the light of dawns, the ensign of the days.

original: tve asuryaṃ vasavo ny ṛṇvan kratuṃ hi te mitramaho juṣanta /
analyzed: tve asuryam vasavaḥ ni ṛṇvan kratum hi te mitra mahas juṣanta
translated: The Vasus have set in thee, O Agni, the lordship of life, for they accept thy will, O thou of mighty friends.

original: tvaṃ dasyūṃr okaso agna āja uru jyotir janayann āryāya //
analyzed: tvam dasyūṃr okasaḥ agne ājaḥ uru jyotiḥ janayan āryāya
translated: Thou, O Agni, hast driven away the Dasyus from their homes, and hast produced wide light for the Ārya.

original: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyur na pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyaḥ /
analyzed: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyuḥ na pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyas
translated: When thou art born in the highest heaven, thou guardest the path, O Vāyu, in a moment.

original: tvam bhuvanā janayann abhi krann apatyāya jātavedo daśasyan //
analyzed: tvam bhuvanā janayan abhi kran apatyāya jātavedaḥ daśasyan
translated: Thou, O all-knower, hast filled the worlds, when thou art born, for offspring, O all-knower.

original: tām agne asme iṣam erayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīṃ jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: tām agne asme iṣam erayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīm jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, O Vaiśvānara, send us that food, O all-knower, that is glorious,

original: yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśvavāra pṛthu śravo dāśuṣe martyāya //🔽taṃ no agne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣuṃ rayiṃ ni vājaṃ śrutyaṃ yuvasva /
analyzed: yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśva vāra pṛthu śravaḥ dāśuṣe martyāya  tam naḥ agne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣum rayim ni vājam śrutyam yuvasva
translated: By which thou swellest the gift, O thou of all boons, the wide fame of the mortal who offers.🔽O Agni, win for us that wealth, O thou of much food, for the wealthy, that is to be desired,

original: vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yaccha rudrebhir agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yaccha rudrebhiḥ agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: O Vaiśvānara, grant us great protection, O Agni, in accord with the Rudras and Vasus.

original: pra samrājo asurasya praśastim puṃsaḥ kṛṣṭīnām anumādyasya /
analyzed: pra samrājaḥ asurasya praśastim puṃsaḥ kṛṣṭīnām anumādyasya
translated: I praise the praiseworthy dominion of the Asura, the lord of men, the one to be extolled by the people.

original: indrasyeva pra tavasas kṛtāni vande dāruṃ vandamāno vivakmi //
analyzed: indrasya iva pra tavasaḥ kṛtāni vande dārum vandamānaḥ vivakmi
translated: I praise the deeds of the powerful one, like Indra's, I praise the wood, I praise, I proclaim.

original: kaviṃ ketuṃ dhāsim bhānum adrer hinvanti śaṃ rājyaṃ rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: kavim ketum dhāsim bhānum adreḥ hinvanti śam rājyam rodasyoḥ
translated: They urge on the sage, the banner, the light of the mountain, the prosperity of the two worlds.

original: purandarasya gīrbhir ā vivāse 'gner vratāni pūrvyā mahāni //
analyzed: purandarasya gīrbhiḥ ā vivāse gneḥ vratāni pūrvyā mahāni
translated: With the songs of Purandara I invoke the ancient great vows of Agni.

original: ny akratūn grathino mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīṃr aśraddhāṃ avṛdhāṃ ayajñān /
analyzed: ni akratūn grathinaḥ mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīṃr aśraddhām a vṛdhām a yajñān
translated: The deceitful ones who are hostile, the grumblers with evil speech, the niggardly ones who lack faith and offer no sacrifices,

original: prapra tān dasyūṃr agnir vivāya pūrvaś cakārāparāṃ ayajyūn //
analyzed: pra pra tān dasyūṃr agniḥ vivāya pūrvaḥ cakāra aparān a yajyūn
translated: Agni has scattered those Dasyus away, and made others powerless for sacrifice.

original: yo apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīś cakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīḥ cakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: He who in the western darkness made the dawns shine forth, the best of men with his powers,

original: tam īśānaṃ vasvo agniṃ gṛṇīṣe 'nānataṃ damayantam pṛtanyūn //
analyzed: tam īśānam vasvaḥ agnim gṛṇīṣe nānatam damayantam pṛtanyūn
translated: I praise that Agni, the lord of wealth, the invincible, the one who subdues the enemies.

original: yo dehyo anamayad vadhasnair yo aryapatnīr uṣasaś cakāra /
analyzed: yaḥ dehyaḥ anamayat vadhasnaiḥ yaḥ arya patnīḥ uṣasaḥ cakāra
translated: He who with his weapon straightened the crooked, who made the wives of the Aryas and the dawns,

original: sa nirudhyā nahuṣo yahvo agnir viśaś cakre balihṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ //
analyzed: sa nirudhya nahuṣaḥ yahvaḥ agniḥ viśaḥ cakre bali hṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ
translated: That youthful Agni, the restrainer, the Nahusa, has made the people offer tribute with his powers.

original: yasya śarmann upa viśve janāsa evais tasthuḥ sumatim bhikṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: yasya śarman upa viśve janāsaḥ evaiḥ tasthuḥ sumatim bhikṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Under whose protection all people stand, seeking his favor with their prayers,

original: vaiśvānaro varam ā rodasyor āgniḥ sasāda pitror upastham //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ varam ā rodasyoḥ agniḥ sasāda pitroḥ upastham
translated: Vaiśvānara Agni has sat down in the lap of the parents, the two world-halves, to receive the boon.

original: ā devo dade budhnyā vasūni vaiśvānara uditā sūryasya /
analyzed: ā devaḥ dade budhnyā vasūni vaiśvānaraḥ uditā sūryasya
translated: The god Vaiśvānara, rising at sunrise, has bestowed treasures from the depths,

original: ā samudrād avarād ā parasmād āgnir dade diva ā pṛthivyāḥ //
analyzed: ā samudrāt avarāt ā parasmāt agniḥ dade divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: from the lower ocean and the higher, from the sky and the earth, Agni has bestowed.

original: pra vo devaṃ cit sahasānam agnim aśvaṃ na vājinaṃ hiṣe namobhiḥ /
analyzed: pra vaḥ devam cit sahasānam agnim aśvam na vājinam hiṣe namobhiḥ
translated: I serve with homage your conquering Agni, even the god, like a strong horse.

original: bhavā no dūto adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ //
analyzed: bhava naḥ dūtaḥ adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ
translated: Be our wise messenger of the sacrifice, seeking among the gods by your own power, O you who measure out the oblations.

original: ā yāhy agne pathyā anu svā mandro devānāṃ sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā yāhi agne pathyā anu svā mandraḥ devānām sakhyam juṣāṇaḥ
translated: Come, O Agni, along the paths to your own abode, delighting in the friendship of the gods, the joyful one.

original: ā sānu śuṣmair nadayan pṛthivyā jambhebhir viśvam uśadhag vanāni //
analyzed: ā sānu śuṣmaiḥ nadayan pṛthivyāḥ jambhebhiḥ viśvam uśadhak vanāni
translated: Shaking the earth with your back and your rushing, burning all the woods with your jaws.

original: prācīno yajñaḥ sudhitaṃ hi barhiḥ prīṇīte agnir īḷito na hotā /
analyzed: prācīnaḥ yajñaḥ sudhitam hi barhiḥ prīṇīte agniḥ īḍitaḥ na hotā
translated: The sacrifice is ancient, the sacred grass is well-spread, Agni is delighted, like an invoked priest.

original: ā mātarā viśvavāre huvāno yato yaviṣṭha jajñiṣe suśevaḥ //
analyzed: ā mātarā viśva vāre huvānaḥ yatas yaviṣṭha jajñiṣe su śevaḥ
translated: Calling you, O most youthful one, who are born for good fortune, O you who have all boons, from your two mothers.

original: sadyo adhvare rathiraṃ jananta mānuṣāso vicetaso ya eṣām /
analyzed: sadyas adhvare rathiram jananta mānuṣāsaḥ vicetasaḥ yaḥ eṣām
translated: The human beings, whose thoughts are varied, have created a swift messenger in the sacrifice, in you,

original: viśām adhāyi viśpatir duroṇe 'gnir mandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā //
analyzed: viśām adhāyi viśpatiḥ duroṇe gniḥ mandraḥ madhu vacāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: the lord of the people, the master of the house, Agni, the joyful one, of true speech, sweet-voiced.

original: asādi vṛto vahnir ājaganvān agnir brahmā nṛṣadane vidhartā /
analyzed: asādi vṛtaḥ vahniḥ ājaganvān agniḥ brahmā nṛṣadane vidhartā
translated: Agni, surrounded by the Maruts, has come, Agni, the Brahman, the ordainer in the seat of men,

original: dyauś ca yam pṛthivī vāvṛdhāte ā yaṃ hotā yajati viśvavāram //🔽ete dyumnebhir viśvam ātiranta mantraṃ ye vāraṃ naryā atakṣan /
analyzed: dyauḥ ca yam pṛthivī vāvṛdhāte ā yam hotā yajati viśva vāram  ete dyumnebhiḥ viśvam ātiranta mantram ye vāram naryāḥ atakṣan
translated: Whom heaven and earth have increased, whom the priest worships as all-bountiful.🔽They who have fashioned the hymn and the ladle, with their glories they pervade all.

original: pra ye viśas tiranta śroṣamāṇā ā ye me asya dīdhayann ṛtasya //
analyzed: pra ye viśaḥ tiranta śroṣamāṇāḥ ā ye me asya dīdhayan ṛtasya
translated: The people who listen, who extend, who have thought out this my holy order.

original: nū tvām agna īmahe vasiṣṭhā īśānaṃ sūno sahaso vasūnām /
analyzed: nu tvām agne īmahe vasiṣṭhāḥ īśānam sūno sahasaḥ vasūnām
translated: Now we invoke you, O Agni, O Vasishthas, you who are the lord of treasures, O son of strength,

original: iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavadbhya ānaḍ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavadbhyaḥ ānaṭ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Bring food to the generous praisers. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: indhe rājā sam aryo namobhir yasya pratīkam āhutaṃ ghṛtena /
analyzed: indhe rājā sam aryaḥ namobhiḥ yasya pratīkam āhutam ghṛtena
translated: The king is kindled with salutations, whose image is worshipped with ghee.

original: naro havyebhir īḷate sabādha āgnir agra uṣasām aśoci //
analyzed: naraḥ havyebhiḥ īḍate sabādhaḥ ā agniḥ agre uṣasām aśoci
translated: Men invoke him with offerings, the all-supporting. Agni shines forth at the head of the dawns.

original: ayam u ṣya sumahāṃ avedi hotā mandro manuṣo yahvo agniḥ /
analyzed: ayam u sya su mahān avedi hotā mandraḥ manuṣaḥ yahvaḥ agniḥ
translated: This very great Agni has been known, the delightful, youthful priest of men.

original: vi bhā akaḥ sasṛjānaḥ pṛthivyāṃ kṛṣṇapavir oṣadhībhir vavakṣe //
analyzed: vi bhās akaḥ sasṛjānaḥ pṛthivyām kṛṣṇa paviḥ oṣadhībhiḥ vavakṣe
translated: Having created light, he has spread out on earth. With the plants, he has grown, with the black plough.

original: kayā no agne vi vasaḥ suvṛktiṃ kām u svadhām ṛṇavaḥ śasyamānaḥ /
analyzed: kayā naḥ agne vi vasaḥ suvṛktim kām u svadhām ṛṇavaḥ śasyamānaḥ
translated: By what good deed, O Agni, shall we praise you, what is your own nature, which you are to be praised?

original: kadā bhavema patayaḥ sudatra rāyo vantāro duṣṭarasya sādhoḥ //
analyzed: kadā bhavema patayaḥ su datra rāyaḥ vantāraḥ duṣṭarasya sādhoḥ
translated: When shall we be the givers of good gifts, the bestowers of wealth hard to resist and good?

original: praprāyam agnir bharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryo na rocate bṛhad bhāḥ /
analyzed: pra pra ayam agniḥ bharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryaḥ na rocate bṛhat bhās
translated: Far away is heard the voice of Agni of Bharata, when his great light shines forth like the sun.

original: abhi yaḥ pūrum pṛtanāsu tasthau dyutāno daivyo atithiḥ śuśoca //
analyzed: abhi yaḥ pūrum pṛtanāsu tasthau dyutānaḥ daivyaḥ atithiḥ śuśoca
translated: He who stood by Puru in battles, the divine guest, shining with splendour, hath shone forth.

original: asann it tve āhavanāni bhūri bhuvo viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ /
analyzed: asan id tve āhavanāni bhūri bhuvaḥ viśvebhiḥ sumanāḥ anīkaiḥ
translated: Be thou present at our many sacrifices, well-disposed with all thy faces.

original: stutaś cid agne śṛṇviṣe gṛṇānaḥ svayaṃ vardhasva tanvaṃ sujāta //
analyzed: stutaḥ cit agne śṛṇviṣe gṛṇānaḥ svayam vardhasva tanvam su jāta
translated: Even when praised, O Agni, thou hearest, when lauded, O well-born one, increase thou thy own body.

original: idaṃ vacaḥ śatasāḥ saṃsahasram ud agnaye janiṣīṣṭa dvibarhāḥ /
analyzed: idam vacaḥ śata sāḥ saṃsahasram ud agnaye janiṣīṣṭa dvibarhāḥ
translated: Let this speech, a hundredfold, a thousandfold, be generated for Agni, of twofold strength.

original: śaṃ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavāti dyumad amīvacātanaṃ rakṣohā //
analyzed: śam yat stotṛbhyaḥ āpaye bhavāti dyumat amīva cātanam rakṣaḥ hā
translated: When it shall be auspicious to the praisers, the supporter, resplendent, driving away evil, the slayer of foes.

original: nū tvām agna īmahe vasiṣṭhā īśānaṃ sūno sahaso vasūnām /
analyzed: nu tvām agne īmahe vasiṣṭhāḥ īśānam sūno sahasaḥ vasūnām
translated: Now we invoke thee, O Agni, O Vasishtha, the lord of treasures, O son of strength.

original: iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavadbhya ānaḍ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavadbhyaḥ ānaṭ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Bring food to the praisers, the wealthy ones. Do ye, O protectors, always protect us with your blessings.

original: abodhi jāra uṣasām upasthād dhotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ /
analyzed: abodhi jāraḥ uṣasām upasthāt hotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ
translated: The son hath awakened at the rising of the dawns, the pleasant, most wise, purifying priest.

original: dadhāti ketum ubhayasya jantor havyā deveṣu draviṇaṃ sukṛtsu //
analyzed: dadhāti ketum ubhayasya jantoḥ havyā deveṣu draviṇam sukṛtsu
translated: He sets up the sign of both creatures, the offering among the gods, wealth among the virtuous.

original: sa sukratur yo vi duraḥ paṇīnām punāno arkam purubhojasaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: sa su kratuḥ yaḥ vi duraḥ paṇīnām punānaḥ arkam puru bhojasam naḥ
translated: He is the wise one who opens the doors of the Paṇis for us, purifying the light that nourishes many.

original: hotā mandro viśāṃ damūnās tiras tamo dadṛśe rāmyāṇām //
analyzed: hotā mandraḥ viśām damūnāḥ tiras tamaḥ dadṛśe rāmyāṇām
translated: The delightful Hotar, the guest of the people, shines beyond the darkness of the lovely ones.

original: amūraḥ kavir aditir vivasvān susaṃsan mitro atithiḥ śivo naḥ /
analyzed: amūraḥ kaviḥ aditiḥ vivasvān su saṃsad mitraḥ atithiḥ śivaḥ naḥ
translated: The unerring sage, the all-embracing Vivasvat, the well-ordered Mitra, the auspicious guest for us.

original: citrabhānur uṣasām bhāty agre 'pāṃ garbhaḥ prasva ā viveśa //
analyzed: citra bhānuḥ uṣasām bhāti agre pām garbhaḥ prasvaḥ ā viveśa
translated: The variously radiant one shines before the dawns, the embryo of the waters has entered the womb.

original: īḷenyo vo manuṣo yugeṣu samanagā aśucaj jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: īḍenyaḥ vaḥ manuṣaḥ yugeṣu samana gāḥ aśucat jātavedāḥ
translated: To be desired by you, O man, in the yokes, the all-pervading Jātavedas, O pure one.

original: susaṃdṛśā bhānunā yo vibhāti prati gāvaḥ samidhānam budhanta //
analyzed: su saṃdṛśā bhānunā yaḥ vibhāti prati gāvaḥ samidhānam budhanta
translated: The one who shines with beautiful form and light, the cows respond to the kindled one.

original: agne yāhi dūtyam mā riṣaṇyo devāṃ acchā brahmakṛtā gaṇena /
analyzed: agne yāhi dūtyam mā riṣaṇyaḥ devān acchā brahma kṛtā gaṇena
translated: O Agni, go as a messenger, do not be angry, go to the gods with a host that performs prayers.

original: sarasvatīm maruto aśvināpo yakṣi devān ratnadheyāya viśvān //
analyzed: sarasvatīm marutaḥ aśvinā apaḥ yakṣi devān ratna dheyāya viśvān
translated: Worship Sarasvatī, the Maruts, the two Ashvins, and all the gods for the sake of obtaining treasures.

original: tvām agne samidhāno vasiṣṭho jarūthaṃ han yakṣi rāye purandhim /
analyzed: tvām agne samidhānaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ jarūtham han yakṣi rāye purandhim
translated: You, O Agni, kindled, Vasishtha, slay the one who injures, worship Purandhi for the sake of wealth.

original: puruṇīthā jātavedo jarasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: puruṇīthā jātavedaḥ jarasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Sing, O Jātavedas, give much, you all protect us with blessings always.

original: uṣo na jāraḥ pṛthu pājo aśred davidyutad dīdyac chośucānaḥ /
analyzed: uṣaḥ na jāraḥ pṛthu pājaḥ aśret davidyutat dīdyat śośucānaḥ
translated: The son of Ushas has risen with wide radiance, shining, sparkling, glowing.

original: vṛṣā hariḥ śucir ā bhāti bhāsā dhiyo hinvāna uśatīr ajīgaḥ //🔽svar ṇa vastor uṣasām aroci yajñaṃ tanvānā uśijo na manma /🔽agnir janmāni deva ā vi vidvān dravad dūto devayāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣā hariḥ śuciḥ ā bhāti bhāsā dhiyaḥ hinvānaḥ uśatīḥ ajīgaḥ  svar na vastoḥ uṣasām aroci yajñam tanvānāḥ uśijaḥ na manma  agniḥ janmāni devaḥ ā vi vidvān dravat dūtaḥ deva yāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ
translated: The tawny, pure, bull shines with his own light, impelling the eager thoughts, he hath attained.🔽He hath shone forth to heaven, to the dawns, the sages, decking the sacrifice, with their hymn as with a robe.🔽Agni, the God, who knoweth all births, the best messenger, who goeth to the Gods, is swift.

original: acchā giro matayo devayantīr agniṃ yanti draviṇam bhikṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: acchā giraḥ matayaḥ devayantīḥ agnim yanti draviṇam bhikṣamāṇāḥ
translated: The hymns, the thoughts that long for God, the songs of praise, go to Agni, seeking wealth.

original: susaṃdṛśaṃ supratīkaṃ svañcaṃ havyavāham aratim mānuṣāṇām //
analyzed: su saṃdṛśam su pratīkam svañcam havyavāham aratim mānuṣāṇām
translated: The bearer of oblations, fair to see, of lovely form, self-moving, the messenger of men.

original: indraṃ no agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣā rudraṃ rudrebhir ā vahā bṛhantam /
analyzed: indram naḥ agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ rudram rudrebhiḥ ā vaha bṛhantam
translated: O Agni, with the Vasus accordant bring Indra with the Rudras to our aid.

original: ādityebhir aditiṃ viśvajanyām bṛhaspatim ṛkvabhir viśvavāram //
analyzed: ādityebhiḥ aditim viśvajanyām bṛhaspatim ṛkvabhiḥ viśva vāram
translated: With the Âdityas bring Aditi, all-sustaining, and Brihaspati, the Lord of all, with the Rik-sages.

original: mandraṃ hotāram uśijo yaviṣṭham agniṃ viśa īḷate adhvareṣu /
analyzed: mandram hotāram uśijaḥ yaviṣṭham agnim viśaḥ īḍate adhvareṣu
translated: The men invite to sacrifices Agni, the cheerful Priest, the messenger, the youngest.

original: sa hi kṣapāvāṃ abhavad rayīṇām atandro dūto yajathāya devān //
analyzed: sa hi kṣapāvān abhavat rayīṇām atandraḥ dūtaḥ yajathāya devān
translated: For he hath become the lord of nights and riches, the watchful messenger to worship the Gods.

original: mahāṃ asy adhvarasya praketo na ṛte tvad amṛtā mādayante /
analyzed: mahān asi adhvarasya praketaḥ na ṛte tvat amṛtāḥ mādayante
translated: Thou art the great foretoken of this solemn rite: without thee the Immortal Ones rejoice not.

original: ā viśvebhiḥ sarathaṃ yāhi devair ny agne hotā prathamaḥ sadeha //
analyzed: ā viśvebhiḥ sa ratham yāhi devaiḥ ni agne hotā prathamaḥ sadā iha
translated: Come hither, O Agni, with all the Gods in their car: sit down as Priest, O Agni, first of all.

original: tvām īḷate ajiraṃ dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ sadam in mānuṣāsaḥ /
analyzed: tvām īḍate ajiram dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ sadam id mānuṣāsaḥ
translated: Men who bring oblations ever call on thee, the swift one, to be their messenger.

original: yasya devair āsado barhir agne 'hāny asmai sudinā bhavanti //
analyzed: yasya devaiḥ āsadaḥ barhiḥ agne hāni asmai su dināḥ bhavanti
translated: Whose seat on the sacred grass is with the gods, for him, O Agni, the days are good days.

original: triś cid aktoḥ pra cikitur vasūni tve antar dāśuṣe martyāya /
analyzed: tris cit aktoḥ pra cikituḥ vasūni tve antar dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: Even from the three-sealed one thou art the seer of treasures for the mortal who offers thee.

original: manuṣvad agna iha yakṣi devān bhavā no dūto abhiśastipāvā //
analyzed: manuṣvat agne iha yakṣi devān bhava naḥ dūtaḥ abhiśasti pāvā
translated: O Agni, like Manu, worship the gods here, be thou our messenger, a protector from imprecations.

original: agnir īśe bṛhato adhvarasyāgnir viśvasya haviṣaḥ kṛtasya /
analyzed: agniḥ īśe bṛhataḥ adhvarasya agniḥ viśvasya haviṣaḥ kṛtasya
translated: Agni is the lord of the great sacrifice, Agni of all the prepared oblation.

original: kratuṃ hy asya vasavo juṣantāthā devā dadhire havyavāham //
analyzed: kratum hi asya vasavaḥ juṣanta athā devāḥ dadhire havyavāham
translated: For his rite the Vasus delight, then the gods have made him the bearer of oblations.

original: āgne vaha haviradyāya devān indrajyeṣṭhāsa iha mādayantām /
analyzed: ā agne vaha haviḥ adyāya devān indra jyeṣṭhāsaḥ iha mādayantām
translated: O Agni, bring the gods to eat the oblation, may they rejoice here, with Indra as their chief.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ divi deveṣu dhehi yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: imam yajñam divi deveṣu dhehi yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Place this sacrifice among the gods in heaven. Do ye, O (gods), protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: aganma mahā namasā yaviṣṭhaṃ yo dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe /
analyzed: aganma mahā namasā yaviṣṭham yaḥ dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe
translated: We have come with great reverence to the youngest, who shines forth, enkindled, in his own abode.

original: citrabhānuṃ rodasī antar urvī svāhutaṃ viśvataḥ pratyañcam //
analyzed: citra bhānum rodasī antar urvī su āhutam viśvatas pratyañcam
translated: The bright-shining one, in the two wide worlds, the one who is worshipped from all sides, from the front.

original: sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvān agni ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvān agni stave dame ā jātavedāḥ
translated: With his greatness, having overcome all evils, I will praise Agni, the all-knower, in the house.

original: sa no rakṣiṣad duritād avadyād asmān gṛṇata uta no maghonaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣiṣat duritāt avadyāt asmān gṛṇataḥ uta naḥ maghonaḥ
translated: May he protect us from misfortune and blame, us who sing his praises, and our wealthy patrons.

original: tvaṃ varuṇa uta mitro agne tvāṃ vardhanti matibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tvam varuṇaḥ uta mitraḥ agne tvām vardhanti matibhiḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are Varuna and Mitra; the Vasishthas exalt you with their hymns.

original: tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽prāgnaye viśvaśuce dhiyandhe 'suraghne manma dhītim bharadhvam /
analyzed: tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  pra agnaye viśva śuce dhiyandhe sura ghne manma dhītim bharadhvam
translated: In you, O good one, are all good things. Protect us always with your blessings.🔽Bring forth the hymn to Agni, the all-purifying, the slayer of demons, the inspirer of thought.

original: bhare havir na barhiṣi prīṇāno vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām //
analyzed: bhare haviḥ na barhiṣi prīṇānaḥ vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām
translated: Bearing the oblation on the sacred grass, I gratify Vaisvānara, the impeller of thoughts.

original: tvam agne śociṣā śośucāna ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamānaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne śociṣā śośucānaḥ ā rodasī apṛṇāḥ jāyamānaḥ
translated: O Agni, shining with your radiance, you filled the two worlds when born.

original: tvaṃ devāṃ abhiśaster amuñco vaiśvānara jātavedo mahitvā //
analyzed: tvam devān abhiśasteḥ amuñcaḥ vaiśvānara jātavedaḥ mahitvā
translated: O Vaisvānara Jātavedas, by your greatness you have freed the gods from the curse.

original: jāto yad agne bhuvanā vy akhyaḥ paśūn na gopā iryaḥ parijmā /
analyzed: jātaḥ yat agne bhuvanā vi akhyaḥ paśūn na gopāḥ iryaḥ parijmā
translated: O Agni, when born, you have looked upon the worlds, like a watchful herdsman.

original: vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda gātuṃ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda gātum yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: O Vaisvānara, find a way for the Brahman priest. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: samidhā jātavedase devāya devahūtibhiḥ /🔽havirbhiḥ śukraśociṣe namasvino vayaṃ dāśemāgnaye //
analyzed: samidhā jātavedase devāya deva hūtibhiḥ  havirbhiḥ śukra śociṣe namasvinaḥ vayam dāśema agnaye
translated: With fuel to Jātavedas, to the god with invocations to the god,🔽with oblations to the one with pure radiance, we, the humble ones, shall offer to Agni.

original: vayaṃ te agne samidhā vidhema vayaṃ dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra /
analyzed: vayam te agne samidhā vidhema vayam dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra
translated: We, O Agni, shall serve you with fuel, we shall offer you praise, O worthy of sacrifice.

original: vayaṃ ghṛtenādhvarasya hotar vayaṃ deva haviṣā bhadraśoce //
analyzed: vayam ghṛtena adhvarasya hotar vayam deva haviṣā bhadra śoce
translated: We, O Hotar of the sacrifice, with ghee, we, O god, with oblation, O thou of fair flame.

original: ā no devebhir upa devahūtim agne yāhi vaṣaṭkṛtiṃ juṣāṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ devebhiḥ upa deva hūtim agne yāhi vaṣaṭkṛtim juṣāṇaḥ
translated: Come to us, O Agni, with the gods, to the invocation of the gods, delighting in the Vasat call.

original: tubhyaṃ devāya dāśataḥ syāma yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: tubhyam devāya dāśataḥ syāma yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May we be the worshippers of thee, the god. Do ye, O ye gods, always protect us with your blessings.

original: upasadyāya mīḷhuṣa āsye juhutā haviḥ /
analyzed: upasadyāya mīḍhuṣe āsye juhuta haviḥ
translated: To the guest-loving one, to be approached, offer the oblation in his mouth,

original: yo no nediṣṭham āpyam //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ nediṣṭham āpyam
translated: Who is nearest to us, to be attained.

original: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīr abhi niṣasāda damedame /
analyzed: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīḥ abhi niṣasāda damedame
translated: He who hath sat down in every house over the five peoples,

original: kavir gṛhapatir yuvā //
analyzed: kaviḥ gṛhapatiḥ yuvā
translated: The young, the wise, the lord of the house.

original: sa no vedo amātyam agnī rakṣatu viśvataḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ vedaḥ amātyam agniḥ rakṣatu viśvatas
translated: May that Agni, our kinsman, protect us on every side,

original: utāsmān pātv aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: uta asmān pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: And may he deliver us from woe.

original: navaṃ nu stomam agnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam /
analyzed: navam nu stomam agnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam
translated: I have produced a new hymn for Agni, for the falcon of the sky.

original: vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ //
analyzed: vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ
translated: Will he not favour us with wealth?

original: spārhā yasya śriyo dṛśe rayir vīravato yathā /
analyzed: spārhāḥ yasya śriyaḥ dṛśe rayiḥ vīravataḥ yathā
translated: Whose glories are to be desired to behold, whose wealth is like that of the hero,

original: agre yajñasya śocataḥ //
analyzed: agre yajñasya śocataḥ
translated: At the head of the sacrifice, shining.

original: semāṃ vetu vaṣaṭkṛtim agnir juṣata no giraḥ /
analyzed: sā imām vetu vaṣaṭkṛtim agniḥ juṣata naḥ giraḥ
translated: May he accept this Vasat call, may Agni delight in our songs,

original: yajiṣṭho havyavāhanaḥ //
analyzed: yajiṣṭhaḥ havyavāhanaḥ
translated: Best worshipper, bearer of the oblation.

original: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantaṃ deva dhīmahi /
analyzed: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantam deva dhīmahi
translated: We will think of thee, O lord of the people, the glorious one, O god,

original: suvīram agna āhuta //
analyzed: su vīram agne āhuta
translated: Well-oxen, O Agni, invoked.

original: kṣapa usraś ca dīdihi svagnayas tvayā vayam /
analyzed: kṣapaḥ usraḥ ca dīdihi su agnayaḥ tvayā vayam
translated: Shine upon us, O Agni, thou who art to be worshipped by us,

original: suvīras tvam asmayuḥ //
analyzed: su vīraḥ tvam asmayuḥ
translated: You are the good hero, the one who has the people.

original: upa tvā sātaye naro viprāso yanti dhītibhiḥ /
analyzed: upa tvā sātaye naraḥ viprāsaḥ yanti dhītibhiḥ
translated: You are the good hero, the one who possesses the people.🔽Men, inspired by the thought of gain, come to you, O Agni, with their hymns,

original: upākṣarā sahasriṇī //
analyzed: upa akṣarā sahasriṇī
translated: With a thousand gifts.

original: agnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukraśocir amartyaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukra śociḥ amartyaḥ
translated: Agni, the immortal, with his bright flame, repels the Raksases,

original: śuciḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ //
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvakaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: The pure, purifying, adorable.

original: sa no rādhāṃsy ā bhareśānaḥ sahaso yaho /
analyzed: sa naḥ rādhāṃsi ā bhara īśānaḥ sahasaḥ yaho
translated: Bring us, O Lord of wealth, O son of strength, O mighty one,

original: bhagaś ca dātu vāryam //
analyzed: bhagaḥ ca dātu vāryam
translated: And may Bhaga grant us good things.

original: tvam agne vīravad yaśo devaś ca savitā bhagaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne vīravat yaśaḥ devaḥ ca savitā bhagaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the God Savitar, and Bhaga, and the glory that wins heroes.

original: ditiś ca dāti vāryam //🔽agne rakṣā ṇo aṃhasaḥ prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ /
analyzed: ditiḥ ca dāti vāryam  agne rakṣa naḥ aṃhasaḥ prati sma deva rīṣataḥ
translated: And Diti grants good things.🔽O Agni, protect us from distress, O God, from the slanderer,

original: tapiṣṭhair ajaro daha //
analyzed: tapiṣṭhaiḥ ajaraḥ daha
translated: With your most burning flames, O undecaying one, burn (him).

original: adhā mahī na āyasy anādhṛṣṭo nṛpītaye /
analyzed: adhā mahī naḥ āyasī anādhṛṣṭaḥ nṛ pītaye
translated: Now be great to us, O unconquered one, for the sake of the hero's drink,

original: pūr bhavā śatabhujiḥ //
analyzed: pūḥ bhava śata bhujiḥ
translated: Be the hundred-fold possessor of wealth.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pāhy aṃhaso doṣāvastar aghāyataḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ doṣāvastar aghāyataḥ
translated: Protect us, O Agni, from distress, O thou who art to be worshipped in the evening and in the morning,

original: divā naktam adābhya //
analyzed: divā naktam adābhya
translated: From the sinner, O thou who canst not be deceived, by day and by night.

original: enā vo agniṃ namasorjo napātam ā huve /🔽priyaṃ cetiṣṭham aratiṃ svadhvaraṃ viśvasya dūtam amṛtam //
analyzed: enā vaḥ agnim namasā ūrjaḥ napātam ā huve  priyam cetiṣṭham aratim su adhvaram viśvasya dūtam amṛtam
translated: To you I call this Agni, the son of strength, to offer worship,🔽The most beloved envoy, the self-controlled, the immortal messenger of all.

original: sa yojate aruṣā viśvabhojasā sa dudravat svāhutaḥ /
analyzed: sa yojate aruṣā viśva bhojasā sa dudravat su āhutaḥ
translated: He yokes the ruddy (horses) who enjoy all, he has run forward, well-worshipped.

original: subrahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnāṃ devaṃ rādho janānām //
analyzed: su brahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnām devam rādhaḥ janānām
translated: The sacrifice is well-praised, well-disposed to wealth, the God's gift to men.

original: ud asya śocir asthād ājuhvānasya mīḷhuṣaḥ /
analyzed: ud asya śociḥ asthāt ājuhvānasya mīḍhuṣaḥ
translated: His flame hath risen up, of the inviting, the bountiful one.

original: ud dhūmāso aruṣāso divispṛśaḥ sam agnim indhate naraḥ //🔽taṃ tvā dūtaṃ kṛṇmahe yaśastamaṃ devāṃ ā vītaye vaha /
analyzed: ud dhūmāsaḥ aruṣāsaḥ divispṛśaḥ sam agnim indhate naraḥ  tam tvā dūtam kṛṇmahe yaśastamam devān ā vītaye vaha
translated: The ruddy smokes, that touch the sky, ascend: men kindle Agni.🔽We make thee our most famous messenger, to bring the Gods to our feast.

original: viśvā sūno sahaso martabhojanā rāsva tad yat tvemahe //🔽tvam agne gṛhapatis tvaṃ hotā no adhvare /
analyzed: viśvā sūno sahasaḥ marta bhojanā rāsva tat yat tvā īmahe  tvam agne gṛhapatiḥ tvam hotā naḥ adhvare
translated: All food for men, O son of strength, give us that which we ask of thee.🔽Thou, O Agni, art the lord of the house, thou art our Hotar priest at the sacrifice.

original: tvam potā viśvavāra pracetā yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam //🔽kṛdhi ratnaṃ yajamānāya sukrato tvaṃ hi ratnadhā asi /
analyzed: tvam potā viśva vāra pracetāḥ yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam  kṛdhi ratnam yajamānāya su krato tvam hi ratna dhāḥ asi
translated: Thou art the purifier, all-bounteous, wise: worship thou and win the prize.🔽Make thou the treasure for the sacrificer, O very wise one: for thou art the bestower of treasure.

original: ā na ṛte śiśīhi viśvam ṛtvijaṃ suśaṃso yaś ca dakṣate //
analyzed: ā naḥ ṛte śiśīhi viśvam ṛtvijam su śaṃsaḥ yaḥ ca dakṣate
translated: Sharpen by inspiration all the priests, O good impeller, he who is skilled in sacrifice.

original: tve agne svāhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: tve agne su āhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ
translated: In thee, O Agni, well worshipped, may our princes be most dear,

original: yantāro ye maghavāno janānām ūrvān dayanta gonām //
analyzed: yantāraḥ ye maghavānaḥ janānām ūrvān dayanta gonām
translated: The leaders who are rich in kine, the lords of men.

original: yeṣām iḷā ghṛtahastā duroṇa āṃ api prātā niṣīdati /🔽tāṃs trāyasva sahasya druho nido yacchā naḥ śarma dīrghaśrut //
analyzed: yeṣām iḷā ghṛta hastā duroṇe ām api prātā niṣīdati  tān trāyasva sahasya druhaḥ nidaḥ yaccha naḥ śarma dīrgha śrut
translated: Whose Iḷā, with hands filled with ghee, sits down in the house, in the morning.🔽Protect them, O Victor, from the treacherous foe: give us shelter, O thou of far-reaching fame.

original: sa mandrayā ca jihvayā vahnir āsā viduṣṭaraḥ /
analyzed: sa mandrayā ca jihvayā vahniḥ āsā viduṣṭaraḥ
translated: He, the most wise, with his pleasant tongue, with his lips, hath come to us.

original: agne rayim maghavadbhyo na ā vaha havyadātiṃ ca sūdaya //
analyzed: agne rayim maghavadbhyaḥ naḥ ā vaha havya dātim ca sūdaya
translated: O Agni, bring wealth to the wealthy, and make ready the offering of the oblation.

original: ye rādhāṃsi dadaty aśvyā maghā kāmena śravaso mahaḥ /
analyzed: ye rādhāṃsi dadati aśvyā maghā kāmena śravasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: Those who bestow gifts of horses and wealth, out of desire for great fame,

original: tāṃ aṃhasaḥ pipṛhi partṛbhiṣ ṭvaṃ śatam pūrbhir yaviṣṭhya //🔽devo vo draviṇodāḥ pūrṇāṃ vivaṣṭy āsicam /
analyzed: tām aṃhasaḥ pipṛhi partṛbhiḥ tvam śatam pūrbhiḥ yaviṣṭhya  devaḥ vaḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ pūrṇām vivaṣṭi āsicam
translated: From that distress do thou deliver us, O thou who art most active, with a hundred deliverances.🔽The god who bestows wealth, O ye people, fills the full vessel and pours it out.

original: ud vā siñcadhvam upa vā pṛṇadhvam ād id vo deva ohate //
analyzed: ud vā siñcadhvam upa vā pṛṇadhvam āt id vaḥ devaḥ ohate
translated: Either pour out or fill up, for the god will surely take of you.

original: taṃ hotāram adhvarasya pracetasaṃ vahniṃ devā akṛṇvata /🔽dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate suvīryam agnir janāya dāśuṣe //
analyzed: tam hotāram adhvarasya pracetasam vahnim devāḥ akṛṇvata  dadhāti ratnam vidhate su vīryam agniḥ janāya dāśuṣe
translated: The gods have made that most wise Agni, the priest of the sacrifice, the bearer (of the oblations).🔽He bestows wealth and good heroism on the one who has the right procedure, Agni to the people who offer.

original: agne bhava suṣamidhā samiddha uta barhir urviyā vi stṛṇītām //
analyzed: agne bhava suṣamidhā samiddhaḥ uta barhiḥ urviyā vi stṛṇītām
translated: O Agni, be kindled with good fuel, and let the sacrificial grass be spread out in width.

original: uta dvāra uśatīr vi śrayantām uta devāṃ uśata ā vaheha //🔽agne vīhi haviṣā yakṣi devān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ //
analyzed: uta dvāraḥ uśatīḥ vi śrayantām uta devān uśataḥ ā vaha iha  agne vīhi haviṣā yakṣi devān su adhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
translated: Let the doors that are eager be opened, and bring hither the gods who are eager.🔽O Agni, come and worship the gods with the oblation, O all-knower, make ready the offerings.

original: svadhvarā karati jātavedā yakṣad devāṃ amṛtān piprayac ca //
analyzed: su adhvarā karati jātavedāḥ yakṣat devān amṛtān piprayat ca
translated: The all-knower makes ready the offerings, let him worship the immortal gods and satisfy them.

original: vaṃsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyā bhavantv āśiṣo no adya //
analyzed: vaṃsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyāḥ bhavantu āśiṣaḥ naḥ adya
translated: Sing forth all your most excellent treasures, O wise one, let our prayers be fulfilled for us this day.

original: tvām u te dadhire havyavāhaṃ devāso agna ūrja ā napātam //
analyzed: tvām u te dadhire havyavāham devāsaḥ agne ūrjaḥ ā napātam
translated: The gods have made thee, O Agni, bearer of the oblation, their son, for strength.

original: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma maho no ratnā vi dadha iyānaḥ //
analyzed: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma mahaḥ naḥ ratnā vi dadhe iyānaḥ
translated: May we be the worshippers of that God of thine, O Agni, bestowing great treasures on us, O thou who art to be invoked.

original: tve ha yat pitaraś cin na indra viśvā vāmā jaritāro asanvan /
analyzed: tve ha yat pitaraḥ cit naḥ indra viśvā vāmā jaritāraḥ asanvan
translated: In thee, O Indra, as in fathers, have the singers, thinking of all good things, been established.

original: tve gāvaḥ sudughās tve hy aśvās tvaṃ vasu devayate vaniṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: tve gāvaḥ su dughāḥ tve hi aśvāḥ tvam vasu devayate vaniṣṭhaḥ
translated: In thee are the well-milking cows, in thee the horses: thou, O Vasu, art the best bestower on the worshipper.

original: rājeva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣy evāva dyubhir abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san /
analyzed: rājā iva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣi eva ava dyubhiḥ abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san
translated: Thou, O wise one, art to be known, as a king among thy people, by thy glories, when thou hast overcome the foe.

original: piśā giro maghavan gobhir aśvais tvāyataḥ śiśīhi rāye asmān //
analyzed: piśa giraḥ maghavan gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ tvāyataḥ śiśīhi rāye asmān
translated: O bountiful one, with cattle and with horses sharpen for us our songs, as they strive (to win thy favour), and make us rich.

original: imā u tvā paspṛdhānāso atra mandrā giro devayantīr upa sthuḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā paspṛdhānāsaḥ atra mandrāḥ giraḥ devayantīḥ upa sthuḥ
translated: These thy gladdening songs, O Indra, striving (to win thy favour), have approached thee here, the songs that long for the gods.

original: arvācī te pathyā rāya etu syāma te sumatāv indra śarman //
analyzed: arvācī te pathyā rāyaḥ etu syāma te sumatau indra śarman
translated: May thy path to riches come hither: may we be in thy good grace, O Indra, for protection.

original: dhenuṃ na tvā sūyavase dudukṣann upa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: dhenum na tvā sūyavase dudukṣan upa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: They have milked thee, as a milch cow, for the sake of the good pasture, to the prayers (addressed to thee), O Vasishṭha.

original: tvām in me gopatiṃ viśva āhā na indraḥ sumatiṃ gantv accha //
analyzed: tvām id me gopatim viśve āha ā naḥ indraḥ sumatim gantu accha
translated: All have called thee the lord of the cattle: may Indra come to us with his good will.

original: arṇāṃsi cit paprathānā sudāsa indro gādhāny akṛṇot supārā /
analyzed: arṇāṃsi cit paprathānā sudāse indraḥ gādhāni akṛṇot su pārā
translated: Indra has made the Sudâs, though his streams spread far, easy to cross, and easy to ford.

original: śardhantaṃ śimyum ucathasya navyaḥ śāpaṃ sindhūnām akṛṇod aśastīḥ //
analyzed: śardhantam śimyum ucathasya navyaḥ śāpam sindhūnām akṛṇot aśastīḥ
translated: The new one of Ucathas made the rushing Shimû the chastiser of the rivers' curse.

original: puroḷā it turvaśo yakṣur āsīd rāye matsyāso niśitā apīva /🔽śruṣṭiṃ cakrur bhṛgavo druhyavaś ca sakhā sakhāyam atarad viṣūcoḥ //
analyzed: puroḷās id turvaśaḥ yakṣuḥ āsīt rāye matsyāsaḥ niśitāḥ api iva  śruṣṭim cakruḥ bhṛgavaḥ druhyavaḥ ca sakhā sakhāyam atarat viṣūcoḥ
translated: The Puròlas were the Yakshus of Turvasa, the Matsyas of Nîshita were the Apîvas of Râya.🔽The Bhrigus and the Druhyus made him their choice: the friend passed over the distress of his friend.

original: ā pakthāso bhalānaso bhanantālināso viṣāṇinaḥ śivāsaḥ /
analyzed: ā pakthāsaḥ bhalānasaḥ viṣāṇinaḥ śivāsaḥ
translated: The Pakshas, the Bhalanasas, the Alinasas, the Visânins, the Shivas, have roared.

original: ā yo 'nayat sadhamā āryasya gavyā tṛtsubhyo ajagan yudhā nṝn //
analyzed: ā yaḥ nayat sadhamāḥ āryasya gavyā tṛtsubhyaḥ ajagan yudhā nṝn
translated: He who brought the good assembly of the noble, conquered the men of the Tṛtsus in battle for the sake of cattle.

original: durādhyo aditiṃ srevayanto 'cetaso vi jagṛbhre paruṣṇīm /
analyzed: durādhyaḥ aditim srevayantaḥ cetasaḥ vi jagṛbhre paruṣṇīm
translated: The Durâdhyas, the Aditis, the Srevayas, the Achetâs, seized Parushṇî.

original: mahnāvivyak pṛthivīm patyamānaḥ paśuṣ kavir aśayac cāyamānaḥ //
analyzed: mahnā avivyak pṛthivīm patyamānaḥ paśuḥ kaviḥ aśayat cāyamānaḥ
translated: The great one, ruling over the earth, the animal, the wise one, lay down, being worshipped.

original: īyur arthaṃ na nyartham paruṣṇīm āśuś caned abhipitvaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: īyuḥ artham na nyartham paruṣṇīm āśuḥ cana id abhipitvam jagāma
translated: They went to their goal, not to a useless one: Parushni was quickly reached by the swift one.

original: sudāsa indraḥ sutukāṃ amitrān arandhayan mānuṣe vadhrivācaḥ //🔽īyur gāvo na yavasād agopā yathākṛtam abhi mitraṃ citāsaḥ /
analyzed: sudāse indraḥ sutukām amitrān arandhayat mānuṣe vadhri vācaḥ  īyuḥ gāvaḥ na yavasāt agopāḥ yathākṛtam abhi mitram citāsaḥ
translated: Indra, Sudâs, with good wishes, the enemies who spoke evil in human speech, he confounded.🔽The cows went not to grass without a herdsman: the thoughtful ones went to their appointed friend.

original: pṛśnigāvaḥ pṛśninipreṣitāsaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakrur niyuto rantayaś ca //
analyzed: pṛśni gāvaḥ pṛśni nipreṣitāsaḥ śruṣṭim cakruḥ niyutaḥ rantayaḥ ca
translated: The cows with dappled calves, sent forth by the dappled one, made him their choice, and the teams and the companions.

original: ekaṃ ca yo viṃśatiṃ ca śravasyā vaikarṇayor janān rājā ny astaḥ /
analyzed: ekam ca yaḥ viṃśatim ca śravasyā vaikarṇayoḥ janān rājā ni astaḥ
translated: The king has slain the twenty men of Vikarna and Eka, who were reviling him.

original: dasmo na sadman ni śiśāti barhiḥ śūraḥ sargam akṛṇod indra eṣām //
analyzed: dasmaḥ na sadman ni śiśāti barhiḥ śūraḥ sargam akṛṇot indraḥ eṣām
translated: The hero Indra has sharpened the grass in their abode, and has made this their escape.

original: adha śrutaṃ kavaṣaṃ vṛddham apsv anu druhyuṃ ni vṛṇag vajrabāhuḥ /
analyzed: adha śrutam kavaṣam vṛddham apsu anu druhyum ni vṛṇak vajra bāhuḥ
translated: The one with the thunderbolt in his arm has chosen the famous old Kavasa among the waters, and Druhyu.

original: vṛṇānā atra sakhyāya sakhyaṃ tvāyanto ye amadann anu tvā //
analyzed: vṛṇānāḥ atra sakhyāya sakhyam tvāyantaḥ ye amadan anu tvā
translated: Choosing here friendship with a friend, those who have been intoxicated following you, have come to you.

original: vi sadyo viśvā dṛṃhitāny eṣām indraḥ puraḥ sahasā sapta dardaḥ /
analyzed: vi sadyas viśvā dṛṃhitāni eṣām indraḥ puraḥ sahasā sapta dardar
translated: Indra has shattered all their strongholds, the seven, with violence, in one day.

original: vy ānavasya tṛtsave gayam bhāg jeṣma pūruṃ vidathe mṛdhravācam //
analyzed: vi ānavasya tṛtsave gayam bhāk jeṣma pūrum vidathe mṛdhra vācam
translated: We have gained the wealth of the son of Anuva, the Tritsus, and Puru, who speaks harshly in the assembly.

original: ni gavyavo 'navo druhyavaś ca ṣaṣṭiḥ śatā suṣupuḥ ṣaṭ sahasrā /
analyzed: ni gavyavaḥ navaḥ druhyavaḥ ca ṣaṣṭiḥ śatā suṣupuḥ ṣaḍ sahasrā
translated: The Anus, the Druhyus, and the Gavyus have slept soundly, sixty hundred, and six thousand.

original: ṣaṣṭir vīrāso adhi ṣaḍ duvoyu viśved indrasya vīryā kṛtāni //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ vīrāsaḥ adhi ṣaṣ duvoyu viśvā id indrasya vīryā kṛtāni
translated: Sixty heroes, and six who are ready for service, all the deeds of Indra's heroism have been done.

original: indreṇaite tṛtsavo veviṣāṇā āpo na sṛṣṭā adhavanta nīcīḥ /
analyzed: indreṇa ete tṛtsavaḥ veviṣāṇāḥ āpaḥ na sṛṣṭāḥ adhavanta nīcīḥ
translated: These Tritsus, longing for it, have rushed forward with Indra, like waters let loose, flowing downward.

original: durmitrāsaḥ prakalavin mimānā jahur viśvāni bhojanā sudāse //
analyzed: durmitrāsaḥ prakala vid mimānāḥ jahuḥ viśvāni bhojanā sudāse
translated: The evil-minded ones, measuring with the Prakalavis, have abandoned all the enjoyments for Sudasa.

original: ardhaṃ vīrasya śṛtapām anindram parā śardhantaṃ nunude abhi kṣām /
analyzed: ardham vīrasya śṛta pām an indram parā śardhantam nunude abhi kṣām
translated: The half of the hero who drinks the cooked food, who is not Indra, the one who is eager to strike, he has driven away from the earth.

original: indro manyum manyumyo mimāya bheje patho vartanim patyamānaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ manyum manyumyaḥ mimāya bheje pathaḥ vartanim patyamānaḥ
translated: Indra, the wrathful one, having measured out wrath, has taken the path, the way, as lord.

original: ādhreṇa cit tad v ekaṃ cakāra siṃhyaṃ cit petvenā jaghāna /🔽ava sraktīr veśyāvṛścad indraḥ prāyacchad viśvā bhojanā sudāse //
analyzed: ādhreṇa cit tat u ekam cakāra siṃhyam cit petvena ā jaghāna  ava sraktīḥ veśyā avṛścat indraḥ prāyacchat viśvā bhojanā sudāse
translated: He made even the wet one one, he struck down even the lion-like one with a small one.🔽Indra has torn away the bonds, has bestowed all enjoyments on Sudās.

original: śaśvanto hi śatravo rāradhuṣ ṭe bhedasya cic chardhato vinda randhim /
analyzed: śaśvantaḥ hi śatravaḥ rāradhuḥ ṭe bhedasya cit śardhataḥ vinda randhim
translated: For ever and ever have the enemies to be active for thee; find delight in the breaking up of the impetuous one.

original: martāṃ ena stuvato yaḥ kṛṇoti tigmaṃ tasmin ni jahi vajram indra //
analyzed: martān enā stuvataḥ yaḥ kṛṇoti tigmam tasmin ni jahi vajram indra
translated: On the mortal who praises thee, O Indra, who does evil, lay thy sharp thunderbolt.

original: āvad indraṃ yamunā tṛtsavaś ca prātra bhedaṃ sarvatātā muṣāyat /
analyzed: āvat indram yamunā tṛtsavaḥ ca pra atra bhedam sarvatātā muṣāyat
translated: The Yamunā, the Tṛtsus, and Indra, have all together destroyed the breaking up of the house.

original: ajāsaś ca śigravo yakṣavaś ca baliṃ śīrṣāṇi jabhrur aśvyāni //
analyzed: ajāsaḥ ca śigravaḥ yakṣavaḥ ca balim śīrṣāṇi jabhruḥ aśvyāni
translated: The goats, the Sigrus, the Yakṣus, have brought tribute, the heads of horses.

original: na ta indra sumatayo na rāyaḥ saṃcakṣe pūrvā uṣaso na nūtnāḥ /
analyzed: na te indra sumatayaḥ na rāyaḥ saṃcakṣe pūrvāḥ uṣasaḥ na nūtnāḥ
translated: Thy good-will, O Indra, and thy wealth, I reckon not as much as the former dawns and the new ones.

original: devakaṃ cin mānyamānaṃ jaghanthāva tmanā bṛhataḥ śambaram bhet //
analyzed: devakam cit mānyamānam jaghanthāva tmanā bṛhataḥ śambaram bhet
translated: Thou hast slain even the god-like one who was to be despised; thou hast broken with thy own self the great Sumbha.

original: pra ye gṛhād amamadus tvāyā parāśaraḥ śatayātur vasiṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: pra ye gṛhāt amamaduḥ tvāyā parāśaraḥ śata yātuḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Those who have rejoiced in thy house, Pārāśara, Śatayātu, Vasiṣṭha,

original: na te bhojasya sakhyam mṛṣantādhā sūribhyaḥ sudinā vy ucchān //
analyzed: na te bhojasya sakhyam mṛṣanta adhā sūribhyaḥ su dinā vi ucchān
translated: Do not deceive the friendship of Bhoja; shine forth for the princes with fair days.

original: dve naptur devavataḥ śate gor dvā rathā vadhūmantā sudāsaḥ /
analyzed: dve naptuḥ devavataḥ śate goḥ dvā rathā vadhūmantā sudāsaḥ
translated: Two hundred cows of Devavata's grandson, two chariots with brides, O Sudâs,

original: arhann agne paijavanasya dānaṃ hoteva sadma pary emi rebhan //
analyzed: arhan agne paijavanasya dānam hotā iva sadma pari emi rebhan
translated: I, Agni, worthy of the gift of Paijavana, go round the house singing like a Hotri priest.

original: catvāro mā paijavanasya dānāḥ smaddiṣṭayaḥ kṛśanino nireke /
analyzed: catvāraḥ mā paijavanasya dānāḥ smad diṣṭayaḥ kṛśaninaḥ nireke
translated: Four gifts of Paijavana, which are to be desired, with black horses, in the front,

original: ṛjrāso mā pṛthiviṣṭhāḥ sudāsas tokaṃ tokāya śravase vahanti //
analyzed: ṛjrāsaḥ mā pṛthiviṣṭhāḥ sudāsaḥ tokam tokāya śravase vahanti
translated: The red ones, most extensive on earth, O Sudâs, carry offspring for offspring's sake.

original: yasya śravo rodasī antar urvī śīrṣṇeśīrṣṇe vibabhājā vibhaktā /
analyzed: yasya śravaḥ rodasī antar urvī śīrṣṇe śīrṣṇe vibabhājā vibhaktā
translated: Whose fame is divided, divided in the two vast worlds, in the head, in the head,

original: sapted indraṃ na sravato gṛṇanti ni yudhyāmadhim aśiśād abhīke //🔽imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatānu divodāsaṃ na pitaraṃ sudāsaḥ /
analyzed: sapta id indram na sravataḥ gṛṇanti ni yudhyāmadhim aśiśāt abhīke  imam naraḥ marutaḥ saścata anu divodāsam na pitaram sudāsaḥ
translated: The seven, as if flowing, praise Indra, who has sharpened his weapon in the battle.🔽This Sudâs, O Maruts, men, follow as a father Divodâsa,

original: aviṣṭanā paijavanasya ketaṃ dūṇāśaṃ kṣatram ajaraṃ duvoyu //
analyzed: aviṣṭanā paijavanasya ketam dūṇāśam kṣatram ajaram duvoyu
translated: The banner of Paijavana, who has conquered, the hope of the people, the imperishable kingdom, which is to be served.

original: yas tigmaśṛṅgo vṛṣabho na bhīma ekaḥ kṛṣṭīś cyāvayati pra viśvāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ cyāvayati pra viśvāḥ
translated: He who, terrible like a sharp-horned bull, alone shakes all the peoples,

original: yaḥ śaśvato adāśuṣo gayasya prayantāsi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ śaśvataḥ a dāśuṣaḥ gayasya prayantāsi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ
translated: Who art the punisher of the niggardly, the giver of wealth to the more hospitable, of the sacrificer who ever offers.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad indra kutsam āvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad indra kutsam āvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tanvā samarye
translated: You, O Indra, helped Kutsa, listening to him with your body in the battle,

original: dāsaṃ yac chuṣṇaṃ kuyavaṃ ny asmā arandhaya ārjuneyāya śikṣan //
analyzed: dāsam yat śuṣṇam kuyavam ni asmai arandhayaḥ ārjuneyāya śikṣan
translated: When you led the Dāsa, the evil one, to destruction for Ārjuneya, the son of Kuya.

original: tvaṃ dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyam prāvo viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ sudāsam /
analyzed: tvam dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyam prāvaḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ sudāsam
translated: You, O bold one, with your boldness, helped Vītahavya, Sudās, with all your aids,

original: pra paurukutsiṃ trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtrahatyeṣu pūrum //
analyzed: pra paurukutsim trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetra sātā vṛtra hatyeṣu pūrum
translated: You helped Purukutsa, Trasadasyu, Pūru in the contests for land, in the slaying of Vr̥itra.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhir nṛmaṇo devavītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi /
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ nṛmaṇaḥ deva vītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi
translated: You, O man-delighting one, with men in the feast of the gods, O you with the bay steeds, slayest many Vr̥itras.

original: tvaṃ ni dasyuṃ cumuriṃ dhuniṃ cāsvāpayo dabhītaye suhantu //🔽tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puro navatiṃ ca sadyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam ni dasyum cumurim dhunim ca asvāpayaḥ dabhītaye su hantu  tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puras navatim ca sadyas
translated: You, for the sake of Dabhîti, hast slain the Dasyu, the demon, the thunderer, for the good slayer.🔽These are your mighty deeds, O you with the thunderbolt in your hand, that you have suddenly destroyed nine and ninety forts,

original: niveśane śatatamāviveṣīr ahañ ca vṛtraṃ namucim utāhan //
analyzed: niveśane śatatama aviveṣīḥ aham ca vṛtram namucim uta ahan
translated: And hast entered the hundredth dwelling, and hast slain Vr̥itra and Namuci.

original: sanā tā ta indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse /🔽vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam //
analyzed: sanā tā te indra bhojanāni rāta havyāya dāśuṣe sudāse  vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam
translated: These are your gifts, O Indra, to the worshipper, to the generous Sudās, who offers you oblations.🔽I yoke for you, O mighty one, your two mighty bay steeds. Let the prayers go forth, O you of much strength, for booty.

original: mā te asyāṃ sahasāvan pariṣṭāv aghāya bhūma harivaḥ parādai /
analyzed: mā te asyām sahasāvan pariṣṭau aghāya bhūma harivas parādai
translated: Do not, O victorious one, in this region, O you who delight in the bay steeds, give up the sinner to destruction.

original: trāyasva no 'vṛkebhir varūthais tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma //
analyzed: trāyasva naḥ vṛkebhiḥ varūthaiḥ tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma
translated: Protect us with thy saving helps: may we be dear to thee among the princes.
