original: priyāsa it te maghavann abhiṣṭau naro madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: priyāsaḥ id te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ
translated: Dear unto thee, O Maghavan, in battle, may we, thy friends, O Hero, be in thy favour.

original: ni turvaśaṃ ni yādvaṃ śiśīhy atithigvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan //
analyzed: ni turvaśam ni yādvam śiśīhi atithigvāya śaṃsyam kariṣyan
translated: Crush down Turvaga and Yadva, O Indra, that thou mayst do honour to Atithigva.

original: sadyaś cin nu te maghavann abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsanty ukthaśāsa ukthā /
analyzed: sadyas cit nu te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsanti uktha śāsaḥ ukthā
translated: Even now, O Maghavan, in battle, men, O Indra, who order the lauds, are singing praises.

original: ye te havebhir vi paṇīṃr adāśann asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai //
analyzed: ye te havebhiḥ vi paṇīṃr adāśan asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai
translated: They who with their invocations have vanquished the Pāṇis, choose us for the alliance.

original: ete stomā narāṃ nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañco dadato maghāni /🔽teṣām indra vṛtrahatye śivo bhūḥ sakhā ca śūro 'vitā ca nṛṇām //
analyzed: ete stomāḥ narām nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañcaḥ dadataḥ maghāni  teṣām indra vṛtra hatye śivaḥ bhūḥ sakhā ca śūraḥ vitā ca nṛṇām
translated: These praises, O most manly of men, are for thee: they, seeking us, bestow their gifts and treasures.🔽Be thou, O Indra, a kind friend to them in the slaying of Vrtra, a hero, a protector of men.

original: nū indra śūra stavamāna ūtī brahmajūtas tanvā vāvṛdhasva /
analyzed: nu indra śūra stavamānaḥ ūtī brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhasva
translated: Now, O Indra, hero, be thou strong, when lauded, strengthened by prayer, for help.

original: upa no vājān mimīhy upa stīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽ugro jajñe vīryāya svadhāvāñ cakrir apo naryo yat kariṣyan /
analyzed: upa naḥ vājān mimīhi upa stīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  ugraḥ jajñe vīryāya svadhāvān cakriḥ apaḥ naryaḥ yat kariṣyan
translated: Measure out for us strength and food: ye, preserve us evermore with your protections.🔽Fierce hath he been born for hero strength, the God-devoted man, when he will do his work.

original: jagmir yuvā nṛṣadanam avobhis trātā na indra enaso mahaś cit //
analyzed: jagmiḥ yuvā nṛṣadanam avobhiḥ trātā naḥ indraḥ enasaḥ mahaḥ cit
translated: The young, the active, hath gone to the men's abode with his aids: Indra hath saved us even from great distress.

original: hantā vṛtram indraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīn nu vīro jaritāram ūtī /
analyzed: hantā vṛtram indraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīt nu vīraḥ jaritāram ūtī
translated: Indra, the slayer of Vrtra, shining forth, has brought help to the hero who sings his praise.

original: kartā sudāse aha vā u lokaṃ dātā vasu muhur ā dāśuṣe bhūt //🔽yudhmo anarvā khajakṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāḍ januṣem aṣāḷhaḥ /
analyzed: kartā sudāse aha vai u lokam dātā vasu muhur ā dāśuṣe bhūt  yudhmaḥ anarvā khaja kṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāh januṣā īm aṣāḷhaḥ
translated: He has made a wide space for Sudās, and has again and again become the giver of wealth to the worshipper.🔽The warrior who cannot be conquered, the destroyer of forts, the victor in battles, the hero who is irresistible in battle,

original: vy āsa indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā adhā viśvaṃ śatrūyantaṃ jaghāna //🔽ubhe cid indra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhis tuviṣmaḥ /
analyzed: vi āsa indraḥ pṛtanāḥ su ojāḥ adhā viśvam śatrūyantam jaghāna  ubhe cit indra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhiḥ tuviṣmas
translated: Indra has spread out the battles, the mighty one, with his own strength, has struck down every foe.🔽O Indra, with your greatness you have filled both worlds, O mighty one.

original: ni vajram indro harivān mimikṣan sam andhasā madeṣu vā uvoca //
analyzed: ni vajram indraḥ harivān mimikṣan sam andhasā madeṣu vai uvoca
translated: Indra, the tawny one, has grasped his thunderbolt, and has spoken in the gatherings, in the joys.

original: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇaṃ raṇāya tam u cin nārī naryaṃ sasūva /
analyzed: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇam raṇāya tam u cit nārī naryam sasūva
translated: The bull has generated the bull for battle, and the woman has given birth to the man who is a man.

original: pra yaḥ senānīr adha nṛbhyo astīnaḥ satvā gaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ //
analyzed: pra yaḥ senā nīḥ adha nṛbhyaḥ astīnaḥ satvā gaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ
translated: He who is the general of the people, the warrior, the seeker of cattle, he is the bold one.

original: nū cit sa bhreṣate jano na reṣan mano yo asya ghoram āvivāsāt /🔽yajñair ya indre dadhate duvāṃsi kṣayat sa rāya ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ //
analyzed: nu cit sa bhreṣate janaḥ na reṣat manaḥ yaḥ asya ghoram āvivāsāt  yajñaiḥ yaḥ indre dadhate duvāṃsi kṣayat sa rāyaḥ ṛta pāḥ ṛtejāḥ
translated: Never is that people destroyed, never is it afflicted, whose mind has entered into his terrible (power).🔽He who offers oblations to Indra with sacrifices, he, the finder of wealth, the righteous one, the powerful one, shall prosper.

original: yad indra pūrvo aparāya śikṣann ayaj jyāyān kanīyaso deṣṇam /
analyzed: yat indra pūrvaḥ aparāya śikṣan ayat jyāyān kanīyasaḥ deṣṇam
translated: When Indra, the greater, instructed the lesser one, he worshipped the gift of the lesser one.

original: amṛta it pary āsīta dūram ā citra citryam bharā rayiṃ naḥ //
analyzed: amṛte id pari āsīta dūram ā citra citryam bhara rayim naḥ
translated: Let him sit down as it were in the immortal, far away. Bring us the wonderful, the variegated wealth.

original: yas ta indra priyo jano dadāśad asan nireke adrivaḥ sakhā te /
analyzed: yaḥ te indra priyaḥ janaḥ dadāśat asat nireke adrivas sakhā te
translated: O Indra, the people who are dear to thee, who give, who are in the neighbourhood, O wielder of the thunderbolt, are thy friends.

original: vayaṃ te asyāṃ sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe aghnato nṛpītau //
analyzed: vayam te asyām sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe a ghnataḥ nṛ pītau
translated: May we be the most devoted to this thy favour, in the protection of the guiltless, O thou who lovest men.

original: eṣa stomo acikradad vṛṣā ta uta stāmur maghavann akrapiṣṭa /
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ acikradat vṛṣā te uta stāmuḥ maghavan akrapiṣṭa
translated: This is the praise that hath been uttered, O Indra, and the prayer, O Maghavan.

original: rāyas kāmo jaritāraṃ ta āgan tvam aṅga śakra vasva ā śako naḥ //🔽sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhās tmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti /
analyzed: rāyaḥ kāmaḥ jaritāram te āgan tvam aṅga śakra vasvaḥ ā śakaḥ naḥ  sa naḥ indra tvayatāyai iṣe dhāḥ tmanā ca ye maghavānaḥ junanti
translated: The desire of wealth hath come to the singer. Thou, O Sakra, art able to give us wealth.🔽So, O Indra, bestow on us food that is to be enjoyed by thee, and by those who are rich in themselves.

original: vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktir yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vasvī su te jaritre astu śaktiḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Let there be wealth in thy power for the singer. Do ye, O Indra, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: asāvi devaṃ goṛjīkam andho ny asminn indro januṣem uvoca /
analyzed: asāvi devam goṛjīkam andhaḥ ni asmin indraḥ januṣā īm uvoca
translated: The priest hath pressed the God who delights in the milk. In this birth Indra hath spoken to him.

original: bodhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñair bodhā na stomam andhaso madeṣu //
analyzed: bodhāmasi tvā hari aśva yajñaiḥ bodha naḥ stomam andhasaḥ madeṣu
translated: We will awake thee, O thou of the bay steeds, with sacrifices. Awake to the praise of the juice in the wild joys.

original: pra yanti yajñaṃ vipayanti barhiḥ somamādo vidathe dudhravācaḥ /
analyzed: pra yanti yajñam vipayanti barhiḥ somamādaḥ vidathe dudhra vācaḥ
translated: They go to the sacrifice, they strew the sacred grass, the impetuous-voiced ones in the assembly to the Soma.

original: ny u bhriyante yaśaso gṛbhād ā dūraupabdo vṛṣaṇo nṛṣācaḥ //
analyzed: ni u bhriyante yaśasaḥ gṛbhāt ā dūraupabdaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ nṛṣācaḥ
translated: They are borne down from the grasp of the fame-giving one, the two far-reaching strong ones, the men's companions.

original: tvam indra sravitavā apas kaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra sravitavai apaḥ kaḥ pariṣṭhitāḥ ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast let loose the waters that were held back by the dragon, O hero, in the east.

original: tvad vāvakre rathyo na dhenā rejante viśvā kṛtrimāṇi bhīṣā //
analyzed: tvat vāvakre rathyaḥ na dhenāḥ rejante viśvā kṛtrimāṇi bhīṣā
translated: Even as the chariot-steeds of him who turns aside, through fear, all the contrivances of the enemy.

original: bhīmo viveṣāyudhebhir eṣām apāṃsi viśvā naryāṇi vidvān /
analyzed: bhīmaḥ viveṣa āyudhebhiḥ eṣām apāṃsi viśvā naryāṇi vidvān
translated: Terrible, he hath entered with his weapons, knowing all manly deeds and all the acts of men.

original: indraḥ puro jarhṛṣāṇo vi dūdhod vi vajrahasto mahinā jaghāna //
analyzed: indraḥ puraḥ jarhṛṣāṇaḥ vi dūdhot vi vajra hastaḥ mahinā jaghāna
translated: Indra hath roared, shaking the forts, and with his might, the wielder of the thunderbolt, hath smitten.

original: na yātava indra jūjuvur no na vandanā śaviṣṭha vedyābhiḥ /🔽sa śardhad aryo viṣuṇasya jantor mā śiśnadevā api gur ṛtaṃ naḥ //
analyzed: na yātavaḥ indra jūjuvuḥ naḥ na vandanā śaviṣṭha vedyābhiḥ  sa śardhat aryaḥ viṣuṇasya jantoḥ mā śiśna devāḥ api guḥ ṛtam naḥ
translated: The challengers have not incited me, O Indra, nor the adorations, O Most Potent One, with their offerings.🔽Let not the gods who delight in the sacrifice pass by the man who is to be helped by thee, O thou who art to be praised by many.

original: abhi kratvendra bhūr adha jman na te vivyaṅ mahimānaṃ rajāṃsi /
analyzed: abhi kratvā indra bhūḥ adha jman na te vivyak mahimānam rajāṃsi
translated: Rise up, O Indra, to the contest, to the fight: thy greatness, O God, the regions do not comprehend.

original: svenā hi vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghantha na śatrur antaṃ vividad yudhā te //
analyzed: svena hi vṛtram śavasā jaghantha na śatruḥ antam vividat yudhā te
translated: For by thine own power thou slewest Vritra: thy foe hath found no end of thee in battle.

original: devāś cit te asuryāya pūrve 'nu kṣatrāya mamire sahāṃsi /🔽indro maghāni dayate viṣahyendraṃ vājasya johuvanta sātau //
analyzed: devāḥ cit te asuryāya pūrve nu kṣatrāya mamire sahāṃsi  indraḥ maghāni dayate viṣahya indram vājasya johuvanta sātau
translated: Even the gods of old, for thy godhead, have measured out great powers for thy lordship.🔽Indra bestows the treasures hard to win: in the winning of strength they call on Indra.

original: kīriś cid dhi tvām avase juhāveśānam indra saubhagasya bhūreḥ /
analyzed: kīriḥ cit hi tvām avase juhāva īśānam indra saubhagasya bhūreḥ
translated: Even the poor man, O Indra, must invoke thee for the sake of help, for the sake of great prosperity.

original: avo babhūtha śatamūte asme abhikṣattus tvāvato varūtā //🔽sakhāyas ta indra viśvaha syāma namovṛdhāso mahinā tarutra /🔽vanvantu smā te 'vasā samīke 'bhītim aryo vanuṣāṃ śavāṃsi //
analyzed: avas babhūtha śatamūte asme abhikṣattuḥ tvāvataḥ varūtā  sakhāyaḥ te indra viśvaha syāma namaḥ vṛdhāsaḥ mahinā tarutra  vanvantu smā te vasā samīke bhītim aryaḥ vanuṣām śavāṃsi
translated: Thou hast become our own, O thou of a hundred powers, for the protection of him who supplicates thee, O thou who givest good gifts.🔽May we all be thy friends, O Indra, O thou who art to be magnified, with homage increasing thee in might.🔽Let them enjoy thy help in the conflict, let the noble ones enjoy the strength of the worshippers.

original: sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhās tmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti /
analyzed: sa naḥ indra tvayatāyai iṣe dhāḥ tmanā ca ye maghavānaḥ junanti
translated: Grant us, O Indra, food to be enjoyed by thee, and by those who are bountiful and who incite (thee to action).

original: vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktir yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vasvī su te jaritre astu śaktiḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Let there be wealth in thy power for the singer. Do ye preserve us ever with your blessings.

original: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yaṃ te suṣāva haryaśvādriḥ /
analyzed: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yam te suṣāva haryaśva adriḥ
translated: Drink the Soma, O Indra, let it delight thee, which the stone, O thou with bay steeds, hath pressed for thee.

original: sotur bāhubhyāṃ suyato nārvā //
analyzed: sotuḥ bāhubhyām su yataḥ na arvā
translated: Well guided by the arms of the presser, as by reins.

original: yas te mado yujyaś cārur asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi /
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ yujyaḥ cāruḥ asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi
translated: That gladdening draught of thine which is meet for the yoke, wherewith thou slayest the foes, O thou with bay steeds,

original: sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu //
analyzed: sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu
translated: Let that, O Indra, make thee glad, O thou who hast much wealth.

original: bodhā su me maghavan vācam emāṃ yāṃ te vasiṣṭho arcati praśastim /
analyzed: bodha su me maghavan vācam ā imām yām te vasiṣṭhaḥ arcati praśastim
translated: Mark thou well this speech of mine, O bountiful one, which Vasistha sings to thee in praise.

original: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva //
analyzed: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva
translated: Accept this prayer in the assembly of the holy.

original: śrudhī havaṃ vipipānasyādrer bodhā viprasyārcato manīṣām /
analyzed: śrudhi havam vipipānasya adreḥ bodha viprasya arcataḥ manīṣām
translated: Hear the call of the thirsty one, of the mountain, mark thou the thought of the singer who extols thee.

original: kṛṣvā duvāṃsy antamā sacemā //
analyzed: kṛṣva duvāṃsi antamā sacā imā
translated: Make thou these stalls of thine the nearest (to us).

original: na te giro api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutim asuryasya vidvān /
analyzed: na te giraḥ api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutim asuryasya vidvān
translated: I will not endure the words of the impetuous one, nor the good praise of the Asura, O wise one.

original: sadā te nāma svayaśo vivakmi //
analyzed: sadā te nāma sva yaśaḥ vivakmi
translated: I always proclaim your name, your glory.

original: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvām it /
analyzed: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvām id
translated: For you have many libations among men; the wise one invokes you much.

original: māre asman maghavañ jyok kaḥ //
analyzed: mā āre asmat maghavan jyok kaḥ
translated: Keep us far away from misfortune, O bountiful one.

original: tubhyed imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyam brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi /
analyzed: tubhya id imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyam brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi
translated: To you, O hero, all these libations, to you I make the prayers that bring prosperity.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhir havyo viśvadhāsi //
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ havyaḥ viśvadha asi
translated: You are to be invoked by men in every way.

original: nū cin nu te manyamānasya dasmod aśnuvanti mahimānam ugra /
analyzed: nu cit nu te manyamānasya dasma ud aśnuvanti mahimānam ugra
translated: Now indeed they attain the greatness of your wondrous one, O mighty one, of you who think.

original: na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ //
analyzed: na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ
translated: Not your heroic power, O Indra, nor your bounty.

original: ye ca pūrva ṛṣayo ye ca nūtnā indra brahmāṇi janayanta viprāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca pūrve ṛṣayaḥ ye ca nūtnāḥ indra brahmāṇi janayanta viprāḥ
translated: Those ancient seers and those new ones, O Indra, the inspired ones who beget prayers,

original: asme te santu sakhyā śivāni yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: asme te santu sakhyā śivāni yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May they have your auspicious friendships with us. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: ud u brahmāṇy airata śravasyendraṃ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha /
analyzed: ud u brahmāṇi airata śravasyā indram samarye mahaya vasiṣṭha
translated: The prayers have risen up, O Vasistha, to exalt Indra for fame in the battle,

original: ā yo viśvāni śavasā tatānopaśrotā ma īvato vacāṃsi //
analyzed: ā yaḥ viśvāni śavasā tatāna upaśrotā me īvataḥ vacāṃsi
translated: Who with his might has stretched out all things. He listens to my words, the bountiful one.

original: ayāmi ghoṣa indra devajāmir irajyanta yac churudho vivāci /
analyzed: ayāmi ghoṣaḥ indra deva jāmiḥ irajyanta yat śurudhaḥ vivāci
translated: The cry has come, O Indra, O son of the gods, when the impetuous ones are eager in their speech.

original: nahi svam āyuś cikite janeṣu tānīd aṃhāṃsy ati parṣy asmān //
analyzed: nahi svam āyuḥ cikite janeṣu tāni id aṃhāṃsi ati parṣi asmān
translated: For no one knows his own life-span among men. Carry us over all these troubles.

original: yuje rathaṃ gaveṣaṇaṃ haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ /🔽vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvendro vṛtrāṇy apratī jaghanvān //
analyzed: yuje ratham gaveṣaṇam haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ  vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvā indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī jaghanvān
translated: Yoke the chariot to be sought by the tawny coursers. They have come to the prayers, eager to enjoy.🔽He has spread out the two worlds with his greatness. Indra, the one with bent knees, has slain the unconquered Vr̥itras.

original: āpaś cit pipyu staryo na gāvo nakṣann ṛtaṃ jaritāras ta indra /
analyzed: āpaḥ cit pipyuḥ staryaḥ na gāvaḥ nakṣan ṛtam jaritāraḥ te indra
translated: Even the waters have swollen like young cows. The praisers have obtained your truth, O Indra.

original: yāhi vāyur na niyuto no acchā tvaṃ hi dhībhir dayase vi vājān //
analyzed: yāhi vāyuḥ na niyutaḥ naḥ acchā tvam hi dhībhiḥ dayase vi vājān
translated: Come to us, like Vayu, with your teams. For you, indeed, with thoughts, give out the prizes.

original: te tvā madā indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇaṃ tuvirādhasaṃ jaritre /
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇam tuvi rādhasam jaritre
translated: Let these gladdening draughts, O Indra, gladden you, the mighty one, the one with great opposition, for the praiser.

original: eko devatrā dayase hi martān asmiñ chūra savane mādayasva //
analyzed: ekaḥ devatrā dayase hi martān asmin śūra savane mādayasva
translated: For you alone, O god, show favor to mortals. Rejoice, O hero, at this libation.

original: eved indraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhuṃ vasiṣṭhāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ /
analyzed: eva id indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum vasiṣṭhāsaḥ abhī arcanti arkaiḥ
translated: Thus the Vasiṣṭhas praise with hymns Indra, the mighty one, with the thunderbolt in his arm.

original: sa na stuto vīravad dhātu gomad yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ stutaḥ vīravat dhātu gomat yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May he, when praised, grant the sacrificer wealth in heroes and cattle. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: yoniṣ ṭa indra sadane akāri tam ā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi /
analyzed: yoniḥ te indra sadane akāri tam ā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi
translated: The birthplace has been made for you, O Indra, in the seat. Come to it, O much-invoked one, with men.

original: aso yathā no 'vitā vṛdhe ca dado vasūni mamadaś ca somaiḥ //
analyzed: asaḥ yathā naḥ vitā vṛdhe ca dadaḥ vasūni mamadaḥ ca somaiḥ
translated: Be as our protector and promoter. Grant us treasures and rejoice with the Soma libations.

original: gṛbhītaṃ te mana indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni /
analyzed: gṛbhītam te manaḥ indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni
translated: O Indra, thy mind is grasped by the two-fold desire; the Soma is pressed, the sweet juices are sprinkled.

original: visṛṣṭadhenā bharate suvṛktir iyam indraṃ johuvatī manīṣā //
analyzed: visṛṣṭa dhenāḥ bharate suvṛktiḥ iyam indram johuvatī manīṣā
translated: The hymn, with its course set free, is brought to thee; this thought of mine is calling upon Indra.

original: ā no diva ā pṛthivyā ṛjīṣinn idam barhiḥ somapeyāya yāhi /🔽vahantu tvā harayo madryañcam āṅgūṣam acchā tavasam madāya //🔽ā no viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ sajoṣā brahma juṣāṇo haryaśva yāhi /
analyzed: ā naḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ ṛjīṣin idam barhiḥ soma peyāya yāhi  vahantu tvā harayaḥ madryañcam āṅgūṣam acchā tavasam madāya  ā naḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ brahma juṣāṇaḥ haryaśva yāhi
translated: From heaven to us, O active one, from earth come to this strew to drink the Soma.🔽Let the tawny coursers bring thee hitherward, the hymn, the strong, for the gladdening draught.🔽With all thy succours, accordant, O thou of Bay steeds, come to the prayer, delighting therein.

original: varīvṛjat sthavirebhiḥ suśiprāsme dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmam indra //
analyzed: varīvṛjat sthavirebhiḥ su śiprā asme dadhat vṛṣaṇam śuṣmam indra
translated: With the most ancient, O thou of fair cheeks, bestowing upon us heroic strength.

original: eṣa stomo maha ugrāya vāhe dhurīvātyo na vājayann adhāyi /🔽indra tvāyam arka īṭṭe vasūnāṃ divīva dyām adhi naḥ śromataṃ dhāḥ //
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ mahe ugrāya vāhe dhuri iva atyaḥ na vājayan adhāyi  indra tvā ayam arkaḥ īṭṭe vasūnām divi iva dyām adhi naḥ śromatam dhāḥ
translated: This is the praise for the great strong draught, as one who wins strength hath set it forth.🔽This hymn, O Indra, is offered for the sake of wealth; bestow upon us glory as it were in heaven.

original: evā na indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīṃ sumatiṃ vevidāma /
analyzed: eva naḥ indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīm sumatim vevidāma
translated: So, O Indra, be pleased with our best gift; we will find for thee a wide and ample favour.

original: iṣam pinva maghavadbhyaḥ suvīrāṃ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: iṣam pinva maghavadbhyaḥ su vīrām yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Make food to swell for the wealthy ones, rich in heroes; do ye all protect us evermore with your protections.

original: ā te maha indroty ugra samanyavo yat samaranta senāḥ /
analyzed: ā te mahaḥ indra ūtī ugra samanyavaḥ yat samaranta senāḥ
translated: Thus, O great and mighty Indra, are thy wrathful thoughts when the armies encounter each other.

original: patāti didyun naryasya bāhvor mā te mano viṣvadryag vi cārīt //
analyzed: patāti didyut naryasya bāhvoḥ mā te manaḥ viṣvadryak vi cārīt
translated: The lightning falls from the arms of the hero; let not thy mind wander in all directions.

original: ni durga indra śnathihy amitrāṃ abhi ye no martāso amanti /
analyzed: ni durge indra śnathihi amitrān abhi ye naḥ martāsaḥ amanti
translated: O Indra, break the forts, destroy the enemies, those who hate us among mortals.

original: āre taṃ śaṃsaṃ kṛṇuhi ninitsor ā no bhara sambharaṇaṃ vasūnām //
analyzed: āre tam śaṃsam kṛṇuhi ninitsoḥ ā naḥ bhara sambharaṇam vasūnām
translated: Turn away that slanderer's censure; bring us the gathering of treasures.

original: śataṃ te śiprinn ūtayaḥ sudāse sahasraṃ śaṃsā uta rātir astu /
analyzed: śatam te śiprin ūtayaḥ sudāse sahasram śaṃsāḥ uta rātiḥ astu
translated: O thou with beautiful lips, a hundred aids, a thousand praises, and a gift be to Sudasa.

original: jahi vadhar vanuṣo martyasyāsme dyumnam adhi ratnaṃ ca dhehi //
analyzed: jahi vadhar vanuṣaḥ martyasya asme dyumnam adhi ratnam ca dhehi
translated: Destroy the mortal's weapon; bestow upon us glory and wealth.

original: tvāvato hīndra kratve asmi tvāvato 'vituḥ śūra rātau /
analyzed: tvāvataḥ hi indra kratve asmi tvāvataḥ vituḥ śūra rātau
translated: For I am the supporter of thee, O Indra, in this rite, of thee, the protector, O hero, in the gift.

original: viśved ahāni taviṣīva ugraṃ okaḥ kṛṇuṣva harivo na mardhīḥ //
analyzed: viśvā id ahāni taviṣīvas ugram okaḥ kṛṇuṣva harivas na mardhīḥ
translated: Make all the days, as a powerful one, the abode of the fierce one; do not be faint, O thou who hast the tawny ones.

original: kutsā ete haryaśvāya śūṣam indre saho devajūtam iyānāḥ /
analyzed: kutsāḥ ete haryaśvāya śūṣam indre sahaḥ deva jūtam iyānāḥ
translated: These Kutsa people bring strength to the one with the tawny horses, Indra, the might impelled by the gods.

original: satrā kṛdhi suhanā śūra vṛtrā vayaṃ tarutrāḥ sanuyāma vājam //
analyzed: satrā kṛdhi su hanā śūra vṛtrā vayam tarutrāḥ sanuyāma vājam
translated: Always make the battles easy to win, O hero; may we, with brave warriors, win the booty.

original: evā na indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīṃ sumatiṃ vevidāma /
analyzed: eva naḥ indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīm sumatim vevidāma
translated: Thus, O Indra, grant us excellent boons; may we find thy great favor.

original: iṣam pinva maghavadbhyaḥ suvīrāṃ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: iṣam pinva maghavadbhyaḥ su vīrām yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Make the food abundant for the wealthy ones, with good heroes; do you, O protectors, always protect us with your blessings.

original: na soma indram asuto mamāda nābrahmāṇo maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ /
analyzed: na somaḥ indram a sutaḥ mamāda na abrahmāṇaḥ maghavānam sutāsaḥ
translated: The unpressed Soma hath not gladdened Indra, nor the libations gladdened Maghavan.

original: tasmā ukthaṃ janaye yaj jujoṣan nṛvan navīyaḥ śṛṇavad yathā naḥ //
analyzed: tasmai uktham janaye yat jujoṣat nṛvat navīyaḥ śṛṇavat yathā naḥ
translated: Therefore let us produce a hymn which he will approve, as a new one, O Man, that he may listen to us.

original: ukthaukthe soma indram mamāda nīthenīthe maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ /
analyzed: uktha aukthe somaḥ indram mamāda nīthenīthe maghavānam sutāsaḥ
translated: In every hymn the pressed Soma hath gladdened Indra, in every invocation Maghavan.

original: yad īṃ sabādhaḥ pitaraṃ na putrāḥ samānadakṣā avase havante //
analyzed: yat īm sabādhaḥ pitaram na putrāḥ samāna dakṣāḥ avase havante
translated: When they, like sons their father, call on him, of one accord, for help, for succour.

original: cakāra tā kṛṇavan nūnam anyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu /
analyzed: cakāra tā kṛṇavat nūnam anyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu
translated: They have done what he bade them do, and now must do what he commands, what the wise ones say at the libations.

original: janīr iva patir ekaḥ samāno ni māmṛje pura indraḥ su sarvāḥ //
analyzed: janīḥ iva patiḥ ekaḥ samānaḥ ni māmṛje puraḥ indraḥ su sarvāḥ
translated: As one sole lord of many women, Indra hath won all these cities for himself.

original: evā tam āhur uta śṛṇva indra eko vibhaktā taraṇir maghānām /
analyzed: eva tam āhuḥ uta śṛṇve indraḥ ekaḥ vibhaktā taraṇiḥ maghānām
translated: So they call him, and he listens, Indra, alone, the distributor of treasures, the swift.

original: mithastura ūtayo yasya pūrvīr asme bhadrāṇi saścata priyāṇi //
analyzed: mithasturaḥ ūtayaḥ yasya pūrvīḥ asme bhadrāṇi saścata priyāṇi
translated: His many aids are mutually helpful: may he win for us good things that we desire.

original: evā vasiṣṭha indram ūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnāṃ vṛṣabhaṃ sute gṛṇāti /
analyzed: eva vasiṣṭhaḥ indram ūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnām vṛṣabham sute gṛṇāti
translated: So Vasistha, for help, praises Indra, the men's Bull, at the libation of the pressed (juice).

original: sahasriṇa upa no māhi vājān yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: sahasriṇaḥ upa naḥ māhi vājān yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Bestow on us a thousand powers: ye, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: indraṃ naro nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyas tāḥ /
analyzed: indram naraḥ nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyaḥ tāḥ
translated: The men who sit in the assembly call on Indra, when they yoke their thoughts for the morrow's work.

original: śūro nṛṣātā śavasaś cakāna ā gomati vraje bhajā tvaṃ naḥ //
analyzed: śūraḥ nṛṣātā śavasaḥ cakānaḥ ā gomati vraje bhaja tvam naḥ
translated: Hero, victorious over men, rejoicing in strength, in the stall of the milk-cow, favour us.

original: ya indra śuṣmo maghavan te asti śikṣā sakhibhyaḥ puruhūta nṛbhyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ indra śuṣmaḥ maghavan te asti śikṣā sakhibhyaḥ puruhūta nṛbhyaḥ
translated: That strength which thou hast, O Indra, O Maghavan, instruct it to thy friends, O thou invoked by many, to men.

original: tvaṃ hi dṛḷhā maghavan vicetā apā vṛdhi parivṛtaṃ na rādhaḥ //
analyzed: tvam hi dṛḍhā maghavan vicetāḥ apa ā vṛdhi parivṛtam na rādhaḥ
translated: For thou, O Maghavan, art strong, of far-reaching thought, thou hast increased thy gift, as 'twere, O Indra, that is encompassed round.

original: indro rājā jagataś carṣaṇīnām adhi kṣami viṣurūpaṃ yad asti /
analyzed: indraḥ rājā jagataḥ carṣaṇīnām adhi kṣami viṣurūpam yat asti
translated: Indra is king over the people of the world, over whatever of various forms is on the earth.

original: tato dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codad rādha upastutaś cid arvāk //
analyzed: tatas dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codat rādhaḥ upastutaḥ cit arvāk
translated: From thence he gives wealth to the worshipper, he sends forth bounty, even when praised, to the worshipper.

original: nū cin na indro maghavā sahūtī dāno vājaṃ ni yamate na ūtī /
analyzed: nu cit naḥ indraḥ maghavā sahūtī dānaḥ vājam ni yamate naḥ ūtī
translated: Now may Indra, the bountiful, the mighty, with our prayers, restrain the booty and the spoil.

original: anūnā yasya dakṣiṇā pīpāya vāmaṃ nṛbhyo abhivītā sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: anūnā yasya dakṣiṇā pīpāya vāmam nṛbhyaḥ abhivītā sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Whose gift, unstinted, hath flowed forth, the good, to men, and the pleasant to his friends.

original: nū indra rāye varivas kṛdhī na ā te mano vavṛtyāma maghāya /
analyzed: nu indra rāye varivaḥ kṛdhī naḥ ā te manaḥ vavṛtyāma maghāya
translated: Now, O Indra, make thou room for us to gain wealth: may our thoughts turn to thee for bounty.

original: gomad aśvāvad rathavad vyanto yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: gomat aśvāvat rathavat vyantaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: With cattle, with horses, with chariots, may we prosper: ye, protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: brahmā ṇa indropa yāhi vidvān arvāñcas te harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ /
analyzed: brahmā naḥ indra upa yāhi vidvān arvāñcaḥ te harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ
translated: O Brahman, come to Indra, come, O thou that art skilled: let thy bay steeds be yoked and brought hither.

original: viśve cid dhi tvā vihavanta martā asmākam ic chṛṇuhi viśvaminva //
analyzed: viśve cit hi tvā vihavanta martāḥ asmākam id śṛṇuhi viśvaminva
translated: For all men call upon thee: hear thou, O thou that hearest all, this prayer of ours.

original: havaṃ ta indra mahimā vy ānaḍ brahma yat pāsi śavasinn ṛṣīṇām /🔽ā yad vajraṃ dadhiṣe hasta ugra ghoraḥ san kratvā janiṣṭhā aṣāḷhaḥ //
analyzed: havam te indra mahimā vi ānaṭ brahma yat pāsi śavasin ṛṣīṇām  ā yat vajram dadhiṣe haste ugra ghoraḥ san kratvā janiṣṭhāḥ aṣāḷhaḥ
translated: Thy greatness, O Indra, hath filled the call of the R̥ishis, the prayer which thou guardest, O Mighty One.🔽When thou layest the bolt in thy hand, O terrible One, thou art born, through wisdom, terrible, invincible.

original: tava praṇītīndra johuvānān saṃ yan nṝn na rodasī ninetha /
analyzed: tava praṇītī indra johuvānān sam yat nṝn na rodasī ninetha
translated: When thou, O Indra, with these, hast brought together the men who call on thee, to the two world-halves,

original: mahe kṣatrāya śavase hi jajñe 'tūtujiṃ cit tūtujir aśiśnat //
analyzed: mahe kṣatrāya śavase hi jajñe tūtujim cit tūtujiḥ aśiśnat
translated: Thou art born for great lordship and strength. Even the unresisted hath resisted.

original: ebhir na indrāhabhir daśasya durmitrāso hi kṣitayaḥ pavante /
analyzed: ebhiḥ naḥ indra ahabhiḥ daśasya durmitrāsaḥ hi kṣitayaḥ pavante
translated: With these, O Indra, be pleased: the people are purified, for they are unfriendly.

original: prati yac caṣṭe anṛtam anenā ava dvitā varuṇo māyī naḥ sāt //
analyzed: prati yat caṣṭe anṛtam anenāḥ ava dvitā varuṇaḥ māyī naḥ sāt
translated: What the deceitful Varuna hath said against us, may he, the guileful, be turned away from us.

original: vocemed indram maghavānam enam maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadan naḥ /
analyzed: vocema id indram maghavānam enam mahaḥ rāyaḥ rādhasaḥ yat dadan naḥ
translated: We will proclaim this Indra, the bountiful, that he may give us great gifts of wealth.

original: yo arcato brahmakṛtim aviṣṭho yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ arcataḥ brahmakṛtim aviṣṭhaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Who most readily accepts the prayer and worship of the worshipper. Do ye preserve us evermore with your protections.

original: ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunva ā tu pra yāhi harivas tadokāḥ /
analyzed: ayam somaḥ indra tubhyam sunve ā tu pra yāhi harivas tad okāḥ
translated: This Soma, O Indra, is pressed for thee: come thou, O Lord of bays, to the place of worship.

original: pibā tv asya suṣutasya cāror dado maghāni maghavann iyānaḥ //
analyzed: pibā tu asya suṣutasya cāroḥ dadaḥ maghāni maghavan iyānaḥ
translated: Drink thou of this well-pressed juice: give, O bountiful one, when thou art pressed, gifts of bounty.

original: brahman vīra brahmakṛtiṃ juṣāṇo 'rvācīno haribhir yāhi tūyam /
analyzed: brahman vīra brahmakṛtim juṣāṇaḥ rvācīnaḥ haribhiḥ yāhi tūyam
translated: O hero, accepting the prayer and worship, come hither with thy bays, O thou who lovest prayer.

original: asminn ū ṣu savane mādayasvopa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā naḥ //
analyzed: asmin u su savane mādayasva upa brahmāṇi śṛṇavaḥ imā naḥ
translated: Delight thyself here at this libation: listen to these prayers of ours, O Indra.

original: kā te asty araṅkṛtiḥ sūktaiḥ kadā nūnaṃ te maghavan dāśema /
analyzed: kā te asti araṅkṛtiḥ sūktaiḥ kadā nūnam te maghavan dāśema
translated: What is thy pleasure? With what hymns shall we best serve thee now, O Maghavan?

original: viśvā matīr ā tatane tvāyādhā ma indra śṛṇavo havemā //
analyzed: viśvāḥ matīḥ ā tatane tvāyā adhā me indra śṛṇavaḥ havā imā
translated: I have spread out all my thoughts to thee: accept, O Indra, listen to my call.

original: uto ghā te puruṣyā id āsan yeṣām pūrveṣām aśṛṇor ṛṣīṇām /
analyzed: uta u gha te puruṣyāḥ id āsan yeṣām pūrveṣām aśṛṇoḥ ṛṣīṇām
translated: And those who were the men of old, of whom thou hast heard, O sage, of the Rishis,

original: adhāhaṃ tvā maghavañ johavīmi tvaṃ na indrāsi pramatiḥ piteva //
analyzed: adha aham tvā maghavam johavīmi tvam naḥ indra asi pramatiḥ pitā iva
translated: Now do I call on thee, O Maghavan: thou, O Indra, art the overseer like a father.

original: vocemed indram maghavānam enam maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadan naḥ /
analyzed: vocema id indram maghavānam enam mahaḥ rāyaḥ rādhasaḥ yat dadan naḥ
translated: We will proclaim this Indra, the bountiful, that he may give us great wealth and gifts.

original: yo arcato brahmakṛtim aviṣṭho yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ arcataḥ brahmakṛtim aviṣṭhaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: He who most readily accepts the praise and prayer of him who worships: do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: ā no deva śavasā yāhi śuṣmin bhavā vṛdha indra rāyo asya /
analyzed: ā naḥ deva śavasā yāhi śuṣmin bhava vṛdhaḥ indra rāyaḥ asya
translated: Come unto us, O God, with might and power: be thou, O Indra, the increaser of this wealth.

original: mahe nṛmṇāya nṛpate suvajra mahi kṣatrāya pauṃsyāya śūra //
analyzed: mahe nṛmṇāya nṛpate su vajra mahi kṣatrāya pauṃsyāya śūra
translated: For great manliness, O Lord of men, O thou of wondrous bolt, for high dominion, for manly strength, O hero.

original: havanta u tvā havyaṃ vivāci tanūṣu śūrāḥ sūryasya sātau /🔽tvaṃ viśveṣu senyo janeṣu tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi randhayā suhantu //
analyzed: havante u tvā havyam vivāci tanūṣu śūrāḥ sūryasya sātau 🔽tvam viśveṣu senyaḥ janeṣu tvam vṛtrāṇi randhaya su hantu
translated: The heroes call on thee, O Indra, for help, in their bodies, in the winning of the sun.🔽Thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra, art to be entreated by all men: thou art to be entreated by all men: thou, O Indra,

original: ahā yad indra sudinā vyucchān dadho yat ketum upamaṃ samatsu /
analyzed: ahā yat indra sudinā vyucchān dadhaḥ yat ketum upamam samatsu
translated: When, O Indra, the bright days have dawned for you, when you have set up the matchless banner in battles,

original: ny agniḥ sīdad asuro na hotā huvāno atra subhagāya devān //
analyzed: ni agniḥ sīdat asuraḥ na hotā huvānaḥ atra subhagāya devān
translated: When Agni, the Asura, has sat down as the Hotar, inviting the gods here for the prosperous one.

original: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca deva stavanta śūra dadato maghāni /
analyzed: vayam te te indra ye ca deva stavanta śūra dadataḥ maghāni
translated: We are yours, O Indra, and those who, O hero, praise you, O giver of boons,

original: yacchā sūribhya upamaṃ varūthaṃ svābhuvo jaraṇām aśnavanta //
analyzed: yaccha sūribhyaḥ upamam varūtham su ābhuvaḥ jaraṇām aśnavanta
translated: Grant the matchless protection to the lords, may the prosperous ones obtain old age.

original: vocemed indram maghavānam enam maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadan naḥ /
analyzed: vocema id indram maghavānam enam mahaḥ rāyaḥ rādhasaḥ yat dadan naḥ
translated: We will speak to Indra, the bountiful one, to him, the giver of great wealth and gifts to us,

original: yo arcato brahmakṛtim aviṣṭho yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ arcataḥ brahmakṛtim aviṣṭhaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Who is most present at the praise and prayer of the worshipper. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: pra va indrāya mādanaṃ haryaśvāya gāyata /
analyzed: pra vaḥ indrāya mādanam haryaśvāya gāyata
translated: Sing forth the gladdening song to Indra, to him of the tawny steeds,

original: sakhāyaḥ somapāvne //
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ soma pāvne
translated: O friends, to him who drinks the Soma.

original: śaṃsed ukthaṃ sudānava uta dyukṣaṃ yathā naraḥ /
analyzed: śaṃset uktham sudānavaḥ uta dyukṣam yathā naraḥ
translated: Praise the hymn, O bountiful one, and the heavenly one, as men do,

original: cakṛmā satyarādhase //
analyzed: cakṛma satya rādhase
translated: For him whose vow is true.

original: tvaṃ na indra vājayus tvaṃ gavyuḥ śatakrato /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra vājayuḥ tvam gavyuḥ śatakrato
translated: You, O Indra, are the winner of booty, you, O Śatakratu, are the winner of cattle,

original: tvaṃ hiraṇyayur vaso //
analyzed: tvam hiraṇyayuḥ vaso
translated: You, O Vasu, are the winner of gold.

original: vayam indra tvāyavo 'bhi pra ṇonumo vṛṣan /
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ bhi pra nonumaḥ vṛṣan
translated: We, O Indra, the active ones, O bull, we praise you,

original: viddhī tv asya no vaso //
analyzed: viddhi tu asya naḥ vaso
translated: Know this, O Vasu, for us.

original: mā no nide ca vaktave 'ryo randhīr arāvṇe /
analyzed: mā naḥ nide ca vaktave ryaḥ randhīḥ arāvṇe
translated: Do not deliver us to blame and censure, to the enemy's spiteful anger,

original: tve api kratur mama //
analyzed: tve api kratuḥ mama
translated: In thee also is my will.

original: tvaṃ varmāsi saprathaḥ puroyodhaś ca vṛtrahan /
analyzed: tvam varmā asi saprathaḥ puras yodhaḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: Thou art the armour, the wide-spreading, the front-fighter, and the Vrtra-slayer.

original: tvayā prati bruve yujā //
analyzed: tvayā prati bruve yujā
translated: With thee as ally I speak.

original: mahāṃ utāsi yasya te 'nu svadhāvarī sahaḥ /
analyzed: mahān uta asi yasya te nu svadhāvarī sahaḥ
translated: And great art thou, of whom thy own impetuous might

original: mamnāte indra rodasī //
analyzed: mamnāte indra rodasī
translated: Is honoured, O Indra, O thou of the two worlds.

original: taṃ tvā marutvatī pari bhuvad vāṇī sayāvarī /
analyzed: tam tvā marutvatī pari bhuvat vāṇī sa yāvarī
translated: Thee, O Indra, the Marut-possessed, the all-surpassing, the most excellent,

original: nakṣamāṇā saha dyubhiḥ //
analyzed: nakṣamāṇā saha dyubhiḥ
translated: The longing one, with the heavenly powers, hath encompassed.

original: ūrdhvāsas tvānv indavo bhuvan dasmam upa dyavi /
analyzed: ūrdhvāsaḥ tvā anu indavaḥ bhuvan dasmam upa dyavi
translated: The wondrous one, the lofty drops have become for thee in the sky.

original: saṃ te namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: sam te namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Thy people bow to thee.

original: pra vo mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatiṃ kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatim kṛṇudhvam
translated: Bring to the great one who increases greatness, to the wise one, bring your offerings; make your good will go forth to him.

original: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra carā carṣaṇiprāḥ //
analyzed: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: Let the people, the leader of the people, go forth to the many.

original: uruvyacase mahine suvṛktim indrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ /
analyzed: uru vyacase mahine suvṛktim indrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ
translated: To the wide-ruling Indra the wise ones have produced the hymn of praise.

original: tasya vratāni na minanti dhīrāḥ //
analyzed: tasya vratāni na minanti dhīrāḥ
translated: The wise ones do not violate his ordinances.

original: indraṃ vāṇīr anuttamanyum eva satrā rājānaṃ dadhire sahadhyai /
analyzed: indram vāṇīḥ anutta manyum eva satrā rājānam dadhire sahadhyai
translated: The people have always made Indra, whose anger is unsurpassed, the king for the sake of union.

original: haryaśvāya barhayā sam āpīn //🔽mo ṣu tvā vāghataś canāre asman ni rīraman /
analyzed: haryaśvāya barhayā sam āpīn  mā u su tvā vāghataḥ cana āre asmat ni rīraman
translated: To the one with the two bay horses, to the great one, the all-embracing one.🔽Let not the evil-minded ones, O thou who art to be invoked, delight in us.

original: ārāttāc cit sadhamādaṃ na ā gahīha vā sann upa śrudhi //
analyzed: ārāttāt cit sadhamādam naḥ ā gahi iha vā san upa śrudhi
translated: Come even from afar to the feast, or listen while thou art here.

original: ime hi te brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā madhau na makṣa āsate /
analyzed: ime hi te brahma kṛtaḥ sute sacā madhau na makṣaḥ āsate
translated: For these, O Brahman, are seated in the Soma, as bees in the honey, at the pressing.

original: indre kāmaṃ jaritāro vasūyavo rathe na pādam ā dadhuḥ //
analyzed: indre kāmam jaritāraḥ vasūyavaḥ rathe na pādam ā
translated: The singers, seeking wealth, have placed their hope in Indra, as on a foot in a chariot.

original: rāyaskāmo vajrahastaṃ sudakṣiṇam putro na pitaraṃ huve //
analyzed: rāyaskāmaḥ vajra hastam su dakṣiṇam putraḥ na pitaram huve
translated: Desiring wealth, I invoke the wielder of the thunderbolt, the very skilful one, like a son his father.

original: ima indrāya sunvire somāso dadhyāśiraḥ /
analyzed: ime indrāya sunvire somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: These Soma juices are being pressed for Indra, with curds and milk.

original: tāṃ ā madāya vajrahasta pītaye haribhyāṃ yāhy oka ā //
analyzed: tām ā madāya vajrahasta pītaye haribhyām yāhi okaḥ ā
translated: Come to the drinking of them, O you whose hand wields the thunderbolt, come to your home on your two bay horses.

original: śravac chrutkarṇa īyate vasūnāṃ nū cin no mardhiṣad giraḥ /
analyzed: śravat śrutkarṇaḥ īyate vasūnām nu cit naḥ mardhiṣat giraḥ
translated: The hearer, with ears to hear, goes to the treasures. Do not destroy our songs.

original: sadyaś cid yaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā dadan nakir ditsantam ā minat //
analyzed: sadyas cit yaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā dadat nakir ditsantam ā minat
translated: He who gives hundreds and thousands at once, no one surpasses the giver.

original: sa vīro apratiṣkuta indreṇa śūśuve nṛbhiḥ /🔽yas te gabhīrā savanāni vṛtrahan sunoty ā ca dhāvati //🔽bhavā varūtham maghavan maghonāṃ yat samajāsi śardhataḥ /
analyzed: sa vīraḥ apratiṣkutaḥ indreṇa śūśuve nṛbhiḥ  yaḥ te gabhīrā savanāni vṛtrahan sunoti ā ca dhāvati  bhava varūtham maghavan maghonām yat samajāsi śardhataḥ
translated: That hero, invincible, has shone forth with Indra and men,🔽You, O slayer of Vrtra, whose deep libations he pours and runs to.🔽Be a protector, O bountiful one, of the bountiful ones, when you join the impetuous ones.

original: vi tvāhatasya vedanam bhajemahy ā dūṇāśo bharā gayam //🔽sunotā somapāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe /
analyzed: vi tvā ahatasya vedanam bhajemahi ā dūṇāśaḥ bhara gayam  sunota soma pāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe
translated: May we enjoy the gift of the unvanquished one. Bring the abundant food.🔽Press the Soma for the Soma-drinker, for Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: pacatā paktīr avase kṛṇudhvam it pṛṇann it pṛṇate mayaḥ //
analyzed: pacata paktīḥ avase kṛṇudhvam id pṛṇan id pṛṇate mayaḥ
translated: Cook the oblations for his help. He who fills fills with bliss.

original: mā sredhata somino dakṣatā mahe kṛṇudhvaṃ rāya ātuje /
analyzed: mā sredhata sominaḥ dakṣata mahe kṛṇudhvam rāyaḥ ātuje
translated: Do not be negligent, O Soma-pressers, in your skill; make great wealth for the sake of gain.

original: taraṇir ij jayati kṣeti puṣyati na devāsaḥ kavatnave //
analyzed: taraṇiḥ id jayati kṣeti puṣyati na devāsaḥ kavatnave
translated: The swift one conquers, rests, and prospers; the gods are not for one who is deceitful.

original: nakiḥ sudāso ratham pary āsa na rīramat /🔽indro yasyāvitā yasya maruto gamat sa gomati vraje //
analyzed: nakir sudāsaḥ ratham pari āsa na rīramat  indraḥ yasya avitā yasya marutaḥ gamat sa gomati vraje
translated: No one has surrounded Sudāsa's chariot, nor has he rejoiced.🔽May he go to the cattle-rich abode, whose helper is Indra, whose (is the help of) the Maruts.

original: gamad vājaṃ vājayann indra martyo yasya tvam avitā bhuvaḥ /
analyzed: gamat vājam vājayan indra martyaḥ yasya tvam avitā bhuvaḥ
translated: May he go to the prize, urging it, O Indra, the mortal man whom thou hast been the helper to be.

original: asmākam bodhy avitā rathānām asmākaṃ śūra nṛṇām //
analyzed: asmākam bodhi avitā rathānām asmākam śūra nṛṇām
translated: Be thou the helper of our chariots, of our men, O hero.

original: ud in nv asya ricyate 'ṃśo dhanaṃ na jigyuṣaḥ /
analyzed: ud id nu asya ricyate ṃśaḥ dhanam na jigyuṣaḥ
translated: His portion is exalted, like the wealth of one who longs to conquer,

original: ya indro harivān na dabhanti taṃ ripo dakṣaṃ dadhāti somini //
analyzed: yaḥ indraḥ harivān na dabhanti tam ripaḥ dakṣam dadhāti somini
translated: Whom, though he has the bay steeds, the foes do not afflict; he places power in the Soma-presser.

original: mantram akharvaṃ sudhitaṃ supeśasaṃ dadhāta yajñiyeṣv ā /
analyzed: mantram akharvam sudhitam supeśasam dadhāta yajñiyeṣu ā
translated: He places the unbending, well-ordered, fair-formed hymn in the sacrificial rites.

original: pūrvīś cana prasitayas taranti taṃ ya indre karmaṇā bhuvat //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ cana prasitayaḥ taranti tam yaḥ indre karmaṇā bhuvat
translated: Even many bonds he passes over, he who is with Indra through his work.

original: kas tam indra tvāvasum ā martyo dadharṣati /
analyzed: kaḥ tam indra tvāvasum ā martyaḥ dadharṣati
translated: What mortal, O Indra, dares to offend that wealth of thine?

original: śraddhā it te maghavan pārye divi vājī vājaṃ siṣāsati //
analyzed: śraddhā id te maghavan pārye divi vājī vājam siṣāsati
translated: Faith, O bountiful one, is thine on the day of trial; the strong one longs for strength.

original: maghonaḥ sma vṛtrahatyeṣu codaya ye dadati priyā vasu /
analyzed: maghonaḥ sma vṛtra hatyeṣu codaya ye dadati priyā vasu
translated: Stir up the bountiful ones at the slaying of Vṛtra, those who give dear treasures.

original: tava praṇītī haryaśva sūribhir viśvā tarema duritā //
analyzed: tava praṇītī haryaśva sūribhiḥ viśvā tarema duritā
translated: By thy leadership, O thou of Bay steeds, with the princes, may we pass over all difficulties.

original: taved indrāvamaṃ vasu tvam puṣyasi madhyamam /
analyzed: tava id indra avamam vasu tvam puṣyasi madhyamam
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the lowest treasure, thou supportest the midmost,

original: satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi nakiṣ ṭvā goṣu vṛṇvate //
analyzed: satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi nakir tvā goṣu vṛṇvate
translated: Thou always rulest over the highest of all. None chooses thee for his own in the matter of the cows.

original: tvaṃ viśvasya dhanadā asi śruto ya īm bhavanty ājayaḥ /
analyzed: tvam viśvasya dhana dāḥ asi śrutaḥ ye īm bhavanti ājayaḥ
translated: Thou art the giver of wealth to all, O famous one, who are the victorious ones.

original: tavāyaṃ viśvaḥ puruhūta pārthivo 'vasyur nāma bhikṣate //
analyzed: tava ayam viśvaḥ puruhūta pārthivaḥ vasyuḥ nāma bhikṣate
translated: This whole earthly world, O much-invoked one, begs of thee, longing for help, for the name (of Indra).

original: yad indra yāvatas tvam etāvad aham īśīya /
analyzed: yat indra yāvataḥ tvam etāvat aham īśīya
translated: O Indra, as much as thou rulest, so much may I rule.

original: stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya //
analyzed: stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya
translated: I would delight in the praiser, O thou of good gifts, I would not be cast down to misery.

original: śikṣeyam in mahayate divedive rāya ā kuhacidvide /
analyzed: śikṣeyam id mahayate dive dive rāyaḥ ā kuhacid vide
translated: I would learn to magnify thee day by day, to find wealth somewhere.

original: nahi tvad anyan maghavan na āpyaṃ vasyo asti pitā cana //
analyzed: nahi tvat anyat maghavan naḥ āpyam vasyaḥ asti pitā cana
translated: For there is no other wealth, O Maghavan, than thine, not even a father.

original: taraṇir it siṣāsati vājam purandhyā yujā /
analyzed: taraṇiḥ id siṣāsati vājam purandhyā yujā
translated: The swift one strives for booty, yoked with the dawn.

original: ā va indram puruhūtaṃ name girā nemiṃ taṣṭeva sudrvam //
analyzed: ā vaḥ indram puru hūtam name girā nemim taṣṭā iva su drvam
translated: To Indra, much-invoked, I bow with a song, like a wheel-maker to a well-wrought wheel.

original: na duṣṭutī martyo vindate vasu na sredhantaṃ rayir naśat /
analyzed: na duṣṭutī martyaḥ vindate vasu na sredhantam rayiḥ naśat
translated: The mortal who sings praises does not obtain wealth, nor does wealth come to him who is indolent.

original: suśaktir in maghavan tubhyam māvate deṣṇaṃ yat pārye divi //
analyzed: su śaktiḥ id maghavan tubhyam māvate deṣṇam yat pārye divi
translated: O Maghavan, the good power which is thine on the farthest day is for thy worshipper.

original: abhi tvā śūra nonumo 'dugdhā iva dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā śūra nonumaḥ dugdhāḥ iva dhenavaḥ
translated: We sing to thee, O hero, like milch-kine who have not been milked.

original: īśānam asya jagataḥ svardṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ //
analyzed: īśānam asya jagataḥ svar dṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ
translated: Thou art the lord of this moving world, the lord of heaven and earth, O Indra.

original: na tvāvāṃ anyo divyo na pārthivo na jāto na janiṣyate /
analyzed: na tvāvām anyaḥ divyaḥ na pārthivaḥ na jātaḥ na janiṣyate
translated: None other than thee, whether in heaven or on earth, is born or shall be born.

original: aśvāyanto maghavann indra vājino gavyantas tvā havāmahe //
analyzed: aśvāyantaḥ maghavan indra vājinaḥ gavyantaḥ tvā havāmahe
translated: O Maghavan, Indra, we call on thee, O mighty one, who lovest horses and cows.

original: abhī ṣatas tad ā bharendra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ /🔽purūvasur hi maghavan sanād asi bharebhare ca havyaḥ //🔽parā ṇudasva maghavann amitrān suvedā no vasū kṛdhi /
analyzed: abhi sataḥ tat ā bhara indra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ  purūvasuḥ hi maghavan sanāt asi bharebhare ca havyaḥ  parā nudasva maghavan amitrān su vedā naḥ vasū kṛdhi
translated: That which is better than a hundred, that I bring to thee, O Indra, better than the lesser.🔽For thou, O Maghavan, hast been from of old the possessor of much wealth, to be invoked in every fight.🔽Drive away our enemies, O Maghavan, make wealth easy to be obtained for us.

original: asmākam bodhy avitā mahādhane bhavā vṛdhaḥ sakhīnām //
analyzed: asmākam bodhi avitā mahādhane bhavā vṛdhaḥ sakhīnām
translated: Be thou our protector in the great conflict, be thou the strengthener of our friends.

original: indra kratuṃ na ā bhara pitā putrebhyo yathā /
analyzed: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā
translated: O Indra, bring us the power as a father to his sons.

original: śikṣā ṇo asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvā jyotir aśīmahi //
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi
translated: Instruct us, O thou who art invoked by many, in this our work, that we may live and win the light.

original: mā no ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyo māśivāso ava kramuḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyaḥ mā aśivāsaḥ ava kramuḥ
translated: Let not unknown, ill-disposed people, wearing black garments, come nigh us.

original: tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīr apo 'ti śūra tarāmasi //🔽śvityañco mā dakṣiṇataskapardā dhiyañjinvāso abhi hi pramanduḥ /
analyzed: tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīḥ apa u ti śūra tarāmasi 🔽śvityañcaḥ mā dakṣiṇa taskapardāḥ dhiyañjinvāsaḥ abhi hi pramanduḥ
translated: By thee, O hero, we will pass over the mighty, ever-flowing waters.🔽The white-backed ones, with their hair hanging down on the right, who quicken the thought, have come to me, to gladden me.

original: uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣo nṝn na me dūrād avitave vasiṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣaḥ nṝn na me dūrāt avitave vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Arise and speak to the men around the sacrificial grass. For me, O Vasiṣṭhas, you are not far away to help.

original: dūrād indram anayann ā sutena tiro vaiśantam ati pāntam ugram /
analyzed: dūrāt indram anayan ā sutena tiras vaiśantam ati pāntam ugram
translated: From afar they brought Indra with the pressed (Soma), the mighty one, beyond the Vaishanta, beyond the protector.

original: pāśadyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutād indro 'vṛṇītā vasiṣṭhān //
analyzed: pāśa dyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutāt indraḥ vṛṇīta ā vasiṣṭhān
translated: From the Soma, from the pressed (juice), from the extended, from the noose-bannered (sacrifice), Indra chose the Vasiṣṭhas.

original: even nu kaṃ sindhum ebhis tatāreven nu kam bhedam ebhir jaghāna /
analyzed: eva id nu kam sindhum ebhiḥ tatāra iva id nu kam bhedam ebhiḥ jaghāna
translated: Even so, with these (sacrifices) he crossed the river Sindhu. Even so, with these (sacrifices) he struck down the Bheda.

original: even nu kaṃ dāśarājñe sudāsam prāvad indro brahmaṇā vo vasiṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: eva id nu kam dāśarājñe sudāsam prāvat indraḥ brahmaṇā vaḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Even so, to the king of the Dasas, to Sudāsa, Indra was favorable through your prayer, O Vasiṣṭhas.

original: juṣṭī naro brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇām akṣam avyayaṃ na kilā riṣātha /🔽yac chakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇendre śuṣmam adadhātā vasiṣṭhāḥ //🔽ud dyām ivet tṛṣṇajo nāthitāso 'dīdhayur dāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ /
analyzed: juṣṭī naraḥ brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇām akṣam avyayam na kila riṣātha  yat śakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇa indre śuṣmam adadhāta vasiṣṭhāḥ  ud dyām iva id tṛṣṇajaḥ nāthitāsaḥ dīdhayuḥ dāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ
translated: The men are pleasing to you through the prayer of your fathers. The axle is not worn out, it will not break.🔽When, with the loud sound in the Shakvari (hymn), you, O Vasiṣṭhas, placed strength in Indra.🔽Like those afflicted by thirst looking up to the sky, the chosen ones were inspired for the king of the Dasas.

original: vasiṣṭhasya stuvata indro aśrod uruṃ tṛtsubhyo akṛṇod u lokam //
analyzed: vasiṣṭhasya stuvataḥ indraḥ aśrot urum tṛtsubhyaḥ akṛṇot u lokam
translated: Indra listened to the praise of Vasiṣṭha and made a wide space for the Tṛtsus.

original: daṇḍā ived goajanāsa āsan paricchinnā bharatā arbhakāsaḥ /
analyzed: daṇḍāḥ iva id go ajanāsaḥ āsan paricchinnāḥ bharatāḥ arbhakāsaḥ
translated: They were like sticks, like cattle and goats, the Bharatas were surrounded, the young ones.

original: abhavac ca puraetā vasiṣṭha ād it tṛtsūnāṃ viśo aprathanta //
analyzed: abhavat ca puraetā vasiṣṭhaḥ āt id tṛtsūnām viśaḥ aprathanta
translated: And Vasiṣṭha became the leader in front, and then the people of the Tṛtsus spread out.

original: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retas tisraḥ prajā āryā jyotiragrāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retaḥ tisraḥ prajāḥ āryāḥ jyotiḥ agrāḥ
translated: Three produce seed in the worlds, three noble beings with light in front.

original: trayo gharmāsa uṣasaṃ sacante sarvāṃ it tāṃ anu vidur vasiṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: trayaḥ gharmāsaḥ uṣasam sacante sarvām id tām anu viduḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Three warm ones attend on the dawn; all of them the Vasishthas know well.

original: sūryasyeva vakṣatho jyotir eṣāṃ samudrasyeva mahimā gabhīraḥ /
analyzed: sūryasya iva vakṣathaḥ jyotiḥ eṣām samudrasya iva mahimā gabhīraḥ
translated: Their light is like the sun's, their greatness is deep like the ocean.

original: vātasyeva prajavo nānyena stomo vasiṣṭhā anvetave vaḥ //
analyzed: vātasya iva prajavaḥ na anyena stomaḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ anvetave vaḥ
translated: Your praise, O Vasishthas, is like the wind's speed, not to be overtaken by another.

original: ta in niṇyaṃ hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasravalśam abhi saṃ caranti /
analyzed: te id niṇyam hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasra valśam abhi sam caranti
translated: They move along the thousand-branched seat, the sign of the heart.

original: yamena tatam paridhiṃ vayanto 'psarasa upa sedur vasiṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: yamena tatam paridhim vayantaḥ psarasaḥ upa seduḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: The Vasishthas, weaving the enclosing stick stretched by Yama, have sat down near the Apsarases.

original: vidyuto jyotiḥ pari saṃjihānam mitrāvaruṇā yad apaśyatāṃ tvā /
analyzed: vidyutaḥ jyotiḥ pari saṃjihānam mitrāvaruṇā yat apaśyatām tvā
translated: When Mitra and Varuna saw you, the light of lightning flashing around,

original: tat te janmotaikaṃ vasiṣṭhāgastyo yat tvā viśa ājabhāra //
analyzed: tat te janma uta ekam vasiṣṭha agastyaḥ yat tvā viśaḥ ājabhāra
translated: That is your one birth, O Vasishtha, which Agastya brought forth when he brought forth the people.

original: utāsi maitrāvaruṇo vasiṣṭhorvaśyā brahman manaso 'dhi jātaḥ /
analyzed: uta asi maitrāvaruṇaḥ vasiṣṭha urvaśyā brahman manasaḥ dhi jātaḥ
translated: And you are the son of Mitra and Varuna, O Vasishtha, born from the mind of Urvasi, O Brahman.

original: drapsaṃ skannam brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvādadanta //
analyzed: drapsam skannam brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvā adadanta
translated: The universal gods placed you, the dropped drop, in the lotus, with divine Brahman.

original: sa praketa ubhayasya pravidvān sahasradāna uta vā sadānaḥ /
analyzed: sa praketaḥ ubhayasya pravidvān sahasra dānaḥ uta vā sadānaḥ
translated: He, knowing both, whether giving a thousand or always giving,

original: yamena tatam paridhiṃ vayiṣyann apsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: yamena tatam paridhim vayiṣyan apsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Vasishtha, about to be born, was born from the womb of the Apsarases, having passed through the enclosing-stick set by Yama.

original: satre ha jātāv iṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam /
analyzed: satre ha jātau iṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam
translated: The two, born at a sacrifice, have been worshipped with salutations; they have poured the seed into the same jar.

original: tato ha māna ud iyāya madhyāt tato jātam ṛṣim āhur vasiṣṭham //
analyzed: tatas ha mānaḥ ud iyāya madhyāt tatas jātam ṛṣim āhuḥ vasiṣṭham
translated: From the middle of that (jar) the mind went forth; they call the Rsi born from that (seed) Vasishtha.

original: ukthabhṛtaṃ sāmabhṛtam bibharti grāvāṇam bibhrat pra vadāty agre /
analyzed: uktha bhṛtam sāma bhṛtam bibharti grāvāṇam bibhrat pra vadāti agre
translated: He bears the Ukthabhrt and the Samyabhrt, bearing the stone he speaks first.

original: upainam ādhvaṃ sumanasyamānā ā vo gacchāti pratṛdo vasiṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: upa enam ādhvam sumanasyamānāḥ ā vaḥ gacchāti pratṛdaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Come to him with good thoughts; Vasishtha will go to you, the giver of gifts.

original: pra śukraitu devī manīṣā asmat sutaṣṭo ratho na vājī //
analyzed: pra śukrā etu devī manīṣā asmat su taṣṭaḥ rathaḥ na vājī
translated: Let the pure thought of the gods come to us, well-fashioned like a strong chariot.

original: viduḥ pṛthivyā divo janitraṃ śṛṇvanty āpo adha kṣarantīḥ //
analyzed: viduḥ pṛthivyāḥ divaḥ janitram śṛṇvanti āpaḥ adha kṣarantīḥ
translated: They know the birth of earth and heaven; the waters hear, flowing along the earth.

original: āpaś cid asmai pinvanta pṛthvīr vṛtreṣu śūrā maṃsanta ugrāḥ //
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asmai pinvanta pṛthvīḥ vṛtreṣu śūrāḥ maṃsante ugrāḥ
translated: Even the waters swell out for him; the brave, the strong, are delighted in the battles.

original: ā dhūrṣv asmai dadhātāśvān indro na vajrī hiraṇyabāhuḥ //🔽abhi pra sthātāheva yajñaṃ yāteva patman tmanā hinota //
analyzed: ā dhūrṣu asmai dadhāta aśvān indraḥ na vajrī hiraṇya bāhuḥ  abhi pra sthāta ahā iva yajñam yāta iva patman tmanā hinota
translated: Place the horses for him in the yoke; let Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the golden-armed, come.🔽Advance to the sacrifice as to a path, as to your own (home), urge it forward.

original: tmanā samatsu hinota yajñaṃ dadhāta ketuṃ janāya vīram //
analyzed: tmanā samatsu hinota yajñam dadhāta ketum janāya vīram
translated: Urge the sacrifice forward with your own (power); place a hero as a sign for the people.

original: ud asya śuṣmād bhānur nārta bibharti bhāram pṛthivī na bhūma //
analyzed: ud asya śuṣmāt bhānuḥ na ārta bibharti bhāram pṛthivī na bhūma
translated: His light, like the sun, shines forth from his might, he bears his burden like the earth her ground.

original: hvayāmi devāṃ ayātur agne sādhann ṛtena dhiyaṃ dadhāmi //
analyzed: hvayāmi devān ayātuḥ agne sādhan ṛtena dhiyam dadhāmi
translated: I invoke the gods, O Agni, the guileless one. With truth I establish the thought.

original: abhi vo devīṃ dhiyaṃ dadhidhvam pra vo devatrā vācaṃ kṛṇudhvam //
analyzed: abhi vaḥ devīm dhiyam dadhidhvam pra vaḥ devatrā vācam kṛṇudhvam
translated: You must conceive the divine thought. You must direct your speech to the gods.

original: ā caṣṭa āsām pātho nadīnāṃ varuṇa ugraḥ sahasracakṣāḥ //
analyzed: ā caṣṭe āsām pāthaḥ nadīnām varuṇaḥ ugraḥ sahasra cakṣāḥ
translated: Varuṇa, the terrible one, the thousand-eyed one, observes the course of these rivers.

original: rājā rāṣṭrānām peśo nadīnām anuttam asmai kṣatraṃ viśvāyu //🔽aviṣṭo asmān viśvāsu vikṣv adyuṃ kṛṇota śaṃsaṃ ninitsoḥ //🔽vy etu didyud dviṣām aśevā yuyota viṣvag rapas tanūnām //
analyzed: rājā rāṣṭrānām peśaḥ nadīnām anuttam asmai kṣatram viśvāyu  aviṣṭaḥ asmān viśvāsu vikṣu adyum kṛṇota śaṃsam ninitsoḥ  vi etu didyut dviṣām aśevā yuyota viṣvak rapaḥ tanūnām
translated: The king of the kingdoms, the essence of the rivers, the highest lordship for him, for all life.🔽Unharmed by all, in all our dwellings, make him resplendent, the reviler's scorn.🔽Let the lightning flash away from the wicked. Drive away the disease from our bodies.

original: avīn no agnir havyān namobhiḥ preṣṭho asmā adhāyi stomaḥ //
analyzed: avīt naḥ agniḥ havyāt namobhiḥ preṣṭhaḥ asmai adhāyi stomaḥ
translated: May Agni, whom we worship with our homage, accept our offerings. To him has been assigned the most excellent praise.

original: sajūr devebhir apāṃ napātaṃ sakhāyaṃ kṛdhvaṃ śivo no astu //
analyzed: sajūs devebhiḥ apām napātam sakhāyam kṛdhvam śivaḥ naḥ astu
translated: Be united with the waters' son, the gods, make him your friend. May he be gracious to us.

original: abjām ukthair ahiṃ gṛṇīṣe budhne nadīnāṃ rajassu ṣīdan //
analyzed: ap jām ukthaiḥ ahim gṛṇīṣe budhne nadīnām rajassu sīdan
translated: With hymns I praise the water-born serpent, sitting in the waters' depths, in the realms of the sky.

original: mā no 'hir budhnyo riṣe dhān mā yajño asya sridhad ṛtāyoḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ riṣe dhāt mā yajñaḥ asya sridhat ṛtāyoḥ
translated: Let not the deep-lying serpent harm us in our sacrifice. Let not his sacrifice fail through our sin.

original: uta na eṣu nṛṣu śravo dhuḥ pra rāye yantu śardhanto aryaḥ //
analyzed: uta naḥ eṣu nṛṣu śravaḥ dhuḥ pra rāye yantu śardhantaḥ aryaḥ
translated: And let them not be deprived of glory among these men. Let the impetuous nobles go to wealth.

original: tapanti śatruṃ svar ṇa bhūmā mahāsenāso amebhir eṣām //
analyzed: tapanti śatrum svar na bhūmā mahā senāsaḥ amebhiḥ eṣām
translated: They scorch the enemy, like the sun on the earth. With these weapons, their great armies.

original: ā yan naḥ patnīr gamanty acchā tvaṣṭā supāṇir dadhātu vīrān //
analyzed: ā yat naḥ patnīḥ gamanti acchā tvaṣṭā su pāṇiḥ dadhātu vīrān
translated: When our wives come to us, may Tvaṣṭar, the good-handed one, grant us heroes.

original: prati na stomaṃ tvaṣṭā juṣeta syād asme aramatir vasūyuḥ //🔽tā no rāsan rātiṣāco vasūny ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu /
analyzed: prati naḥ stomam tvaṣṭā juṣeta syāt asme aramatiḥ vasūyuḥ  tā naḥ rāsan rātiṣācaḥ vasūni ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu
translated: May Tvaṣṭar accept our praise. May he be to us Arāti, who possesses wealth.🔽May they grant us gifts and treasures. May Varuṇa's daughter listen to the two world-halves.

original: varūtrībhiḥ suśaraṇo no astu tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyaḥ //🔽tan no rāyaḥ parvatās tan na āpas tad rātiṣāca oṣadhīr uta dyauḥ /
analyzed: varūtrībhiḥ su śaraṇaḥ naḥ astu tvaṣṭā su datraḥ vi dadhātu rāyaḥ  tat naḥ rāyaḥ parvatāḥ tat naḥ āpaḥ tat rātiṣācaḥ oṣadhīḥ uta dyauḥ
translated: May she be our good protector with the Varūtrīs. May Tvaṣṭar, the good bestower, grant us wealth.🔽May the mountains, may the waters, may the plants that grant gifts, and the sky,

original: vanaspatibhiḥ pṛthivī sajoṣā ubhe rodasī pari pāsato naḥ //
analyzed: vanaspatibhiḥ pṛthivī sajoṣāḥ ubhe rodasī pari pāsataḥ naḥ
translated: May the earth in accord with the trees, may the two world-halves, protect us on every side.

original: anu tad urvī rodasī jihātām anu dyukṣo varuṇa indrasakhā /
analyzed: anu tat urvī rodasī jihātām anu dyukṣaḥ varuṇaḥ indra sakhā
translated: May the two broad worlds, the sky, Varuṇa, Indra's friend, follow that (our wish).

original: anu viśve maruto ye sahāso rāyaḥ syāma dharuṇaṃ dhiyadhyai //
analyzed: anu viśve marutaḥ ye sahāsaḥ rāyaḥ syāma dharuṇam
translated: May all the Maruts, who are of the same mind, follow it. May we possess wealth, the support, for the sake of our thoughts.

original: tan na indro varuṇo mitro agnir āpa oṣadhīr vanino juṣanta /
analyzed: tat naḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ āpaḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, the waters, the plants, and the trees accept that (our wish).

original: śarman syāma marutām upasthe yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: śarman syāma marutām upasthe yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May we be in the favour of the Maruts. Do ye, O ye gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: śaṃ na indrāgnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śaṃ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā /
analyzed: śam naḥ indra agnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śam naḥ indrāvaruṇā rāta havyā
translated: Be ye, O Indra and Agni, gracious unto us with your favours; be ye gracious, O Indra and Varuna, who receive offerings.

original: śam indrāsomā suvitāya śaṃ yoḥ śaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau //
analyzed: śam indrāsomā suvitāya śam yos śam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau
translated: Be ye gracious, O Indra and Soma, for prosperity and strength; be ye gracious, O Indra and Pusan, in the winning of booty.

original: śaṃ no bhagaḥ śam u naḥ śaṃso astu śaṃ naḥ purandhiḥ śam u santu rāyaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ bhagaḥ śam u naḥ śaṃsaḥ astu śam naḥ purandhiḥ śam u santu rāyaḥ
translated: Be Bhaga gracious to us, and may the praise be gracious to us; be Purandhi gracious to us, and may the riches be gracious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ satyasya suyamasya śaṃsaḥ śaṃ no aryamā purujāto astu //
analyzed: śam naḥ satyasya su yamasya śaṃsaḥ śam naḥ aryamā puru jātaḥ astu
translated: Be the praise of the true and well-governed one gracious to us, and may Aryaman, of many births, be gracious to us.

original: śaṃ no dhātā śam u dhartā no astu śaṃ na urūcī bhavatu svadhābhiḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ dhātā śam u dhartā naḥ astu śam naḥ urūcī bhavatu svadhābhiḥ
translated: Be Dhatr gracious to us, and may the supporter be gracious to us; be the far-reaching one gracious to us with her own powers.

original: śaṃ rodasī bṛhatī śaṃ no adriḥ śaṃ no devānāṃ suhavāni santu //
analyzed: śam rodasī bṛhatī śam naḥ adriḥ śam naḥ devānām su havāni santu
translated: Be the two great worlds gracious to us, and may the mountain be gracious to us; may the well-praised ones of the gods be gracious to us.

original: śaṃ no agnir jyotiranīko astu śaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāv aśvinā śam /
analyzed: śam naḥ agniḥ jyotiḥ anīkaḥ astu śam naḥ mitrāvaruṇau aśvinā śam
translated: Be Agni, the banner of light, gracious to us; be Mitra, Varuna, and the two Asvins gracious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ sukṛtāṃ sukṛtāni santu śaṃ na iṣiro abhi vātu vātaḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ su kṛtām sukṛtāni santu śam naḥ iṣiraḥ abhi vātu vātaḥ
translated: Be the well-done deeds of the well-doers gracious to us; be the impetuous wind gracious to us.

original: śaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvahūtau śam antarikṣaṃ dṛśaye no astu /
analyzed: śam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī pūrva hūtau śam antarikṣam dṛśaye naḥ astu
translated: Be heaven and earth gracious to us when first invoked; be the atmosphere gracious to us to look upon.

original: śaṃ na oṣadhīr vanino bhavantu śaṃ no rajasas patir astu jiṣṇuḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ rajasaḥ patiḥ astu jiṣṇuḥ
translated: May the plants and the trees be auspicious to us. May the victorious lord of the realm be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ na indro vasubhir devo astu śam ādityebhir varuṇaḥ suśaṃsaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ indraḥ vasubhiḥ devaḥ astu śam ādityebhiḥ varuṇaḥ su śaṃsaḥ
translated: May the god Indra be auspicious to us with the Vasus, and may Varuna, well-praised, be auspicious to us with the Adityas.

original: śaṃ no rudro rudrebhir jalāṣaḥ śaṃ nas tvaṣṭā gnābhir iha śṛṇotu //🔽śaṃ naḥ somo bhavatu brahma śaṃ naḥ śaṃ no grāvāṇaḥ śam u santu yajñāḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ rudraḥ rudrebhiḥ jalāṣaḥ śam naḥ tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ iha śṛṇotu  śam naḥ somaḥ bhavatu brahma śam naḥ śam naḥ grāvāṇaḥ śam u santu yajñāḥ
translated: May Rudra be auspicious to us with the Rudras, the bountiful one. May Tvastr be auspicious to us here, may he listen with the wives.🔽May Soma be auspicious to us, may the Brahman be auspicious to us. May the pressing stones be auspicious to us, and may the sacrifices be auspicious.

original: śaṃ naḥ svarūṇām mitayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ prasvaḥ śam v astu vediḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ svarūṇām mitayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ prasvaḥ śam u astu vediḥ
translated: May the measures of our hymns be auspicious to us. May the sacrificial grass be auspicious to us, and may the altar be auspicious.

original: śaṃ naḥ sūrya urucakṣā ud etu śaṃ naś catasraḥ pradiśo bhavantu /
analyzed: śam naḥ sūryaḥ uru cakṣāḥ ud etu śam naḥ catasraḥ pradiśaḥ bhavantu
translated: May the far-seeing sun rise auspicious to us. May the four quarters be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ parvatā dhruvayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ sindhavaḥ śam u santv āpaḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ parvatāḥ dhruvayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ sindhavaḥ śam u santu āpaḥ
translated: May the firm mountains be auspicious to us. May the rivers and waters be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no aditir bhavatu vratebhiḥ śaṃ no bhavantu marutaḥ svarkāḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ aditiḥ bhavatu vratebhiḥ śam naḥ bhavantu marutaḥ su arkāḥ
translated: May Aditi be auspicious to us with her vows. May the Maruts, the joyous ones, be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no viṣṇuḥ śam u pūṣā no astu śaṃ no bhavitraṃ śam v astu vāyuḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ viṣṇuḥ śam u pūṣā naḥ astu śam naḥ bhavitram śam u astu vāyuḥ
translated: May Vishnu be auspicious to us, and may Pusan be auspicious to us. May the purifier be auspicious to us, and may Vayu be auspicious.

original: śaṃ no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavantūṣaso vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śam naḥ bhavantu uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: May the god Savita, the protector, be auspicious to us. May the shining dawns be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ parjanyo bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śaṃ naḥ kṣetrasya patir astu śambhuḥ //🔽śaṃ no devā viśvadevā bhavantu śaṃ sarasvatī saha dhībhir astu /
analyzed: śam naḥ parjanyaḥ bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śam naḥ kṣetrasya patiḥ astu śambhuḥ  śam naḥ devāḥ viśva devāḥ bhavantu śam sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ astu
translated: May Parjanya be gracious to the people, and may the auspicious Lord of the field be gracious to us.🔽May the gods, all the gods, be gracious to us, and may Sarasvatī be gracious with the hymns.

original: śam abhiṣācaḥ śam u rātiṣācaḥ śaṃ no divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śaṃ no apyāḥ //
analyzed: śam abhiṣācaḥ śam u rātiṣācaḥ śam naḥ divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śam naḥ apyāḥ
translated: Gracious be the rain-bestowing (clouds), and gracious the bestowers of gifts; gracious to us be the heavenly (waters), and gracious the earthly (waters).

original: śaṃ naḥ satyasya patayo bhavantu śaṃ no arvantaḥ śam u santu gāvaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ satyasya patayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ arvantaḥ śam u santu gāvaḥ
translated: Gracious to us be the lords of truth; gracious be the horses, and gracious be the cows.

original: śaṃ na ṛbhavaḥ sukṛtaḥ suhastāḥ śaṃ no bhavantu pitaro haveṣu //🔽śaṃ no aja ekapād devo astu śaṃ no 'hir budhnyaḥ śaṃ samudraḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ ṛbhavaḥ su kṛtaḥ su hastāḥ śam naḥ bhavantu pitaraḥ haveṣu  śam naḥ ajaḥ eka pād devaḥ astu śam naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ śam samudraḥ
translated: Gracious to us be the Rbhus, the well-made, the skilful-handed; gracious to us be the fathers in our invocations.🔽Gracious to us be the one-footed god, the goat; gracious to us be the deep-lying serpent, gracious the ocean.

original: śaṃ no apāṃ napāt perur astu śaṃ naḥ pṛśnir bhavatu devagopā //
analyzed: śam naḥ apām napāt peruḥ astu śam naḥ pṛśniḥ bhavatu deva gopā
translated: Gracious to us be the son of the waters, the swift one; gracious to us be the dappled one, the god-protected.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavo juṣantedam brahma kriyamāṇaṃ navīyaḥ /
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ juṣanta idam brahma kriyamāṇam navīyaḥ
translated: May the Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus accept this new prayer that is made.

original: śṛṇvantu no divyāḥ pārthivāso gojātā uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ //
analyzed: śṛṇvantu naḥ divyāḥ pārthivāsaḥ go jātāḥ uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: May the heavenly, the earthly, and those born of the cow, and those worthy of sacrifice, hear us.

original: ye devānāṃ yajñiyā yajñiyānām manor yajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: ye devānām yajñiyāḥ yajñiyānām manoḥ yajatrāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: Those who are of the gods, worthy of sacrifice, of the worthy of sacrifice, of Manu, the sacrificers, the immortal, the righteous,

original: te no rāsantām urugāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: te naḥ rāsantām uru gāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May they grant us wide protection this day. Do ye, O ye, protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: pra brahmaitu sadanād ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryo gāḥ /
analyzed: pra brahmā etu sadanāt ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryaḥ gāḥ
translated: Let the prayer go forth from the seat of truth. The sun hath created the cows with his rays.

original: vi sānunā pṛthivī sasra urvī pṛthu pratīkam adhy edhe agniḥ //
analyzed: vi sānunā pṛthivī sasre urvī pṛthu pratīkam adhi edhe agniḥ
translated: The wide earth hath spread out with its ridge. Agni hath been kindled on the broad surface.

original: imāṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktim iṣaṃ na kṛṇve asurā navīyaḥ /
analyzed: imām vām mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktim iṣam na kṛṇve asurāḥ navīyaḥ
translated: This good hymn of yours, O Mitra-Varuṇa, I make, O Asuras, more new than food.

original: ino vām anyaḥ padavīr adabdho janaṃ ca mitro yatati bruvāṇaḥ //
analyzed: inaḥ vām anyaḥ padavīḥ adabdhaḥ janam ca mitraḥ yatati bruvāṇaḥ
translated: One of you, O infallible one, follows your paths. Mitra, speaking, strives to reach the people.

original: ā vātasya dhrajato ranta ityā apīpayanta dhenavo na sūdāḥ /
analyzed: ā vātasya dhrajataḥ rante ityāḥ apīpayanta dhenavaḥ na sūdāḥ
translated: The milch-cows, like good wives, have filled for him the basins of the moving wind.

original: maho divaḥ sadane jāyamāno 'cikradad vṛṣabhaḥ sasminn ūdhan //
analyzed: mahaḥ divaḥ sadane jāyamānaḥ cikradat vṛṣabhaḥ sasmin ūdhan
translated: The bull hath bellowed in his own udder, being born in the great seat of heaven.

original: girā ya etā yunajad dharī ta indra priyā surathā śūra dhāyū /
analyzed: girā yaḥ etā yunajat harī te indra priyā su rathā śūra dhāyū
translated: He whom the song hath yoked, O Indra, thy dear strong-winged chariot, O hero,

original: pra yo manyuṃ ririkṣato mināty ā sukratum aryamaṇaṃ vavṛtyām //
analyzed: pra yaḥ manyum ririkṣataḥ mināti ā sukratum aryamaṇam vavṛtyām
translated: Whom, when he is about to hurl his wrath, I will turn away, the wise, the bountiful.

original: yajante asya sakhyaṃ vayaś ca namasvinaḥ sva ṛtasya dhāman /
analyzed: yajante asya sakhyam vayaḥ ca namasvinaḥ sve ṛtasya dhāman
translated: They worship his friendship and his power, the humble ones, in the abode of his own truth.

original: vi pṛkṣo bābadhe nṛbhi stavāna idaṃ namo rudrāya preṣṭham //
analyzed: vi pṛkṣaḥ bābadhe nṛbhiḥ stavānaḥ idam namaḥ rudrāya preṣṭham
translated: He hath destroyed the food with men, with the praise. This homage is most dear to Rudra.

original: ā yat sākaṃ yaśaso vāvaśānāḥ sarasvatī saptathī sindhumātā /
analyzed: ā yat sākam yaśasaḥ vāvaśānāḥ sarasvatī saptathī sindhu mātā
translated: When the seven sisters, the mothers of the river, the roaring Sarasvatī, come together,

original: yāḥ suṣvayanta sudughāḥ sudhārā abhi svena payasā pīpyānāḥ //
analyzed: yāḥ su dughāḥ su dhārāḥ abhi svena payasā pīpyānāḥ
translated: The well-milked, well-flowing ones, swelling with their own milk.

original: uta tye no maruto mandasānā dhiyaṃ tokaṃ ca vājino 'vantu /
analyzed: uta tye naḥ marutaḥ mandasānāḥ dhiyam tokam ca vājinaḥ vantu
translated: And may those very powerful Maruts, being delighted, protect our thought and offspring,

original: mā naḥ pari khyad akṣarā caranty avīvṛdhan yujyaṃ te rayiṃ naḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ pari khyat akṣarā carantī avīvṛdhan yujyam te rayim naḥ
translated: May they not pass by our words, may they increase our wealth fit for yoking.

original: pra vo mahīm aramatiṃ kṛṇudhvam pra pūṣaṇaṃ vidathyaṃ na vīram /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahīm aramatim kṛṇudhvam pra pūṣaṇam vidathyam na vīram
translated: Make your great Armatî, make Pûshan, the hero who frequents assemblies,

original: bhagaṃ dhiyo 'vitāraṃ no asyāḥ sātau vājaṃ rātiṣācam purandhim //
analyzed: bhagam dhiyaḥ vitāram naḥ asyāḥ sātau vājam rātiṣācam purandhim
translated: Bhaga, the leader of our thoughts in this contest, the bountiful, the winner of strength, the rich.

original: acchāyaṃ vo marutaḥ śloka etv acchā viṣṇuṃ niṣiktapām avobhiḥ /
analyzed: acchā ayam vaḥ marutaḥ ślokaḥ etu acchā viṣṇum niṣikta pām avobhiḥ
translated: To you, O Maruts, may this hymn come nigh, to Vishṇu, the besprinkler, with its words of praise.

original: uta prajāyai gṛṇate vayo dhur yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: uta prajāyai gṛṇate vayaḥ dhuḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: And to the singer give ye life for offspring. Ye, protect us evermore with blessings.
