original: ā vo vāhiṣṭho vahatu stavadhyai ratho vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktaḥ /
analyzed: ā vaḥ vāhiṣṭhaḥ vahatu stavadhyai rathaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ amṛktaḥ
translated: May your best bearer bring you hitherward to be adored, your chariot, O ye R̥ibhus, unresisted, bearing strength,

original: abhi tripṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somair made suśiprā mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam //
analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somaiḥ made su śiprāḥ mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam
translated: And fill you with the gladdening Soma draughts, O ye of fair-cut hair, with the great (sacrifices), O ye of triple seat.

original: yūyaṃ ha ratnam maghavatsu dhattha svardṛśa ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktam /
analyzed: yūyam ha ratnam maghavatsu dhattha svar dṛśaḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ amṛktam
translated: Ye, O R̥ibhus, give the treasure, the light-discovering, to the bounteous ones, the unresisted.

original: saṃ yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvaṃ vi no rādhāṃsi matibhir dayadhvam //
analyzed: sam yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvam vi naḥ rādhāṃsi matibhiḥ dayadhvam
translated: At sacrifices, ye who are rich in your own power, drink ye; and with your thoughts favour us with gifts.

original: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇam maho arbhasya vasuno vibhāge /
analyzed: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇam mahaḥ arbhasya vasunaḥ vibhāge
translated: For thou hast spoken, O bountiful one, of the bestowal of wealth in the distribution of the great and the small.

original: ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā gabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā //
analyzed: ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā gabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā
translated: Both thy hands are full of wealth; no kindly office is denied thee which may bring prosperity.

original: tvam indra svayaśā ṛbhukṣā vājo na sādhur astam eṣy ṛkvā /
analyzed: tvam indra sva yaśāḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ na sādhuḥ astam eṣi ṛkvā
translated: Thou, O Indra, art self-famous, a R̥ibhu, a steed to be won by the pious, by the singer.

original: vayaṃ nu te dāśvāṃsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvanto harivo vasiṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: vayam nu te dāśvāṃsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvantaḥ harivas vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: May we be thy worshippers, O thou of tawny steeds, we Vasishṭhas, offering prayer.

original: sanitāsi pravato dāśuṣe cid yābhir viveṣo haryaśva dhībhiḥ /🔽vavanmā nu te yujyābhir ūtī kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyeḥ //
analyzed: sanitāsi pravataḥ dāśuṣe cit yābhiḥ viveṣaḥ haryaśva dhībhiḥ  vavanma nu te yujyābhiḥ ūtī kadā naḥ indra rāyaḥ ā daśasyeḥ
translated: Thou art the winner of the prize even for the liberal worshipper, with those thoughts, O thou of bay steeds, wherewith thou hast penetrated (to the gods).🔽Willst thou not now, with thy yoked helpers, favour us with wealth, O Indra?

original: vāsayasīva vedhasas tvaṃ naḥ kadā na indra vacaso bubodhaḥ /
analyzed: vāsayasi iva vedhasaḥ tvam naḥ kadā naḥ indra vacasaḥ bubodhaḥ
translated: As a creator thou dwellest with us: when wilt thou, O Indra, understand our words?

original: astaṃ tātyā dhiyā rayiṃ suvīram pṛkṣo no arvā ny uhīta vājī //
analyzed: astam tātyā dhiyā rayim su vīram pṛkṣaḥ naḥ arvā ni uhīta vājī
translated: Let the strong steed bring us, as it were, from afar, wealth with brave men, by the thought of him who is to be praised.

original: abhi yaṃ devī nirṛtiś cid īśe nakṣanta indraṃ śaradaḥ supṛkṣaḥ /
analyzed: abhi yam devī nirṛtiḥ cit īśe nakṣante indram śaradaḥ su pṛkṣaḥ
translated: Whom even the goddess Nirr̥iti must obey, to whom the autumn months come, bringing good store of food, to Indra.

original: upa tribandhur jaradaṣṭim ety asvaveśaṃ yaṃ kṛṇavanta martāḥ //
analyzed: upa tribandhuḥ jaradaṣṭim eti a sva veśam yam kṛṇavanta martāḥ
translated: To him whom mortals have made to be their own, to him who hath three bonds, to him whose teeth are strong.

original: ā no rādhāṃsi savita stavadhyā ā rāyo yantu parvatasya rātau /
analyzed: ā naḥ rādhāṃsi savitaḥ stavadhyai ā rāyaḥ yantu parvatasya rātau
translated: O Savitar, let the gifts be worthy of praise, let the riches come in the gift of Parvata.

original: sadā no divyaḥ pāyuḥ siṣaktu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: sadā naḥ divyaḥ pāyuḥ siṣaktu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May the heavenly protector always be with us. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīm amatiṃ yām aśiśret /
analyzed: ud u sya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīm amatim yām aśiśret
translated: The god Savitar has raised up the golden thought which he has conceived.

original: nūnam bhago havyo mānuṣebhir vi yo ratnā purūvasur dadhāti //🔽ud u tiṣṭha savitaḥ śrudhy asya hiraṇyapāṇe prabhṛtāv ṛtasya /
analyzed: nūnam bhagaḥ havyaḥ mānuṣebhiḥ vi yaḥ ratnā purūvasuḥ dadhāti  ud u tiṣṭha savitar śrudhi asya hiraṇya pāṇe prabhṛtau ṛtasya
translated: Surely Bhaga, who distributes treasures with abundant wealth, should be invoked by men.🔽Rise up, O Savitar, be ready for this, O thou with golden hands, at the beginning of the rite.

original: vy urvīm pṛthvīm amatiṃ sṛjāna ā nṛbhyo martabhojanaṃ suvānaḥ //
analyzed: vi urvīm pṛthvīm amatim sṛjānaḥ ā nṛbhyaḥ marta bhojanam suvānaḥ
translated: Stretching out the wide, broad thought, creating, bestowing on men the enjoyment of mortals.

original: api ṣṭutaḥ savitā devo astu yam ā cid viśve vasavo gṛṇanti /🔽sa na stomān namasyaś cano dhād viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhir ni sūrīn //
analyzed: api stutaḥ savitā devaḥ astu yam ā cit viśve vasavaḥ gṛṇanti  sa naḥ stomān namasyaḥ canaḥ dhāt viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhiḥ ni sūrīn
translated: May the god Savitar be praised, even if all the Vasus sing his praises.🔽May he, to be revered by the hymns, grant favor, and protect the princes with all his protecting powers.

original: abhi yaṃ devy aditir gṛṇāti savaṃ devasya savitur juṣāṇā /
analyzed: abhi yam devī aditiḥ gṛṇāti savam devasya savituḥ juṣāṇā
translated: Whom the goddess Aditi praises, accepting the rite of god Savitar,

original: abhi samrājo varuṇo gṛṇanty abhi mitrāso aryamā sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: abhi samrājaḥ varuṇaḥ gṛṇanti abhi mitrāsaḥ aryamā sajoṣāḥ
translated: The emperors Varuna sing praises, the friends Mitra and Aryaman in unison.

original: abhi ye mitho vanuṣaḥ sapante rātiṃ divo rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: abhi ye mithas vanuṣaḥ sapante rātim divaḥ rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Whom the mutually contending ones desire, the bountiful ones of heaven and earth,

original: ahir budhnya uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtry ekadhenubhir ni pātu //
analyzed: ahiḥ budhnyaḥ uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtrī ekadhenubhiḥ ni pātu
translated: May Ahi Budhnya also hear us, and Varuna with the Ekadhanus protect us.

original: anu tan no jāspatir maṃsīṣṭa ratnaṃ devasya savitur iyānaḥ /
analyzed: anu tat naḥ jāspatiḥ maṃsīṣṭa ratnam devasya savituḥ iyānaḥ
translated: May the lord of the house think of that wealth for us, going to the god Savitar.

original: bhagam ugro 'vase johavīti bhagam anugro adha yāti ratnam //🔽śaṃ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ /
analyzed: bhagam ugraḥ vase johavīti bhagam anugraḥ adha yāti ratnam  śam naḥ bhavantu vājinaḥ haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ su arkāḥ
translated: The strong one invokes Bhaga for help, the weak one goes to Bhaga for wealth.🔽May the strong ones be auspicious to us in our invocations, the gods' companions, whose course is measured, the pure ones.

original: jambhayanto 'hiṃ vṛkaṃ rakṣāṃsi sanemy asmad yuyavann amīvāḥ //
analyzed: jambhayantaḥ him vṛkam rakṣāṃsi sanemi asmat yuyavan amīvāḥ
translated: Crushing the serpent, the wolf, the Raksases, may they drive away evil from us.

original: vājevāje 'vata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: vājevāje vata vājinaḥ naḥ dhaneṣu viprāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: In every contest, O strong ones, help us, O immortal sages who know the truth, in our possessions.

original: asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṃ tṛptā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ //🔽ūrdhvo agniḥ sumatiṃ vasvo aśret pratīcī jūrṇir devatātim eti /
analyzed: asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvam tṛptāḥ yāta pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ  ūrdhvaḥ agniḥ sumatim vasvaḥ aśret pratīcī jūrṇiḥ devatātim eti
translated: Drink of this mead, rejoice, and satisfied go on the paths of the gods.🔽Agni has risen upwards to the good will of wealth; the burning one goes to the assembly of the gods.

original: bhejāte adrī rathyeva panthām ṛtaṃ hotā na iṣito yajāti //
analyzed: bhejāte adrī rathyā iva panthām ṛtam hotā naḥ iṣitaḥ yajāti
translated: The two Adhvaryus have opened the path like a chariot-path. The appointed Hotri priest offers the truth.

original: pra vāvṛje suprayā barhir eṣām ā viśpatīva bīriṭa iyāte /
analyzed: pra vāvṛje su prayāḥ barhiḥ eṣām ā viśpatī iva bīriṭe iyāte
translated: The good paths of these have spread out; they have come like the lords of the people.

original: viśām aktor uṣasaḥ pūrvahūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān //
analyzed: viśām aktoḥ uṣasaḥ pūrva hūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān
translated: In the invocation of the dawn of the people's assembly, Vayu and Pushan with their team are for our welfare.

original: jmayā atra vasavo ranta devā urāv antarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ /
analyzed: jma yāḥ atra vasavaḥ ranta devāḥ urau antarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ
translated: Here the Vasus, the delightful gods, in the wide atmosphere, the bright ones, purify themselves.

original: arvāk patha urujrayaḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ śrotā dūtasya jagmuṣo no asya //
analyzed: arvāk pathaḥ uru jrayaḥ kṛṇudhvam śrota dūtasya jagmuṣaḥ naḥ asya
translated: Make ye the path to come hitherward, O ye of wide paths, that this envoy may hear of our going.

original: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmāḥ sadhasthaṃ viśve abhi santi devāḥ /
analyzed: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsaḥ ūmāḥ sadhastham viśve abhi santi devāḥ
translated: For they are the most adorable at sacrifices, all the gods are present in the place of worship.

original: tāṃ adhvara uśato yakṣy agne śruṣṭī bhagaṃ nāsatyā purandhim //
analyzed: tām adhvare uśataḥ yakṣi agne śruṣṭī bhagam nāsatyā purandhim
translated: Worship those who are eager for the sacrifice, O Agni, hear Purandhi, Bhaga, the Nâsatyas.

original: āgne giro diva ā pṛthivyā mitraṃ vaha varuṇam indram agnim /
analyzed: ā agne giraḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ mitram vaha varuṇam indram agnim
translated: Bring, O Agni, the songs from heaven and earth, bring Mitra, Varuna, Indra, Agni.

original: āryamaṇam aditiṃ viṣṇum eṣāṃ sarasvatī maruto mādayantām //
analyzed: ā aryamaṇam aditim viṣṇum eṣām sarasvatī marutaḥ mādayantām
translated: Delight Aryaman, Aditi, Vishnu, Sarasvatî, the Maruts of these.

original: rare havyam matibhir yajñiyānāṃ nakṣat kāmam martyānām asinvan /
analyzed: rare havyam matibhiḥ yajñiyānām nakṣat kāmam martyānām asinvan
translated: Let him, with the hymns of the adorable ones, spread the offering, fulfilling the desire of mortals.

original: dhātā rayim avidasyaṃ sadāsāṃ sakṣīmahi yujyebhir nu devaiḥ //
analyzed: dhāta rayim avidasyam sadāsām sakṣīmahi yujyebhiḥ nu devaiḥ
translated: May we obtain wealth, O Dhatr, that is never failing, with the help of the gods who are to be yoked.

original: nū rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhair ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ /
analyzed: nu rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhaiḥ ṛtāvānaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: Now may the two worlds, praised by the most excellent, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, the righteous,

original: yacchantu candrā upamaṃ no arkaṃ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: yacchantu candrāḥ upamam naḥ arkam yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Let the Chandras grant us a praise worthy of comparison. Do ye, O ye, protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: o śruṣṭir vidathyā sam etu prati stomaṃ dadhīmahi turāṇām /
analyzed: ā u śruṣṭiḥ vidathyā sam etu prati stomam dadhīmahi turāṇām
translated: O Shrusti, let her come to the sacrificer, let us set our thought on the praise of the strong ones.

original: yad adya devaḥ savitā suvāti syāmāsya ratnino vibhāge //
analyzed: yat adya devaḥ savitā suvāti syāma asya ratninaḥ vibhāge
translated: What the god Savitar now impels, may we be the possessors of his treasure.

original: mitras tan no varuṇo rodasī ca dyubhaktam indro aryamā dadātu /
analyzed: mitraḥ tat naḥ varuṇaḥ rodasī ca dyu bhaktam indraḥ aryamā dadātu
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, the two world-halves, Indra, Aryaman grant us the portion of the sky.

original: dideṣṭu devy aditī rekṇo vāyuś ca yan niyuvaite bhagaś ca //
analyzed: dideṣṭu devī aditiḥ rekṇaḥ vāyuḥ ca yat niyuvaite bhagaḥ ca
translated: May the goddess Aditi, the wealth of the gods, Vayu and Bhaga, when they are yoked, grant it.

original: sed ugro astu marutaḥ sa śuṣmī yam martyam pṛṣadaśvā avātha /
analyzed: sa id ugraḥ astu marutaḥ sa śuṣmī yam martyam pṛṣat aśvāḥ avātha
translated: Let him be strong, O Maruts, let him be mighty, whom ye, O ye with spotted horses, have helped.

original: utem agniḥ sarasvatī junanti na tasya rāyaḥ paryetāsti //
analyzed: uta īm agniḥ sarasvatī junanti na tasya rāyaḥ paryetā asti
translated: And him, too, Agni and Sarasvatî urge on; there is no lack of wealth for him.

original: ayaṃ hi netā varuṇa ṛtasya mitro rājāno aryamāpo dhuḥ /
analyzed: ayam hi netā varuṇaḥ ṛtasya mitraḥ rājānaḥ aryamā apaḥ dhuḥ
translated: For he is the leader of this god of truth, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the kings, the waters.

original: suhavā devy aditir anarvā te no aṃho ati parṣann ariṣṭān //
analyzed: su havā devī aditiḥ anarvā te naḥ aṃhaḥ ati parṣan ariṣṭān
translated: The goddess Aditi, the swift to hear, the unerring, may she lead us over trouble to safety.

original: asya devasya mīḷhuṣo vayā viṣṇor eṣasya prabhṛthe havirbhiḥ /
analyzed: asya devasya mīḍhuṣaḥ vayāḥ viṣṇoḥ eṣasya prabhṛthe havirbhiḥ
translated: For this bountiful god, the mighty, the all-surpassing, Viṣṇu, at the solemn rite with oblations,

original: vide hi rudro rudriyam mahitvaṃ yāsiṣṭaṃ vartir aśvināv irāvat //
analyzed: vide hi rudraḥ rudriyam mahi tvam yāsiṣṭam vartiḥ aśvinau irāvat
translated: For Rudra knows his own great power, O ye Aśvins, ye go to the dwelling-place with food.

original: mātra pūṣann āghṛṇa irasyo varūtrī yad rātiṣācaś ca rāsan /
analyzed: mā atra pūṣan āghṛṇe irasyaḥ varūtrī yat rātiṣācaḥ ca rāsan
translated: Do not be angry, O Pūṣan, O thou of no anger, when the protector and the bountiful are yoked.

original: mayobhuvo no arvanto ni pāntu vṛṣṭim parijmā vāto dadātu //
analyzed: mayobhuvaḥ naḥ arvantaḥ ni pāntu vṛṣṭim parijmā vātaḥ dadātu
translated: May the well-being-giving horses protect us; may the wind, the all-surrounding, give rain.

original: nū rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhair ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ /
analyzed: nu rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhaiḥ ṛtāvānaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: Now the two worlds are praised by the truthful Vasishthas, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Agni.

original: yacchantu candrā upamaṃ no arkaṃ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: yacchantu candrāḥ upamam naḥ arkam yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May they grant us a praise worthy of comparison. Protect us always, ye Gods, with your blessings.

original: prātar agnim prātar indraṃ havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā /
analyzed: prātar agnim prātar indram havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā
translated: In the morning we invoke Agni, in the morning Indra, in the morning Mitra-Varuṇa, in the morning the Asvins,

original: prātar bhagam pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim prātaḥ somam uta rudraṃ huvema //
analyzed: prātar bhagam pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaḥ patim prātar somam uta rudram huvema
translated: In the morning Bhaga, Pusan, the lord of prayer, in the morning Soma, and Rudra we invoke.

original: prātarjitam bhagam ugraṃ huvema vayam putram aditer yo vidhartā /
analyzed: prātar jitam bhagam ugram huvema vayam putram aditeḥ yaḥ vidhartā
translated: In the morning let us invoke the victorious Bhaga, the mighty, the son of Aditi, who is the ordainer.

original: ādhraś cid yam manyamānas turaś cid rājā cid yam bhagam bhakṣīty āha //
analyzed: ādhraḥ cit yam manyamānaḥ turaḥ cit rājā cit yam bhagam bhakṣi iti āha
translated: Even the poor man, thinking himself rich, even the swift one, even the king, says, 'I will enjoy Bhaga.'

original: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satyarādho bhagemāṃ dhiyam ud avā dadan naḥ /
analyzed: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satya rādhaḥ bhaga imām dhiyam ud ava dadan naḥ
translated: O Bhaga, leader, Bhaga, whose prayers are true, O Bhaga, grant us this thought.

original: bhaga pra ṇo janaya gobhir aśvair bhaga pra nṛbhir nṛvantaḥ syāma //
analyzed: bhaga pra naḥ janaya gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ bhaga pra nṛbhiḥ nṛvantaḥ syāma
translated: O Bhaga, generate us with cattle and horses. O Bhaga, may we be prosperous with men.

original: utedānīm bhagavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām /
analyzed: uta idānīm bhagavantaḥ syāma uta prapitve uta madhye ahnām
translated: And now, O Bhaga, may we be prosperous, and in the evening, and in the middle of the days.

original: utoditā maghavan sūryasya vayaṃ devānāṃ sumatau syāma //
analyzed: uta uditā maghavan sūryasya vayam devānām sumatau syāma
translated: And in the morning, O bountiful one, at sunrise, may we be in the favor of the gods.

original: bhaga eva bhagavāṃ astu devās tena vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma /
analyzed: bhagaḥ eva bhagavān astu devāḥ tena vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma
translated: May Bhaga be the Lord of all, O ye Gods, and through him may we be Lords of wealth.

original: taṃ tvā bhaga sarva ij johavīti sa no bhaga puraetā bhaveha //
analyzed: tam tvā bhaga sarvaḥ id johavīti sa naḥ bhaga puraetā bhava iha
translated: All call on thee, O Bhaga, for that wealth: be thou our leader, O thou Bhaga.

original: sam adhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya /
analyzed: sam adhvarāya uṣasaḥ namanta dadhikrāvā iva śucaye padāya
translated: The Dawns bow down to him for the sacrifice, as Dadhikrâvan to the pure place of worship.

original: arvācīnaṃ vasuvidam bhagaṃ no ratham ivāśvā vājina ā vahantu //
analyzed: arvācīnam vasu vidam bhagam naḥ ratham iva aśvāḥ vājinaḥ ā vahantu
translated: As swift steeds draw a chariot, so let them bring us hitherward Bhaga who finds us wealth.

original: aśvāvatīr gomatīr na uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ /
analyzed: aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ naḥ uṣāsaḥ vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ
translated: May blessed Mornings ever rise on us, rich in horses, rich in cattle, rich in heroes.

original: ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtam duhānāḥ viśvatas prapītāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Pouring forth fatness from all sides, to be drunk by all: ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: pra brahmāṇo aṅgiraso nakṣanta pra krandanur nabhanyasya vetu /
analyzed: pra brahmāṇaḥ aṅgirasaḥ nakṣanta pra krandanuḥ nabhanyasya vetu
translated: Let the Brahmans, the Angirases, come nigh: let the loud roar of the cloud be heard.

original: pra dhenava udapruto navanta yujyātām adrī adhvarasya peśaḥ //
analyzed: pra dhenavaḥ uda prutaḥ navanta yujyātām adrī adhvarasya peśaḥ
translated: Let the milch-kine, the wanderers afar, low: let the two stones be yoked for the sacrifice's rite.

original: sugas te agne sanavitto adhvā yukṣvā sute harito rohitaś ca /
analyzed: sugaḥ te agne sanavittaḥ adhvā yukṣva sute haritaḥ rohitaḥ ca
translated: Easy for thee is the path, O Agni, to win the prize: yoke thy two bay steeds, and thy ruddy one.

original: ye vā sadmann aruṣā vīravāho huve devānāṃ janimāni sattaḥ //
analyzed: ye vā sadman aruṣā vīra vāhaḥ huve devānām janimāni sattaḥ
translated: Or, bearing heroes in thy house, red steeds, I call to the generations of the Gods.

original: sam u vo yajñam mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandro ririca upāke /
analyzed: sam u vaḥ yajñam mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandraḥ ririce upāke
translated: Exalting your sacrifice with adorations, the Priest, the joyful one, hath sat him down in front.

original: yajasva su purvaṇīka devān ā yajñiyām aramatiṃ vavṛtyāḥ //
analyzed: yajasva su purvaṇīka devān ā yajñiyām aramatim vavṛtyāḥ
translated: Worship the gods, O thou of fair offerings, turn thou unto the worshipful favour of the gods.

original: yadā vīrasya revato duroṇe syonaśīr atithir āciketat /
analyzed: yadā vīrasya revataḥ duroṇe syonaśīḥ atithiḥ āciketat
translated: When the wealthy guest, with kindly head, hath announced himself in the house of the hero,

original: suprīto agniḥ sudhito dama ā sa viśe dāti vāryam iyatyai //
analyzed: su prītaḥ agniḥ sudhitaḥ dame ā sa viśe dāti vāryam iyatyai
translated: Well-pleased is Agni, well-disposed in the house, he bestows wealth on the clan for this (sacrifice).

original: imaṃ no agne adhvaraṃ juṣasva marutsv indre yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ /
analyzed: imam naḥ agne adhvaram juṣasva marutsu indre yaśasam kṛdhī naḥ
translated: Accept this sacrifice of ours, O Agni, make it glorious among the Maruts, among Indra, for us.

original: ā naktā barhiḥ sadatām uṣāsośantā mitrāvaruṇā yajeha //
analyzed: ā naktā barhiḥ sadatām uṣāsā uśantā mitrāvaruṇā yaja iha
translated: Let the night and the dawn sit on the sacred grass, O Mitra-Varuṇa, be worshipped here.

original: evāgniṃ sahasyaṃ vasiṣṭho rāyaskāmo viśvapsnyasya staut /
analyzed: eva agnim sahasyam vasiṣṭhaḥ rāyaskāmaḥ viśvapsnyasya staut
translated: Thus Vasishtha has praised this Agni, the conqueror, longing for wealth, the all-impelling one.

original: iṣaṃ rayim paprathad vājam asme yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: iṣam rayim paprathat vājam asme yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: He hath extended food, wealth, and strength for us. Do ye, O (Maruts), protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: pra vo yajñeṣu devayanto arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ pṛthivī iṣadhyai /
analyzed: pra vaḥ yajñeṣu devayantaḥ arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ pṛthivī iṣadhyai
translated: You who are devoted to the gods, in your sacrifices, with salutations to heaven and earth, seek food.

original: yeṣām brahmāṇy asamāni viprā viṣvag viyanti vanino na śākhāḥ //🔽pra yajña etu hetvo na saptir ud yacchadhvaṃ samanaso ghṛtācīḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām brahmāṇi asamāni viprāḥ viṣvak viyanti vaninaḥ na śākhāḥ  pra yajñaḥ etu hetvaḥ na saptiḥ ud yacchadhvam samanasaḥ ghṛtācīḥ
translated: Whose unequalled prayers, the sages, spread out in all directions, like the branches of trees.🔽Let the sacrifice go forth like a horse to the prize, raise ye the ladles with one mind.

original: stṛṇīta barhir adhvarāya sādhūrdhvā śocīṃṣi devayūny asthuḥ //
analyzed: stṛṇīta barhiḥ adhvarāya sādhu ūrdhvā śocīṃṣi devayūni asthuḥ
translated: Strew the sacred grass for the sacrifice, the pure one. The bright flames have risen up to the gods.

original: ā putrāso na mātaraṃ vibhṛtrāḥ sānau devāso barhiṣaḥ sadantu /
analyzed: ā putrāsaḥ na mātaram vibhṛtrāḥ sānau devāsaḥ barhiṣaḥ sadantu
translated: As the sons support their mother, so may the Gods sit on the grass-bunch of the altar.

original: ā viśvācī vidathyām anaktv agne mā no devatātā mṛdhas kaḥ //
analyzed: ā viśvācī vidathyām anaktu agne mā naḥ devatātā mṛdhaḥ kaḥ
translated: Anoint all the paths that lead to the assembly, O Agni: let there be no strife among us, O God.

original: te sīṣapanta joṣam ā yajatrā ṛtasya dhārāḥ sudughā duhānāḥ /🔽jyeṣṭhaṃ vo adya maha ā vasūnām ā gantana samanaso yati ṣṭha //
analyzed: te sīṣapanta joṣam ā yajatrāḥ ṛtasya dhārāḥ sudughāḥ duhānāḥ  jyeṣṭham vaḥ adya mahaḥ ā vasūnām ā gantana samanasaḥ yati stha
translated: They have accepted the will of the adorable ones, the streams of holy order, well-milked, pouring milk.🔽The best of your great treasures today: come ye together, be ye of one mind.

original: evā no agne vikṣv ā daśasya tvayā vayaṃ sahasāvann āskrāḥ /
analyzed: eva naḥ agne vikṣu ā daśasya tvayā vayam sahasāvan āskrāḥ
translated: So, O Agni, be gracious to us in all our dwellings: through thee, O victor, may we be unassailable.

original: rāyā yujā sadhamādo ariṣṭā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: rāyā yujā sadhamādaḥ ariṣṭāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Unharmed, united with wealth, in the same place, do ye, O ye, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: dadhikrāṃ vaḥ prathamam aśvinoṣasam agniṃ samiddham bhagam ūtaye huve /
analyzed: dadhikrām vaḥ prathamam aśvinā uṣasam agnim samiddham bhagam ūtaye huve
translated: I call Dadhikrâvan, the first of the Asvins, the Dawns, and Agni when the kindling-stick is kindled, and Bhaga to help us.

original: indraṃ viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim ādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ //
analyzed: indram viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaḥ patim ādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svar
translated: Indra, Vishṇu, Pûshan, the Lord of prayer, the Âdityas, Heaven and Earth, the waters, and the sky.

original: dadhikrām u namasā bodhayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ /🔽iḷāṃ devīm barhiṣi sādayanto 'śvinā viprā suhavā huvema //
analyzed: dadhikrām u namasā bodhayantaḥ udīrāṇāḥ yajñam upaprayantaḥ  iḷām devīm barhiṣi sādayantaḥ śvinā viprā su havāḥ huvema
translated: Awakening Dadhikrâvan with homage, rising and approaching the sacrifice,🔽Placing the Goddess Ilâ on the sacred grass, let us invoke the Asvins, the sages, the ready to hear.

original: dadhikrāvāṇam bubudhāno agnim upa bruva uṣasaṃ sūryaṃ gām /
analyzed: dadhikrāvāṇam bubudhānaḥ agnim upa bruve uṣasam sūryam gām
translated: Awakening Agni Dadhikrâvan, I address the Dawn, the Sun, the Cow.

original: bradhnam māṃścator varuṇasya babhruṃ te viśvāsmad duritā yāvayantu //
analyzed: bradhnam māṃścatoḥ varuṇasya babhrum te viśvā asmat duritā yāvayantu
translated: May they, the swift one, the brown one of Varuna and of Manchat, remove from us all evils.

original: dadhikrāvā prathamo vājy arvāgre rathānām bhavati prajānan /
analyzed: dadhikrāvā prathamaḥ vājī arvā agre rathānām bhavati prajānan
translated: Dadhikravan, the first swift steed, goes in front, knowing, of the chariots.

original: saṃvidāna uṣasā sūryeṇādityebhir vasubhir aṅgirobhiḥ //
analyzed: saṃvidānaḥ uṣasā sūryeṇa ādityebhiḥ vasubhiḥ aṅgirobhiḥ
translated: In accord with the dawn, with the sun, with the Adityas, with the Vasus, with the Angirases.

original: ā no dadhikrāḥ pathyām anaktv ṛtasya panthām anvetavā u /
analyzed: ā naḥ dadhikrāḥ pathyām anaktu ṛtasya panthām anvetavai u
translated: Dadhikravan, anoint the path for us, the path of truth, you who follow it.

original: śṛṇotu no daivyaṃ śardho agniḥ śṛṇvantu viśve mahiṣā amūrāḥ //
analyzed: śṛṇotu naḥ daivyam śardhaḥ agniḥ śṛṇvantu viśve mahiṣāḥ amūrāḥ
translated: May the divine host, Agni, hear us. May all the mighty ones, the unerring ones, listen.

original: ā devo yātu savitā suratno 'ntarikṣaprā vahamāno aśvaiḥ /
analyzed: ā devaḥ yātu savitā su ratnaḥ ntarikṣa prāḥ vahamānaḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: May the god Savitar come to us with good treasure, borne on his horses through the atmosphere,

original: haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi niveśayañ ca prasuvañ ca bhūma //
analyzed: haste dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi niveśayam ca prasuvam ca bhūma
translated: Holding in his hand many manly things, settling and producing the earth.

original: ud asya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divo antāṃ anaṣṭām /🔽nūnaṃ so asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraś cid asmā anu dād apasyām //🔽sa ghā no devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣad vasupatir vasūni /
analyzed: ud asya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divaḥ antām anaṣṭām  nūnam saḥ asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraḥ cit asmai anu dāt apasyām  sa gha naḥ devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣat vasu patiḥ vasūni
translated: His two mighty, firm, golden arms, not decaying, reach to the ends of the sky.🔽Surely his greatness is to be desired. Even the sun has given him the most excellent thing.🔽May that god Savitar, the lord of treasures, grant us treasures together with our friends.

original: viśrayamāṇo amatim urūcīm martabhojanam adha rāsate naḥ //
analyzed: viśrayamāṇaḥ amatim urūcīm marta bhojanam adha rāsate naḥ
translated: Giving us wide space, may he bestow upon us the food of men.

original: imā giraḥ savitāraṃ sujihvam pūrṇagabhastim īḷate supāṇim /
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ savitāram su jihvam pūrṇa gabhastim īḍate su pāṇim
translated: These songs praise Savitar the very skilful, the God with perfect arms, with fingers splayed.

original: citraṃ vayo bṛhad asme dadhātu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: citram vayaḥ bṛhat asme dadhātu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May he bestow upon us wondrous vigour, and may ye all preserve us safe for ever.

original: imā rudrāya sthiradhanvane giraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne /
analyzed: imāḥ rudrāya sthiradhanvane giraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne
translated: These songs are sung to Rudra, firm of bow, to the swift-darting God, the God who rules of old,

original: aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tigmāyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ //
analyzed: aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tigma āyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ
translated: To him who slays not, to the conquering, ordering God, to him whose weapon is most keen. Let him hear us.

original: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati /🔽avann avantīr upa no duraś carānamīvo rudra jāsu no bhava //
analyzed: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati  avan avantīḥ upa naḥ duraḥ cara anamīvaḥ rudra jāsu naḥ bhava
translated: For he is Lord of all that moves and all that moves not, of the celestial and the earthly realm.🔽Be gracious, Rudra, to our cattle, to our folk, to our possessions, to our homes. Be gracious.

original: yā te didyud avasṛṣṭā divas pari kṣmayā carati pari sā vṛṇaktu naḥ /
analyzed: yā te didyut avasṛṣṭā divaḥ pari kṣmayā carati pari sā vṛṇaktu naḥ
translated: That dart of thine, O Rudra, which is shot from heaven, which moves along the earth, may that avoid us.

original: sahasraṃ te svapivāta bheṣajā mā nas tokeṣu tanayeṣu rīriṣaḥ //🔽mā no vadhī rudra mā parā dā mā te bhūma prasitau hīḷitasya /
analyzed: sahasram te svapivāta bheṣajā mā naḥ tokeṣu tanayeṣu rīriṣaḥ  mā naḥ vadhīḥ rudra mā parā dāḥ mā te bhūma prasitau hīḷitasya
translated: A thousand medicines be thine: afflict us not in our sons and grandsons.🔽Kill us not, Rudra, give us not as prey to man: let us not in thy snare be caught, O thou of tangled ways.

original: ā no bhaja barhiṣi jīvaśaṃse yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ bhaja barhiṣi jīva śaṃse yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Give us a share of grass and corn: preserve us evermore, ye Gods.

original: āpo yaṃ vaḥ prathamaṃ devayanta indrapānam ūrmim akṛṇvateḷaḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ yam vaḥ prathamam devayantaḥ indra pānam ūrmim akṛṇvata iḷaḥ
translated: Ye waters, which the pious have made first to flow, the wave that Indra drinks,

original: taṃ vo vayaṃ śucim aripram adya ghṛtapruṣam madhumantaṃ vanema //
analyzed: tam vaḥ vayam śucim aripram adya ghṛta pruṣam madhumantam vanema
translated: We will enjoy that pure, unadulterated one today, rich in ghee and honey.

original: tam ūrmim āpo madhumattamaṃ vo 'pāṃ napād avatv āśuhemā /
analyzed: tam ūrmim āpaḥ madhumattamam vaḥ pām napāt avatu āśu hemā
translated: May the water bring you that wave, most rich in honey, the water's foot, swift to move.

original: yasminn indro vasubhir mādayāte tam aśyāma devayanto vo adya //
analyzed: yasmin indraḥ vasubhiḥ mādayāte tam aśyāma devayantaḥ vaḥ adya
translated: In which Indra rejoices with the Vasus, may we obtain that today, you who are devoted to the gods.

original: śatapavitrāḥ svadhayā madantīr devīr devānām api yanti pāthaḥ /
analyzed: śata pavitrāḥ svadhayā madantīḥ devīḥ devānām api yanti pāthaḥ
translated: The one hundred-filtered (waters), rejoicing in their own nature, the divine (waters) go along the path of the gods.

original: tā indrasya na minanti vratāni sindhubhyo havyaṃ ghṛtavaj juhota //
analyzed: tāḥ indrasya na minanti vratāni sindhubhyaḥ havyam ghṛtavat juhota
translated: They do not violate Indra's laws. Offer oblations with ghee to the rivers.

original: yāḥ sūryo raśmibhir ātatāna yābhya indro aradad gātum ūrmim /
analyzed: yāḥ sūryaḥ raśmibhiḥ ātatāna yābhyaḥ indraḥ aradat gātum ūrmim
translated: Those (waters) which the sun has spread out with his rays, for which Indra has plowed the path with a wave,

original: te sindhavo varivo dhātanā no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: te sindhavaḥ varivaḥ dhātana naḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May those rivers grant us room. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: ṛbhukṣaṇo vājā mādayadhvam asme naro maghavānaḥ sutasya /
analyzed: ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ vājāḥ mādayadhvam asme naraḥ maghavānaḥ sutasya
translated: O Rbhukṣaṇas, O Vājas, rejoice in our Soma, O wealthy men.

original: ā vo 'rvācaḥ kratavo na yātāṃ vibhvo rathaṃ naryaṃ vartayantu //
analyzed: ā vaḥ rvācaḥ kratavaḥ na yātām vibhvaḥ ratham naryam vartayantu
translated: May your thoughts come to us from afar. May the all-pervading ones turn the chariot of men.

original: ṛbhur ṛbhubhir abhi vaḥ syāma vibhvo vibhubhiḥ śavasā śavāṃsi /
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ ṛbhubhiḥ abhi vaḥ syāma vibhvaḥ vibhubhiḥ śavasā śavāṃsi
translated: We will be with the Rbhus, with the Rbhus, with the all-pervading ones, with the all-pervading ones, with strength, with strength.

original: vājo asmāṃ avatu vājasātāv indreṇa yujā taruṣema vṛtram //
analyzed: vājaḥ asmām avatu vājasātau indreṇa yujā taruṣema vṛtram
translated: May Vāja help us in the race for strength. United with Indra, may we conquer Vṛtra.

original: te cid dhi pūrvīr abhi santi śāsā viśvāṃ arya uparatāti vanvan /
analyzed: te cit hi pūrvīḥ abhi santi śāsā viśvān aryaḥ uparatāti vanvan
translated: For they have conquered many in the past, overcoming all the enemies who stood against them.

original: indro vibhvāṃ ṛbhukṣā vājo aryaḥ śatror mithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam //🔽nū devāso varivaḥ kartanā no bhūta no viśve 'vase sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ vibhvā ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ aryaḥ śatroḥ mithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam  nu devāsaḥ varivaḥ kartana naḥ bhūta naḥ viśve vase sajoṣāḥ
translated: Indra, the lord of all, the powerful, the strong, has made his manliness prevail over the wickedness of the foe.🔽Now, O gods, be gracious to us, be all of one mind to give us help.

original: sam asme iṣaṃ vasavo dadīran yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: sam asme iṣam vasavaḥ dadīran yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Grant us food, O Vasus, protect us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

original: samudrajyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānā yanty aniviśamānāḥ /
analyzed: samudra jyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānāḥ yanti a niviśamānāḥ
translated: The waters, born in the ocean, in the midst of the waters, being purified, flow on unceasingly.

original: indro yā vajrī vṛṣabho rarāda tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu //
analyzed: indraḥ yāḥ vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ rarāda tāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ iha mām avantu
translated: May those waters, O ye Gods, which the thunder-armed Indra, the bull, hath shaken, protect me here.

original: yā āpo divyā uta vā sravanti khanitrimā uta vā yāḥ svayañjāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ āpaḥ divyāḥ uta vā sravanti khanitrimāḥ uta vā yāḥ svayañjāḥ
translated: Those waters which flow down from heaven, or those which spring from digging, or those which come of themselves,

original: samudrārthā yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakās tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu //
analyzed: samudra arthāḥ yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ tāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ iha mām avantu
translated: those which have the ocean for their goal, the pure, the purifying, may those waters, O ye Gods, protect me here.

original: yāsāṃ rājā varuṇo yāti madhye satyānṛte avapaśyañ janānām /
analyzed: yāsām rājā varuṇaḥ yāti madhye satya anṛte avapaśyam janānām
translated: In the midst of which the king Varuna moves, beholding the truth and untruth of men,

original: madhuścutaḥ śucayo yāḥ pāvakās tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu //
analyzed: madhuścutaḥ śucayaḥ yāḥ pāvakāḥ tāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ iha mām avantu
translated: those which flow with honey, the pure, the purifying, may those waters, O ye Gods, protect me here.

original: yāsu rājā varuṇo yāsu somo viśve devā yāsūrjam madanti /
analyzed: yāsu rājā varuṇaḥ yāsu somaḥ viśve devāḥ yāsu ūrjam madanti
translated: In which the king Varuna, in which Soma, in which the All-Gods rejoice,

original: vaiśvānaro yāsv agniḥ praviṣṭas tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu //🔽ā mām mitrāvaruṇeha rakṣataṃ kulāyayad viśvayan mā na ā gan /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ yāsu agniḥ praviṣṭaḥ tāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ iha mām avantu  ā mām mitrāvaruṇā iha rakṣatam kulāyayat viśvayat mā naḥ ā gan
translated: May those waters, in which Agni, Vaisvānara, has entered, the divine waters, protect me here.🔽Protect me here, O Mitra and Varuṇa, from the all-destroying, from the one who comes to us.

original: ajakāvaṃ durdṛśīkaṃ tiro dadhe mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ //
analyzed: ajakāvam durdṛśīkam tiras dadhe mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
translated: I have hidden the disease that is hard to look at, the one that moves in the joints. May the disease that goes in the joints not find me.

original: yad vijāman paruṣi vandanam bhuvad aṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat /
analyzed: yat vijāman paruṣi vandanam bhuvat aṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat
translated: What misfortune there is in the limbs, what is to be lamented in the body, what is in the ankle bones and the knee bones,

original: agniṣ ṭac chocann apa bādhatām ito mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ tat śocan apa bādhatām itas mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
translated: may Agni, the purifier, drive that away from here. May the disease that goes in the joints not find me.

original: yac chalmalau bhavati yan nadīṣu yad oṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam /
analyzed: yat śalmalau bhavati yat nadīṣu yat oṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam
translated: What poison there is in the śalmali tree, in the rivers, what is born around the plants,

original: viśve devā nir itas tat suvantu mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ //🔽yāḥ pravato nivata udvata udanvatīr anudakāś ca yāḥ /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ niḥ itas tat suvantu mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ  yāḥ pravataḥ nivataḥ udvataḥ udanvatīḥ anudakāḥ ca yāḥ
translated: may all the gods carry that away from here. May the disease that goes in the joints not find me.🔽Those that flow down from the mountains, those that flow down from the hills, those that flow down from the uplands, those that flow down from the lowlands, those that have water, and those that are without water,

original: tā asmabhyam payasā pinvamānāḥ śivā devīr aśipadā bhavantu sarvā nadyo aśimidā bhavantu //
analyzed: tāḥ asmabhyam payasā pinvamānāḥ śivāḥ devīḥ a śipadāḥ bhavantu sarvāḥ nadyaḥ a śimidāḥ bhavantu
translated: may they, swelling with milk, be auspicious goddesses, with feet that do not stumble. May all the rivers be without stumbling.

original: ādityānām avasā nūtanena sakṣīmahi śarmaṇā śantamena /
analyzed: ādityānām avasā nūtanena sakṣīmahi śarmaṇā śantamena
translated: By the new favour of the Ādityas, may we obtain the most delightful protection.

original: anāgāstve adititve turāsa imaṃ yajñaṃ dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ //
analyzed: anāgāstve aditi tve turāsaḥ imam yajñam dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ
translated: In the state of being guiltless, in the state of being free from sin, may the strong ones, listening, establish this sacrifice.

original: ādityāso aditir mādayantām mitro aryamā varuṇo rajiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ aditiḥ mādayantām mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ rajiṣṭhāḥ
translated: May the Âdityas, may Aditi rejoice, Mitra, Aryaman, Varuna, in the most spacious (place).

original: asmākaṃ santu bhuvanasya gopāḥ pibantu somam avase no adya //
analyzed: asmākam santu bhuvanasya gopāḥ pibantu somam avase naḥ adya
translated: May they be the guardians of our world. Let them drink the Soma for our help this day.

original: ādityā viśve marutaś ca viśve devāś ca viśva ṛbhavaś ca viśve /
analyzed: ādityāḥ viśve marutaḥ ca viśve devāḥ ca viśve ṛbhavaḥ ca viśve
translated: All the Âdityas, all the Maruts, all the Gods, all the R̥ibhus,

original: indro agnir aśvinā tuṣṭuvānā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ agniḥ aśvinā tuṣṭuvānāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Indra, Agni, the two Âśvins, being praised, do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: ādityāso aditayaḥ syāma pūr devatrā vasavo martyatrā /🔽sanema mitrāvaruṇā sananto bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ //
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ aditayaḥ syāma pūḥ devatrā vasavaḥ martyatrā  sanema mitrāvaruṇā sanantaḥ bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ
translated: May we be with the Âdityas, with Aditi, with the Gods, O ye Âdityas, with the Vasus among men.🔽May we, when we have gained, gain Mitra and Varuna. May we be, when we have become, with Dyaus and Prithivî.

original: mitras tan no varuṇo māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya gopāḥ /
analyzed: mitraḥ tat naḥ varuṇaḥ māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya gopāḥ
translated: May Mitra and Varuna, the guardians, grant us that protection for our seed and offspring.

original: mā vo bhujemānyajātam eno mā tat karma vasavo yac cayadhve //
analyzed: mā vaḥ bhujema anya jātam enaḥ mā tat karma vasavaḥ yat cayadhve
translated: Let not that sin of yours which ye have committed, O Vasus, be long-lasting.

original: turaṇyavo 'ṅgiraso nakṣanta ratnaṃ devasya savitur iyānāḥ /
analyzed: turaṇyavaḥ ṅgirasaḥ nakṣanta ratnam devasya savituḥ iyānāḥ
translated: The Angirases, the swift ones, have gone forth, seeking the treasure of God Savitar.

original: pitā ca tan no mahān yajatro viśve devāḥ samanaso juṣanta //
analyzed: pitā ca tat naḥ mahān yajatraḥ viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ juṣanta
translated: And that, our great, holy father, the All-Gods, with one accord, accept.

original: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādha īḷe bṛhatī yajatre /
analyzed: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādhas īḍe bṛhatī yajatre
translated: I worship with sacrifices and adorations the two great, adorable heavens and earth.

original: te cid dhi pūrve kavayo gṛṇantaḥ puro mahī dadhire devaputre //
analyzed: te cit hi pūrve kavayaḥ gṛṇantaḥ puras mahī dadhire deva putre
translated: For those ancient sages, singing praises, have placed the two great ones, the sons of heaven, in the foremost place.

original: pra pūrvaje pitarā navyasībhir gīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ sadane ṛtasya /
analyzed: pra pūrva je pitarā navyasībhiḥ gīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvam sadane ṛtasya
translated: With fresh hymns make ready the two ancient parents in the seat of holy order.

original: ā no dyāvāpṛthivī daivyena janena yātam mahi vāṃ varūtham //
analyzed: ā naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī daivyena janena yātam mahi vām varūtham
translated: Come, O heaven and earth, with the divine people: great is your protection for us.

original: uto hi vāṃ ratnadheyāni santi purūṇi dyāvāpṛthivī sudāse /
analyzed: uta u hi vām ratna dheyāni santi purūṇi dyāvāpṛthivī sudāse
translated: For you, O heaven and earth, have many treasures for Sudâs.

original: asme dhattaṃ yad asad askṛdhoyu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: asme dhattam yat asat yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Bestow on us what is good, O ye who are ever ready. Preserve us evermore with your blessings.

original: vāstoṣ pate prati jānīhy asmān svāveśo anamīvo bhavā naḥ /
analyzed: vāstoḥ pate prati jānīhi asmān su āveśaḥ anamīvaḥ bhava naḥ
translated: O Vâstoshpati, be gracious to us: be thou a kind master to us, free from sickness.

original: yat tvemahe prati tan no juṣasva śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade //
analyzed: yat tvā īmahe prati tat naḥ juṣasva śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: Accept that which we ask of thee: be thou a blessing to our bipeds and to our quadrupeds.

original: vāstoṣ pate prataraṇo na edhi gayasphāno gobhir aśvebhir indo /
analyzed: vāstoḥ pate prataraṇaḥ naḥ edhi gaya sphānaḥ gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ indo
translated: O Vâstoshpati, be thou our protector, a gladdener of our house, O Indu, with cattle and horses.

original: ajarāsas te sakhye syāma piteva putrān prati no juṣasva //
analyzed: ajarāsaḥ te sakhye syāma pitā iva putrān prati naḥ juṣasva
translated: May we be free from old age in thy friendship: as a father to his sons, so love thou us.

original: vāstoṣ pate śagmayā saṃsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā gātumatyā /
analyzed: vāstoḥ pate śagmayā saṃsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā gātumatyā
translated: O Vâstoshpati, with thy auspicious company may we enjoy thy favour, O thou who goest in pleasant paths.

original: pāhi kṣema uta yoge varaṃ no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: pāhi kṣeme uta yoge varam naḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Protect us for welfare and for the best boon in our union. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: amīvahā vāstoṣ pate viśvā rūpāṇy āviśan /
analyzed: amīva hā vāstoḥ pate viśvā rūpāṇi āviśan
translated: O Vastospati, bringing no disease, entering all forms,

original: sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ //
analyzed: sakhā su śevaḥ edhi naḥ
translated: Be a friend to us, very gracious.

original: yad arjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅga yacchase /
analyzed: yat arjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅga yacchase
translated: O Saramā's dog, when you bark with tawny teeth,

original: vīva bhrājanta ṛṣṭaya upa srakveṣu bapsato ni ṣu svapa //
analyzed: vi iva bhrājante ṛṣṭayaḥ upa srakveṣu bapsataḥ ni su svapa
translated: Like shining swords, you leap up in the waterholes, and sleep in your own place.

original: stenaṃ rāya sārameya taskaraṃ vā punaḥsara /
analyzed: stenam rāya sārameya taskaram vā punaḥsara
translated: O Saramā's dog, you find the thief or robber again.

original: stotṝn indrasya rāyasi kim asmān ducchunāyase ni ṣu svapa //
analyzed: stotṝn indrasya rāyasi kim asmān ducchunāyase ni su svapa
translated: You favor the praisers of Indra. Why do you threaten us with misfortune? Sleep in your own place.

original: tvaṃ sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ /
analyzed: tvam sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ
translated: You must bite the boar. The boar must bite you.

original: stotṝn indrasya rāyasi kim asmān ducchunāyase ni ṣu svapa //
analyzed: stotṝn indrasya rāyasi kim asmān ducchunāyase ni su svapa
translated: You favor the praisers of Indra. Why do you threaten us with misfortune? Sleep in your own place.

original: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ /
analyzed: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ
translated: Let the mother be still, let the father be still, let the dog be still, let the lord of the house be still.

original: sasantu sarve jñātayaḥ sastv ayam abhito janaḥ //
analyzed: sasantu sarve jñātayaḥ sastu ayam abhitas janaḥ
translated: Let all the relatives be still, let this surrounding people be still.

original: ya āste yaś ca carati yaś ca paśyati no janaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ āste yaḥ ca carati yaḥ ca paśyati naḥ janaḥ
translated: He who sits, he who moves about, he who looks at us, the people,

original: teṣāṃ saṃ hanmo akṣāṇi yathedaṃ harmyaṃ tathā //
analyzed: teṣām sam hanmaḥ akṣāṇi yathā idam harmyam tathā
translated: We will crush their eyes, just like this house.

original: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabho yaḥ samudrād udācarat /
analyzed: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ yaḥ samudrāt udācarat
translated: The bull with a thousand horns who rises from the ocean,

original: tenā sahasyenā vayaṃ ni janān svāpayāmasi //
analyzed: tena sahasyena vayam ni janān svāpayāmasi
translated: With that Sahasya we lull the people to sleep.

original: proṣṭheśayā vahyeśayā nārīr yās talpaśīvarīḥ /
analyzed: proṣṭheśayāḥ vahyeśayāḥ nārīḥ yāḥ talpa śīvarīḥ
translated: The women who lie on the eastern bed, the western bed, who sleep on the couch,

original: striyo yāḥ puṇyagandhās tāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi //
analyzed: striyaḥ yāḥ puṇya gandhāḥ tāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi
translated: the women who have auspicious fragrance, all of them we lull to sleep.

original: ka īṃ vyaktā naraḥ sanīḷā rudrasya maryā adha svaśvāḥ //
analyzed: ke īm vyaktāḥ naraḥ sanīḍāḥ rudrasya maryāḥ adha su aśvāḥ
translated: Who has revealed the men, the companions, the swift horses of Rudra's Maruts?

original: nakir hy eṣāṃ janūṃṣi veda te aṅga vidre mitho janitram //
analyzed: nakir hi eṣām janūṃṣi veda te aṅga vidre mithas janitram
translated: For none knoweth their generations: they have divided among themselves the power of generation.

original: abhi svapūbhir mitho vapanta vātasvanasaḥ śyenā aspṛdhran //
analyzed: abhi svapūbhiḥ mithas vapanta vāta svanasaḥ śyenāḥ aspṛdhran
translated: They sprinkle themselves mutually with their own pure (waters); the hawks, with the sound of the wind, have striven (for the prey).

original: etāni dhīro niṇyā ciketa pṛśnir yad ūdho mahī jabhāra //🔽sā viṭ suvīrā marudbhir astu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam //
analyzed: etāni dhīraḥ niṇyā ciketa pṛśniḥ yat ūdhaḥ mahī jabhāra  sā viś su vīrā marudbhiḥ astu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam
translated: The wise one hath understood these (things), that the dappled one, the great udder, hath borne.🔽May that (cow) be with good heroes, with the Maruts, from of old, enduring, nourishing heroism.

original: yāmaṃ yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślā ojobhir ugrāḥ //🔽ugraṃ va oja sthirā śavāṃsy adhā marudbhir gaṇas tuviṣmān //
analyzed: yāmam yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślāḥ ojobhiḥ ugrāḥ  ugram vaḥ ojaḥ sthirā śavāṃsi adhā marudbhiḥ gaṇaḥ tuviṣmān
translated: Most splendid, most beautiful, most excellent, most closely united by glory, most mighty,🔽are ye, O Maruts, with your terrible strength, with your terrible power, with your firm powers.

original: śubhro vaḥ śuṣmaḥ krudhmī manāṃsi dhunir munir iva śardhasya dhṛṣṇoḥ //
analyzed: śubhraḥ vaḥ śuṣmaḥ krudhmī manāṃsi dhuniḥ muniḥ iva śardhasya dhṛṣṇoḥ
translated: Your strength is white, your minds are wrathful, your shout is like that of a sage, of the impetuous troop.

original: sanemy asmad yuyota didyum mā vo durmatir iha praṇaṅ naḥ //
analyzed: sanemi asmat yuyota didyum mā vaḥ durmatiḥ iha praṇak naḥ
translated: Turn away from us your dart: let not your evil thought here destroy us.

original: priyā vo nāma huve turāṇām ā yat tṛpan maruto vāvaśānāḥ //
analyzed: priyā vaḥ nāma huve turāṇām ā yat tṛpat marutaḥ vāvaśānāḥ
translated: I call you, O Maruts, by your dear names, when, O Maruts, you are satisfied with the lowing (kine).

original: svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ suniṣkā uta svayaṃ tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ //
analyzed: su āyudhāsaḥ iṣmiṇaḥ su niṣkāḥ uta svayam tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
translated: You who have good weapons, who are swift, who have good doors, and who adorn your own bodies,

original: śucī vo havyā marutaḥ śucīnāṃ śuciṃ hinomy adhvaraṃ śucibhyaḥ /
analyzed: śucī vaḥ havyā marutaḥ śucīnām śucim hinomi adhvaram śucibhyaḥ
translated: Your oblations are pure, O Maruts, I offer a pure sacrifice to the pure ones.

original: ṛtena satyam ṛtasāpa āyañ chucijanmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ //
analyzed: ṛtena satyam ṛtasāpaḥ āyam śuci janmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: By truth the truthful have come, born of purity, pure, purifying,

original: aṃseṣv ā marutaḥ khādayo vo vakṣassu rukmā upaśiśriyāṇāḥ /🔽vi vidyuto na vṛṣṭibhī rucānā anu svadhām āyudhair yacchamānāḥ //
analyzed: aṃseṣu ā marutaḥ khādayaḥ vaḥ vakṣassu rukmāḥ upaśiśriyāṇāḥ  vi vidyutaḥ na vṛṣṭibhiḥ rucānāḥ anu svadhām āyudhaiḥ yacchamānāḥ
translated: O Maruts, your bellies are on your shoulders, your chests are covered with gold,🔽Your lightnings flash like rain, you direct your weapons according to your nature.

original: pra budhnyā va īrate mahāṃsi pra nāmāni prayajyavas tiradhvam /
analyzed: pra budhnyā vaḥ īrate mahāṃsi pra nāmāni prayajyavaḥ tiradhvam
translated: They send forth great deeds from the depths, they spread their names, the well-adoring ones.

original: sahasriyaṃ damyam bhāgam etaṃ gṛhamedhīyam maruto juṣadhvam //
analyzed: sahasriyam damyam bhāgam etam gṛhamedhīyam marutaḥ juṣadhvam
translated: Accept this share, O Maruts, a thousandfold, to be enjoyed at home, which is offered to you.

original: yadi stutasya maruto adhīthetthā viprasya vājino havīman /
analyzed: yadi stutasya marutaḥ adhītha itthā viprasya vājinaḥ havīman
translated: If, O Maruts, you accept this praise of the strong singer of praises, this invocation,

original: makṣū rāyaḥ suvīryasya dāta nū cid yam anya ādabhad arāvā //
analyzed: makṣū rāyaḥ su vīryasya dāta nu cit yam anyaḥ ādabhat arāvā
translated: Do not delay in bestowing wealth and good heroism, lest any other should overcome him with hostility.

original: atyāso na ye marutaḥ svañco yakṣadṛśo na śubhayanta maryāḥ /
analyzed: atyāsaḥ na ye marutaḥ svañcaḥ yakṣa dṛśaḥ na śubhayanta maryāḥ
translated: Those Maruts who are swift, who are like Yakshas in appearance, who delight in the pure ones,

original: te harmyeṣṭhāḥ śiśavo na śubhrā vatsāso na prakrīḷinaḥ payodhāḥ //
analyzed: te harmyeṣṭhāḥ śiśavaḥ na śubhrāḥ vatsāsaḥ na prakrīḍinaḥ payodhāḥ
translated: They, the most excellent in the world, are like bright children, like calves that love to play, givers of milk.

original: daśasyanto no maruto mṛḷantu varivasyanto rodasī sumeke /
analyzed: daśasyantaḥ naḥ marutaḥ mṛḍantu varivasyantaḥ rodasī sumeke
translated: May the Maruts, favouring us, be gracious, bestowing wide room, the well-formed heaven and earth.

original: āre gohā nṛhā vadho vo astu sumnebhir asme vasavo namadhvam //
analyzed: āre go hā nṛ hā vadhaḥ vaḥ astu sumnebhiḥ asme vasavaḥ namadhvam
translated: Let the slaying of kine and men be far from you. With blessings, O Vasus, be gracious to us.

original: ā vo hotā johavīti sattaḥ satrācīṃ rātim maruto gṛṇānaḥ /
analyzed: ā vaḥ hotā johavīti sattaḥ satrācīm rātim marutaḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Your priest, seated, invokes you, O Maruts, singing for the ever-present gift.

original: ya īvato vṛṣaṇo asti gopāḥ so advayāvī havate va ukthaiḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ īvataḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ asti gopāḥ saḥ advayāvī havate vaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: He who has you, O bulls, as guardians, he, unafraid, invokes you with lauds.

original: ime turam maruto rāmayantīme sahaḥ sahasa ā namanti /
analyzed: ime turam marutaḥ rāmayanti ime sahaḥ sahasaḥ ā namanti
translated: These Maruts delight in the swift one; these, in strength, pay homage to the thousand.

original: ime śaṃsaṃ vanuṣyato ni pānti guru dveṣo araruṣe dadhanti //
analyzed: ime śaṃsam vanuṣyataḥ ni pānti guru dveṣaḥ a raruṣe dadhanti
translated: These protect the singer from the reviler; they place great hatred on the red-haired one.

original: ime radhraṃ cin maruto junanti bhṛmiṃ cid yathā vasavo juṣanta /
analyzed: ime radhram cit marutaḥ junanti bhṛmim cit yathā vasavaḥ juṣanta
translated: These Maruts stimulate even the sluggish one; the Vasus accept even the slow one.

original: apa bādhadhvaṃ vṛṣaṇas tamāṃsi dhatta viśvaṃ tanayaṃ tokam asme //
analyzed: apa bādhadhvam vṛṣaṇaḥ tamāṃsi dhatta viśvam tanayam tokam asme
translated: Drive away the darkness, O bulls; bestow on us all offspring and progeny.

original: mā vo dātrān maruto nir arāma mā paścād daghma rathyo vibhāge /
analyzed: mā vaḥ dātrāt marutaḥ niḥ arāma mā paścāt daghma rathyaḥ vibhāge
translated: O Maruts, let us not be deprived of your gifts; let us not be left behind in the division of the chariot.

original: ā na spārhe bhajatanā vasavye yad īṃ sujātaṃ vṛṣaṇo vo asti //
analyzed: ā naḥ spārhe bhajatana vasavye yat īm su jātam vṛṣaṇaḥ vaḥ asti
translated: In the desirable possession, in the good birth that you have, O bulls, bestow on us.

original: saṃ yad dhananta manyubhir janāsaḥ śūrā yahvīṣv oṣadhīṣu vikṣu /
analyzed: sam yat hananta manyubhiḥ janāsaḥ śūrāḥ yahvīṣu oṣadhīṣu vikṣu
translated: When the people, with their wrath, are gathering wealth, the heroes in the young plants of the plants in the fields,

original: adha smā no maruto rudriyāsas trātāro bhūta pṛtanāsv aryaḥ //
analyzed: adha smā naḥ marutaḥ rudriyāsaḥ trātāraḥ bhūta pṛtanāsu aryaḥ
translated: Then be ye, O Maruts, our protectors, O Rudras, in the battles with the foe.

original: bhūri cakra marutaḥ pitryāṇy ukthāni yā vaḥ śasyante purā cit /
analyzed: bhūri cakra marutaḥ pitryāṇi ukthāni yā vaḥ śasyante purā cit
translated: Ye Maruts, many are the ancestral hymns which are recited to you even before this day.

original: marudbhir ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sāḷhā marudbhir it sanitā vājam arvā //
analyzed: marudbhiḥ ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sāḷhā marudbhiḥ id sanitā vājam arvā
translated: With the Maruts is the strong one victorious in battles; with the Maruts he wins the prize.

original: asme vīro marutaḥ śuṣmy astu janānāṃ yo asuro vidhartā /
analyzed: asme vīraḥ marutaḥ śuṣmī astu janānām yaḥ asuraḥ vidhartā
translated: Let the hero be strong among us, O Maruts, the Asura who rules among men.

original: apo yena sukṣitaye taremādha svam oko abhi vaḥ syāma //
analyzed: apaḥ yena su kṣitaye tarema adha svam okaḥ abhi vaḥ syāma
translated: By whom we may safely pass over the waters, and come to our own abode, to you.

original: tan na indro varuṇo mitro agnir āpa oṣadhīr vanino juṣanta /
analyzed: tat naḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ āpaḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, Agni, the waters, the plants, and the trees accept this (offering) of ours.

original: śarman syāma marutām upasthe yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: śarman syāma marutām upasthe yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May we be in the bosom of the Maruts under the protection (of the gods). Do ye, O Maruts, protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: madhvo vo nāma mārutaṃ yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti /
analyzed: madhvaḥ vaḥ nāma mārutam yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti
translated: The sweet one, your name, O Maruts, is to be worshipped, O holy ones; they rejoice in strength in the sacrifices.

original: ye rejayanti rodasī cid urvī pinvanty utsaṃ yad ayāsur ugrāḥ //
analyzed: ye rejayanti rodasī cit urvī pinvanti utsam yat ayāsuḥ ugrāḥ
translated: They who make even the two wide worlds tremble, who fill the spring when they come, the strong ones.

original: nicetāro hi maruto gṛṇantam praṇetāro yajamānasya manma /
analyzed: nicetāraḥ hi marutaḥ gṛṇantam praṇetāraḥ yajamānasya manma
translated: For the Maruts are the leaders of the singer, the leaders of the sacrificer's thought.

original: asmākam adya vidatheṣu barhir ā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ //
analyzed: asmākam adya vidatheṣu barhiḥ ā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ
translated: Let them sit on the sacred grass in our assemblies today, being pleased with the offering.

original: naitāvad anye maruto yatheme bhrājante rukmair āyudhais tanūbhiḥ /
analyzed: na etāvat anye marutaḥ yathā ime bhrājante rukmaiḥ āyudhaiḥ tanūbhiḥ
translated: Other Maruts are not equal to these in this respect, that they shine with their golden weapons and bodies.

original: ā rodasī viśvapiśaḥ piśānāḥ samānam añjy añjate śubhe kam //
analyzed: ā rodasī viśva piśaḥ piśānāḥ samānam añji añjate śubhe kam
translated: They have filled both worlds with all their forms, and they anoint the same auspicious one with the same unguent.

original: ṛdhak sā vo maruto didyud astu yad va āgaḥ puruṣatā karāma /
analyzed: ṛdhak sā vaḥ marutaḥ didyut astu yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma
translated: O Maruts, let this thunderbolt of yours fall on us, if we have done you wrong as men.

original: mā vas tasyām api bhūmā yajatrā asme vo astu sumatiś caniṣṭhā //
analyzed: mā vaḥ tasyām api bhūma yajatrāḥ asme vaḥ astu sumatiḥ caniṣṭhā
translated: Do not let us be destroyed by that, O you who are to be worshipped. Let your greatest favor be with us.

original: kṛte cid atra maruto raṇantānavadyāsaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ /
analyzed: kṛte cit atra marutaḥ raṇanta anavadyāsaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: Even when they are angry, O Maruts, you are faultless, pure, and purifying.

original: pra ṇo 'vata sumatibhir yajatrāḥ pra vājebhis tirata puṣyase naḥ //
analyzed: pra naḥ vata sumatibhiḥ yajatrāḥ pra vājebhiḥ tirata puṣyase naḥ
translated: Come down to us with your favors, O you who are to be worshipped. Lead us forward with your powers. Prosper us.

original: uta stutāso maruto vyantu viśvebhir nāmabhir naro havīṃṣi /
analyzed: uta stutāsaḥ marutaḥ vyantu viśvebhiḥ nāmabhiḥ naraḥ havīṃṣi
translated: May the Maruts, when praised, accept the offerings with all their names, O men.

original: dadāta no amṛtasya prajāyai jigṛta rāyaḥ sūnṛtā maghāni //
analyzed: dadāta naḥ amṛtasya prajāyai jigṛta rāyaḥ sūnṛtāḥ maghāni
translated: Grant us immortality for our offspring. Delight in wealth and generosity.

original: ā stutāso maruto viśva ūtī acchā sūrīn sarvatātā jigāta /
analyzed: ā stutāsaḥ marutaḥ viśve ūtī acchā sūrīn sarvatātā jigāta
translated: O Maruts, come hither, praised by all, with all your helpers, to the lords of all.

original: ye nas tmanā śatino vardhayanti yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: ye naḥ tmanā śatinaḥ vardhayanti yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Those who increase our strength by themselves - protect us always with your blessings.

original: pra sākamukṣe arcatā gaṇāya yo daivyasya dhāmnas tuviṣmān /🔽uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākaṃ nirṛter avaṃśāt //
analyzed: pra sākamukṣe arcata gaṇāya yaḥ daivyasya dhāmnaḥ tuviṣmān  uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākam nirṛteḥ avaṃśāt
translated: Praise the company of the mighty Sakambukṣa, who is powerful in the abode of the divine.🔽They shake the two worlds with their greatness, they reach the vault from the lowest point of misfortune.

original: janūś cid vo marutas tveṣyeṇa bhīmāsas tuvimanyavo 'yāsaḥ /
analyzed: janūḥ cit vaḥ marutaḥ tveṣyeṇa bhīmāsaḥ tuvi manyavaḥ yāsaḥ
translated: Even in your birth, O Maruts, you are terrible with your fierce splendor, impetuous, and very wrathful.

original: pra ye mahobhir ojasota santi viśvo vo yāman bhayate svardṛk //
analyzed: pra ye mahobhiḥ ojasā uta santi viśvaḥ vaḥ yāman bhayate svar dṛś
translated: They who are with great powers and energies, all of them fear your path, O you who see heaven.

original: bṛhad vayo maghavadbhyo dadhāta jujoṣann in marutaḥ suṣṭutiṃ naḥ /
analyzed: bṛhat vayaḥ maghavadbhyaḥ dadhāta jujoṣan id marutaḥ suṣṭutim naḥ
translated: Grant great glory to the wealthy ones, O Maruts, be pleased with our praise.

original: gato nādhvā vi tirāti jantum pra ṇa spārhābhir ūtibhis tireta //
analyzed: gataḥ na adhvā vi tirāti jantum pra naḥ spārhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ tireta
translated: The path goes forth and separates the living being, may it extend with its desirable aids.

original: yuṣmoto vipro marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmoto arvā sahuriḥ sahasrī /
analyzed: yuṣmotaḥ vipraḥ marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmotaḥ arvā sahuriḥ sahasrī
translated: Your priest, O Maruts, is worth a hundred, your swift one is worth a thousand.

original: yuṣmotaḥ samrāḷ uta hanti vṛtram pra tad vo astu dhūtayo deṣṇam //
analyzed: yuṣmotaḥ samrāj uta hanti vṛtram pra tat vaḥ astu dhūtayaḥ deṣṇam
translated: Your emperor slays Vṛtra, may that be your gift, O you who are shaken.

original: tāṃ ā rudrasya mīḷhuṣo vivāse kuvin naṃsante marutaḥ punar naḥ /
analyzed: tām ā rudrasya mīḍhuṣaḥ vivāse kuvid naṃsante marutaḥ punar naḥ
translated: We invoke that of Rudra, the bountiful one, to be removed. Do the Maruts favor us again?

original: yat sasvartā jihīḷire yad āvir ava tad ena īmahe turāṇām //
analyzed: yat sasvartā jihīḍire yat āvis ava tat enaḥ īmahe turāṇām
translated: What they have hidden, what they have revealed, that we seek from the impetuous ones.

original: pra sā vāci suṣṭutir maghonām idaṃ sūktam maruto juṣanta /
analyzed: pra sā vāci suṣṭutiḥ maghonām idam sūktam marutaḥ juṣanta
translated: That praise of the wealthy ones is good in speech, O Maruts, accept this hymn.

original: ārāc cid dveṣo vṛṣaṇo yuyota yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: ārāt cit dveṣaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yuyota yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Even from afar, O ye mighty, keep hatred away. Do ye all deliver us from sin.

original: yaṃ trāyadhva idamidaṃ devāso yaṃ ca nayatha /
analyzed: yam trāyadhve idam idam devāsaḥ yam ca nayatha
translated: Whom ye protect, O ye Gods, and whom ye lead forward,

original: tasmā agne varuṇa mitrāryaman marutaḥ śarma yacchata //
analyzed: tasmai agne varuṇa mitra aryaman marutaḥ śarma yacchata
translated: To him, O Agni, O Varuṇa, O Mitra, O Aryaman, O Maruts, grant protection.

original: yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priya ījānas tarati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: yuṣmākam devāḥ avasā ahani priye ījānaḥ tarati dviṣaḥ
translated: The worshipper, O Gods, in your abode, overcomes his foes.

original: pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīr iṣo yo vo varāya dāśati //
analyzed: pra sa kṣayam tirate vi mahīḥ iṣaḥ yaḥ vaḥ varāya dāśati
translated: He passes over the wide spaces of the earth, who offers you his gifts.

original: nahi vaś caramaṃ cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṃsate /
analyzed: nahi vaḥ caramam cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṃsate
translated: Vasishtha does not despise even your lowest (gift).

original: asmākam adya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ //
analyzed: asmākam adya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ
translated: With us, O Maruts, O ye all, in the juice shed forth, drink ye who are eager.

original: nahi va ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmā arādhvaṃ naraḥ /🔽abhi va āvart sumatir navīyasī tūyaṃ yāta pipīṣavaḥ //
analyzed: nahi vaḥ ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmai arādhvam naraḥ  abhi vaḥ āvart sumatiḥ navīyasī tūyam yāta pipīṣavaḥ
translated: For your help in battles never fails, from whom ye receive, O Heroes.🔽To us come back again your newest favour. Come hither, ye who are thirsty.

original: o ṣu ghṛṣvirādhaso yātanāndhāṃsi pītaye /
analyzed: ā u su ghṛṣvi rādhasaḥ yātana andhāṃsi pītaye
translated: Come, O ye who are rich in gifts, to the libations, to the draughts.

original: imā vo havyā maruto rare hi kam mo ṣv anyatra gantana //
analyzed: imā vaḥ havyā marutaḥ rare hi kam mā u su anyatra gantana
translated: These are your offerings, O Maruts. Do not go to any other (place).

original: ā ca no barhiḥ sadatāvitā ca na spārhāṇi dātave vasu /
analyzed: ā ca naḥ barhiḥ ca naḥ spārhāṇi dātave vasu
translated: Sit on our sacred grass, and help us. Give us wealth which is to be desired.

original: asredhanto marutaḥ somye madhau svāheha mādayādhvai //
analyzed: a sredhantaḥ marutaḥ somye madhau svāhā iha mādayādhvai
translated: Ye Maruts, rejoicing in the sweet juice, rich in Soma, rejoice here with Svâhâ.

original: sasvaś cid dhi tanvaḥ śumbhamānā ā haṃsāso nīlapṛṣṭhā apaptan /🔽viśvaṃ śardho abhito mā ni ṣeda naro na raṇvāḥ savane madantaḥ //
analyzed: sasvar cit hi tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ ā haṃsāsaḥ nīla pṛṣṭhāḥ apaptan  viśvam śardhaḥ abhitas mā ni seda naraḥ na raṇvāḥ savane madantaḥ
translated: For even their own bodies, when adorned, have fallen like geese with dark backs.🔽Let the whole host sit around me, men rejoicing in the draught like those who love.

original: yo no maruto abhi durhṛṇāyus tiraś cittāni vasavo jighāṃsati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ marutaḥ abhi durhṛṇāyuḥ tiras cittāni vasavaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: He who is hostile to us, O Maruts, O Vasus, who would injure our thoughts even from afar,

original: druhaḥ pāśān prati sa mucīṣṭa tapiṣṭhena hanmanā hantanā tam //
analyzed: druhaḥ pāśān prati sa mucīṣṭa tapiṣṭhena hanmanā hantana tam
translated: May he be loosed from the bonds of the noose of the wicked one, slay him with your most burning weapon.

original: sāṃtapanā idaṃ havir marutas taj jujuṣṭana /
analyzed: sāṃtapanāḥ idam haviḥ marutaḥ tat jujuṣṭana
translated: O Maruts, O you who heat all around, accept this oblation of ours.

original: yuṣmākotī riśādasaḥ //
analyzed: yuṣmākā ūtiḥ riśādasaḥ
translated: You who destroy all enemies.

original: gṛhamedhāsa ā gata maruto māpa bhūtana /
analyzed: gṛha medhāsaḥ ā gata marutaḥ mā apa bhūtana
translated: Come, O Maruts, to the domestic sacrifice, do not pass by.

original: yuṣmākotī sudānavaḥ //
analyzed: yuṣmākā ūtī sudānavaḥ
translated: You who are bountiful.

original: iheha vaḥ svatavasaḥ kavayaḥ sūryatvacaḥ /
analyzed: iha iha vaḥ svatavasaḥ kavayaḥ sūrya tvacaḥ
translated: Here, O self-dependent ones, O sages, O you whose skin is like the sun,

original: yajñam maruta ā vṛṇe //
analyzed: yajñam marutaḥ ā vṛṇe
translated: I choose the sacrifice, O Maruts.

original: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhim puṣṭivardhanam /
analyzed: tryambakam yajāmahe sugandhim puṣṭi vardhanam
translated: We worship the three-eyed one, fragrant, the increaser of prosperity,

original: urvārukam iva bandhanān mṛtyor mukṣīya māmṛtāt //
analyzed: urvārukam iva bandhanāt mṛtyoḥ mukṣīya mā amṛtāt
translated: May I be freed from death, from the noose of the wicked one, like a cucumber from its stem.

original: yad adya sūrya bravo 'nāgā udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam /
analyzed: yat adya sūrya bravaḥ nāgāḥ udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam
translated: What I say today, O Sun, as you rise, sinless, to Mitra and Varuna is true.

original: vayaṃ devatrādite syāma tava priyāso aryaman gṛṇantaḥ //
analyzed: vayam devatrā adite syāma tava priyāsaḥ aryaman gṛṇantaḥ
translated: May we be dear to you, O Aditi, O Aryaman, singing your praises, O gods.

original: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛcakṣā ubhe ud eti sūryo abhi jman /
analyzed: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛ cakṣāḥ ubhe ud eti sūryaḥ abhi jman
translated: This is the Sun, O Mitra-Varuṇa, the beholder of men, rising above both worlds.

original: viśvasya sthātur jagataś ca gopā ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan //
analyzed: viśvasya sthātuḥ jagataḥ ca gopāḥ ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan
translated: The guardian of all that stands and moves, beholding the upright and the crooked among mortals.

original: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthād yā īṃ vahanti sūryaṃ ghṛtācīḥ /
analyzed: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthāt yāḥ īm vahanti sūryam ghṛtācīḥ
translated: The seven bay horses have been yoked from their station, which carry the Sun, the pure ones.

original: dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ saṃ yo yūtheva janimāni caṣṭe //
analyzed: dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ sam yaḥ yūthā iva janimāni caṣṭe
translated: The two have made the abodes of Mitra-Varuṇa, he who looks on the generations as on a herd.

original: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanto asthur ā sūryo aruhac chukram arṇaḥ /🔽yasmā ādityā adhvano radanti mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: ud vām pṛkṣāsaḥ madhumantaḥ asthuḥ ā sūryaḥ aruhat śukram arṇaḥ  yasmai ādityāḥ adhvanaḥ radanti mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: Your nourishing juices have risen up, the Sun has mounted the pure path.🔽From whom the Ādityas, Mitra, Aryaman, Varuṇa of one mind, make the way straight.

original: ime cetāro anṛtasya bhūrer mitro aryamā varuṇo hi santi /
analyzed: ime cetāraḥ anṛtasya bhūreḥ mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ hi santi
translated: These are the observers of the great untruth, for they are Mitra, Aryaman, Varuṇa.

original: ima ṛtasya vāvṛdhur duroṇe śagmāsaḥ putrā aditer adabdhāḥ //
analyzed: ime ṛtasya vāvṛdhuḥ duroṇe śagmāsaḥ putrāḥ aditeḥ adabdhāḥ
translated: These, the strong sons of Aditi, infallible, have grown in the abode of holy order.

original: ime mitro varuṇo dūḷabhāso 'cetasaṃ cic citayanti dakṣaiḥ /
analyzed: ime mitraḥ varuṇaḥ dūḍabhāsaḥ cetasam cit citayanti dakṣaiḥ
translated: These, Mitra and Varuṇa, with far-reaching rays, with their powers make even the thoughtless wise.

original: api kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatantas tiraś cid aṃhaḥ supathā nayanti //
analyzed: api kratum su cetasam vatantaḥ tiras cit aṃhaḥ su pathā nayanti
translated: Even those who have a well-thought-out plan, they lead across the distress by the good path.

original: ime divo animiṣā pṛthivyāś cikitvāṃso acetasaṃ nayanti /
analyzed: ime divaḥ animiṣāḥ pṛthivyāḥ cikitvāṃsaḥ acetasam nayanti
translated: These, the watchful ones of heaven and earth, lead the thoughtless to wisdom.

original: pravrāje cin nadyo gādham asti pāraṃ no asya viṣpitasya parṣan //
analyzed: pravrāje cit nadyaḥ gādham asti pāram naḥ asya viṣpitasya parṣan
translated: Even when one is exiled, there is a ford for the rivers, and one can cross this wide expanse.

original: yad gopāvad aditiḥ śarma bhadram mitro yacchanti varuṇaḥ sudāse /
analyzed: yat gopāvat aditiḥ śarma bhadram mitraḥ yacchanti varuṇaḥ sudāse
translated: The good protection which Aditi, Mitra, and Varuna, like two cowherds, grant to Sudasa,

original: tasminn ā tokaṃ tanayaṃ dadhānā mā karma devaheḷanaṃ turāsaḥ //
analyzed: tasmin ā tokam tanayam dadhānāḥ mā karma deva heḍanam turāsaḥ
translated: In that we place our offspring and our sons, may the swift ones not do the deed of the angry gods.

original: ava vediṃ hotrābhir yajeta ripaḥ kāś cid varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ /
analyzed: ava vedim hotrābhiḥ yajeta ripaḥ kāḥ cit varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ
translated: One should worship the altar with offerings, some enemies are indeed bound by Varuna.

original: pari dveṣobhir aryamā vṛṇaktūruṃ sudāse vṛṣaṇā u lokam //
analyzed: pari dveṣobhiḥ aryamā vṛṇaktu urum sudāse vṛṣaṇau u lokam
translated: Aryaman is surrounded by enmities, the mighty ones make a wide world for Sudasa.

original: sasvaś cid dhi samṛtis tveṣy eṣām apīcyena sahasā sahante /
analyzed: sasvar cit hi samṛtiḥ tveṣī eṣām apīcyena sahasā sahante
translated: Even the powerful one has their support, they endure with impetuous violence.

original: yuṣmad bhiyā vṛṣaṇo rejamānā dakṣasya cin mahinā mṛḷatā naḥ //🔽yo brahmaṇe sumatim āyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ /
analyzed: yuṣmat bhiyā vṛṣaṇaḥ rejamānāḥ dakṣasya cit mahinā mṛḍata naḥ  yaḥ brahmaṇe sumatim āyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ
translated: Through your fear, O mighty ones, trembling, be gracious to us even with the greatness of Daksha.🔽He who has produced good will for the Brahman in the winning of strength and the highest wealth,

original: sīkṣanta manyum maghavāno arya uru kṣayāya cakrire sudhātu //
analyzed: sīkṣanta manyum maghavānaḥ aryaḥ uru kṣayāya cakrire su dhātu
translated: The mighty ones seek anger against the enemy, they have made a good abode for wide prosperity.

original: iyaṃ deva purohitir yuvabhyāṃ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāv akāri /
analyzed: iyam deva purohitiḥ yuvabhyām yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇau akāri
translated: This divine worship has been performed for you two, O Mitra and Varuna, in sacrifices.

original: viśvāni durgā pipṛtaṃ tiro no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: viśvāni durgā pipṛtam tiras naḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Provide all the difficulties for us to pass over. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: ud vāṃ cakṣur varuṇa supratīkaṃ devayor eti sūryas tatanvān /
analyzed: ud vām cakṣuḥ varuṇa su pratīkam devayoḥ eti sūryaḥ tatanvān
translated: Your eye, O Varuṇa, fair-faced, rises up, O ye two Gods, the Sun, stretching himself,

original: abhi yo viśvā bhuvanāni caṣṭe sa manyum martyeṣv ā ciketa //
analyzed: abhi yaḥ viśvā bhuvanāni caṣṭe sa manyum martyeṣu ā ciketa
translated: Who looks on all existing things. He knows the wrath among mortals.

original: pra vāṃ sa mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvā vipro manmāni dīrghaśrud iyarti /
analyzed: pra vām sa mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāvā vipraḥ manmāni dīrgha śrut iyarti
translated: That sage, O Mitra-Varuṇa, who is true to his word, sends forth his thoughts, O ye of far-reaching fame,

original: yasya brahmāṇi sukratū avātha ā yat kratvā na śaradaḥ pṛṇaithe //
analyzed: yasya brahmāṇi su kratū avātha ā yat kratvā na śaradaḥ pṛṇaithe
translated: Whose prayers ye have accepted, O ye of good counsel, whom ye have filled with food by your wisdom.

original: proror mitrāvaruṇā pṛthivyāḥ pra diva ṛṣvād bṛhataḥ sudānū /
analyzed: pra uroḥ mitrāvaruṇā pṛthivyāḥ pra divaḥ ṛṣvāt bṛhataḥ sudānū
translated: O Mitra-Varuṇa, from the wide air, from the lofty lofty heaven, O ye bountiful ones,

original: spaśo dadhāthe oṣadhīṣu vikṣv ṛdhag yato animiṣaṃ rakṣamāṇā //🔽śaṃsā mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma śuṣmo rodasī badbadhe mahitvā /
analyzed: spaśaḥ dadhāthe oṣadhīṣu vikṣu ṛdhak yataḥ animiṣam rakṣamāṇā  śaṃsā mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma śuṣmaḥ rodasī badbadhe mahitvā
translated: Ye have placed your spies in all the plants, watching with unclosed eyes, prospering.🔽I praise the nature of Mitra and Varuna. The mighty one has filled the two world-halves with his greatness.

original: ayan māsā ayajvanām avīrāḥ pra yajñamanmā vṛjanaṃ tirāte //
analyzed: ayan māsāḥ ayajvanām avīrāḥ pra yajña manmā vṛjanam tirāte
translated: The months of the childless, the manless, have passed away. The sacrifice, the company, have been destroyed by the sinner.

original: amūrā viśvā vṛṣaṇāv imā vāṃ na yāsu citraṃ dadṛśe na yakṣam /
analyzed: amūrā viśvā vṛṣaṇau imāḥ vām na yāsu citram dadṛśe na yakṣam
translated: All these, O ye mighty ones, are yours, in which no wonderful thing is seen, no spirit.

original: druhaḥ sacante anṛtā janānāṃ na vāṃ niṇyāny acite abhūvan //
analyzed: druhaḥ sacante anṛtāḥ janānām na vām niṇyāni a cite abhūvan
translated: The falsehoods of men, the injuries, follow you not, O ye wise ones, as you sit on your seats.

original: sam u vāṃ yajñam mahayaṃ namobhir huve vām mitrāvaruṇā sabādhaḥ /
analyzed: sam u vām yajñam mahayam namobhiḥ huve vām mitrāvaruṇā sabādhas
translated: I call you, O Mitra-Varuna, with great reverence to your sacrifice, you two, O ye of the same abode.

original: pra vām manmāny ṛcase navāni kṛtāni brahma jujuṣann imāni //
analyzed: pra vām manmāni ṛcase navāni kṛtāni brahma jujuṣan imāni
translated: I, accepting these prayers, offer you these new hymns, O you who are to be praised.

original: iyaṃ deva purohitir yuvabhyāṃ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāv akāri /
analyzed: iyam deva purohitiḥ yuvabhyām yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇau akāri
translated: This is the divine worship, O you two, which I have performed for you in sacrifices, O Mitra and Varuna.

original: viśvāni durgā pipṛtaṃ tiro no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: viśvāni durgā pipṛtam tiras naḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Protect us from all difficulties, O you two. May you two always protect us with your blessings.

original: ut sūryo bṛhad arcīṃṣy aśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: ud sūryaḥ bṛhat arcīṃṣi aśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām
translated: The sun has risen with great rays, pervading many births of human beings.

original: samo divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhir bhūt //
analyzed: samaḥ divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ su kṛtaḥ kartṛbhiḥ bhūt
translated: He is seen in the sky, shining equally, made by thought, well-made by the makers.

original: sa sūrya prati puro na ud gā ebhi stomebhir etaśebhir evaiḥ /🔽pra no mitrāya varuṇāya voco 'nāgaso aryamṇe agnaye ca //
analyzed: sa sūrya prati puras naḥ ud gāḥ ebhiḥ stomebhiḥ etaśebhiḥ evaiḥ  pra naḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vocaḥ nāgasaḥ aryamṇe agnaye ca
translated: O sun, rise up in front of us with these new hymns, with these songs.🔽Speak to Mitra, Varuna, and Agni for us, so that we may be free from sin, and to Aryaman.

original: vi naḥ sahasraṃ śurudho radantv ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ /
analyzed: vi naḥ sahasram śurudhaḥ radantu ṛtāvānaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: May the truthful ones, Varuna, Mitra, and Agni, grant us a thousand desires.

original: yacchantu candrā upamaṃ no arkam ā naḥ kāmam pūpurantu stavānāḥ //🔽dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ no ye vāṃ jajñuḥ sujanimāna ṛṣve /
analyzed: yacchantu candrāḥ upamam naḥ arkam ā naḥ kāmam pūpurantu stavānāḥ  dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthām naḥ ye vām jajñuḥ su janimānaḥ ṛṣve
translated: May they give us praise worthy of comparison. May they fulfill our wishes when praised.🔽O Dyaus and Prithivī, O Aditi, protect us, who have been born from you, O you two of good birth, O you two of great power.

original: mā heḷe bhūma varuṇasya vāyor mā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām //
analyzed: mā heḍe bhūma varuṇasya vāyoḥ mā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām
translated: Let us not offend Varuna, Vayu, or Mitra, the most beloved of men.

original: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṃ jīvase na ā no gavyūtim ukṣataṃ ghṛtena /🔽ā no jane śravayataṃ yuvānā śrutam me mitrāvaruṇā havemā //
analyzed: pra bāhavā sisṛtam jīvase naḥ ā naḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam ghṛtena  ā naḥ jane śravayatam yuvānā śrutam me mitrāvaruṇā havā imā
translated: Stretch forth your arms and give us life: pour for us, as 'twere, the rain of milk.🔽Make us renowned among the people, O ye Twain, young, mighty, Varuṇa and Mitra: hear my call.

original: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā nas tmane tokāya varivo dadhantu /
analyzed: nu mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā naḥ tmane tokāya varivaḥ dadhantu
translated: Now may Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman vouchsafe us room for our descendants and ourselves.

original: sugā no viśvā supathāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: sugā naḥ viśvā su pathāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
