translated: May all our paths be easy and good to travel. Ye, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: ud v eti subhago viśvacakṣāḥ sādhāraṇaḥ sūryo mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: ud u eti subhagaḥ viśva cakṣāḥ sādhāraṇaḥ sūryaḥ mānuṣāṇām
translated: The fortunate, the all-beholding Sun, the common light of men, goes up on high.

original: cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasya devaś carmeva yaḥ samavivyak tamāṃsi //
analyzed: cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya devaḥ carma iva yaḥ samavivyak tamāṃsi
translated: The God, the eye of Mitra, Varuṇa, is like a shield that hides the darkness from us.

original: ud v eti prasavītā janānām mahān ketur arṇavaḥ sūryasya /🔽samānaṃ cakram paryāvivṛtsan yad etaśo vahati dhūrṣu yuktaḥ //
analyzed: ud u eti prasavītā janānām mahān ketuḥ arṇavaḥ sūryasya  samānam cakram paryāvivṛtsan yat etaśaḥ vahati dhūrṣu yuktaḥ
translated: The great, the universal light of men, the Sun, the ocean, goes up to give us life.🔽Turning the common wheel, the Sun, when yoked, moves on in the paths of heaven.

original: vibhrājamāna uṣasām upasthād rebhair ud ety anumadyamānaḥ /
analyzed: vibhrājamānaḥ uṣasām upasthāt rebhaiḥ ud eti anumadyamānaḥ
translated: Shining in the presence of the Dawns, the Sun goes up, gladdening the R̥ibhus with his light.

original: eṣa me devaḥ savitā cacchanda yaḥ samānaṃ na pramināti dhāma //
analyzed: eṣa me devaḥ savitā cacchanda yaḥ samānam na pramināti dhāma
translated: This God Savitar is my delight, who never breaks the common law.

original: divo rukma urucakṣā ud eti dūrearthas taraṇir bhrājamānaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ rukmaḥ uru cakṣāḥ ud eti dūrearthaḥ taraṇiḥ bhrājamānaḥ
translated: The light of heaven, the far-extending eye, the swift, the shining Sun goes up on high.

original: nūnaṃ janāḥ sūryeṇa prasūtā ayann arthāni kṛṇavann apāṃsi //
analyzed: nūnam janāḥ sūryeṇa prasūtāḥ ayan arthāni kṛṇavan apāṃsi
translated: Surely the people are born with the sun, performing their tasks in the day.

original: yatrā cakrur amṛtā gātum asmai śyeno na dīyann anv eti pāthaḥ /
analyzed: yatra cakruḥ amṛtāḥ gātum asmai śyenaḥ na dīyan anu eti pāthaḥ
translated: Where the immortals have made a path for him, the hawk flies along the way, as if given.

original: prati vāṃ sūra udite vidhema namobhir mitrāvaruṇota havyaiḥ //🔽nū mitro varuṇo aryamā nas tmane tokāya varivo dadhantu /
analyzed: prati vām sūre udite vidhema namobhiḥ mitrāvaruṇā uta havyaiḥ  nu mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā naḥ tmane tokāya varivaḥ dadhantu
translated: When the sun has risen, we will worship you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, with homage and offerings.🔽May Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman grant us room for ourselves and our offspring.

original: sugā no viśvā supathāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: sugā naḥ viśvā su pathāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May all our paths be easy and good for us. Do you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, protect us with your blessings.

original: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyām pra vāṃ ghṛtasya nirṇijo dadīran /
analyzed: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyām pra vām ghṛtasya nirṇijaḥ dadīran
translated: Dwelling in the sky, in the firmament, on the earth, may they spread out for you the cleansing of ghee.

original: havyaṃ no mitro aryamā sujāto rājā sukṣatro varuṇo juṣanta //
analyzed: havyam naḥ mitraḥ aryamā su jātaḥ rājā su kṣatraḥ varuṇaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, and the well-born king Varuṇa accept our offering.

original: ā rājānā maha ṛtasya gopā sindhupatī kṣatriyā yātam arvāk /🔽iḷāṃ no mitrāvaruṇota vṛṣṭim ava diva invataṃ jīradānū //
analyzed: ā rājānā mahaḥ ṛtasya gopā sindhu patī kṣatriyā yātam arvāk  iḍām naḥ mitrāvaruṇā uta vṛṣṭim ava divaḥ invatam jīra dānū
translated: O royal guardians of great truth, lords of the rivers, come hither on your own paths.🔽O Mitra-Varuṇa, send us rain, like food, and cause it to descend from the sky, O you who give abundantly.

original: mitras tan no varuṇo devo aryaḥ pra sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhir nayantu /
analyzed: mitraḥ tat naḥ varuṇaḥ devaḥ aryaḥ pra sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhiḥ nayantu
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, and the god Aryaman lead us by the most excellent paths,

original: bravad yathā na ād ariḥ sudāsa iṣā madema saha devagopāḥ //
analyzed: bravat yathā naḥ āt ariḥ sudāse iṣā madema saha deva gopāḥ
translated: So that we may be like Sudās, the non-Aryan, and rejoice in food, protected by the gods.

original: yo vāṃ gartam manasā takṣad etam ūrdhvāṃ dhītiṃ kṛṇavad dhārayac ca /
analyzed: yaḥ vām gartam manasā takṣat etam ūrdhvām dhītim kṛṇavat dhārayat ca
translated: He who hath fashioned this your pit with thought, who hath made your thought erect and hath supported it,

original: ukṣethām mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtena tā rājānā sukṣitīs tarpayethām //
analyzed: ukṣethām mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtena tāḥ rājānā su kṣitīḥ tarpayethām
translated: Do ye sprinkle, O Mitra-Varuṇa, with ghee; do ye, O Kings, satisfy the well-spread (offerings).

original: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra tubhyaṃ somaḥ śukro na vāyave 'yāmi /
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ varuṇa mitra tubhyam somaḥ śukraḥ na vāyave yāmi
translated: This praise is for you, O Mitra-Varuṇa; I send forth the bright Soma to Vâyu.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jigṛtam purandhīr yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhiyaḥ jigṛtam purandhīḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Accept ye the thoughts, ye who are rich in wisdom. Do ye, O Mitra-Varuṇa, preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: prati vāṃ sūra udite sūktair mitraṃ huve varuṇam pūtadakṣam /
analyzed: prati vām sūre udite sūktaiḥ mitram huve varuṇam pūta dakṣam
translated: To you, O Sûrya, at your rising, with hymns I call Mitra, Varuṇa of pure ability,

original: yayor asuryam akṣitaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ viśvasya yāmann ācitā jigatnu //
analyzed: yayoḥ asuryam akṣitam jyeṣṭham viśvasya yāman ācitā jigatnu
translated: Whose godhead, undecaying, is the highest, who, in all men's paths, are ever active.

original: tā hi devānām asurā tāv aryā tā naḥ kṣitīḥ karatam ūrjayantīḥ /
analyzed: tā hi devānām asurā tau aryā tā naḥ kṣitīḥ karatam ūrjayantīḥ
translated: For they are the Gods' and Asuras' rulers, and they, O ye who are to be invoked, our lands.

original: aśyāma mitrāvaruṇā vayaṃ vāṃ dyāvā ca yatra pīpayann ahā ca //
analyzed: aśyāma mitrāvaruṇā vayam vām dyāvā ca yatra pīpayan ahā ca
translated: May we, O Mitra-Varuṇa, enjoy your favour, where Dyaus and the days have caused the waters to flow.

original: tā bhūripāśāv anṛtasya setū duratyetū ripave martyāya /🔽ṛtasya mitrāvaruṇā pathā vām apo na nāvā duritā tarema //
analyzed: tā bhūri pāśau anṛtasya setū duratyetū ripave martyāya  ṛtasya mitrāvaruṇā pathā vām apaḥ na nāvā duritā tarema
translated: Those who have many snares, the bridges of untruth, hard to be passed by the mortal who is hostile,🔽By you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, on the path of holy order, as in a boat, may we pass over troubles.

original: ā no mitrāvaruṇā havyajuṣṭiṃ ghṛtair gavyūtim ukṣatam iḷābhiḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ mitrāvaruṇā havya juṣṭim ghṛtaiḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam iḷābhiḥ
translated: To our oblation, O Mitra-Varuṇa, sprinkle the path of the cows with ghee, with sacrificial food.

original: prati vām atra varam ā janāya pṛṇītam udno divyasya cāroḥ //
analyzed: prati vām atra varam ā janāya pṛṇītam udnaḥ divyasya cāroḥ
translated: Or grant us here a boon for the people, a reservoir of heavenly bliss.

original: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra tubhyaṃ somaḥ śukro na vāyave 'yāmi /
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ varuṇa mitra tubhyam somaḥ śukraḥ na vāyave yāmi
translated: This praise is for you, O Varuṇa and Mitra, I offer the bright Soma to Vāyu.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jigṛtam purandhīr yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽pra mitrayor varuṇayo stomo na etu śūṣyaḥ /
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhiyaḥ jigṛtam purandhīḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  pra mitrayoḥ varuṇayoḥ stomaḥ naḥ etu śūṣyaḥ
translated: Accept the inspired thoughts, O wise ones. You, protect us always with your blessings.🔽Let the praise of the two, Mitra and Varuṇa, go forth, to be accepted.

original: namasvān tuvijātayoḥ //
analyzed: namasvān tuvi jātayoḥ
translated: With homage to the two of great power.

original: yā dhārayanta devāḥ sudakṣā dakṣapitarā /
analyzed: yā dhārayanta devāḥ su dakṣā dakṣa pitarā
translated: Those who, as gods, the well-skilled, the parents of skill,

original: asuryāya pramahasā //
analyzed: asuryāya pramahasā
translated: support the Asura with great might.

original: tā na stipā tanūpā varuṇa jaritṝṇām /
analyzed: tā naḥ stipā tanū pā varuṇa jaritṝṇām
translated: They, the protectors of vows, the guardians of bodies, O Varuṇa, of the praisers,

original: mitra sādhayataṃ dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: mitra sādhayatam dhiyaḥ
translated: O Mitra, accomplish the thoughts.

original: yad adya sūra udite 'nāgā mitro aryamā /
analyzed: yat adya sūre udite nāgāḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: What today, when the sun has risen, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: suvāti savitā bhagaḥ //
analyzed: suvāti savitā bhagaḥ
translated: Savitar, Bhaga, the sinless, blow away.

original: suprāvīr astu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: su prāvīḥ astu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ
translated: May that dwelling be well-protected, we will go forth, the bountiful,

original: ye no aṃho 'tipiprati //
analyzed: ye naḥ aṃhaḥ tipiprati
translated: who will lead us beyond distress.

original: uta svarājo aditir adabdhasya vratasya ye /
analyzed: uta sva rājaḥ aditiḥ adabdhasya vratasya ye
translated: And the self-ruling ones, the undeceiving ones of Aditi,

original: maho rājāna īśate //
analyzed: mahaḥ rājānaḥ īśate
translated: the great kings rule over.

original: prati vāṃ sūra udite mitraṃ gṛṇīṣe varuṇam /
analyzed: prati vām sūre udite mitram gṛṇīṣe varuṇam
translated: To you, when the sun has risen, I sing the praise of Mitra, Varuṇa,

original: aryamaṇaṃ riśādasam //
analyzed: aryamaṇam riśādasam
translated: and of Aryaman, the foe-destroyer.

original: rāyā hiraṇyayā matir iyam avṛkāya śavase /
analyzed: rāyā hiraṇyayā matiḥ iyam avṛkāya śavase
translated: This thought of wealth, of gold, for the fearless power,

original: iyaṃ viprā medhasātaye //
analyzed: iyam viprā medha sātaye
translated: This, O Brahmins, is for the sake of wisdom.

original: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha /
analyzed: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha
translated: May we be with you, O god Varuna, with you, O Mitra, with the princes,

original: iṣaṃ svaś ca dhīmahi //
analyzed: iṣam svar ca dhīmahi
translated: And think of food and our own.

original: bahavaḥ sūracakṣaso 'gnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ sūra cakṣasaḥ gni jihvāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: Many are they, with the eyes of the sun, with Agni as their tongue, increasers of truth,

original: trīṇi ye yemur vidathāni dhītibhir viśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: trīṇi ye yemuḥ vidathāni dhītibhiḥ viśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ
translated: Who have sent forth three sacrifices with their thoughts, all with their overcomings.

original: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradam māsam ād ahar yajñam aktuṃ cād ṛcam /
analyzed: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradam māsam āt ahar yajñam aktum ca āt ṛcam
translated: They who have sent forth the autumn, the month, the day, the sacrifice, and the verse,

original: anāpyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā kṣatraṃ rājāna āśata //
analyzed: an āpyam varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā kṣatram rājānaḥ āśata
translated: The unapproachable, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, the kings of the realm, have attained.

original: tad vo adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūra udite /
analyzed: tat vaḥ adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūre udite
translated: That we may think of you today with hymns, O Sūrya, when you have risen,

original: yad ohate varuṇo mitro aryamā yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ //
analyzed: yat ohate varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ
translated: What you, O Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, you who are the charioteers of truth, have accepted.

original: ṛtāvāna ṛtajātā ṛtāvṛdho ghorāso anṛtadviṣaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtāvānaḥ ṛta jātāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ghorāsaḥ anṛta dviṣaḥ
translated: Righteous, born of truth, increasers of truth, terrible, haters of falsehood,

original: teṣāṃ vaḥ sumne succhardiṣṭame naraḥ syāma ye ca sūrayaḥ //🔽ud u tyad darśataṃ vapur diva eti pratihvare /
analyzed: teṣām vaḥ sumne su chardiṣṭame naraḥ syāma ye ca sūrayaḥ  ud u tyad darśatam vapuḥ divaḥ eti pratihvare
translated: In your favor, O men, may we be, and those who are princes, most prosperous.🔽That beautiful form of yours goes up to heaven at dawn,

original: yad īm āśur vahati deva etaśo viśvasmai cakṣase aram //
analyzed: yat īm āśuḥ vahati devaḥ etaśaḥ viśvasmai cakṣase aram
translated: When the swift one, the god Etaṣa, carries it for all to see.

original: śīrṣṇaḥśīrṣṇo jagatas tasthuṣas patiṃ samayā viśvam ā rajaḥ /
analyzed: śīrṣṇaḥ śīrṣṇaḥ jagataḥ tasthuṣas patim samayā viśvam ā rajaḥ
translated: The head of the moving and the standing world, the lord of all the regions,

original: sapta svasāraḥ suvitāya sūryaṃ vahanti harito rathe //
analyzed: sapta svasāraḥ suvitāya sūryam vahanti haritaḥ rathe
translated: The seven sisters carry the Sun for prosperity, the green horses on the chariot.

original: tac cakṣur devahitaṃ śukram uccarat /
analyzed: tat cakṣuḥ deva hitam śukram uccarat
translated: That eye, which is beneficial to the gods, is bright and moves upwards.

original: paśyema śaradaḥ śataṃ jīvema śaradaḥ śatam //
analyzed: paśyema śaradaḥ śatam jīvema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we see a hundred autumns, may we live a hundred autumns.

original: kāvyebhir adābhyā yātaṃ varuṇa dyumat /
analyzed: kāvyebhiḥ adābhyā yātam varuṇa dyumat
translated: Come, O Varuna, with your invincible and brilliant thoughts, O Mitra,

original: mitraś ca somapītaye //
analyzed: mitraḥ ca soma pītaye
translated: to drink the Soma.

original: divo dhāmabhir varuṇa mitraś cā yātam adruhā /
analyzed: divaḥ dhāmabhiḥ varuṇa mitraḥ ca ā yātam adruhā
translated: O Varuna and Mitra, come with the harmless ways of heaven,

original: pibataṃ somam ātujī //
analyzed: pibatam somam ātujī
translated: and drink the Soma with delight.

original: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā juṣāṇāv āhutiṃ narā /
analyzed: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā juṣāṇau āhutim narā
translated: Come, O Mitra and Varuna, accept the offering, O heroes,

original: pātaṃ somam ṛtāvṛdhā //
analyzed: pātam somam ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: and drink the Soma, O you who increase the truth.

original: prati vāṃ rathaṃ nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena /
analyzed: prati vām ratham nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena
translated: I praise your chariot, O lords of men, with a mind full of oblations fit for sacrifice.

original: yo vāṃ dūto na dhiṣṇyāv ajīgar acchā sūnur na pitarā vivakmi //
analyzed: yaḥ vām dūtaḥ na dhiṣṇyau ajīgar acchā sūnuḥ na pitarā vivakmi
translated: I, your messenger, O you who are to be worshipped, go to my parents like a son.

original: aśocy agniḥ samidhāno asme upo adṛśran tamasaś cid antāḥ /
analyzed: aśoci agniḥ samidhānaḥ asme upa u adṛśran tamasaḥ cit antāḥ
translated: Agni, who is to be worshipped, shines for us, the ends of darkness are seen.

original: aceti ketur uṣasaḥ purastāc chriye divo duhitur jāyamānaḥ //
analyzed: aceti ketuḥ uṣasaḥ purastāt śriye divaḥ duhituḥ jāyamānaḥ
translated: The banner of the dawn moves in front, being born for the glory of heaven's daughter.

original: abhi vāṃ nūnam aśvinā suhotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyā vivakvān /
analyzed: abhi vām nūnam aśvinā su hotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyāḥ vivakvān
translated: Now, O Asvins, the good priest, the inspirer, with praises, approaches you, O Nāsatyas.

original: pūrvībhir yātam pathyābhir arvāk svarvidā vasumatā rathena //
analyzed: pūrvībhiḥ yātam pathyābhiḥ arvāk svarvidā vasumatā rathena
translated: Come on the ancient paths, on the path of wealth, with a chariot that finds light and treasure.

original: avor vāṃ nūnam aśvinā yuvākur huve yad vāṃ sute mādhvī vasūyuḥ /
analyzed: vām nūnam aśvinā yuvākuḥ huve yat vām sute mādhvī vasūyuḥ
translated: I call you, O Aśvins, to the juice, to the sweet juice, to win treasure, that you may make my prayer, O you who have horses for your share, successful.

original: ā vāṃ vahantu sthavirāso aśvāḥ pibātho asme suṣutā madhūni //🔽prācīm u devāśvinā dhiyam me 'mṛdhrāṃ sātaye kṛtaṃ vasūyum /🔽viśvā aviṣṭaṃ vāja ā purandhīs tā naḥ śaktaṃ śacīpatī śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: ā vām vahantu sthavirāsaḥ aśvāḥ pibāthaḥ asme suṣutā madhūni  prācīm u devā aśvinā dhiyam me mṛdhrām sātaye kṛtam vasūyum  viśvāḥ aviṣṭam vāje ā purandhīḥ tāḥ naḥ śaktam śacīpatī śacībhiḥ
translated: Let your strong horses bring you hitherward: drink ye the well-pressed juices in our house.🔽O you who have horses for your share, make my prayer successful, O Aśvins, forward-looking, not to be deceived, to win treasure.🔽All treasures have ye entered, O ye rich in wealth: drink ye, O Lords of power, with your powers, what I have gained.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhīṣv aśvinā na āsu prajāvad reto ahrayaṃ no astu /
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhīṣu aśvinā naḥ āsu prajāvat retaḥ ahrayam naḥ astu
translated: O Aśvins, enter ye these two prayers of mine: let our seed be undecaying, rich in children.

original: ā vāṃ toke tanaye tūtujānāḥ suratnāso devavītiṃ gamema //
analyzed: ā vām toke tanaye tūtujānāḥ su ratnāsaḥ deva vītim gamema
translated: With our children and our offspring may we come to the banquet of the gods, O ye rich in treasures, longing for you.

original: eṣa sya vām pūrvagatveva sakhye nidhir hito mādhvī rāto asme /
analyzed: eṣa sya vām pūrva gatvā iva sakhye nidhiḥ hitaḥ mādhvī rātaḥ asme
translated: This treasure, O you who love the sweet, is laid up for you in the first place, in our house, to be bestowed.

original: aheḷatā manasā yātam arvāg aśnantā havyam mānuṣīṣu vikṣu //
analyzed: a heḍatā manasā yātam arvāk aśnantā havyam mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
translated: Come hitherward with a friendly mind, and eat the offering in the houses of men.

original: ekasmin yoge bhuraṇā samāne pari vāṃ sapta sravato ratho gāt /🔽na vāyanti subhvo devayuktā ye vāṃ dhūrṣu taraṇayo vahanti //
analyzed: ekasmin yoge bhuraṇā samāne pari vām sapta sravataḥ rathaḥ gāt  na vāyanti su bhvaḥ deva yuktāḥ ye vām dhūrṣu taraṇayaḥ vahanti
translated: In one and the same union, O ye swift ones, your chariot hath gone round the seven flowing (rivers).🔽The strong horses yoked by the gods do not fail, which carry you on your paths, O ye who are to be invoked.

original: asaścatā maghavadbhyo hi bhūtaṃ ye rāyā maghadeyaṃ junanti /
analyzed: asaścatā maghavadbhyaḥ hi bhūtam ye rāyā magha deyam junanti
translated: Be ye two, O ye who are to be invoked, for those who are rich in wealth, who long for wealth and the bestowing of wealth.

original: pra ye bandhuṃ sūnṛtābhis tirante gavyā pṛñcanto aśvyā maghāni //
analyzed: pra ye bandhum sūnṛtābhiḥ tirante gavyā pṛñcantaḥ aśvyā maghāni
translated: Who, bestowing wealth in cattle and horses, extend their kinship with their kindly natures.

original: nū me havam ā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā yāsiṣṭaṃ vartir aśvināv irāvat /
analyzed: nu me havam ā śṛṇutam yuvānā yāsiṣṭam vartiḥ aśvinau irāvat
translated: Now listen to my call, O you two young men, go on a mission, O Asvins, bringing food.

original: dhattaṃ ratnāni jarataṃ ca sūrīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: dhattam ratnāni jaratam ca sūrīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Give treasures, and make the old men strong. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: ā śubhrā yātam aśvinā svaśvā giro dasrā jujuṣāṇā yuvākoḥ /
analyzed: ā śubhrā yātam aśvinā su aśvā giraḥ dasrā jujuṣāṇā yuvākoḥ
translated: O you two bright ones, come, O Asvins, with your good horses, accepting the songs of the young man who delights in you.

original: havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītaṃ naḥ //
analyzed: havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītam naḥ
translated: And remember our offerings.

original: pra vām andhāṃsi madyāny asthur araṃ gantaṃ haviṣo vītaye me /
analyzed: pra vām andhāṃsi madyāni asthuḥ aram gantam haviṣaḥ vītaye me
translated: Your gladdening juices are ready. Come easily to enjoy my oblation.

original: tiro aryo havanāni śrutaṃ naḥ //
analyzed: tiras aryaḥ havanāni śrutam naḥ
translated: Listen to our calls across the enemies.

original: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā iyarti tiro rajāṃsy aśvinā śatotiḥ /
analyzed: pra vām rathaḥ manaḥ javāḥ iyarti tiras rajāṃsi aśvinā śata ūtiḥ
translated: Your chariot, O Asvins, which moves with the speed of thought, which goes across the regions, which is praised a hundred times,

original: asmabhyaṃ sūryāvasū iyānaḥ //🔽ayaṃ ha yad vāṃ devayā u adrir ūrdhvo vivakti somasud yuvabhyām /
analyzed: asmabhyam sūryāvasū iyānaḥ  ayam ha yat vām deva yāḥ u adriḥ ūrdhvaḥ vivakti soma sut yuvabhyām
translated: Approaching us, bringing the two suns.

original: ā valgū vipro vavṛtīta havyaiḥ //🔽citraṃ ha yad vām bhojanaṃ nv asti ny atraye mahiṣvantaṃ yuyotam /
analyzed: ā valgū vipraḥ havyaiḥ  citram ha yat vām bhojanam nu asti ni atraye mahiṣvantam yuyotam
translated: This very mountain, O you two, which is directed towards you, the gods, which is lifted up, which presses out Soma for you,🔽The sage has turned to you with offerings.🔽Wonderful is the food that you have, which you should give to the poor, which contains great riches.

original: yo vām omānaṃ dadhate priyaḥ san //
analyzed: yaḥ vām omānam dadhate priyaḥ san
translated: Or the dear one who places his trust in you.

original: uta tyad vāṃ jurate aśvinā bhūc cyavānāya pratītyaṃ havirde /
analyzed: uta tyad vām jurate aśvinā bhūt cyavānāya pratītyam haviḥ de
translated: And that, O ye Aṣvins, may be your quarrel, that you have given to Chyavâna a welcome offering.

original: adhi yad varpa itaūti dhatthaḥ //
analyzed: adhi yat varpaḥ itaūti dhatthaḥ
translated: Since ye have placed this form of yours above.

original: uta tyam bhujyum aśvinā sakhāyo madhye jahur durevāsaḥ samudre /
analyzed: uta tyam bhujyum aśvinā sakhāyaḥ madhye jahuḥ durevāsaḥ samudre
translated: And that friend of yours, O ye Aṣvins, whom the Durias in the sea left in the midst,

original: nir īm parṣad arāvā yo yuvākuḥ //
analyzed: niḥ īm parṣat arāvā yaḥ yuvākuḥ
translated: Ye have delivered from the demon who held him.

original: vṛkāya cij jasamānāya śaktam uta śrutaṃ śayave hūyamānā /🔽yāv aghnyām apinvatam apo na staryaṃ cic chakty aśvinā śacībhiḥ //🔽eṣa sya kārur jarate sūktair agre budhāna uṣasāṃ sumanmā /
analyzed: vṛkāya cit jasamānāya śaktam uta śrutam śayave hūyamānā  yau aghnyām apinvatam apaḥ naḥ staryam cit śaktī aśvinā śacībhiḥ  eṣa sya kāruḥ jarate sūktaiḥ agre budhānaḥ uṣasām su manmā
translated: To the weak Vr̥ika who was fain to strive, and to the famous Sarya who was called on,🔽Ye gave strength, O ye Aṣvins, with your powers, as ye filled the milch-cow with the waters.🔽This your kind friend, O ye who know, is glorified with hymns, the well-disposed at the dawning of the days.

original: iṣā taṃ vardhad aghnyā payobhir yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: iṣā tam vardhat aghnyā payobhiḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Him, O ye who slay not, increase with the waters and with the milk of the milch-cow, with your powers, O ye Aṣvins.

original: ā vāṃ ratho rodasī badbadhāno hiraṇyayo vṛṣabhir yātv aśvaiḥ /
analyzed: ā vām rathaḥ rodasī badbadhānaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ vṛṣabhiḥ yātu aśvaiḥ
translated: May your chariot, yoked to the two world-halves, come hither, O ye Aṣvins, on your golden car, drawn by strong horses,

original: ghṛtavartaniḥ pavibhī rucāna iṣāṃ voḷhā nṛpatir vājinīvān //
analyzed: ghṛta vartaniḥ pavibhiḥ rucānaḥ iṣām voḷhā nṛpatiḥ vājinīvān
translated: With a path of ghee, shining with its own light, seeking food, a lord of men, rich in booty.

original: sa paprathāno abhi pañca bhūmā trivandhuro manasā yātu yuktaḥ /
analyzed: sa paprathānaḥ abhi pañca bhūmā tri vandhuraḥ manasā yātu yuktaḥ
translated: That chariot, extended over the five regions, yoked with mind, with three seats, may it come.

original: viśo yena gacchatho devayantīḥ kutrā cid yāmam aśvinā dadhānā //
analyzed: viśaḥ yena gacchathaḥ devayantīḥ kutra cit yāmam aśvinā dadhānā
translated: By which ye go to the people who long for the Gods, O ye Aṣvins, bestowing the journey somewhere.

original: svaśvā yaśasā yātam arvāg dasrā nidhim madhumantam pibāthaḥ /
analyzed: su aśvā yaśasā yātam arvāk dasrā nidhim madhumantam pibāthaḥ
translated: Come hither on your own bright car, O ye Wonder-Workers, to the mead that hath sweet juices.

original: vi vāṃ ratho vadhvā yādamāno 'ntān divo bādhate vartanibhyām //
analyzed: vi vām rathaḥ vadhvā yādamānaḥ ntān divaḥ bādhate vartanibhyām
translated: Your chariot, with its pole extended, O ye Wonder-Workers, passes the ends of the sky by its two wheels.

original: yuvoḥ śriyam pari yoṣāvṛṇīta sūro duhitā paritakmyāyām /
analyzed: yuvoḥ śriyam pari yoṣā vṛṇīta sūraḥ duhitā paritakmyāyām
translated: The maiden, the daughter of the Sun, hath chosen your glory as a wife in the Paritakman (sacrifice).

original: yad devayantam avathaḥ śacībhiḥ pari ghraṃsam omanā vāṃ vayo gāt //
analyzed: yat devayantam avathaḥ śacībhiḥ pari ghraṃsam omanā vām vayaḥ gāt
translated: When ye help him who worships with your powers, the Ghr̥ita hath come to you, O ye Asvins, for your food.

original: yo ha sya vāṃ rathirā vasta usrā ratho yujānaḥ pariyāti vartiḥ /🔽tena naḥ śaṃ yor uṣaso vyuṣṭau ny aśvinā vahataṃ yajñe asmin //
analyzed: yaḥ ha sya vām rathirā usrā rathaḥ yujānaḥ pariyāti vartiḥ  tena naḥ śam yoḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau ni aśvinā vahatam yajñe asmin
translated: Your chariot, O ye Wonder-Workers, which is swift, which is yoked, which goes round, which is your way,🔽Therewith, O Asvins, at the dawn, at the rising of the dawn, bring ye to this sacrifice for our welfare.

original: narā gaureva vidyutaṃ tṛṣāṇāsmākam adya savanopa yātam /
analyzed: narā gaurā iva vidyutam tṛṣāṇā asmākam adya savanā upa yātam
translated: O ye Heroes, like a cow to the lightning, come to our libation to-day, being thirsty.

original: purutrā hi vām matibhir havante mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ //
analyzed: purutrā hi vām matibhiḥ havante mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ
translated: For ye are called by many thoughts and prayers: let not others who worship the gods hinder you.

original: yuvam bhujyum avaviddhaṃ samudra ud ūhathur arṇaso asridhānaiḥ /
analyzed: yuvam bhujyum avaviddham samudre ud ūhathuḥ arṇasaḥ a sridhānaiḥ
translated: Ye have raised up Bhujyu, O ye Asvins, who was wounded in the sea, with your undecaying,

original: patatribhir aśramair avyathibhir daṃsanābhir aśvinā pārayantā //
analyzed: patatribhiḥ aśramaiḥ avyathibhiḥ daṃsanābhiḥ aśvinā pārayantā
translated: With your unwearied, with your flying, with your darting, O ye Asvins, to safety.

original: nū me havam ā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā yāsiṣṭaṃ vartir aśvināv irāvat /
analyzed: nu me havam ā śṛṇutam yuvānā yāsiṣṭam vartiḥ aśvinau irāvat
translated: Now, O ye Young Ones, listen to my call: come, O ye Asvins, on your way that brings prosperity.

original: dhattaṃ ratnāni jarataṃ ca sūrīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽ā viśvavārāśvinā gataṃ naḥ pra tat sthānam avāci vām pṛthivyām /🔽aśvo na vājī śunapṛṣṭho asthād ā yat sedathur dhruvase na yonim //
analyzed: dhattam ratnāni jaratam ca sūrīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  ā viśva vārā aśvinā gatam naḥ pra tat sthānam avāci vām pṛthivyām  aśvaḥ na vājī śuna pṛṣṭhaḥ asthāt ā yat sedathuḥ dhruvase na yonim
translated: Bestow riches, and make the nobles old. Do ye, O Asvins, come to us, who are all-powerful,🔽That place of yours is declared on earth.🔽The swift horse, with dogs on his back, stands, when ye two have sat down in your firm seat.

original: siṣakti sā vāṃ sumatiś caniṣṭhātāpi gharmo manuṣo duroṇe /
analyzed: siṣakti sā vām sumatiḥ caniṣṭhā atāpi gharmaḥ manuṣaḥ duroṇe
translated: That is your most excellent favour, O ye Asvins, the heated (milk) in the house of the man (who sacrifices).

original: yo vāṃ samudrān saritaḥ piparty etagvā cin na suyujā yujānaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vām samudrān saritaḥ piparti etagvā cit na su yujā yujānaḥ
translated: He who, O ye Asvins, with a yoke-fellow like a bird, fills the oceans and the rivers,

original: yāni sthānāny aśvinā dadhāthe divo yahvīṣv oṣadhīṣu vikṣu /
analyzed: yāni sthānāni aśvinā dadhāthe divaḥ yahvīṣu oṣadhīṣu vikṣu
translated: The places, O Asvins, which ye have, on the heights of the young plants of heaven,

original: ni parvatasya mūrdhani sadanteṣaṃ janāya dāśuṣe vahantā //
analyzed: ni parvatasya mūrdhani sadantā iṣam janāya dāśuṣe vahantā
translated: Sitting on the top of the mountain, bring to the man who sacrifices, to the people, to the worshipper.

original: caniṣṭaṃ devā oṣadhīṣv apsu yad yogyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām /
analyzed: caniṣṭam devau oṣadhīṣu apsu yat yogyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām
translated: The most excellent (favour), O ye Asvins, among the plants and in the waters, which ye have obtained, O ye Rsis,

original: purūṇi ratnā dadhatau ny asme anu pūrvāṇi cakhyathur yugāni //
analyzed: purūṇi ratnā dadhatau ni asme anu pūrvāṇi cakhyathuḥ yugāni
translated: Bestowing upon us many treasures, ye have passed over the former generations.

original: śuśruvāṃsā cid aśvinā purūṇy abhi brahmāṇi cakṣāthe ṛṣīṇām /
analyzed: śuśruvāṃsā cit aśvinā purūṇi abhi brahmāṇi cakṣāthe ṛṣīṇām
translated: O ye Asvins, though ye are far away, ye look upon the many prayers of the Rsis.

original: prati pra yātaṃ varam ā janāyāsme vām astu sumatiś caniṣṭhā //
analyzed: prati pra yātam varam ā janāya asme vām astu sumatiḥ caniṣṭhā
translated: Come back to the people, to the man. Let your most excellent favour be with us.

original: yo vāṃ yajño nāsatyā haviṣmān kṛtabrahmā samaryo bhavāti /
analyzed: yaḥ vām yajñaḥ nāsatyāḥ haviṣmān kṛta brahmā samaryaḥ bhavāti
translated: The sacrifice which you, O Nâsatyas, shall receive, with oblation, with prayer, in the conflict,

original: upa pra yātaṃ varam ā vasiṣṭham imā brahmāṇy ṛcyante yuvabhyām //
analyzed: upa pra yātam varam ā vasiṣṭham imā brahmāṇi ṛcyante yuvabhyām
translated: Come ye to him, to the best of abodes: these prayers are offered up to you.

original: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīr imāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām /
analyzed: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīḥ imām suvṛktim vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
translated: This is the thought, this is the song, O Aṣvins: accept this hymn of praise, O ye most mighty.

original: imā brahmāṇi yuvayūny agman yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: imā brahmāṇi yuvayūni agman yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: These prayers have come to you, O youthful Heroes: preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

original: apa svasur uṣaso nag jihīte riṇakti kṛṣṇīr aruṣāya panthām /
analyzed: apa svasuḥ uṣasaḥ nak jihīte riṇakti kṛṣṇīḥ aruṣāya panthām
translated: He shines forth from his Sister, from the Dawns: he breaks the dark nights up to make the pathway.

original: aśvāmaghā gomaghā vāṃ huvema divā naktaṃ śarum asmad yuyotam //
analyzed: aśvāmaghā go maghā vām huvema divā naktam śarum asmat yuyotam
translated: To you, O ye whose wealth is horses and is cattle, we pray by day and night: drive from us sorrow.

original: upāyātaṃ dāśuṣe martyāya rathena vāmam aśvinā vahantā /
analyzed: upāyātam dāśuṣe martyāya rathena vāmam aśvinā vahantā
translated: Come to the mortal man who offers you: bring, O ye Aṣvins, on your car what is most excellent.

original: yuyutam asmad anirām amīvāṃ divā naktam mādhvī trāsīthāṃ naḥ //🔽ā vāṃ ratham avamasyāṃ vyuṣṭau sumnāyavo vṛṣaṇo vartayantu /
analyzed: yuyutam asmat anirām amīvām divā naktam mādhvī trāsīthām naḥ  ā vām ratham avamasyām vyuṣṭau sumnāyavaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ vartayantu
translated: Drive ye away from us disease that knows no healing: be kind to us, O ye who love the mead, both night and day.🔽At the first flushing of the dawn may the most youthful, O ye Mighty, bring your car to us for our prosperity.

original: syūmagabhastim ṛtayugbhir aśvair āśvinā vasumantaṃ vahethām //
analyzed: syūma gabhastim ṛta yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ āśvinā vasumantam vahethām
translated: With horses yoked by Law, O ye Âṣvins, bring hither your car that hath a many-coloured pole, and is rich in treasures.

original: yo vāṃ ratho nṛpatī asti voḷhā trivandhuro vasumāṃ usrayāmā /
analyzed: yaḥ vām rathaḥ nṛpatī asti voḍhā tri vandhuraḥ vasumān usra yāmā
translated: That car of yours, O ye who rule mankind, which is most excellent, which hath three seats, and is rich in treasures,

original: ā na enā nāsatyopa yātam abhi yad vāṃ viśvapsnyo jigāti //🔽yuvaṃ cyavānaṃ jaraso 'mumuktaṃ ni pedava ūhathur āśum aśvam /🔽nir aṃhasas tamasa spartam atriṃ ni jāhuṣaṃ śithire dhātam antaḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ enā nāsatyā upa yātam abhi yat vām viśvapsnyaḥ jigāti  yuvam cyavānam jarasaḥ mumuktam ni pedavaḥ ūhathuḥ āśum aśvam  niḥ aṃhasaḥ tamasaḥ spartam atrim ni jāhuṣam śithire dhātam antar
translated: Come hither unto us, O Nâsatyas, to the place where all-knowing Vivasvan dwells.

original: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīr imāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām /🔽imā brahmāṇi yuvayūny agman yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽ā gomatā nāsatyā rathenāśvāvatā puruścandreṇa yātam /🔽abhi vāṃ viśvā niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā //🔽ā no devebhir upa yātam arvāk sajoṣasā nāsatyā rathena /🔽yuvor hi naḥ sakhyā pitryāṇi samāno bandhur uta tasya vittam //🔽ud u stomāso aśvinor abudhrañ jāmi brahmāṇy uṣasaś ca devīḥ /🔽āvivāsan rodasī dhiṣṇyeme acchā vipro nāsatyā vivakti //
analyzed: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīḥ imām suvṛktim vṛṣaṇā juṣethām 🔽imā brahmāṇi yuvayūni agman yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ 🔽ā gomatā nāsatyā rathena aśvāvatā puru ścandreṇa yātam 🔽abhi vām viśvāḥ niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā 🔽ā naḥ devebhiḥ upa yātam arvāk sajoṣasā nāsatyā rathena 🔽yuvoḥ hi naḥ sakhyā pitryāṇi samānaḥ bandhuḥ uta tasya vittam 🔽ud u stomāsaḥ aśvinoḥ abudhram jāmi brahmāṇi uṣasaḥ ca devīḥ 🔽āvivāsan rodasī dhiṣṇyā ime acchā vipraḥ nāsatyā vivakti
translated: Ye rescued Cyavana from old age, and gave him back his youth, and gave him back his youth, and gave him back his youth, and gave him back his youth, and gave him back his youth, and gave original: vi ced ucchanty aśvinā uṣāsaḥ pra vām brahmāṇi kāravo bharante /
analyzed: vi ced ucchanti aśvinau uṣāsaḥ pra vām brahmāṇi kāravaḥ bharante
translated: If the dawns rise for you, O Asvins, or the bards bring your prayers,

original: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitā devo aśred bṛhad agnayaḥ samidhā jarante //
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum savitā devaḥ aśret bṛhat agnayaḥ samidhā jarante
translated: Savitar the god has raised his light on high; the great fires are kindled with fuel.

original: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastād āśvinā yātam adharād udaktāt /
analyzed: ā paścātāt nāsatyā purastāt āśvinā yātam adharāt udaktāt
translated: Come from the west, O Nâsatyas, come from the east, O ye Âsvins, come from below, come from above,

original: ā viśvataḥ pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: ā viśvatas pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: From all sides with the wealth of him of fivefold race. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: atāriṣma tamasas pāram asya prati stomaṃ devayanto dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: atāriṣma tamasaḥ pāram asya prati stomam devayantaḥ dadhānāḥ
translated: We have crossed over to the farther shore of this darkness, bringing praise to the gods.

original: purudaṃsā purutamā purājāmartyā havate aśvinā gīḥ //
analyzed: purudaṃsā purutamā purājā amartyā havate aśvinā gīḥ
translated: The most bountiful, the most ancient, the most youthful of mortals, O ye Aṣvins, invokes you with his song.

original: ny u priyo manuṣaḥ sādi hotā nāsatyā yo yajate vandate ca /
analyzed: ni u priyaḥ manuṣaḥ sādi hotā nāsatyā yaḥ yajate vandate ca
translated: The dear guest of men has come, the priest, whom ye, O Nâsatyas, honour and praise, who sacrifices and worships.

original: aśnītam madhvo aśvinā upāka ā vāṃ voce vidatheṣu prayasvān //
analyzed: aśnītam madhvaḥ aśvinau upāke ā vām voce vidatheṣu prayasvān
translated: Eat ye the honey, O ye Aṣvins, in our house: to you, the bountiful, I speak in assemblies.

original: ahema yajñam pathām urāṇā imāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām /🔽śruṣṭīveva preṣito vām abodhi prati stomair jaramāṇo vasiṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: ahema yajñam pathām urāṇāḥ imām suvṛktim vṛṣaṇā juṣethām  śruṣṭīvā iva preṣitaḥ vām abodhi prati stomaiḥ jaramāṇaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: We have come to the sacrifice, O ye Mighty, on the path: accept ye this fair hymn, O ye Bulls.🔽Like one who listens, sent by you, hath Vasisṭha, the young, awakened with his praises.

original: upa tyā vahnī gamato viśaṃ no rakṣohaṇā sambhṛtā vīḷupāṇī /
analyzed: upa tyā vahnī gamataḥ viśam naḥ rakṣaḥ haṇā sambhṛtā vīḍu pāṇī
translated: Come to our house, O ye two who are borne by Bays, ye who are armed with thunder, who slay the fiends.

original: sam andhāṃsy agmata matsarāṇi mā no mardhiṣṭam ā gataṃ śivena //
analyzed: sam andhāṃsi agmata matsarāṇi mā naḥ mardhiṣṭam ā gatam śivena
translated: The gladdening juices have come together. Do not afflict us, come to us with what is auspicious.

original: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastād āśvinā yātam adharād udaktāt /
analyzed: ā paścātāt nāsatyā purastāt āśvinā yātam adharāt udaktāt
translated: From the west, O Nāsatyas, from the east, O Aśvins, come from the south, from the north.

original: ā viśvataḥ pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽imā u vāṃ diviṣṭaya usrā havante aśvinā /
analyzed: ā viśvatas pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  imāḥ u vām diviṣṭayaḥ usrā havante aśvinā
translated: From all sides with the wealth of the five peoples. Do you all protect us with your blessings.🔽These two, O you who delight in the sky, the two dawns, call you, O Aśvins.

original: ayaṃ vām ahve 'vase śacīvasū viśaṃviśaṃ hi gacchathaḥ //
analyzed: ayam vām ahve vase śacī vasū viśam viśam hi gacchathaḥ
translated: This one calls you for help, O you who possess power, for you go to every clan.

original: yuvaṃ citraṃ dadathur bhojanaṃ narā codethāṃ sūnṛtāvate /
analyzed: yuvam citram dadathuḥ bhojanam narā codethām sūnṛtāvate
translated: You two grant wonderful nourishment, O heroes, be roused for the one who delights in truth.

original: arvāg rathaṃ samanasā ni yacchatam pibataṃ somyam madhu //
analyzed: arvāk ratham samanasā ni yacchatam pibatam somyam madhu
translated: Turn your chariot hither with one mind, drink the Soma-mixed mead.

original: ā yātam upa bhūṣatam madhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā /
analyzed: ā yātam upa bhūṣatam madhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā
translated: Come, approach, and enjoy the sweet drink, O Aśvins.

original: dugdham payo vṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā no mardhiṣṭam ā gatam //
analyzed: dugdham payaḥ vṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā naḥ mardhiṣṭam ā gatam
translated: Drink the milk, O mighty ones, O you who possess noble treasures. Do not afflict us, come.

original: aśvāso ye vām upa dāśuṣo gṛhaṃ yuvāṃ dīyanti bibhrataḥ /
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ ye vām upa dāśuṣaḥ gṛham yuvām dīyanti bibhrataḥ
translated: The horses which come to the house of the worshipper, you two, O Aśvins, are given by the one who bears you.

original: makṣūyubhir narā hayebhir aśvinā devā yātam asmayū //
analyzed: makṣūyubhiḥ narā hayebhiḥ aśvinā devā yātam asmayū
translated: With the swift ones, O heroes, with the horses, O Aśvins, O gods, come to us.

original: adhā ha yanto aśvinā pṛkṣaḥ sacanta sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: adhā ha yantaḥ aśvinā pṛkṣaḥ sacanta sūrayaḥ
translated: Now, when you two, O Aśvins, are coming, the rich men follow with their gifts.

original: tā yaṃsato maghavadbhyo dhruvaṃ yaśaś chardir asmabhyaṃ nāsatyā //🔽pra ye yayur avṛkāso rathā iva nṛpātāro janānām /
analyzed: tā yaṃsataḥ maghavadbhyaḥ dhruvam yaśaḥ chardiḥ asmabhyam nāsatyā  pra ye yayuḥ avṛkāsaḥ rathāḥ iva nṛ pātāraḥ janānām
translated: That you may bestow on the wealthy, firm glory, and protection on us, O Nāsatyas.🔽Those who have gone forth like chariots without enemies, the protectors of the people,

original: uta svena śavasā śūśuvur nara uta kṣiyanti sukṣitim //🔽vy uṣā āvo divijā ṛtenāviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānam āgāt /
analyzed: uta svena śavasā śūśuvuḥ naraḥ uta kṣiyanti su kṣitim  vi uṣāḥ āvaḥ divijāḥ ṛtena āviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānam āgāt
translated: And who have shone forth with their own power, the men, and who enjoy good fortune.🔽Dawn, born in the sky, has come with the law, revealing her greatness,

original: apa druhas tama āvar ajuṣṭam aṅgirastamā pathyā ajīgaḥ //
analyzed: apa druhaḥ tamaḥ āvaḥ ajuṣṭam aṅgirastamā pathyāḥ ajīgaḥ
translated: And has brought away the most hateful darkness. O Angiras-like one, you have reached the path.

original: mahe no adya suvitāya bodhy uṣo mahe saubhagāya pra yandhi /
analyzed: mahe naḥ adya suvitāya bodhi uṣaḥ mahe saubhagāya pra yandhi
translated: Be awake for our great welfare today, O Dawn, and strive for our great good fortune.

original: citraṃ rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehy asme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum //
analyzed: citram rayim yaśasam dhehi asme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum
translated: Give us, O goddess among mortals, wonderful wealth, glorious among men, and one who desires fame.

original: ete tye bhānavo darśatāyāś citrā uṣaso amṛtāsa āguḥ /
analyzed: ete tye bhānavaḥ darśatāyāḥ citrāḥ uṣasaḥ amṛtāsaḥ āguḥ
translated: These are the rays of the visible Dawn, the wondrous immortal ones have come.

original: janayanto daivyāni vratāny āpṛṇanto antarikṣā vy asthuḥ //
analyzed: janayantaḥ daivyāni vratāni āpṛṇantaḥ antarikṣā vi asthuḥ
translated: Begetting the divine ordinances, filling the spaces, they have spread out.

original: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyo jigāti /🔽abhipaśyantī vayunā janānāṃ divo duhitā bhuvanasya patnī //
analyzed: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyas jigāti  abhipaśyantī vayunā janānām divaḥ duhitā bhuvanasya patnī
translated: This one, yoked, goes forth from afar, in a moment she traverses the five regions.🔽Looking upon the doings of the people, the daughter of the sky, the wife of the world.

original: vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāya īśe vasūnām /
analyzed: vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāyaḥ īśe vasūnām
translated: The wife of Surya, rich in wealth, of wondrous bounty, rules over riches and goods.

original: ṛṣiṣṭutā jarayantī maghony uṣā ucchati vahnibhir gṛṇānā //
analyzed: ṛṣiṣṭutā jarayantī maghonī uṣāḥ ucchati vahnibhiḥ gṛṇānā
translated: Praised by the sages, bringing wealth, growing old, Dawn rises with her fires, singing.

original: prati dyutānām aruṣāso aśvāś citrā adṛśrann uṣasaṃ vahantaḥ /
analyzed: prati dyutānām aruṣāsaḥ aśvāḥ citrāḥ adṛśran uṣasam vahantaḥ
translated: The ruddy horses of the shining ones, the wondrous ones, are seen carrying Dawn.

original: yāti śubhrā viśvapiśā rathena dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate janāya //
analyzed: yāti śubhrā viśva piśā rathena dadhāti ratnam vidhate janāya
translated: The bright one goes with her all-seeing chariot, bestowing treasure on the man who offers.

original: satyā satyebhir mahatī mahadbhir devī devebhir yajatā yajatraiḥ /
analyzed: satyā satyebhiḥ mahatī mahadbhiḥ devī devebhiḥ yajatā yajatraiḥ
translated: True, with the true ones, great with the great ones, the goddess with the gods, the worthy with the worthy ones,

original: rujad dṛḷhāni dadad usriyāṇām prati gāva uṣasaṃ vāvaśanta //🔽nū no gomad vīravad dhehi ratnam uṣo aśvāvat purubhojo asme /
analyzed: rujat dṛḷhāni dadat usriyāṇām prati gāvaḥ uṣasam vāvaśanta  nu naḥ gomat vīravat dhehi ratnam uṣaḥ aśvāvat puru bhojaḥ asme
translated: she breaks the firm ones, bestowing the cows. The cows have lowed to Dawn.🔽Come to us with wealth in cattle and heroes, O Dawn, with horses and abundant food for us.

original: mā no barhiḥ puruṣatā nide kar yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ barhiḥ puruṣa tā nide kaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Do not make our sacrificial grass a reproach to men. Do you all protect us evermore with blessings.

original: ud u jyotir amṛtaṃ viśvajanyaṃ viśvānaraḥ savitā devo aśret /
analyzed: ud u jyotiḥ amṛtam viśvajanyam viśvānaraḥ savitā devaḥ aśret
translated: Savitar, the god, the all-mankind's immortal light, hath shone.

original: kratvā devānām ajaniṣṭa cakṣur āvir akar bhuvanaṃ viśvam uṣāḥ //
analyzed: kratvā devānām ajaniṣṭa cakṣuḥ āvis akaḥ bhuvanam viśvam uṣāḥ
translated: By the gods' wisdom hath he been born as their eye. Dawn hath revealed the whole world.

original: pra me panthā devayānā adṛśrann amardhanto vasubhir iṣkṛtāsaḥ /
analyzed: pra me panthāḥ deva yānāḥ adṛśran a mardhantaḥ vasubhiḥ iṣkṛtāsaḥ
translated: The paths that lead to the gods have appeared to me, made ready by the Vasus, not to be hindered.

original: abhūd u ketur uṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcy āgād adhi harmyebhyaḥ //
analyzed: abhūt u ketuḥ uṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcī āgāt adhi harmyebhyaḥ
translated: The light of the Dawns hath appeared in front. It hath come from the west to the houses.

original: tānīd ahāni bahulāny āsan yā prācīnam uditā sūryasya /
analyzed: tāni id ahāni bahulāni āsan yā prācīnam uditā sūryasya
translated: Those were many days, before the rising of the sun,

original: yataḥ pari jāra ivācaranty uṣo dadṛkṣe na punar yatīva //
analyzed: yatas pari jāre iva ācarantī uṣaḥ dadṛkṣe na punar yatī iva
translated: From which they wander like a lover, and the dawn is seen, not as if going back again.

original: ta id devānāṃ sadhamāda āsann ṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrvyāsaḥ /🔽gūḷhaṃ jyotiḥ pitaro anv avindan satyamantrā ajanayann uṣāsam //
analyzed: te id devānām sadhamādaḥ āsan ṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrvyāsaḥ  gūḍham jyotiḥ pitaraḥ anu avindan satya mantrāḥ ajanayan uṣāsam
translated: They were indeed the most delightful of the gods, the truthful, the ancient sages.🔽The fathers have found the hidden light, the truthful ones have generated the dawn.

original: samāna ūrve adhi saṃgatāsaḥ saṃ jānate na yatante mithas te /
analyzed: samāne ūrve adhi saṃgatāsaḥ sam jānate na yatante mithas te
translated: They are united on the same surface, they agree, they do not strive against each other.

original: te devānāṃ na minanti vratāny amardhanto vasubhir yādamānāḥ //🔽prati tvā stomair īḷate vasiṣṭhā uṣarbudhaḥ subhage tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ /
analyzed: te devānām na minanti vratāni a mardhantaḥ vasubhiḥ yādamānāḥ  prati tvā stomaiḥ īḍate vasiṣṭhāḥ uṣarbudhaḥ subhage tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ
translated: They do not violate the rites of the gods, being immortal, striving with the Vasus.🔽The Vasishthas praise you with hymns, O you who awaken at dawn, O you who are blessed.

original: gavāṃ netrī vājapatnī na ucchoṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva //
analyzed: gavām netrī vāja patnī naḥ uccha uṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva
translated: Be the leader of cows, the wife of strength, O dawn, O you who are well-born, shine forth first.

original: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānām uṣā ucchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ /
analyzed: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānām uṣāḥ ucchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ
translated: This dawn, the leader of riches and of pleasant things, is praised by the Vasishthas as it rises.

original: dīrghaśrutaṃ rayim asme dadhānā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: dīrgha śrutam rayim asme dadhānāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Granting us wealth renowned far and wide, may you protect us always with your blessings.

original: upo ruruce yuvatir na yoṣā viśvaṃ jīvam prasuvantī carāyai /
analyzed: upa u ruruce yuvatiḥ na yoṣā viśvam jīvam prasuvantī carāyai
translated: The young woman shines forth like a maiden, giving life to all that moves.

original: abhūd agniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇām akar jyotir bādhamānā tamāṃsi //
analyzed: abhūt agniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇām akaḥ jyotiḥ bādhamānā tamāṃsi
translated: Agni has become the kindler of men, he has made light, dispelling the darkness.

original: viśvam pratīcī saprathā ud asthād ruśad vāso bibhratī śukram aśvait /🔽hiraṇyavarṇā sudṛśīkasaṃdṛg gavām mātā netry ahnām aroci //
analyzed: viśvam pratīcī saprathāḥ ud asthāt ruśat vāsaḥ bibhratī śukram aśvait  hiraṇya varṇā su dṛśīka saṃdṛś gavām mātā netrī ahnām aroci
translated: The all-pervading dawn has arisen with its radiance, wearing a shining garment, it has shone forth.🔽The golden-hued, well-seen, well-regarded one, the mother of cows, the guide of the days, has shone forth.

original: devānāṃ cakṣuḥ subhagā vahantī śvetaṃ nayantī sudṛśīkam aśvam /
analyzed: devānām cakṣuḥ subhagā vahantī śvetam nayantī su dṛśīkam aśvam
translated: The auspicious dawn, carrying the eye of the gods, leading the white, well-seen horse,

original: uṣā adarśi raśmibhir vyaktā citrāmaghā viśvam anu prabhūtā //🔽antivāmā dūre amitram ucchorvīṃ gavyūtim abhayaṃ kṛdhī naḥ /
analyzed: uṣāḥ adarśi raśmibhiḥ vyaktā citrāmaghā viśvam anu prabhūtā  antivāmā dūre amitram uccha urvīm gavyūtim abhayam kṛdhī naḥ
translated: The dawn has appeared, revealed with its rays, of wondrous bounty, ruling over all.🔽Drive away the foe, whether near or far, and make our pasture secure and free from danger.

original: yāvaya dveṣa ā bharā vasūni codaya rādho gṛṇate maghoni //
analyzed: yāvaya dveṣaḥ ā bhara vasūni codaya rādhaḥ gṛṇate maghoni
translated: Drive away hatred, bring us riches, and stimulate bounty for the singer, O bountiful one.

original: asme śreṣṭhebhir bhānubhir vi bhāhy uṣo devi pratirantī na āyuḥ /
analyzed: asme śreṣṭhebhiḥ bhānubhiḥ vi bhāhi uṣaḥ devi pratirantī naḥ āyuḥ
translated: Shine upon us, O dawn, O goddess, with your most excellent beams, prolonging our life.

original: iṣaṃ ca no dadhatī viśvavāre gomad aśvāvad rathavac ca rādhaḥ //
analyzed: iṣam ca naḥ dadhatī viśva vāre gomat aśvāvat rathavat ca rādhaḥ
translated: Bestowing food upon us, O all-good one, and riches consisting of cattle, horses, and chariots.

original: yāṃ tvā divo duhitar vardhayanty uṣaḥ sujāte matibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: yām tvā divaḥ duhitar vardhayanti uṣaḥ sujāte matibhiḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: O daughter of the sky, whom the Vasishthas, O well-born dawn, extol with their thoughts,

original: sāsmāsu dhā rayim ṛṣvam bṛhantaṃ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: sā asmāsu dhāḥ rayim ṛṣvam bṛhantam yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Bestow upon us great and lofty wealth. Do you, O Vasus, always protect us with your blessings.

original: prati ketavaḥ prathamā adṛśrann ūrdhvā asyā añjayo vi śrayante /
analyzed: prati ketavaḥ prathamāḥ adṛśran ūrdhvāḥ asyāḥ añjayaḥ vi śrayante
translated: The first rays of light have been seen, the bright ones of this (dawn) are extended upwards.

original: uṣo arvācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmam asmabhyaṃ vakṣi //
analyzed: uṣaḥ arvācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmam asmabhyam vakṣi
translated: O Dawn, bring us with your great light-filled chariot what is good for us.

original: prati ṣīm agnir jarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāso matibhir gṛṇantaḥ /
analyzed: prati sīm agniḥ jarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ
translated: This Agni is praised by the priests with their hymns, the sages with their thoughts.

original: uṣā yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṃsi duritāpa devī //
analyzed: uṣāḥ yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṃsi duritā apa devī
translated: Dawn goes forth, dispelling the darkness with her light, the goddess dispelling all evil darkness.

original: etā u tyāḥ praty adṛśran purastāj jyotir yacchantīr uṣaso vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ u tyāḥ prati adṛśran purastāt jyotiḥ yacchantīḥ uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: These dawns have been seen in front, bestowing light, shining.

original: ajījanan sūryaṃ yajñam agnim apācīnaṃ tamo agād ajuṣṭam //
analyzed: ajījanan sūryam yajñam agnim apācīnam tamaḥ agāt ajuṣṭam
translated: They have generated the sun, the sacrifice, and Agni. Unwelcome darkness has gone away.

original: aceti divo duhitā maghonī viśve paśyanty uṣasaṃ vibhātīm /
analyzed: aceti divaḥ duhitā maghonī viśve paśyanti uṣasam vibhātīm
translated: The generous daughter of heaven shines, all behold the shining dawn.

original: āsthād rathaṃ svadhayā yujyamānam ā yam aśvāsaḥ suyujo vahanti //🔽prati tvādya sumanaso budhantāsmākāso maghavāno vayaṃ ca /
analyzed: āsthāt ratham svadhayā yujyamānam ā yam aśvāsaḥ su yujaḥ vahanti  prati tvā adya sumanasaḥ budhanta asmākāsaḥ maghavānaḥ vayam ca
translated: She has mounted the chariot yoked by its own nature, which is drawn by well-yoked horses.🔽Today let the well-disposed ones praise you, we and our wealthy ones.

original: tilvilāyadhvam uṣaso vibhātīr yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: tilvilāyadhvam uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: You shining dawns, be joyful. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: vy uṣā āvaḥ pathyā janānām pañca kṣitīr mānuṣīr bodhayantī /
analyzed: vi uṣāḥ āvaḥ pathyāḥ janānām pañca kṣitīḥ mānuṣīḥ bodhayantī
translated: Dawn has opened the path of men, awakening the five human abodes.

original: susaṃdṛgbhir ukṣabhir bhānum aśred vi sūryo rodasī cakṣasāvaḥ //🔽vy añjate divo anteṣv aktūn viśo na yuktā uṣaso yatante /
analyzed: su saṃdṛgbhiḥ ukṣabhiḥ bhānum aśret vi sūryaḥ rodasī cakṣasā avaḥ  vi añjate divaḥ anteṣu aktūn viśaḥ na yuktāḥ uṣasaḥ yatante
translated: With well-seen bulls he has raised the light, Sûrya has looked on the two world-halves with his eye.🔽The rays are spread abroad on the confines of the sky; the Dawns, like teams of horses, strive to win.

original: saṃ te gāvas tama ā vartayanti jyotir yacchanti saviteva bāhū //
analyzed: sam te gāvaḥ tamaḥ ā vartayanti jyotiḥ yacchanti savitā iva bāhū
translated: Thy cows turn back the darkness and bring thee light, as Savitar doth his arms.

original: abhūd uṣā indratamā maghony ajījanat suvitāya śravāṃsi /
analyzed: abhūt uṣāḥ indratamā maghonī ajījanat suvitāya śravāṃsi
translated: Dawn hath become most bountiful, like Indra, she hath brought forth glories for our weal.

original: vi divo devī duhitā dadhāty aṅgirastamā sukṛte vasūni //🔽tāvad uṣo rādho asmabhyaṃ rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyo arado gṛṇānā /
analyzed: vi divaḥ devī duhitā dadhāti aṅgirastamā su kṛte vasūni  tāvat uṣaḥ rādhaḥ asmabhyam rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyaḥ aradaḥ gṛṇānā
translated: The Goddess of the sky, the Daughter, bestows on him who acts aright the choicest treasures.🔽So, O Dawn, grant us bounty as thou hast granted to the singers who have praised thee,

original: yāṃ tvā jajñur vṛṣabhasyā raveṇa vi dṛḷhasya duro adrer aurṇoḥ //🔽devaṃdevaṃ rādhase codayanty asmadryak sūnṛtā īrayantī /
analyzed: yām tvā jajñuḥ vṛṣabhasya raveṇa vi dṛḷhasya duraḥ adreḥ aurṇoḥ  devam devam rādhase codayantī asmadryak sūnṛtāḥ īrayantī
translated: The Dawn whom they have known by the bull's roar, the Daughter of the firm and lofty mountain.🔽They urge each God to bounty, sending us good things, and causing pleasant songs to come to us.

original: vyucchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyo dhā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vyucchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyaḥ dhāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Dawn, as thou shinest forth, give us our wishes. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

original: prati stomebhir uṣasaṃ vasiṣṭhā gīrbhir viprāsaḥ prathamā abudhran /
analyzed: prati stomebhiḥ uṣasam vasiṣṭhāḥ gīrbhiḥ viprāsaḥ prathamāḥ abudhran
translated: The Vasishthas with their lauds have wakened Dawn, the sages with their songs have first addressed her.

original: vivartayantīṃ rajasī samante āviṣkṛṇvatīm bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: vivartayantīm rajasī samante āviṣkṛṇvatīm bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: She who turneth the two worlds around, and maketh all living creatures manifest.

original: eṣā syā navyam āyur dadhānā gūḍhvī tamo jyotiṣoṣā abodhi /
analyzed: eṣā syā navyam āyuḥ dadhānā gūḍhvī tamaḥ jyotiṣā uṣāḥ abodhi
translated: This Dawn, bestowing new life, hath risen, the hidden one, from out the darkness into light.

original: agra eti yuvatir ahrayāṇā prācikitat sūryaṃ yajñam agnim //🔽aśvāvatīr gomatīr na uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ /
analyzed: agre eti yuvatiḥ ahrayāṇā prācikitat sūryam yajñam agnim  aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ naḥ uṣāsaḥ vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ
translated: The young maid goes in front, roaring, and hath discovered the Sun, the sacrifice, and Agni.🔽May the auspicious Dawns ever rise upon us, rich in horses, rich in cattle, rich in heroes.

original: ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtam duhānāḥ viśvatas prapītāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Pouring forth ghee on every side, may ye, O ye, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: praty u adarśy āyaty ucchantī duhitā divaḥ /🔽apo mahi vyayati cakṣase tamo jyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī //🔽ud usriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacāṃ udyan nakṣatram arcivat /
analyzed: prati u adarśi āyatī ucchantī duhitā divaḥ  apa u mahi vyayati cakṣase tamaḥ jyotiḥ kṛṇoti sūnarī  ud usriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacā udyan nakṣatram arcivat
translated: She hath appeared, rising, the Daughter of Heaven,🔽she spreadeth out the waters, and beholds the great expanse. She maketh light out of darkness, the blessed one.🔽The Sun sends forth the bright Dawns, his companions, rising, the star that shineth.

original: taved uṣo vyuṣi sūryasya ca sam bhaktena gamemahi //
analyzed: tava id uṣaḥ vyuṣi sūryasya ca sam bhaktena gamemahi
translated: We will go to thee, O Dawn, at the time appointed by thee and by the Sun.

original: prati tvā duhitar diva uṣo jīrā abhutsmahi /
analyzed: prati tvā duhitar divaḥ uṣaḥ jīrāḥ abhutsmahi
translated: We have extolled thee, O Daughter of the Sky, O Dawn, as thou comest,

original: yā vahasi puru spārhaṃ vananvati ratnaṃ na dāśuṣe mayaḥ //
analyzed: yā vahasi puru spārham vananvati ratnam na dāśuṣe mayaḥ
translated: thou who bearest much that is desirable to the worshipper, as a treasure, O thou who givest joy.

original: ucchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṃhanā mahi prakhyai devi svar dṛśe /
analyzed: ucchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṃhanā mahi prakhyai devi svar dṛśe
translated: O thou who risest, O thou who makest great things with thy bounty, O Goddess, that we may behold the light,

original: tasyās te ratnabhāja īmahe vayaṃ syāma mātur na sūnavaḥ //
analyzed: tasyāḥ te ratna bhājaḥ īmahe vayam syāma mātuḥ na sūnavaḥ
translated: we seek to win that favour of thine, O Dawn. May we be as the sons of our mother.

original: tac citraṃ rādha ā bharoṣo yad dīrghaśruttamam /
analyzed: tat citram rādhaḥ ā bhara uṣaḥ yat dīrghaśruttamam
translated: That wonderful gift I bring, O Agni, that is most famous,

original: yat te divo duhitar martabhojanaṃ tad rāsva bhunajāmahai //
analyzed: yat te divaḥ duhitar marta bhojanam tat rāsva bhunajāmahai
translated: Whatever, O Daughter of Heaven, is your food for mortals, bestow that; let us enjoy it.

original: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṃ vasutvanaṃ vājāṃ asmabhyaṃ gomataḥ /
analyzed: śravaḥ sūribhyaḥ amṛtam vasutvanam vājām asmabhyam gomataḥ
translated: Glory to the princes, immortality, wealth to us, and strength in cattle.

original: codayitrī maghonaḥ sūnṛtāvaty uṣā ucchad apa sridhaḥ //
analyzed: codayitrī maghonaḥ sūnṛtāvatī uṣāḥ ucchat apa sridhaḥ
translated: The impeller of the wealthy, rich in bounty, Dawn hath risen, dispelling the darkness.

original: indrāvaruṇā yuvam adhvarāya no viśe janāya mahi śarma yacchatam /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā yuvam adhvarāya naḥ viśe janāya mahi śarma yacchatam
translated: O Indra and Varuna, grant us great protection for our sacrifice, for our people, for our clan.

original: dīrghaprayajyum ati yo vanuṣyati vayaṃ jayema pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ //
analyzed: dīrgha prayajyum ati yaḥ vanuṣyati vayam jayema pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ
translated: He who would overcome the one who sacrifices for a long time, may we conquer the evildoers in battles.

original: samrāḷ anyaḥ svarāḷ anya ucyate vām mahāntāv indrāvaruṇā mahāvasū /🔽viśve devāsaḥ parame vyomani saṃ vām ojo vṛṣaṇā sam balaṃ dadhuḥ //
analyzed: samrāj anyaḥ svarāj anyaḥ ucyate vām mahāntau indrāvaruṇā mahā vasū  viśve devāsaḥ parame vyomani sam vām ojaḥ vṛṣaṇā sam balam
translated: One is called the sovereign, another the lord, you two are great, O Indra and Varuna, great possessors of wealth.🔽All the gods in the highest heaven have placed your strength, O mighty ones, and your power together.

original: anv apāṃ khāny atṛntam ojasā sūryam airayataṃ divi prabhum /
analyzed: anu apām khāni atṛntam ojasā sūryam airayatam divi prabhum
translated: You have followed the waters' excavations with strength, you have sent forth the sun in the sky as lord.

original: indrāvaruṇā made asya māyino 'pinvatam apitaḥ pinvataṃ dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā made asya māyinaḥ pinvatam apitaḥ pinvatam dhiyaḥ
translated: O Indra and Varuna, in the intoxication of this one who delights, you have filled the barren ones, you have filled the thoughts.

original: yuvām id yutsu pṛtanāsu vahnayo yuvāṃ kṣemasya prasave mitajñavaḥ /
analyzed: yuvām id yutsu pṛtanāsu vahnayaḥ yuvām kṣemasya prasave mitajñavaḥ
translated: You two are the charioteers in battles, you two are the wise ones in the commencement of peace.

original: īśānā vasva ubhayasya kārava indrāvaruṇā suhavā havāmahe //
analyzed: īśānā vasvaḥ ubhayasya kāravaḥ indrāvaruṇā su havā havāmahe
translated: We call on the lords of wealth, the makers of both, Indra and Varuna, the swift to listen.

original: indrāvaruṇā yad imāni cakrathur viśvā jātāni bhuvanasya majmanā /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā yat imāni cakrathuḥ viśvā jātāni bhuvanasya majmanā
translated: O Indra and Varuna, what you have made these all beings, by the majesty of the world,

original: kṣemeṇa mitro varuṇaṃ duvasyati marudbhir ugraḥ śubham anya īyate //
analyzed: kṣemeṇa mitraḥ varuṇam duvasyati marudbhiḥ ugraḥ śubham anyaḥ īyate
translated: Mitra serves Varuna with peace; the fierce one goes to the auspicious with the Maruts.

original: mahe śulkāya varuṇasya nu tviṣa ojo mimāte dhruvam asya yat svam /
analyzed: mahe śulkāya varuṇasya nu tviṣe ojaḥ mimāte dhruvam asya yat svam
translated: For the great price of Varuna you two measure out his strength, what is firm and his own.

original: ajāmim anyaḥ śnathayantam ātirad dabhrebhir anyaḥ pra vṛṇoti bhūyasaḥ //
analyzed: ajāmim anyaḥ śnathayantam ātirat dabhrebhiḥ anyaḥ pra vṛṇoti bhūyasaḥ
translated: One has surpassed the unborn one who was spreading out; with the bold ones the other chooses the greater.

original: na tam aṃho na duritāni martyam indrāvaruṇā na tapaḥ kutaś cana /
analyzed: na tam aṃhaḥ na duritāni martyam indrāvaruṇā na tapaḥ kutas cana
translated: O Indra and Varuna, that mortal neither grief nor evils nor heat from anywhere,

original: yasya devā gacchatho vītho adhvaraṃ na tam martasya naśate parihvṛtiḥ //
analyzed: yasya devā gacchathaḥ vīthaḥ adhvaram na tam martasya naśate parihvṛtiḥ
translated: Whose sacrifice, O gods, you two go to as guests, his human power of destruction does not reach him.

original: arvāṅ narā daivyenāvasā gataṃ śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ yadi me jujoṣathaḥ /🔽yuvor hi sakhyam uta vā yad āpyam mārḍīkam indrāvaruṇā ni yacchatam //
analyzed: arvāk narā daivyena avasā gatam śṛṇutam havam yadi me jujoṣathaḥ  yuvoḥ hi sakhyam uta vā yat āpyam mārḍīkam indrāvaruṇā ni yacchatam
translated: O men, come with the divine help; listen if you will to my call.🔽Grant us, O Indra and Varuna, your favour, which is your friendship and your wealth.

original: asmākam indrāvaruṇā bharebhare puroyodhā bhavataṃ kṛṣṭyojasā /
analyzed: asmākam indrāvaruṇā bharebhare puroyodhā bhavatam kṛṣṭi ojasā
translated: O Indra and Varuna, be our leaders in every battle, with the strength of the field.

original: yad vāṃ havanta ubhaye adha spṛdhi naras tokasya tanayasya sātiṣu //
analyzed: yat vām havante ubhaye adha spṛdhi naraḥ tokasya tanayasya sātiṣu
translated: When men call you both to the contest, on both sides, in the battles for offspring and sons.

original: asme indro varuṇo mitro aryamā dyumnaṃ yacchantu mahi śarma saprathaḥ /
analyzed: asme indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā dyumnam yacchantu mahi śarma saprathaḥ
translated: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, and Aryaman bestow upon us great glory and wide protection.

original: avadhraṃ jyotir aditer ṛtāvṛdho devasya ślokaṃ savitur manāmahe //
analyzed: avadhram jyotiḥ aditeḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ devasya ślokam savituḥ manāmahe
translated: We meditate on the light of the truthful one, the far-reaching glory of the god Savita.

original: yuvāṃ narā paśyamānāsa āpyam prācā gavyantaḥ pṛthuparśavo yayuḥ /
analyzed: yuvām narā paśyamānāsaḥ āpyam prācā gavyantaḥ pṛthu parśavaḥ yayuḥ
translated: You two, O men, looking on the attainable, have gone forth, longing for cattle, with wide strides.

original: dāsā ca vṛtrā hatam āryāṇi ca sudāsam indrāvaruṇāvasāvatam //
analyzed: dāsā ca vṛtrā hatam āryāṇi ca sudāsam indrāvaruṇā avasā avatam
translated: You have helped Sudasa, O Indra and Varuna, in slaying the Dasa and Aryan foes.

original: yatrā naraḥ samayante kṛtadhvajo yasminn ājā bhavati kiṃ cana priyam /🔽yatrā bhayante bhuvanā svardṛśas tatrā na indrāvaruṇādhi vocatam //
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ kṛta dhvajaḥ yasmin ājā bhavati kim cana priyam  yatrā bhayante bhuvanā svar dṛśaḥ tatrā naḥ indrāvaruṇā adhi vocatam
translated: Where men gather, with their standards raised, where something dear happens,🔽Where the worlds tremble, seeing heaven, there, O Indra and Varuna, speak to us.

original: sam bhūmyā antā dhvasirā adṛkṣatendrāvaruṇā divi ghoṣa āruhat /
analyzed: sam bhūmyāḥ antāḥ dhvasirāḥ adṛkṣata indrāvaruṇā divi ghoṣaḥ āruhat
translated: The ends of the earth are seen, O Indra and Varuna, the cry has mounted to heaven.

original: asthur janānām upa mām arātayo 'rvāg avasā havanaśrutā gatam //
analyzed: asthuḥ janānām upa mām arātayaḥ rvāk avasā havana śrutā gatam
translated: The evil spirits of the people have come to me; come hither, O you who hear the invocation, to help.

original: indrāvaruṇā vadhanābhir aprati bhedaṃ vanvantā pra sudāsam āvatam /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā vadhanābhiḥ aprati bhedam vanvantā pra sudāsam āvatam
translated: O Indra and Varuna, with irresistible weapons, winning the victory, you have helped Sudasa.

original: brahmāṇy eṣāṃ śṛṇutaṃ havīmani satyā tṛtsūnām abhavat purohitiḥ //
analyzed: brahmāṇi eṣām śṛṇutam havīmani satyā tṛtsūnām abhavat purohitiḥ
translated: Hearken to their invocations, O ye Brahmans: the Tṛtsus' prayer hath been true in the contest.

original: indrāvaruṇāv abhy ā tapanti māghāny aryo vanuṣām arātayaḥ /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇau abhī ā tapanti mā aghāni aryaḥ vanuṣām arātayaḥ
translated: The wicked, the enemies' evil designs, burn against Indra and Varuna, O ye Mighty.

original: yuvaṃ hi vasva ubhayasya rājatho 'dha smā no 'vatam pārye divi //
analyzed: yuvam hi vasvaḥ ubhayasya rājathaḥ dha smā naḥ vatam pārye divi
translated: For ye rule over all wealth: come then to our aid in the fight, in the last battle.

original: yuvāṃ havanta ubhayāsa ājiṣv indraṃ ca vasvo varuṇaṃ ca sātaye /
analyzed: yuvām havante ubhayāsaḥ ājiṣu indram ca vasvaḥ varuṇam ca sātaye
translated: In the contests they call on Indra and on Varuṇa, on Varuṇa and on Indra for the sake of wealth.

original: yatra rājabhir daśabhir nibādhitam pra sudāsam āvataṃ tṛtsubhiḥ saha //
analyzed: yatra rājabhiḥ daśabhiḥ nibādhitam pra sudāsam āvatam tṛtsubhiḥ saha
translated: Where Sudâs was hemmed in by ten kings, ye delivered him with the aid of the Tṛtsus.

original: daśa rājānaḥ samitā ayajyavaḥ sudāsam indrāvaruṇā na yuyudhuḥ /
analyzed: daśa rājānaḥ samitāḥ ayajyavaḥ sudāsam indrāvaruṇā na yuyudhuḥ
translated: Ten kings, united, who offered no sacrifice, fought against Sudâs, O Indra and Varuna.

original: satyā nṛṇām admasadām upastutir devā eṣām abhavan devahūtiṣu //
analyzed: satyā nṛṇām admasadām upastutiḥ devāḥ eṣām abhavan deva hūtiṣu
translated: The true praise of men who ever eat their fill: the gods were on their side in their invocations.

original: dāśarājñe pariyattāya viśvataḥ sudāsa indrāvaruṇāv aśikṣatam /
analyzed: dāśarājñe pariyattāya viśvatas sudāse indrāvaruṇau aśikṣatam
translated: To Sudâs, the king of the ten tribes, ye have granted all things from every side, O Indra and Varuna.

original: śvityañco yatra namasā kapardino dhiyā dhīvanto asapanta tṛtsavaḥ //
analyzed: śvityañcaḥ yatra namasā kapardinaḥ dhiyā dhīvantaḥ asapanta tṛtsavaḥ
translated: Where the white-robed, the curly-haired, the wise, the eager Tṛtsus have bowed them with reverence.

original: vṛtrāṇy anyaḥ samitheṣu jighnate vratāny anyo abhi rakṣate sadā /
analyzed: vṛtrāṇi anyaḥ samitheṣu jighnate vratāni anyaḥ abhi rakṣate sadā
translated: One of them slayeth Vr̥itras in the battles: one ever guardeth the eternal statutes.

original: havāmahe vāṃ vṛṣaṇā suvṛktibhir asme indrāvaruṇā śarma yacchatam //
analyzed: havāmahe vām vṛṣaṇā suvṛktibhiḥ asme indrāvaruṇā śarma yacchatam
translated: We invoke you, O mighty ones, with good hymns; grant us, O Indra and Varuna, protection.

original: asme indro varuṇo mitro aryamā dyumnaṃ yacchantu mahi śarma saprathaḥ /
analyzed: asme indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā dyumnam yacchantu mahi śarma saprathaḥ
translated: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, and Aryaman grant us great glory and wide protection.

original: avadhraṃ jyotir aditer ṛtāvṛdho devasya ślokaṃ savitur manāmahe //
analyzed: avadhram jyotiḥ aditeḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ devasya ślokam savituḥ manāmahe
translated: We meditate on the light of the truthful one, the divine praise of Savitar, the increaser of truth.

original: ā vāṃ rājānāv adhvare vavṛtyāṃ havyebhir indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ /
analyzed: ā vām rājānau adhvare vavṛtyām havyebhiḥ indrāvaruṇāḥ namobhiḥ
translated: I turn to you, O Kings, at the sacrifice, with offerings, O Indra and Varuna, with salutations.

original: pra vāṃ ghṛtācī bāhvor dadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jigāti //
analyzed: pra vām ghṛtācī bāhvoḥ dadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jigāti
translated: Bearing the ladle in your arms, she moves around in various forms, according to her own will.

original: yuvo rāṣṭram bṛhad invati dyaur yau setṛbhir arajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ /
analyzed: yuvoḥ rāṣṭram bṛhat invati dyauḥ yau setṛbhiḥ a rajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ
translated: Your great kingdom extends to the sky, which you have made with bridges and ropes.

original: pari no heḷo varuṇasya vṛjyā uruṃ na indraḥ kṛṇavad u lokam //
analyzed: pari naḥ heḍaḥ varuṇasya vṛjyāḥ urum naḥ indraḥ kṛṇavat u lokam
translated: May we be freed from the noose of Varuna, and may Indra make a wide space for us.

original: kṛtaṃ no yajñaṃ vidatheṣu cāruṃ kṛtam brahmāṇi sūriṣu praśastā /
analyzed: kṛtam naḥ yajñam vidatheṣu cārum kṛtam brahmāṇi sūriṣu praśastā
translated: Make our sacrifice beautiful in the assemblies, make our prayers excellent among the nobles.

original: upo rayir devajūto na etu pra ṇa spārhābhir ūtibhis tiretam //
analyzed: upa u rayiḥ deva jūtaḥ naḥ etu pra naḥ spārhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ tiretam
translated: May wealth, inspired by the gods, come to us, and may it surpass with its desirable aids.

original: asme indrāvaruṇā viśvavāraṃ rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantam purukṣum /
analyzed: asme indrāvaruṇāḥ viśva vāram rayim dhattam vasumantam purukṣum
translated: O Indra and Varuna, grant us wealth that is all-giving, rich in goods and grain.

original: pra ya ādityo anṛtā mināty amitā śūro dayate vasūni //
analyzed: pra yaḥ ādityaḥ anṛtā mināti amitā śūraḥ dayate vasūni
translated: The unlimited, the hero, the sun, distributes treasures, passing over the untrue.

original: iyam indraṃ varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā /
analyzed: iyam indram varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā
translated: This my song has brought Indra and Varuna to help in the birth of my child.

original: suratnāso devavītiṃ gamema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: su ratnāsaḥ deva vītim gamema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May we go to the feast of the gods, rich in treasures. Do ye, O ye two, protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: punīṣe vām arakṣasam manīṣāṃ somam indrāya varuṇāya juhvat /
analyzed: punīṣe vām arakṣasam manīṣām somam indrāya varuṇāya juhvat
translated: I purify for you the thought free from guile, offering the Soma to Indra and Varuna.

original: ghṛtapratīkām uṣasaṃ na devīṃ tā no yāmann uruṣyatām abhīke //🔽spardhante vā u devahūye atra yeṣu dhvajeṣu didyavaḥ patanti /🔽yuvaṃ tāṃ indrāvaruṇāv amitrān hatam parācaḥ śarvā viṣūcaḥ //
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkām uṣasam na devīm tāḥ naḥ yāman uruṣyatām abhīke  spardhante vai u deva hūye atra yeṣu dhvajeṣu didyavaḥ patanti  yuvam tām indrāvaruṇau amitrān hatam parācaḥ śarvā viṣūcaḥ
translated: The divine Dawn, whose face is turned towards the ghee, may they protect us on our way, in the conflict.🔽Ye two, O Indra and Varuna, do ye slay those enemies who strive against us here at the invocation of the gods, in whose banners the arrows fall.🔽Ye two, O Indra and Varuna, slay those enemies who are turned away, who are violent and wide-spread.

original: āpaś cid dhi svayaśasaḥ sadassu devīr indraṃ varuṇaṃ devatā dhuḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ cit hi sva yaśasaḥ sadassu devīḥ indram varuṇam devatāḥ dhuḥ
translated: Even the self-shining waters, the divine ones, have brought Indra and Varuna to the assemblies.

original: kṛṣṭīr anyo dhārayati praviktā vṛtrāṇy anyo apratīni hanti //
analyzed: kṛṣṭīḥ anyaḥ dhārayati praviktāḥ vṛtrāṇi anyaḥ apratīni hanti
translated: One of them supports the widely spread people, the other slays the unconquered Vr̥itras.

original: sa sukratur ṛtacid astu hotā ya āditya śavasā vāṃ namasvān /
analyzed: sa sukratuḥ ṛta cit astu hotā yaḥ āditya śavasā vām namasvān
translated: May he, the wise, the true, be the Hotar, who, with his might, bowing, turns to you, O Adityas.

original: āvavartad avase vāṃ haviṣmān asad it sa suvitāya prayasvān //
analyzed: āvavartat avase vām haviṣmān asat id sa suvitāya prayasvān
translated: He, bringing oblations, has turned to you for help; he shall be ready for your easy favour.

original: iyam indraṃ varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā /
analyzed: iyam indram varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā
translated: This my song has brought Indra and Varuna to help in the birth of my child.

original: suratnāso devavītiṃ gamema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽dhīrā tv asya mahinā janūṃṣi vi yas tastambha rodasī cid urvī /
analyzed: su ratnāsaḥ deva vītim gamema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  dhīrā tu asya mahinā janūṃṣi vi yaḥ tastambha rodasī cit urvī
translated: May we go to the abode of the gods, rich in good things. Do ye, O ye, protect us evermore with blessings.🔽But the wise one, by his greatness, hath extended his generations, who hath propped up the two vast worlds.

original: pra nākam ṛṣvaṃ nunude bṛhantaṃ dvitā nakṣatram paprathac ca bhūma //
analyzed: pra nākam ṛṣvam nunude bṛhantam dvitā nakṣatram paprathat ca bhūma
translated: He hath pushed up the lofty vault, the lofty constellation, and hath extended the earth.

original: uta svayā tanvā saṃ vade tat kadā nv antar varuṇe bhuvāni /
analyzed: uta svayā tanvā sam vade tat kadā nu antar varuṇe bhuvāni
translated: And may I agree with him in my own body. When now shall I be within Varuna?

original: kim me havyam ahṛṇāno juṣeta kadā mṛḷīkaṃ sumanā abhi khyam //🔽pṛcche tad eno varuṇa didṛkṣūpo emi cikituṣo vipṛccham /
analyzed: kim me havyam a hṛṇānaḥ juṣeta kadā mṛḷīkam sumanāḥ abhi khyam  pṛcche tat enaḥ varuṇa didṛkṣu upa u emi cikituṣaḥ vipṛccham
translated: What offering of mine, not grudging, will he accept? When will he, well-disposed, look on me with favour?🔽I ask thee this, O Varuna, desiring to see thee. I come to thee, O wise one, to ask.

original: samānam in me kavayaś cid āhur ayaṃ ha tubhyaṃ varuṇo hṛṇīte //
analyzed: samānam id me kavayaḥ cit āhuḥ ayam ha tubhyam varuṇaḥ hṛṇīte
translated: The wise ones have told me this in common. This Varuna is angry with thee.

original: kim āga āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭhaṃ yat stotāraṃ jighāṃsasi sakhāyam /
analyzed: kim āgaḥ āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭham yat stotāram jighāṃsasi sakhāyam
translated: What is the highest offence, O Varuna, that thou seekest to slay thy praiser, thy friend?

original: pra tan me voco dūḷabha svadhāvo 'va tvānenā namasā tura iyām //
analyzed: pra tat me vocaḥ dūḍabha svadhāvas va tvā anena namasā turaḥ iyām
translated: Declare that to me, O thou of easy access, O thou of easy access, I will come to thee with this homage.

original: ava drugdhāni pitryā sṛjā no 'va yā vayaṃ cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ /
analyzed: ava drugdhāni pitryā sṛja naḥ va yā vayam cakṛma tanūbhiḥ
translated: Deliver us from the secret sins of our fathers, and from those which we have committed with our bodies.

original: ava rājan paśutṛpaṃ na tāyuṃ sṛjā vatsaṃ na dāmno vasiṣṭham //
analyzed: ava rājan paśutṛpam na tāyum sṛja vatsam na dāmnaḥ vasiṣṭham
translated: Deliver, O king, the cattle-loving one, the greedy one, as a calf from the stall, the most excellent one.

original: na sa svo dakṣo varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyur vibhīdako acittiḥ /
analyzed: na sa svaḥ dakṣaḥ varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyuḥ vibhīdakaḥ acittiḥ
translated: That is not his own, O Varuna, that is your firm decree, the god, the anger, the terrible, the thought.

original: asti jyāyān kanīyasa upāre svapnaś caned anṛtasya prayotā //
analyzed: asti jyāyān kanīyasaḥ upāre svapnaḥ cana id anṛtasya prayotā
translated: There is a greater one than the lesser in the flood. Sleep is indeed the instigator of untruth.

original: araṃ dāso na mīḷhuṣe karāṇy ahaṃ devāya bhūrṇaye 'nāgāḥ /
analyzed: aram dāsaḥ na mīḍhuṣe karāṇi aham devāya bhūrṇaye nāgāḥ
translated: I will make my hands serviceable for the greedy god, I, the sinner, for the impetuous god.

original: acetayad acito devo aryo gṛtsaṃ rāye kavitaro junāti //
analyzed: acetayat acitaḥ devaḥ aryaḥ gṛtsam rāye kavitaraḥ junāti
translated: The wise god, the holy one, has made the thought for the one without thought. He joins the singer to wealth.

original: ayaṃ su tubhyaṃ varuṇa svadhāvo hṛdi stoma upaśritaś cid astu /
analyzed: ayam su tubhyam varuṇa svadhāvas hṛdi stomaḥ upaśritaḥ cit astu
translated: This praise, O Varuna, of thine, O thou of true law, may be ever present in thy heart.

original: śaṃ naḥ kṣeme śam u yoge no astu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ kṣeme śam u yoge naḥ astu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Be peace to us in our abode, and peace to us in our union. Do ye, O ye gods, protect us evermore with your protections.

original: radat patho varuṇaḥ sūryāya prārṇāṃsi samudriyā nadīnām /
analyzed: radat pathaḥ varuṇaḥ sūryāya pra arṇāṃsi samudriyā nadīnām
translated: Varuna has opened the paths for the sun, the ocean-like waters of the rivers.

original: sargo na sṛṣṭo arvatīr ṛtāyañ cakāra mahīr avanīr ahabhyaḥ //🔽ātmā te vāto raja ā navīnot paśur na bhūrṇir yavase sasavān /🔽antar mahī bṛhatī rodasīme viśvā te dhāma varuṇa priyāṇi //
analyzed: sargaḥ na sṛṣṭaḥ arvatīḥ ṛtāyam cakāra mahīḥ avanīḥ ahabhyaḥ  ātmā te vātaḥ rajaḥ ā navīnot paśuḥ na bhūrṇiḥ yavase sasavān  antar mahī bṛhatī rodasī ime viśvā te dhāma varuṇa priyāṇi
translated: The creator has created the wide, flowing rivers for the holy one, the great, the all-pervading ones for the days.🔽Thy breath, O Varuna, has moved in the region, like a swift animal in the pasture, full of sap.🔽In the great, wide-extended heaven and earth, O Varuna, all thy dear abodes.

original: pari spaśo varuṇasya smadiṣṭā ubhe paśyanti rodasī sumeke /
analyzed: pari spaśaḥ varuṇasya smadiṣṭāḥ ubhe paśyanti rodasī sumeke
translated: The spies of Varuna, well-appointed, behold both the well-formed heavens and earth.

original: ṛtāvānaḥ kavayo yajñadhīrāḥ pracetaso ya iṣayanta manma //
analyzed: ṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ yajña dhīrāḥ pracetasaḥ ye iṣayanta manma
translated: The truthful, wise, sacrificial priests, the far-seeing ones who carry out my thought.

original: uvāca me varuṇo medhirāya triḥ sapta nāmāghnyā bibharti /
analyzed: uvāca me varuṇaḥ medhirāya tris sapta nāma aghnyā bibharti
translated: Varuna told me to the wise one: He bears the three times seven inviolable names.

original: vidvān padasya guhyā na vocad yugāya vipra uparāya śikṣan //
analyzed: vidvān padasya guhyā na vocat yugāya vipraḥ uparāya śikṣan
translated: The wise one, knowing the secret of the word, did not speak it to the young brahmin who was learning for the sake of the age.

original: tisro dyāvo nihitā antar asmin tisro bhūmīr uparāḥ ṣaḍvidhānāḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ dyāvaḥ nihitāḥ antar asmin tisraḥ bhūmīḥ uparāḥ ṣaṣ vidhānāḥ
