translated: Three heavens are placed within this, three earths are the lower six-formed ones.

original: gṛtso rājā varuṇaś cakra etaṃ divi preṅkhaṃ hiraṇyayaṃ śubhe kam //
analyzed: gṛtsaḥ rājā varuṇaḥ cakre etam divi preṅkham hiraṇyayam śubhe kam
translated: King Gritsa and Varuna have made this, the beautiful ornament, the golden one that moves in the sky.

original: ava sindhuṃ varuṇo dyaur iva sthād drapso na śveto mṛgas tuviṣmān /
analyzed: ava sindhum varuṇaḥ dyauḥ iva sthāt drapsaḥ na śvetaḥ mṛgaḥ tuviṣmān
translated: Varuna stands over the river like the sky, the powerful white deer-like drop.

original: gambhīraśaṃso rajaso vimānaḥ supārakṣatraḥ sato asya rājā //
analyzed: gambhīra śaṃsaḥ rajasaḥ vimānaḥ su pāra kṣatraḥ sataḥ asya rājā
translated: The one with deep praise, the measurer of space, the king of this existence, with well-protected power.

original: yo mṛḷayāti cakruṣe cid āgo vayaṃ syāma varuṇe anāgāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mṛḍayāti cakruṣe cit āgaḥ vayam syāma varuṇe anāgāḥ
translated: He who would be gracious even to the sinner - may we be sinless before Varuna.

original: anu vratāny aditer ṛdhanto yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: anu vratāni aditeḥ ṛdhantaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Following the ordinances of Aditi, prospering, do you all protect us with your blessings evermore.

original: pra śundhyuvaṃ varuṇāya preṣṭhām matiṃ vasiṣṭha mīḷhuṣe bharasva /
analyzed: pra śundhyuvam varuṇāya preṣṭhām matim vasiṣṭha mīḍhuṣe bharasva
translated: O Vasishtha, bring forth the most excellent thought to Varuna, the bountiful one, the pure one.

original: ya īm arvāñcaṃ karate yajatraṃ sahasrāmaghaṃ vṛṣaṇam bṛhantam //
analyzed: yaḥ īm arvāñcam karate yajatram sahasrāmagham vṛṣaṇam bṛhantam
translated: He who brings hither the worthy of sacrifice, the thousand-fold giver, the mighty, the great one.

original: adhā nv asya saṃdṛśaṃ jaganvān agner anīkaṃ varuṇasya maṃsi /
analyzed: adhā nu asya saṃdṛśam jaganvān agneḥ anīkam varuṇasya maṃsi
translated: Then, having found the sight of him, the face of Agni, I have thought of Varuna.

original: svar yad aśmann adhipā u andho 'bhi mā vapur dṛśaye ninīyāt //
analyzed: svar yat aśman adhipāḥ u andhaḥ bhi mā vapuḥ dṛśaye ninīyāt
translated: When the light is on the stone, may the lord of the waters lead me to the sight of his form.

original: ā yad ruhāva varuṇaś ca nāvam pra yat samudram īrayāva madhyam /
analyzed: ā yat ruhāva varuṇaḥ ca nāvam pra yat samudram īrayāva madhyam
translated: When we two, Varuna and I, have mounted the boat, when we have set the ocean in motion,

original: adhi yad apāṃ snubhiś carāva pra preṅkha īṅkhayāvahai śubhe kam //
analyzed: adhi yat apām snubhiḥ carāva pra preṅkhe īṅkhayāvahai śubhe kam
translated: When we have gone on the waves of the waters, we shall move to and fro for some good fortune.

original: vasiṣṭhaṃ ha varuṇo nāvy ādhād ṛṣiṃ cakāra svapā mahobhiḥ /
analyzed: vasiṣṭham ha varuṇaḥ nāvi ādhāt ṛṣim cakāra su apāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: Varuna placed Vasistha in a boat, and made the Rishi his own with great powers.

original: stotāraṃ vipraḥ sudinatve ahnāṃ yān nu dyāvas tatanan yād uṣāsaḥ //
analyzed: stotāram vipraḥ sudina tve ahnām yāt nu dyāvaḥ tatanan yāt uṣāsaḥ
translated: The sage (made him) a praiser at the bright time of day, O you who have stretched out the heavens and the dawns.

original: kva tyāni nau sakhyā babhūvuḥ sacāvahe yad avṛkam purā cit /
analyzed: kva tyāni nau sakhyā babhūvuḥ sacāvahe yat avṛkam purā cit
translated: Where have those friendships of ours been, which we two had when there was no enmity?

original: bṛhantam mānaṃ varuṇa svadhāvaḥ sahasradvāraṃ jagamā gṛhaṃ te //
analyzed: bṛhantam mānam varuṇa svadhāvas sahasra dvāram jagama gṛham te
translated: To your house, O Varuna of true nature, we have come, the lofty abode with a thousand doors.

original: ya āpir nityo varuṇa priyaḥ san tvām āgāṃsi kṛṇavat sakhā te /🔽mā ta enasvanto yakṣin bhujema yandhi ṣmā vipra stuvate varūtham //
analyzed: yaḥ āpiḥ nityaḥ varuṇa priyaḥ san tvām āgāṃsi kṛṇavat sakhā te  mā te enasvantaḥ yakṣin bhujema yandhi sma vipra stuvate varūtham
translated: You who are the ever-present guest, O Varuna, being dear, have made these offerings to you, O friend.🔽May we not be injured, O you who punish the guilty, grant protection to the sage who praises you.

original: dhruvāsu tvāsu kṣitiṣu kṣiyanto vy asmat pāśaṃ varuṇo mumocat /
analyzed: dhruvāsu tvā āsu kṣitiṣu kṣiyantaḥ vi asmat pāśam varuṇaḥ mumocat
translated: Living in these firm abodes, Varuna has loosed the bond from us.

original: avo vanvānā aditer upasthād yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: avaḥ vanvānāḥ aditeḥ upasthāt yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Seeking your favour, O Aditi, from the place of Aditi, protect us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

original: mo ṣu varuṇa mṛnmayaṃ gṛhaṃ rājann ahaṃ gamam /
analyzed: mā u su varuṇa mṛd mayam gṛham rājan aham gamam
translated: O King Varuna, I come not to thy house of clay.

original: mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya //
analyzed: mṛḷa su kṣatra mṛḍaya
translated: Be gracious, O thou of good dominion, be gracious to me.

original: yad emi prasphurann iva dṛtir na dhmāto adrivaḥ /
analyzed: yat emi prasphuran iva dṛtiḥ na dhmātaḥ adrivas
translated: When I go forth, trembling as it were, like a bellows that is not blown, O thou of the thunderbolt.

original: mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya //🔽kratvaḥ samaha dīnatā pratīpaṃ jagamā śuce /
analyzed: mṛḷa su kṣatra mṛḍaya  kratvaḥ samaha dīna tā pratīpam jagama śuce
translated: Be gracious, O thou of good dominion, be gracious to me.🔽O thou of good dominion, I have gone to the opposite side of the low place, O thou of pure strength.

original: mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya //
analyzed: mṛḷa su kṣatra mṛḍaya
translated: Be gracious, O thou of good dominion, be gracious to me.

original: apām madhye tasthivāṃsaṃ tṛṣṇāvidaj jaritāram /
analyzed: apām madhye tasthivāṃsam tṛṣṇā vidat jaritāram
translated: The singer who has stood in the midst of the waters, who has been afflicted with thirst, O thou of the thunderbolt.

original: mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya //
analyzed: mṛḷa su kṣatra mṛḍaya
translated: Be gracious, O thou of good dominion, be gracious to me.

original: yat kiṃ cedaṃ varuṇa daivye jane 'bhidroham manuṣyāś carāmasi /
analyzed: yat kim ca idam varuṇa daivye jane bhidroham manuṣyāḥ carāmasi
translated: Whatever sin we commit, O Varuna, in the divine people, or whatever men do against us,

original: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā nas tasmād enaso deva rīriṣaḥ //🔽pra vīrayā śucayo dadrire vām adhvaryubhir madhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ /🔽vaha vāyo niyuto yāhy acchā pibā sutasyāndhaso madāya //
analyzed: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā naḥ tasmāt enasaḥ deva rīriṣaḥ  pra vīrayā śucayaḥ dadrire vām adhvaryubhiḥ madhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ  vaha vāyo niyutaḥ yāhi acchā piba sutasya andhasaḥ madāya
translated: If we disregard thy laws, O God, do not afflict us with that sin.🔽The pure (waters) have flowed forth with hero strength to you, the sweet juices with the Adhvaryus.🔽Bring thy teams, O Vayu, come hither; drink of the juice of the Soma for thy delight.

original: īśānāya prahutiṃ yas ta ānaṭ chuciṃ somaṃ śucipās tubhyaṃ vāyo /
analyzed: īśānāya prahutim yaḥ te ānaṭ śucim somam śuci pāḥ tubhyam vāyo
translated: He who has brought the offering to the lord, the pure Soma to thee, O Vayu, who drinkest the pure (waters).

original: kṛṇoṣi tam martyeṣu praśastaṃ jātojāto jāyate vājy asya //
analyzed: kṛṇoṣi tam martyeṣu praśastam jātaḥ jātaḥ jāyate vājī asya
translated: Thou makest him to be extolled among mortals; born again and again, the strong one is born of him.

original: rāye nu yaṃ jajñatū rodasīme rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam /
analyzed: rāye nu yam jajñatuḥ rodasī ime rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam
translated: For wealth was he born whom the two world-halves have generated; for wealth the divine Dhisana nourishes the god.

original: adha vāyuṃ niyutaḥ saścata svā uta śvetaṃ vasudhitiṃ nireke //🔽ucchann uṣasaḥ sudinā ariprā uru jyotir vividur dīdhyānāḥ /
analyzed: adha vāyum niyutaḥ saścata svāḥ uta śvetam vasu dhitim nireke  ucchan uṣasaḥ su dināḥ ariprāḥ uru jyotiḥ vividuḥ dīdhyānāḥ
translated: Now the teams follow Vayu, and the white Vasudhiti in the front.🔽The dawns have risen, with fair days, free from guile; they, reflecting, have found wide light.

original: gavyaṃ cid ūrvam uśijo vi vavrus teṣām anu pradivaḥ sasrur āpaḥ //
analyzed: gavyam cit ūrvam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ teṣām anu pradivaḥ sasruḥ āpaḥ
translated: The eager ones have opened even the stall of the cow; after them the days have flowed on.

original: te satyena manasā dīdhyānāḥ svena yuktāsaḥ kratunā vahanti /
analyzed: te satyena manasā dīdhyānāḥ svena yuktāsaḥ kratunā vahanti
translated: They, reflecting with a mind that is true, carry (the sacrifice) with their own union and with their own will.

original: indravāyū vīravāhaṃ rathaṃ vām īśānayor abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante //
analyzed: indra vāyū vīra vāham ratham vām īśānayoḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante
translated: To your chariot, O Indra and Vayu, which carries heroes, the portions attend, of you two who are lords.

original: īśānāso ye dadhate svar ṇo gobhir aśvebhir vasubhir hiraṇyaiḥ /
analyzed: īśānāsaḥ ye dadhate svar naḥ gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ vasubhiḥ hiraṇyaiḥ
translated: Those who are lords, who bestow on us heaven, with cattle, with horses, with treasures, with gold,

original: indravāyū sūrayo viśvam āyur arvadbhir vīraiḥ pṛtanāsu sahyuḥ //
analyzed: indra vāyū sūrayaḥ viśvam āyuḥ arvadbhiḥ vīraiḥ pṛtanāsu sahyuḥ
translated: O Indra and Vayu, the rich ones, with their horses and heroes, may they be able to endure all life in the battles.

original: arvanto na śravaso bhikṣamāṇā indravāyū suṣṭutibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: arvantaḥ na śravasaḥ bhikṣamāṇāḥ indra vāyū suṣṭutibhiḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Like horses seeking glory, O Indra and Vayu, the Vasishthas with their praises,

original: vājayantaḥ sv avase huvema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vājayantaḥ su avase huvema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: extolling you, we will call on you for protection. Do you, O (gods), protect us evermore with blessings.

original: kuvid aṅga namasā ye vṛdhāsaḥ purā devā anavadyāsa āsan /
analyzed: kuvid aṅga namasā ye vṛdhāsaḥ purā devāḥ anavadyāsaḥ āsan
translated: Who, indeed, by worship, in the days of old, the Gods who were free from blame, the strengtheners?

original: te vāyave manave bādhitāyāvāsayann uṣasaṃ sūryeṇa //
analyzed: te vāyave manave bādhitāya avāsayan uṣasam sūryeṇa
translated: They caused to dwell with Vayu, with man, with the afflicted, with the dawn, with the sun.

original: uśantā dūtā na dabhāya gopā māsaś ca pāthaḥ śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: uśantā dūtā na dabhāya gopā māsaḥ ca pāthaḥ śaradaḥ ca pūrvīḥ
translated: The eager messengers, the guardians against deceit, the months, and the many autumns,

original: indravāyū suṣṭutir vām iyānā mārḍīkam īṭṭe suvitaṃ ca navyam //
analyzed: indra vāyū suṣṭutiḥ vām iyānā mārḍīkam īṭṭe suvitam ca navyam
translated: Indra and Vayu, seeking your praise, bring you the favor and the new prosperity.

original: pīvoannāṃ rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ /
analyzed: pīvaḥ annām rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ
translated: The white one, rich in food, increasing wealth, of good thought, flows to the company, to the beautiful one.

original: te vāyave samanaso vi tasthur viśven naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ //
analyzed: te vāyave samanasaḥ vi tasthuḥ viśvā id naraḥ su apatyāni cakruḥ
translated: They, of one mind, have settled for Vayu. All the men have performed their own duties.

original: yāvat taras tanvo yāvad ojo yāvan naraś cakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat taraḥ tanvaḥ yāvat ojaḥ yāvat naraḥ cakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ
translated: As far as the bodies, as far as the strength, as far as the men, thinking with the eye,

original: śuciṃ somaṃ śucipā pātam asme indravāyū sadatam barhir edam //
analyzed: śucim somam śuci pā pātam asme indra vāyū sadatam barhiḥ ā idam
translated: Drink the pure Soma, O you who drink the pure, for us, O Indra and Vayu, sit on this sacred grass.

original: niyuvānā niyuta spārhavīrā indravāyū sarathaṃ yātam arvāk /
analyzed: niyuvānā niyutaḥ spārha vīrāḥ indra vāyū sa ratham yātam arvāk
translated: You two, O Indra and Vayu, with your teams, with your teams, with your desirable heroes, come hither in your chariot.

original: idaṃ hi vām prabhṛtam madhvo agram adha prīṇānā vi mumuktam asme //
analyzed: idam hi vām prabhṛtam madhvaḥ agram adha prīṇānā vi mumuktam asme
translated: For this is your share, the first of the sweet offerings. Having delighted us, be released among us.

original: yā vāṃ śataṃ niyuto yāḥ sahasram indravāyū viśvavārāḥ sacante /
analyzed: yāḥ vām śatam niyutaḥ yāḥ sahasram indra vāyū viśva vārāḥ sacante
translated: Those of you who have a hundred teams, who have a thousand, O Indra and Vayu, who are sought by all, follow.

original: ābhir yātaṃ suvidatrābhir arvāk pātaṃ narā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ //
analyzed: ābhiḥ yātam suvidatrābhiḥ arvāk pātam narā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ
translated: Come hither with these friendly ones; protect, O Heroes, the offered mead.

original: arvanto na śravaso bhikṣamāṇā indravāyū suṣṭutibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: arvantaḥ na śravasaḥ bhikṣamāṇāḥ indra vāyū suṣṭutibhiḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: The Vasishthas, O Indra and Vayu, like horses seeking glory, with their praises,

original: vājayantaḥ sv avase huvema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vājayantaḥ su avase huvema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: while they delight you, call you to their help. Do ye preserve us evermore with your protections.

original: ā vāyo bhūṣa śucipā upa naḥ sahasraṃ te niyuto viśvavāra /
analyzed: ā vāyo bhūṣa śuci pāḥ upa naḥ sahasram te niyutaḥ viśva vāra
translated: Come hither, O Vayu, thou who drinkest the pure, to us, O thou of a thousand teams, O thou who givest all boons.

original: upo te andho madyam ayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam //
analyzed: upa u te andhaḥ madyam ayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam
translated: I bring thee the draught of Soma, of which thou, O God, hast the first drink.

original: pra sotā jīro adhvareṣv asthāt somam indrāya vāyave pibadhyai /
analyzed: pra sotā jīraḥ adhvareṣu asthāt somam indrāya vāyave pibadhyai
translated: The presser hath stood up, the singer, at the sacrifices, to make Indra and Vayu drink the Soma.

original: pra yad vām madhvo agriyam bharanty adhvaryavo devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ //🔽pra yābhir yāsi dāśvāṃsam acchā niyudbhir vāyav iṣṭaye duroṇe /
analyzed: pra yat vām madhvaḥ agriyam bharanti adhvaryavaḥ devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ  pra yābhiḥ yāsi dāśvāṃsam acchā niyudbhiḥ vāyo iṣṭaye duroṇe
translated: When the Adhvaryus, serving the Gods with their powers, bring you the first sweet draught of Soma.🔽With what teams, O Vayu, dost thou come to the worshipper, to the house for the sake of the offering?

original: ni no rayiṃ subhojasaṃ yuvasva ni vīraṃ gavyam aśvyaṃ ca rādhaḥ //
analyzed: ni naḥ rayim su bhojasam yuvasva ni vīram gavyam aśvyam ca rādhaḥ
translated: Bestow on us wealth which is good to enjoy, and bestow on us the gift of heroic strength in cattle and horses.

original: ye vāyava indramādanāsa ādevāso nitośanāso aryaḥ /
analyzed: ye vāyavaḥ indra mādanāsaḥ ādevāsaḥ nitośanāsaḥ aryaḥ
translated: O Vayu, those who delight in Indra, who are Gods, who are bountiful, who are good friends,

original: ghnanto vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ ṣyāma sāsahvāṃso yudhā nṛbhir amitrān //
analyzed: ghnantaḥ vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ syāma sāsahvāṃsaḥ yudhā nṛbhiḥ amitrān
translated: slaying the Vr̥itras, may we be prosperous with princes, and with men conquering our enemies in fight.

original: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhir adhvaraṃ sahasriṇībhir upa yāhi yajñam /
analyzed: ā naḥ niyudbhiḥ śatinībhiḥ adhvaram sahasriṇībhiḥ upa yāhi yajñam
translated: Come to our sacrifice with your teams of a hundred, with your teams of a thousand, come to the sacrifice.

original: vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: O Vayu, rejoice in this libation. Do you all protect us ever with your blessings.

original: śuciṃ nu stomaṃ navajātam adyendrāgnī vṛtrahaṇā juṣethām /🔽ubhā hi vāṃ suhavā johavīmi tā vājaṃ sadya uśate dheṣṭhā //
analyzed: śucim nu stomam nava jātam adyā indra agnī vṛtra haṇā juṣethām  ubhā hi vām su havā johavīmi tā vājam sadyas uśate dheṣṭhā
translated: Accept today, O Indra and Agni, the pure hymn, newly born, ye Vritra-slayers.🔽For I invoke you both, O ye who are easily invoked. Best givers of booty, grant us wealth without delay.

original: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtaṃ sākaṃvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṃsā /🔽kṣayantau rāyo yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktaṃ vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ //
analyzed: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtam sākaṃvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṃsā  kṣayantau rāyaḥ yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktam vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
translated: For ye are the two who have become the givers of good gifts, waxing strong together, waxing strong.🔽Bestowing wide-spread wealth of food and riches, grant us strength that is strong and vigorous.

original: upo ha yad vidathaṃ vājino gur dhībhir viprāḥ pramatim icchamānāḥ /
analyzed: upa u ha yat vidatham vājinaḥ guḥ dhībhiḥ viprāḥ pramatim icchamānāḥ
translated: When the strong ones approach the assembly, the sages, longing for favour with their thoughts,

original: arvanto na kāṣṭhāṃ nakṣamāṇā indrāgnī johuvato naras te //
analyzed: arvantaḥ na kāṣṭhām nakṣamāṇāḥ indra agnī johuvataḥ naraḥ te
translated: Like horses eager for the goal, O Indra and Agni, men invoke you.

original: gīrbhir vipraḥ pramatim icchamāna īṭṭe rayiṃ yaśasam pūrvabhājam /
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ vipraḥ pramatim icchamānaḥ īṭṭe rayim yaśasam pūrvabhājam
translated: The sage, longing for favour with his songs, seeks wealth that is glorious, that is to be enjoyed by the first-born.

original: indrāgnī vṛtrahaṇā suvajrā pra no navyebhis tirataṃ deṣṇaiḥ //
analyzed: indra agnī vṛtra haṇā su vajrā pra naḥ navyebhiḥ tiratam deṣṇaiḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, slayers of Vrtra, with your good deeds, favour us with your new gifts.

original: saṃ yan mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite /
analyzed: sam yat mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite
translated: When the two great ones, contending, striving in heroic deeds, with the radiance of their forms,

original: adevayuṃ vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hataṃ somasutā janena //
analyzed: adevayum vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hatam soma sutā janena
translated: The godless one in the assembly of the godly, slain by the people who offer Soma.

original: imām u ṣu somasutim upa na endrāgnī saumanasāya yātam /
analyzed: imām u su soma sutim upa naḥ ā indra agnī saumanasāya yātam
translated: Come now to this pressing of the Soma, O Indra and Agni, come for our delight.

original: nū cid dhi parimamnāthe asmān ā vāṃ śaśvadbhir vavṛtīya vājaiḥ //
analyzed: nu cit hi parimamnāthe asmān ā vām śaśvadbhiḥ vavṛtīya vājaiḥ
translated: For you two surely have compassion on us; may I be able to serve you with ever-fresh powers.

original: so agna enā namasā samiddho 'cchā mitraṃ varuṇam indraṃ voceḥ /
analyzed: saḥ agne enā namasā samiddhaḥ u ccha mitram varuṇam indram voceḥ
translated: O Agni, kindled with this homage, call to us Mitra, Varuna, and Indra,

original: yat sīm āgaś cakṛmā tat su mṛḷa tad aryamāditiḥ śiśrathantu //
analyzed: yat sīm āgaḥ cakṛma tat su mṛḍa tat aryamā aditiḥ śiśrathantu
translated: Whatever fault we have committed, forgive it. May Aditi and Aryaman accept it.

original: etā agna āśuṣāṇāsa iṣṭīr yuvoḥ sacābhy aśyāma vājān /
analyzed: etāḥ agne āśuṣāṇāsaḥ iṣṭīḥ yuvoḥ sacā abhi aśyāma vājān
translated: O Agni, with these offerings may we quickly win the prizes that are to be gained by you two.

original: mendro no viṣṇur marutaḥ pari khyan yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: mā indraḥ naḥ viṣṇuḥ marutaḥ pari khyan yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May Indra, Vishnu, and the Maruts protect us. Do you all protect us evermore with blessings.

original: iyaṃ vām asya manmana indrāgnī pūrvyastutiḥ /
analyzed: iyam vām asya manmanaḥ indra agnī pūrvya stutiḥ
translated: This is your thought, O Indra and Agni, this ancient praise,

original: abhrād vṛṣṭir ivājani //
analyzed: abhrāt vṛṣṭiḥ iva ajani
translated: It has arisen like rain from the cloud.

original: śṛṇutaṃ jaritur havam indrāgnī vanataṃ giraḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇutam jarituḥ havam indra agnī vanatam giraḥ
translated: Listen to the singer's call, O Indra and Agni, accept the songs.

original: īśānā pipyataṃ dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: īśānā pipyatam dhiyaḥ
translated: O lords, make our thoughts prosper.

original: mā pāpatvāya no narendrāgnī mābhiśastaye /
analyzed: mā pāpa tvāya naḥ nara indra agnī mā abhiśastaye
translated: Do not lead us to sin, O Indra and Agni, do not to reproach.

original: mā no rīradhataṃ nide //
analyzed: mā naḥ rīradhatam nide
translated: Do not place us in distress.

original: indre agnā namo bṛhat suvṛktim erayāmahe /
analyzed: indre agnā namaḥ bṛhat suvṛktim erayāmahe
translated: To Indra and Agni we offer a great hymn of praise,

original: dhiyā dhenā avasyavaḥ //
analyzed: dhiyā dhenāḥ avasyavaḥ
translated: With thought, with song, with prayer.

original: tā hi śaśvanta īḷata itthā viprāsa ūtaye /
analyzed: tā hi śaśvantaḥ īḍate itthā viprāsaḥ ūtaye
translated: For they are ever to be invoked here by the sages for help,

original: sabādho vājasātaye //
analyzed: sabādhaḥ vājasātaye
translated: To conquer the foe in the winning of booty.

original: tā vāṃ gīrbhir vipanyavaḥ prayasvanto havāmahe /
analyzed: tā vām gīrbhiḥ vipanyavaḥ prayasvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We invoke you, O you who look to the people, with our songs, with our gifts,

original: medhasātā saniṣyavaḥ //
analyzed: medha sātā saniṣyavaḥ
translated: With our thoughts, O you who are to be gained.

original: indrāgnī avasā gatam asmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahā /
analyzed: indra agnī avasā gatam asmabhyam carṣaṇī sahā
translated: O Indra and Agni, come to us with help, you who conquer the people,

original: mā no duḥśaṃsa īśata //
analyzed: mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ īśata
translated: Let not the evil-wisher rule over us.

original: mā kasya no araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṅ martyasya /🔽indrāgnī śarma yacchatam //
analyzed: mā kasya naḥ a raruṣaḥ dhūrtiḥ praṇak martyasya  indra agnī śarma yacchatam
translated: Let not the wicked blow of any mortal come near us,🔽O Indra and Agni, grant us protection.

original: gomad dhiraṇyavad vasu yad vām aśvāvad īmahe /
analyzed: gomat hiraṇyavat vasu yat vām aśvāvat īmahe
translated: The wealth which we seek from you, O Indra and Agni, is rich in cattle and gold, and in horses,

original: indrāgnī tad vanemahi //
analyzed: indra agnī tat vanemahi
translated: That, O Indra and Agni, may we obtain.

original: yat soma ā sute nara indrāgnī ajohavuḥ /
analyzed: yat some ā sute naraḥ indra agnī ajohavuḥ
translated: When the men have pressed the Soma, O Indra and Agni, have been invoked,

original: saptīvantā saparyavaḥ //
analyzed: saptīvantā saparyavaḥ
translated: With the charioteer and the attendants.

original: ukthebhir vṛtrahantamā yā mandānā cid ā girā /
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ vṛtra hantamā yā mandānā cit ā girā
translated: You two, best slayers of Vrtra, with the songs of the pressing, even with the word,

original: āṅgūṣair āvivāsataḥ //
analyzed: āṅgūṣaiḥ āvivāsataḥ
translated: With the praises, have been invited.

original: tāv id duḥśaṃsam martyaṃ durvidvāṃsaṃ rakṣasvinam /
analyzed: tau id duḥśaṃsam martyam durvidvāṃsam rakṣasvinam
translated: You two have struck down the evil-wishing mortal, the one who knows not, the Raksas,

original: ābhogaṃ hanmanā hatam udadhiṃ hanmanā hatam //🔽pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasra eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇam āyasī pūḥ /
analyzed: ābhogam hanmanā hatam udadhim hanmanā hatam  pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasre eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇam āyasī pūḥ
translated: The one who lies in wait, have struck down, the one who is in the water, have struck down.🔽This Sarasvatī, the supporter, the stronghold of iron, has flowed forth with the flood and the oblation.

original: prabābadhānā rathyeva yāti viśvā apo mahinā sindhur anyāḥ //
analyzed: prabābadhānā rathyā iva yāti viśvāḥ apaḥ mahinā sindhuḥ anyāḥ
translated: She goes forth, like a chariot, opening up, with her greatness, all the waters, the other rivers.

original: ekācetat sarasvatī nadīnāṃ śucir yatī giribhya ā samudrāt /
analyzed: ekā acetat sarasvatī nadīnām śuciḥ yatī giribhyaḥ ā samudrāt
translated: This Sarasvatî, the pure one of the rivers, from the mountains and the sea, hath flowed to us.

original: rāyaś cetantī bhuvanasya bhūrer ghṛtam payo duduhe nāhuṣāya //
analyzed: rāyaḥ cetantī bhuvanasya bhūreḥ ghṛtam payaḥ duduhe nāhuṣāya
translated: She, thinking of wealth, of the wide world's riches, hath for Nâhusha milked out milk and ghee.

original: sa vāvṛdhe naryo yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśur vṛṣabho yajñiyāsu /
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhe naryaḥ yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśuḥ vṛṣabhaḥ yajñiyāsu
translated: He hath waxed great among the maidens, the men, the young bull, the strong bull among the holy ones.

original: sa vājinam maghavadbhyo dadhāti vi sātaye tanvam māmṛjīta //
analyzed: sa vājinam maghavadbhyaḥ dadhāti vi sātaye tanvam māmṛjīta
translated: He bestows the strong steed on the bountiful: he hath made ready his own body for the race.

original: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇopa śravat subhagā yajṇe asmin /
analyzed: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇā upa śravat subhagā yajṇe asmin
translated: And may Sarasvatî, accepting, listen to us, to this our sacrifice, most blessed One.

original: mitajñubhir namasyair iyānā rāyā yujā cid uttarā sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: mitajñubhiḥ namasyaiḥ iyānāḥ rāyā yujā cit uttarā sakhibhyaḥ
translated: May she, with those who bow and worship, come to us, and with wealth to our friends even more abundantly.

original: imā juhvānā yuṣmad ā namobhiḥ prati stomaṃ sarasvati juṣasva /
analyzed: imā juhvānā yuṣmat ā namobhiḥ prati stomam sarasvati juṣasva
translated: With this our ladle, O Sarasvatî, with our adorations, accept this laud of ours.

original: tava śarman priyatame dadhānā upa stheyāma śaraṇaṃ na vṛkṣam //
analyzed: tava śarman priyatame dadhānāḥ upa stheyāma śaraṇam na vṛkṣam
translated: May we, bestowing thee in our bosom, most dear, find shelter as beneath a tree.

original: ayam u te sarasvati vasiṣṭho dvārāv ṛtasya subhage vy āvaḥ /
analyzed: ayam u te sarasvati vasiṣṭhaḥ dvārau ṛtasya subhage vi āvaḥ
translated: This Vasishtba, O Sarasvatî, hath opened for thee the doors of sacrifice, O blessed One.

original: vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Increase, O bright one, the strength for the praiser: preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

original: bṛhad u gāyiṣe vaco 'suryā nadīnām /
analyzed: bṛhat u gāyiṣe vacaḥ suryā nadīnām
translated: I will sing forth a lofty hymn to the divine rivers.

original: sarasvatīm in mahayā suvṛktibhi stomair vasiṣṭha rodasī //
analyzed: sarasvatīm id mahaya suvṛktibhiḥ stomaiḥ vasiṣṭha rodasī
translated: Sarasvatî with great hymns, O Vasishtḥ, the two world-halves.

original: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ /
analyzed: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ
translated: When both thy bright regions, O thou of great power, the Pûrus overspread.

original: sā no bodhy avitrī marutsakhā coda rādho maghonām //
analyzed: sā naḥ bodhi avitrī marut sakhā coda rādhaḥ maghonām
translated: Be thou our helper, O thou that art not deceived, friend of the Maruts, impel the bounty of the bountiful.

original: bhadram id bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvaty akavārī cetati vājinīvatī /
analyzed: bhadram id bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvatī a kavārī cetati vājinīvatī
translated: May the auspicious Sarasvatî perform the auspicious rite. The bountiful one, not barren, is aware of it.

original: gṛṇānā jamadagnivat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭhavat //
analyzed: gṛṇānā jamadagni vat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭha vat
translated: Praised like Jamadagni, and lauded like Vasishtḥ.

original: janīyanto nv agravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: janīyantaḥ nu agravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ
translated: The bountiful ones, like brothers, the well-givers, like sons,

original: sarasvantaṃ havāmahe //
analyzed: sarasvantam havāmahe
translated: We invoke Sarasvatî.

original: ye te sarasva ūrmayo madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ /
analyzed: ye te sarasvas ūrmayaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ
translated: Those thy wave-currents, O Sarasvatî, which are full of sweetness, dropping with ghee,

original: tebhir no 'vitā bhava //
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ vitā bhava
translated: With them be thou our protector.

original: pīpivāṃsaṃ sarasvata stanaṃ yo viśvadarśataḥ /
analyzed: pīpivāṃsam sarasvataḥ stanam yaḥ viśva darśataḥ
translated: The swelling breast, O Sarasvatî, which thou hast, O thou that art seen of all,

original: bhakṣīmahi prajām iṣam //
analyzed: bhakṣīmahi prajām iṣam
translated: May we enjoy offspring and food.

original: yajñe divo nṛṣadane pṛthivyā naro yatra devayavo madanti /
analyzed: yajñe divaḥ nṛṣadane pṛthivyāḥ naraḥ yatra devayavaḥ madanti
translated: In the sacrifice of heaven, in the seat of men on earth, where men rejoice in the feast of the gods,

original: indrāya yatra savanāni sunve gaman madāya prathamaṃ vayaś ca //
analyzed: indrāya yatra savanāni sunve gamat madāya prathamam vayaḥ ca
translated: Where they press the libations for Indra, to the first gladdening and to the prime of life.

original: ā daivyā vṛṇīmahe 'vāṃsi bṛhaspatir no maha ā sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: ā daivyā vṛṇīmahe vāṃsi bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ mahaḥ ā sakhāyaḥ
translated: We choose the heavenly, the low-lying (waters), Br̥ihaspati is our great friend, our kinsmen.

original: yathā bhavema mīḷhuṣe anāgā yo no dātā parāvataḥ piteva //
analyzed: yathā bhavema mīḍhuṣe anāgāḥ yaḥ naḥ dātā parāvataḥ pitā iva
translated: That we may be without sin before the bountiful one, who from afar hath given us, as a father.

original: tam u jyeṣṭhaṃ namasā havirbhiḥ suśevam brahmaṇas patiṃ gṛṇīṣe /
analyzed: tam u jyeṣṭham namasā havirbhiḥ su śevam brahmaṇaḥ patim gṛṇīṣe
translated: I praise with reverence and offerings that most gracious Br̥ihaspati, the Lord of prayer, the eldest.

original: indraṃ śloko mahi daivyaḥ siṣaktu yo brahmaṇo devakṛtasya rājā //
analyzed: indram ślokaḥ mahi daivyaḥ siṣaktu yaḥ brahmaṇaḥ deva kṛtasya rājā
translated: Let the great heavenly hymn of praise attend on Indra, who is King of holy prayer and work of God.

original: sa ā no yoniṃ sadatu preṣṭho bṛhaspatir viśvavāro yo asti /
analyzed: saḥ ā naḥ yonim sadatu preṣṭhaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ viśva vāraḥ yaḥ asti
translated: May he, most welcome, sit in our own birthplace, Br̥ihaspati, who is the Lord of all our treasures.

original: kāmo rāyaḥ suvīryasya taṃ dāt parṣan no ati saścato ariṣṭān //🔽tam ā no arkam amṛtāya juṣṭam ime dhāsur amṛtāsaḥ purājāḥ /🔽śucikrandaṃ yajatam pastyānām bṛhaspatim anarvāṇaṃ huvema //
analyzed: kāmaḥ rāyaḥ su vīryasya tam dāt parṣat naḥ ati saścataḥ ariṣṭān  tam ā naḥ arkam amṛtāya juṣṭam ime dhāsuḥ amṛtāsaḥ purājāḥ  śuci krandam yajatam pastyānām bṛhaspatim anarvāṇam huvema
translated: May he bestow on us the wish, the boon of wealth and hero might. May he bear us beyond our foes, unharmed.🔽To him, the Immortal's friend, whom the immortal Ones of old have stablished, as a light for Amrit,🔽To Br̥ihaspati, the pure, the holy, the Priest of men, let us call, the irresistible.

original: taṃ śagmāso aruṣāso aśvā bṛhaspatiṃ sahavāho vahanti /
analyzed: tam śagmāsaḥ aruṣāsaḥ aśvāḥ bṛhaspatim sahavāhaḥ vahanti
translated: Steeds of a ruddy hue, strong horses, bring Br̥ihaspati, who hath the power of conquering,

original: sahaś cid yasya nīlavat sadhasthaṃ nabho na rūpam aruṣaṃ vasānāḥ //
analyzed: sahaḥ cit yasya nīlavat sadhastham nabhaḥ na rūpam aruṣam vasānāḥ
translated: Whose seat is like a sapphire, whose form is like the ruddy cloud, when clothed in robes.

original: sa hi śuciḥ śatapatraḥ sa śundhyur hiraṇyavāśīr iṣiraḥ svarṣāḥ /
analyzed: sa hi śuciḥ śata patraḥ sa śundhyuḥ hiraṇya vāśīḥ iṣiraḥ svarṣāḥ
translated: For he is pure, he hath a hundred leaves, he is the bright one, he whose hair is gold, the active, self-resplendent.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ sa svāveśa ṛṣvaḥ purū sakhibhya āsutiṃ kariṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ sa su āveśaḥ ṛṣvaḥ purū sakhibhyaḥ āsutim kariṣṭhaḥ
translated: Br̥ihaspati is he who hath his own abode, most liberal to his friends of many a gift.

original: devī devasya rodasī janitrī bṛhaspatiṃ vāvṛdhatur mahitvā /
analyzed: devī devasya rodasī janitrī bṛhaspatim vāvṛdhatuḥ mahitvā
translated: The Goddess and God, the two worlds, the mother, have increased Brihaspati's greatness.

original: dakṣāyyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ karad brahmaṇe sutarā sugādhā //
analyzed: dakṣāyyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ karat brahmaṇe sutarā su gādhā
translated: O friends, make him most skilful in the art of sacrifice, most accessible to the Brahman, most easy to approach.

original: iyaṃ vām brahmaṇas pate suvṛktir brahmendrāya vajriṇe akāri /
analyzed: iyam vām brahmaṇaḥ pate suvṛktiḥ brahma indrāya vajriṇe akāri
translated: This is your good hymn, O Brahmanaspati, the Brahman has been made for Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jigṛtam purandhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ //
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhiyaḥ jigṛtam purandhīḥ jajastam aryaḥ vanuṣām arātīḥ
translated: Stir up the thoughts that have entered, the wise ones, and destroy the evil designs of the enemies.

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya
translated: O Brihaspati, you two, and Indra, are the lords of wealth, of the heavenly and of the earthly.

original: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //🔽adhvaryavo 'ruṇaṃ dugdham aṃśuṃ juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām /
analyzed: dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ  adhvaryavaḥ ruṇam dugdham aṃśum juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
translated: Grant wealth even to the poor who praises you. Protect us always with your blessings.🔽O Adhvaryus, offer the red-coloured milk in the Amsu to the bull of the earth.

original: gaurād vedīyāṃ avapānam indro viśvāhed yāti sutasomam icchan //
analyzed: gaurāt vedīyān avapānam indraḥ viśvāhā id yāti suta somam icchan
translated: From the white one, Indra, desiring to go to the one who has pressed the Soma, should drink the remaining portion.

original: yad dadhiṣe pradivi cārv annaṃ divedive pītim id asya vakṣi /
analyzed: yat dadhiṣe pradivi cāru annam dive dive pītim id asya vakṣi
translated: When you enjoy the beautiful food on the surface of the earth, speak of his drink day by day.

original: uta hṛdota manasā juṣāṇa uśann indra prasthitān pāhi somān //
analyzed: uta hṛdā uta manasā juṣāṇaḥ uśan indra prasthitān pāhi somān
translated: Accepting with your heart and mind, O Indra, being pleased, protect the Somas that are offered.

original: jajñānaḥ somaṃ sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca /
analyzed: jajñānaḥ somam sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca
translated: Being born, you drank the Soma with might. Your mother spoke of your greatness.

original: endra paprāthorv antarikṣaṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha //
analyzed: ā indra paprātha uru antarikṣam yudhā devebhyaḥ varivaḥ cakartha
translated: O Indra, thou hast filled the wide air-space, and hast made room for the gods in battle.

original: yad yodhayā mahato manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān /
analyzed: yat yodhayā mahataḥ manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān
translated: When thou hast fought with the mighty who think themselves great, thou hast crushed them with thy arms, O thou who givest food.

original: yad vā nṛbhir vṛta indrābhiyudhyās taṃ tvayājiṃ sauśravasaṃ jayema //
analyzed: yat vā nṛbhiḥ vṛtaḥ indra abhiyudhyāḥ tam tvayā ājim sauśravasam jayema
translated: Or when we are encompassed by men, O Indra, in battle, may we win that fight through thee, and gain great glory.

original: prendrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra /
analyzed: pra indrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra
translated: I will proclaim the first deeds of Indra, and the new ones which the bountiful one has done.

original: yaded adevīr asahiṣṭa māyā athābhavat kevalaḥ somo asya //
analyzed: yadā id adevīḥ asahiṣṭa māyāḥ atha abhavat kevalaḥ somaḥ asya
translated: When the godless could not endure his might, then Soma became his only companion.

original: tavedaṃ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyaṃ yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya /
analyzed: tava idam viśvam abhitas paśavyam yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya
translated: This whole world around is thine, O Indra, which thou seest with the eye of the sun.

original: gavām asi gopatir eka indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ //
analyzed: gavām asi go patiḥ ekaḥ indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ
translated: Thou art the lord of cattle, thou art alone. May we enjoy the wealth which thou hast prepared.

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya
translated: O Brhaspati, ye two, Indra and thou, are the lords of wealth, of the heavenly and of the earthly.

original: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Grant riches even to the poor who sings your praise. Do ye, O ye, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: paro mātrayā tanvā vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anv aśnuvanti /
analyzed: paras mātrayā tanvā vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anu aśnuvanti
translated: Thou hast grown beyond measure with thy body. They do not attain to thy greatness.

original: ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyā viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse //
analyzed: ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyāḥ viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse
translated: We know both thy realms, O Vishnu, O god, thou knowest the highest of the two, O lord of the earth.

original: na te viṣṇo jāyamāno na jāto deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa /
analyzed: na te viṣṇo jāyamānaḥ na jātaḥ deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa
translated: O Viṣṇu, neither being born nor born hast thou, O god, attained the highest limit of greatness.

original: ud astabhnā nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantaṃ dādhartha prācīṃ kakubham pṛthivyāḥ //
analyzed: ud astabhnāḥ nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantam dādhartha prācīm kakubham pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Thou hast upheld the lofty, vast vault of the sky; thou hast fixed the eastern horizon of the earth.

original: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtaṃ sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā /
analyzed: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtam sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā
translated: Be thou who hast become rich in food, rich in milk, rich in good grass, for the sake of man.

original: vy astabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ //
analyzed: vi astabhnāḥ rodasī viṣṇo ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhitas mayūkhaiḥ
translated: Thou hast stretched out these two worlds, O Viṣṇu; thou hast fixed the earth on all sides with thy rays.

original: uruṃ yajñāya cakrathur u lokaṃ janayantā sūryam uṣāsam agnim /
analyzed: urum yajñāya cakrathuḥ u lokam janayantā sūryam uṣāsam agnim
translated: Ye have made a wide space for the sacrifice, generating the sun, the dawn, and Agni.

original: dāsasya cid vṛṣaśiprasya māyā jaghnathur narā pṛtanājyeṣu //
analyzed: dāsasya cit vṛṣaśiprasya māyāḥ jaghnathuḥ narā pṛtanājyeṣu
translated: Ye have slain the illusions of the Dāsa, O heroes, of the bull-browed one, in the battles for booty.

original: indrāviṣṇū dṛṃhitāḥ śambarasya nava puro navatiṃ ca śnathiṣṭam /
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū dṛṃhitāḥ śambarasya nava puraḥ navatim ca śnathiṣṭam
translated: O Indra and Viṣṇu, ye have shattered the nine-and-ninety forts of Śambara.

original: śataṃ varcinaḥ sahasraṃ ca sākaṃ hatho apraty asurasya vīrān //
analyzed: śatam varcinaḥ sahasram ca sākam hathaḥ aprati asurasya vīrān
translated: Ye have slain together a hundred Vr̥itras and a thousand of the Asura's heroes.

original: iyam manīṣā bṛhatī bṛhantorukramā tavasā vardhayantī /🔽rare vāṃ stomaṃ vidatheṣu viṣṇo pinvatam iṣo vṛjaneṣv indra //
analyzed: iyam manīṣā bṛhatī bṛhantā uru kramā tavasā vardhayantī  rare vām stomam vidatheṣu viṣṇo pinvatam iṣaḥ vṛjaneṣu indra
translated: This lofty hymn, O ye lofty ones, this hymn of wide steps, exalting you with its might,🔽I offer to you, O Viṣṇu, in the assemblies; fill ye the two bowls, O Indra, in the contests.

original: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam /
analyzed: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇo āsaḥ ā kṛṇomi tat me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
translated: I offer to thee, O Viṣṇu, the Vasat call; accept thou this offering of mine, O Śipiviṣṭa.

original: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo giro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayaḥ giraḥ me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May my songs, well-praised, make thee grow. Do ye all protect us evermore with blessings.

original: nū marto dayate saniṣyan yo viṣṇava urugāyāya dāśat /
analyzed: nu martaḥ dayate saniṣyan yaḥ viṣṇave urugāyāya dāśat
translated: Now the mortal who desires to give to thee, O Vishnu, the far-going one, is favoured.

original: pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāta etāvantaṃ naryam āvivāsāt //🔽tvaṃ viṣṇo sumatiṃ viśvajanyām aprayutām evayāvo matiṃ dāḥ /
analyzed: pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāte etāvantam naryam āvivāsāt  tvam viṣṇo sumatim viśvajanyām aprayutām eva yāvaḥ matim dāḥ
translated: He who has worshipped with his mind from ancient times, has obtained so much human wealth.🔽O Vishnu, give us the all-people-loving, unforgotten, ever-moving thought,

original: parco yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūrer aśvāvataḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ //
analyzed: parcaḥ yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūreḥ aśvāvataḥ puru ścandrasya rāyaḥ
translated: So that we may have the wealth of good life, full of cattle, rich in men, and full of food.

original: trir devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā /
analyzed: tris devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣaḥ etām vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā
translated: This god has spread out this earth in three steps, with a hundred powers through his greatness.

original: pra viṣṇur astu tavasas tavīyān tveṣaṃ hy asya sthavirasya nāma //
analyzed: pra viṣṇuḥ astu tavasaḥ tavīyān tveṣam hi asya sthavirasya nāma
translated: May Vishnu be stronger than the strong, for his name is 'the mighty one'.

original: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ kṣetrāya viṣṇur manuṣe daśasyan /
analyzed: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣaḥ etām kṣetrāya viṣṇuḥ manuṣe daśasyan
translated: This Vishnu has spread out this earth in ten directions, desiring to give it to Manu for a field.

original: dhruvāso asya kīrayo janāsa urukṣitiṃ sujanimā cakāra //🔽pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāmāryaḥ śaṃsāmi vayunāni vidvān /
analyzed: dhruvāsaḥ asya kīrayaḥ janāsaḥ uru kṣitim su janimā cakāra  pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāma aryaḥ śaṃsāmi vayunāni vidvān
translated: His people are firmly established, his subjects. He has made the earth wide and well-born.🔽Today, O Sipivishta, I, the noble one, knowing the ordinances, proclaim that name of thine.

original: taṃ tvā gṛṇāmi tavasam atavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke //
analyzed: tam tvā gṛṇāmi tavasam a tavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke
translated: Thee, the strong one among the weak, I praise, dwelling far away in this region.

original: kim it te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yad vavakṣe śipiviṣṭo asmi /
analyzed: kim id te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yat vavakṣe śipiviṣṭaḥ asmi
translated: What is to be said to thee, O Viṣṇu, when I, Śipiviṣṭa, have expanded?

original: mā varpo asmad apa gūha etad yad anyarūpaḥ samithe babhūtha //🔽vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam /
analyzed: mā varpaḥ asmat apa gūha etat yat anya rūpaḥ samithe babhūtha  vaṣaṭ te viṣṇo āsaḥ ā kṛṇomi tat me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
translated: Hide not from us this thy form, since thou hast become of another appearance in the assembly.🔽I offer thee praise, O Viṣṇu, accept this offering of mine, O Śipiviṣṭa.

original: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo giro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayaḥ giraḥ me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May my songs, well-sung, increase thee. Do ye, O Viṣṇu, protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: tisro vācaḥ pra vada jyotiragrā yā etad duhre madhudogham ūdhaḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ vācaḥ pra vada jyotiḥ agrāḥ yāḥ etat duhre madhu dogham ūdhaḥ
translated: Speak forth three voices, O Jyotis, whose udders yield this honey-flowing milk.

original: sa vatsaṃ kṛṇvan garbham oṣadhīnāṃ sadyo jāto vṛṣabho roravīti //
analyzed: sa vatsam kṛṇvan garbham oṣadhīnām sadyas jātaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti
translated: Making the calf, the embryo of the plants, the newly-born bull roars.

original: yo vardhana oṣadhīnāṃ yo apāṃ yo viśvasya jagato deva īśe /
analyzed: yaḥ vardhanaḥ oṣadhīnām yaḥ apām yaḥ viśvasya jagataḥ devaḥ īśe
translated: He who is the increaser of the plants, he who is of the waters, he who is the God who rules over all the world,

original: sa tridhātu śaraṇaṃ śarma yaṃsat trivartu jyotiḥ svabhiṣṭy asme //
analyzed: sa tri dhātu śaraṇam śarma yaṃsat trivartu jyotiḥ su abhiṣṭi asme
translated: May he, the three-formed one, grant us protection and shelter, may the three-turning light be our prosperity.

original: starīr u tvad bhavati sūta u tvad yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ /
analyzed: starīḥ u tvat bhavati sūte u tvat yathāvaśam tanvam cakre eṣaḥ
translated: The singer is dependent on thee, the reciter is dependent on thee. As he wills, he has made his body.

original: pituḥ payaḥ prati gṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ //
analyzed: pituḥ payaḥ prati gṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ
translated: The mother receives the milk of the father; by that the father grows, by that the son.

original: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthus tisro dyāvas tredhā sasrur āpaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ tisraḥ dyāvaḥ tredhā sasruḥ āpaḥ
translated: In whom all the worlds have stood, the three heavens have flowed in three ways, the waters,

original: trayaḥ kośāsa upasecanāso madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam //
analyzed: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ upasecanāsaḥ madhvaḥ ścotanti abhitas virapśam
translated: The three reservoirs, the sprinklings, the sweet honey drip around the cloud.

original: idaṃ vacaḥ parjanyāya svarāje hṛdo astv antaraṃ taj jujoṣat /
analyzed: idam vacaḥ parjanyāya sva rāje hṛdaḥ astu antaram tat jujoṣat
translated: Let this speech be in the heart for Parjanya, the self-ruling king, may he approve of it.

original: mayobhuvo vṛṣṭayaḥ santv asme supippalā oṣadhīr devagopāḥ //
analyzed: mayobhuvaḥ vṛṣṭayaḥ santu asme su pippalāḥ oṣadhīḥ deva gopāḥ
translated: May the rain-showers be refreshing to us, and the plants well-filled with grain, protected by the gods.

original: sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnāṃ tasminn ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca /
analyzed: sa retaḥ dhāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām tasmin ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca
translated: He is the seed-sower, the bull of the everlasting ones, in him is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.

original: tan ma ṛtam pātu śataśāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: tat me ṛtam pātu śata śāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May that truth protect me for a hundred autumns. Do you all protect us ever with your blessings.

original: parjanyāya pra gāyata divas putrāya mīḷhuṣe /
analyzed: parjanyāya pra gāyata divas putrāya mīḍhuṣe
translated: Sing forth to Parjanya, to the son of heaven, to the rain-shower.

original: sa no yavasam icchatu //
analyzed: sa naḥ yavasam icchatu
translated: May he desire our fodder for the cattle.

original: yo garbham oṣadhīnāṃ gavāṃ kṛṇoty arvatām /
analyzed: yaḥ garbham oṣadhīnām gavām kṛṇoti arvatām
translated: He who produces the embryo of the plants, of the cows, of the horses,

original: parjanyaḥ puruṣīṇām //
analyzed: parjanyaḥ puruṣīṇām
translated: Parjanya of human beings.

original: tasmā id āsye havir juhotā madhumattamam /
analyzed: tasmai id āsye haviḥ juhota madhumattamam
translated: To him in his mouth let us offer the oblation, the sweetest of the sweet.

original: iḷāṃ naḥ saṃyataṃ karat //
analyzed: iḷām naḥ saṃyatam karat
translated: May he make us possess food in abundance.

original: saṃvatsaraṃ śaśayānā brāhmaṇā vratacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: saṃvatsaram śaśayānāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vrata cāriṇaḥ
translated: The Brahmanas, observing vows, have yearned for a year.

original: vācam parjanyajinvitām pra maṇḍūkā avādiṣuḥ //
analyzed: vācam parjanya jinvitām pra maṇḍūkāḥ avādiṣuḥ
translated: The frogs have croaked forth speech inspired by Parjanya.

original: divyā āpo abhi yad enam āyan dṛtiṃ na śuṣkaṃ sarasī śayānam /
analyzed: divyāḥ āpaḥ abhi yat enam āyan dṛtim na śuṣkam sarasī śayānam
translated: When the divine waters have come upon him, lying in the lake like a dry leather bag,

original: gavām aha na māyur vatsinīnām maṇḍūkānāṃ vagnur atrā sam eti //
analyzed: gavām aha na māyuḥ vatsinīnām maṇḍūkānām vagnuḥ atrā sam eti
translated: The voice of the young cows with calves, and the croaking of the frogs, all come together here.

original: yad īm enāṃ uśato abhy avarṣīt tṛṣyāvataḥ prāvṛṣy āgatāyām /
analyzed: yat īm enām uśataḥ abhī avarṣīt tṛṣyāvataḥ prāvṛṣi āgatāyām
translated: When he has rained upon this one who was eager, when the rainy season has come, the one who was thirsty,

original: akhkhalīkṛtyā pitaraṃ na putro anyo anyam upa vadantam eti //
analyzed: akhkhalīkṛtya pitaram na putraḥ anyaḥ anyam upa vadantam eti
translated: Like a son who has been scolded by his father, one goes to the other who is speaking.

original: anyo anyam anu gṛbhṇāty enor apām prasarge yad amandiṣātām /
analyzed: anyaḥ anyam anu gṛbhṇāti enoḥ apām prasarge yat amandiṣātām
translated: One grasps the other by the neck, when they have rejoiced in the outpouring of the waters.

original: maṇḍūko yad abhivṛṣṭaḥ kaniṣkan pṛśniḥ sampṛṅkte haritena vācam //
analyzed: maṇḍūkaḥ yat abhivṛṣṭaḥ kaniṣkan pṛśniḥ sampṛṅkte haritena vācam
translated: When the frog has been rained upon, the speckled one mixes his voice with the green one.

original: yad eṣām anyo anyasya vācaṃ śāktasyeva vadati śikṣamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yat eṣām anyaḥ anyasya vācam śāktasya iva vadati śikṣamāṇaḥ
translated: When one of them speaks the speech of another, as if learning to speak,

original: sarvaṃ tad eṣāṃ samṛdheva parva yat suvāco vadathanādhy apsu //
analyzed: sarvam tat eṣām samṛdhā iva parva yat su vācaḥ vadathana adhi apsu
translated: All that of them is like a festival, when you speak good words in the water.

original: gomāyur eko ajamāyur ekaḥ pṛśnir eko harita eka eṣām /
analyzed: go māyuḥ ekaḥ aja māyuḥ ekaḥ pṛśniḥ ekaḥ haritaḥ ekaḥ eṣām
translated: One is a jackal, one is a goat, one is speckled, one is green, of these.

original: samānaṃ nāma bibhrato virūpāḥ purutrā vācam pipiśur vadantaḥ //
analyzed: samānam nāma bibhrataḥ virūpāḥ purutrā vācam pipiśuḥ vadantaḥ
translated: Bearing the same name, they are of different forms, speaking, they have extended their voice in many ways.

original: brāhmaṇāso atirātre na some saro na pūrṇam abhito vadantaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāsaḥ atirātre na some saraḥ na pūrṇam abhitas vadantaḥ
translated: The Brahmanas, at the Atiratra, not at the Soma, speak around like a full lake.

original: saṃvatsarasya tad ahaḥ pari ṣṭha yan maṇḍūkāḥ prāvṛṣīṇam babhūva //
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya tat ahar pari stha yat maṇḍūkāḥ prāvṛṣīṇam babhūva
translated: That day of the year which is the rainy season with the frogs,

original: brāhmaṇāsaḥ somino vācam akrata brahma kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāsaḥ sominaḥ vācam akrata brahma kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam
translated: The Brahmins who offer Soma have uttered speech, making the prayer for the year.

original: adhvaryavo gharmiṇaḥ siṣvidānā āvir bhavanti guhyā na ke cit //
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ gharmiṇaḥ siṣvidānāḥ āvis bhavanti guhyāḥ na ke cit
translated: The Adhvaryus who offer the Gharma, sweating, become manifest, none of them are hidden.

original: devahitiṃ jugupur dvādaśasya ṛtuṃ naro na pra minanty ete /
analyzed: deva hitim jugupuḥ dvādaśasya ṛtum naraḥ na pra minanti ete
translated: They have taken up the invocation of the gods for the twelfth season, these men do not neglect it.

original: saṃvatsare prāvṛṣy āgatāyāṃ taptā gharmā aśnuvate visargam //
analyzed: saṃvatsare prāvṛṣi āgatāyām taptāḥ gharmāḥ aśnuvate visargam
translated: When the rainy season comes in the year, the heated Gharma obtains release.

original: gomāyur adād ajamāyur adāt pṛśnir adād dharito no vasūni /
analyzed: go māyuḥ adāt aja māyuḥ adāt pṛśniḥ adāt haritaḥ naḥ vasūni
translated: The jackal has given, the goat has given, the dappled one has given us wealth, the brown one.

original: gavām maṇḍūkā dadataḥ śatāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ //
analyzed: gavām maṇḍūkāḥ dadataḥ śatāni sahasrasāve pra tirante āyuḥ
translated: The frogs of the cows give hundreds, they extend life to one who has a thousand cows.

original: indrāsomā tapataṃ rakṣa ubjataṃ ny arpayataṃ vṛṣaṇā tamovṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: indrāsomā tapatam rakṣaḥ ubjatam ni arpayatam vṛṣaṇā tamaḥ vṛdhaḥ
translated: O Indra and Soma, burn the Rakshas, crush them, O bulls, throw them down who strengthen darkness.

original: parā śṛṇītam acito ny oṣataṃ hataṃ nudethāṃ ni śiśītam atriṇaḥ //
analyzed: parā śṛṇītam acitaḥ ni oṣatam hatam nudethām ni śiśītam atriṇaḥ
translated: Destroy the wicked, drive them away, crush the greedy ones, drive them down here.

original: indrāsomā sam aghaśaṃsam abhy aghaṃ tapur yayastu carur agnivāṃ iva /
analyzed: indrāsomā sam agha śaṃsam abhī agham tapuḥ yayastu caruḥ agnivān iva
translated: O Indra and Soma, smite down the evil-doer, burn him who is wicked, as if he had fire.

original: brahmadviṣe kravyāde ghoracakṣase dveṣo dhattam anavāyaṃ kimīdine //
analyzed: brahma dviṣe kravya ade ghora cakṣase dveṣaḥ dhattam anavāyam kimīdine
translated: Give hatred to the flesh-eater who hates the Brahman, to the one with a terrible eye, to the Kimīdin who cannot be overcome.

original: indrāsomā duṣkṛto vavre antar anārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam /
analyzed: indrāsomā duṣkṛtaḥ vavre antar an ārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam
translated: O Indra and Soma, pierce the wicked one into the darkness that has no support, into the darkness.

original: yathā nātaḥ punar ekaś canodayat tad vām astu sahase manyumac chavaḥ //
analyzed: yathā na atas punar ekaḥ cana udayat tat vām astu sahase manyumat śavaḥ
translated: So that not a single one of him may rise again, let that be your strength, your wrathful power, for victory.

original: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divo vadhaṃ sam pṛthivyā aghaśaṃsāya tarhaṇam /
analyzed: indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ vadham sam pṛthivyāḥ agha śaṃsāya tarhaṇam
translated: O Indra and Soma, hurl down the weapon from heaven, from the earth the crushing blow against the evil-doer.

original: ut takṣataṃ svaryam parvatebhyo yena rakṣo vāvṛdhānaṃ nijūrvathaḥ //
analyzed: ud takṣatam svaryam parvatebhyaḥ yena rakṣaḥ vāvṛdhānam nijūrvathaḥ
translated: Sharpen the weapon from the mountains, with which you drive away the growing demon.

original: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divas pary agnitaptebhir yuvam aśmahanmabhiḥ /
analyzed: indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ pari agni taptebhiḥ yuvam aśma hanmabhiḥ
translated: O Indra and Soma, roll down from heaven with your thunderbolt-like hammers heated by fire.

original: tapurvadhebhir ajarebhir atriṇo ni parśāne vidhyataṃ yantu nisvaram //🔽indrāsomā pari vām bhūtu viśvata iyam matiḥ kakṣyāśveva vājinā /🔽yāṃ vāṃ hotrām parihinomi medhayemā brahmāṇi nṛpatīva jinvatam //
analyzed: tapuḥ vadhebhiḥ ajarebhiḥ atriṇaḥ ni parśāne vidhyatam yantu nisvaram  indrāsomā pari vām bhūtu viśvatas iyam matiḥ kakṣyā aśvā iva vājinā  yām vām hotrām parihinomi medhayā imā brahmāṇi nṛpatī iva jinvatam
translated: With your eternal, consuming weapons, pierce their sides, let them go to destruction.🔽O Indra and Soma, may this thought of mine go around you on every side, like a harness on a horse with speed.🔽The oblation which I offer to you for worship, with these prayers quicken you, as if you were kings.

original: prati smarethāṃ tujayadbhir evair hataṃ druho rakṣaso bhaṅgurāvataḥ /
analyzed: prati smarethām tujayadbhiḥ evaiḥ hatam druhaḥ rakṣasaḥ bhaṅgurāvataḥ
translated: Remember with those victorious ones the slain enemy, the demon who was crushed by you.

original: indrāsomā duṣkṛte mā sugam bhūd yo naḥ kadā cid abhidāsati druhā //
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ duṣkṛte mā sugam bhūt yaḥ naḥ kadā cit abhidāsati druhā
translated: O Indra and Soma, let there be no easy path for the evil-doer who ever injures us with hatred.

original: yo mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhir vacobhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhiḥ vacobhiḥ
translated: He who, with deceitful thoughts, accuses me who am acting with pure thoughts with untrue words,

original: āpa iva kāśinā saṃgṛbhītā asann astv āsata indra vaktā //
analyzed: āpaḥ iva kāśinā saṃgṛbhītāḥ asan astu asataḥ indra vaktā
translated: Let him be bound like a bird with a snare, let him be bound, O Indra, let the accuser be bound.

original: ye pākaśaṃsaṃ viharanta evair ye vā bhadraṃ dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ /
analyzed: ye pāka śaṃsam viharante evaiḥ ye vā bhadram dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ
translated: Those who, with evil intentions, destroy the praise of cooked food, or who defile the good with their own natures,

original: ahaye vā tān pradadātu soma ā vā dadhātu nirṛter upasthe //
analyzed: ahaye vā tān pradadātu somaḥ ā vā dadhātu nirṛteḥ upasthe
translated: Let them be given over to the serpent, or let them be placed in the lap of Nirriti, O Soma.

original: yo no rasaṃ dipsati pitvo agne yo aśvānāṃ yo gavāṃ yas tanūnām /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ rasam dipsati pitvaḥ agne yaḥ aśvānām yaḥ gavām yaḥ tanūnām
translated: He who, O Agni, injures our sap, whether as a guest or as a host, who (injures) our horses, our cows, or our bodies,

original: ripu stena steyakṛd dabhram etu ni ṣa hīyatāṃ tanvā tanā ca //
analyzed: ripuḥ stenaḥ steya kṛt dabhram etu ni sa hīyatām tanvā tanā ca
translated: Let the enemy, the thief, the stealer, go to ruin. Let him be separated from his body and his offspring.

original: paraḥ so astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīr adho astu viśvāḥ /
analyzed: paras saḥ astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ adhas astu viśvāḥ
translated: Let him be far away from his body and his offspring. Let him be under all the three earths.

original: prati śuṣyatu yaśo asya devā yo no divā dipsati yaś ca naktam //
analyzed: prati śuṣyatu yaśaḥ asya devāḥ yaḥ naḥ divā dipsati yaḥ ca naktam
translated: Let his glory dry up, O gods, who injures us by day or who injures us by night.

original: suvijñānaṃ cikituṣe janāya sac cāsac ca vacasī paspṛdhāte /
analyzed: su vijñānam cikituṣe janāya sat ca asat ca vacasī paspṛdhāte
translated: Easy to know is this for the discerning people: the true and the false contend in speech.

original: tayor yat satyaṃ yatarad ṛjīyas tad it somo 'vati hanty āsat //
analyzed: tayoḥ yat satyam yatarad ṛjīyaḥ tat id somaḥ vati hanti āsat
translated: Of these two, whatever is true and more powerful, that indeed does the Soma protect, and the false it destroys.

original: na vā u somo vṛjinaṃ hinoti na kṣatriyam mithuyā dhārayantam /
analyzed: na vai u somaḥ vṛjinam hinoti na kṣatriyam mithuyā dhārayantam
translated: The Soma does not lead to perdition the man who is not perjurious, nor the Kshatriya who upholds the truth.

original: hanti rakṣo hanty āsad vadantam ubhāv indrasya prasitau śayāte //
analyzed: hanti rakṣaḥ hanti asat vadantam ubhau indrasya prasitau śayāte
translated: He slays the Rakshas, he slays the man who speaks evil; both lie in the noose of Indra.

original: yadi vāham anṛtadeva āsa moghaṃ vā devāṃ apyūhe agne /
analyzed: yadi vā aham anṛta devaḥ āsa mogham vā devān api ūhe agne
translated: If I have been a worshipper of false gods, or have offered to the gods in vain, O Agni,

original: kim asmabhyaṃ jātavedo hṛṇīṣe droghavācas te nirṛthaṃ sacantām //
analyzed: kim asmabhyam jātavedaḥ hṛṇīṣe drogha vācaḥ te nirṛtham sacantām
translated: why art thou angry with us, O all-knower? Let the words of the slanderer be fulfilled upon his own head.

original: adyā murīya yadi yātudhāno asmi yadi vāyus tatapa pūruṣasya /
analyzed: adya murīya yadi yātudhānaḥ asmi yadi vā āyuḥ tatapa pūruṣasya
translated: If I am a Yātudhāna today, or if I have scorched a man in anger,

original: adhā sa vīrair daśabhir vi yūyā yo mā moghaṃ yātudhānety āha //
analyzed: adhā sa vīraiḥ daśabhiḥ vi yūyāḥ yaḥ mā mogham yātudhāna iti āha
translated: may he be rent in pieces by the tenfold hero who has called me a vain Yātudhāna.

original: yo māyātuṃ yātudhānety āha yo vā rakṣāḥ śucir asmīty āha /
analyzed: yaḥ mā a yātum yātudhāna iti āha yaḥ vā rakṣāḥ śuciḥ asmi iti āha
translated: He who has called me a Yātudhāna, a Rakshas, or who has said, 'I am pure,' O Rakshas,

original: indras taṃ hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantor adhamas padīṣṭa //🔽pra yā jigāti khargaleva naktam apa druhā tanvaṃ gūhamānā /🔽vavrāṃ anantāṃ ava sā padīṣṭa grāvāṇo ghnantu rakṣasa upabdaiḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ tam hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantoḥ adhamaḥ padīṣṭa  pra yā jigāti khargalā iva naktam apa druhā tanvam gūhamānā  vavrām anantām ava sā padīṣṭa grāvāṇaḥ ghnantu rakṣasaḥ upabdaiḥ
translated: may Indra slay him with a mighty weapon; may he be the lowest of all living beings.🔽She who goes forth like a she-ass by night, concealing her body from the foe,🔽may she go forth to her endless abode; let the pressing-stones slay the Rakshas with their noise.

original: vi tiṣṭhadhvam maruto vikṣv icchata gṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ sam pinaṣṭana /
analyzed: vi tiṣṭhadhvam marutaḥ vikṣu icchata gṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ sam pinaṣṭana
translated: Stand ye forth, O Maruts, run in all directions, seize the Rakshas, crush them.

original: vayo ye bhūtvī patayanti naktabhir ye vā ripo dadhire deve adhvare //
analyzed: vayaḥ ye bhūtvī patayanti naktabhiḥ ye vā ripaḥ dadhire deve adhvare
translated: Those who fly down upon us in the night, or who have made themselves our enemies in the sacrifice to the gods,

original: pra vartaya divo aśmānam indra somaśitam maghavan saṃ śiśādhi /
analyzed: pra vartaya divaḥ aśmānam indra soma śitam maghavan sam śiśādhi
translated: Turn away the stone from heaven, O Indra, sharpen it, O bountiful one, whet it with Soma.

original: prāktād apāktād adharād udaktād abhi jahi rakṣasaḥ parvatena //🔽eta u tye patayanti śvayātava indraṃ dipsanti dipsavo 'dābhyam /
analyzed: prāktāt apāktāt adharāt udaktāt abhi jahi rakṣasaḥ parvatena  ete u tye patayanti śvayātavaḥ indram dipsanti dipsavaḥ dābhyam
translated: From the east, from the west, from the south, from the north, strike down the Raksases with the thunderbolt.🔽These, indeed, are flying about, the swift ones, the spiteful ones, who would injure the unassailable Indra.

original: śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyo vadhaṃ nūnaṃ sṛjad aśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ //
analyzed: śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nūnam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ
translated: Shakra sharpens his weapon against the spiteful ones; he hurls his thunderbolt at the Yātudhānas.

original: indro yātūnām abhavat parāśaro havirmathīnām abhy āvivāsatām /
analyzed: indraḥ yātūnām abhavat parāśaraḥ havirmathīnām abhi āvivāsatām
translated: Indra became the slayer of the Yātudhānas, the destroyer of the obstructors who seek to injure.

original: abhīd u śakraḥ paraśur yathā vanam pātreva bhindan sata eti rakṣasaḥ //
analyzed: abhi id u śakraḥ paraśuḥ yathā vanam pātrā iva bhindan satas eti rakṣasaḥ
translated: Shakra goes forth, breaking the Raksases like a tree with an axe, as if with a vessel.

original: ulūkayātuṃ śuśulūkayātuṃ jahi śvayātum uta kokayātum /
analyzed: ulūka yātum śuśulūka yātum jahi śva yātum uta koka yātum
translated: Destroy the owl-Yātudhāna, the owl-Yātudhāna, the dog-Yātudhāna, and the crow-Yātudhāna.

original: suparṇayātum uta gṛdhrayātuṃ dṛṣadeva pra mṛṇa rakṣa indra //
analyzed: suparṇa yātum uta gṛdhra yātum dṛṣadā iva pra mṛṇa rakṣaḥ indra
translated: Destroy the eagle-Yātudhāna, the vulture-Yātudhāna, crush the Raksases like a stone, O Indra.

original: mā no rakṣo abhi naḍ yātumāvatām apocchatu mithunā yā kimīdinā /
analyzed: mā naḥ rakṣaḥ abhi naṭ yātumāvatām apocchatu mithunā yā kimīdinā
translated: Let not the Rākṣasa, the Yātudhāna, the pair of Kimīdins, who would injure us, prevail.

original: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātv aṃhaso 'ntarikṣaṃ divyāt pātv asmān //
analyzed: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātu aṃhasaḥ ntarikṣam divyāt pātu asmān
translated: May the Earth protect us from earthly woe, may the Firmament protect us from heavenly woe.

original: indra jahi pumāṃsaṃ yātudhānam uta striyam māyayā śāśadānām /
analyzed: indra jahi pumāṃsam yātudhānam uta striyam māyayā śāśadānām
translated: O Indra, slay the male demon and the female demon who deceive by magic.

original: vigrīvāso mūradevā ṛdantu mā te dṛśan sūryam uccarantam //
analyzed: vigrīvāsaḥ mūradevāḥ ṛdantu mā te dṛśan sūryam uccarantam
translated: Let the neckless, godless demons perish. May they not see the rising sun.

original: prati cakṣva vi cakṣvendraś ca soma jāgṛtam /
analyzed: prati cakṣva vi cakṣva indraḥ ca soma jāgṛtam
translated: Look straight and look around, O Indra and Soma, be watchful.

original: rakṣobhyo vadham asyatam aśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ //
analyzed: rakṣobhyaḥ vadham asyatam aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ
translated: Send forth your weapon against the demons, your thunderbolt against the sorcerers.
